original: des na 'jig pa dang gzugs zhes bgyi ba 'di yang gnyis su bgyir ma mchis zhes bya ba ste gzugs dang 'jig pa yang gnyis ka btags pa yin pa'i phyir med pa nyid kyis gcig pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'jig pa dang gzugs zhes bgyi ba 'di yang gnyis su bgyir ma mchis zhes bya ba ste gzugs dang 'jig pa yang gnyis ka btags pa yin pa'i phyir med pa nyid kyis gcig pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, this so-called destruction and form are not dual. The meaning is that because form and destruction are both imputations, they are non-existent.

original: 'jig pa med ces bya ba'i 'don pa la chos nyid kyi gzugs la mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir mi 'jig pa la yang chos nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir gcig pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //🔽gzugs zhes bgyi ba ni gnyis su med pa la chos nyid kyi phyir gcig pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //

original: don dam pa de'i grangs 'di lta ste gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ci zhig gsungs par 'gyur chos nyid kyi gzugs dang chos nyid tshor ba ji srid du chos nyid rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis
analyzed: don dam pa de'i grangs 'di lta ste gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ci zhig gsungs par 'gyur chos nyid kyi gzugs dang chos nyid tshor ba ji srid du chos nyid rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis
translated: The words “the reality of form, the reality of feeling,” up to “the reality of consciousness,” etc.,

original: gcig pa nyid gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa rnam pa mang po byas nas mngon par brjod pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa rnam pa mang po byas nas mngon par brjod pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: make many different aspects of the ultimate, which is nondual sameness, into the referents of expressions.

original: nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa ni de ltar chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa ni de ltar chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The summary is stated from “Thus, all phenomena” and so on.

original: 'di las gzhan de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: 'di las gzhan de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: From here on, the passage beginning “Then the venerable Śāriputra” and so on

original: gnas brtan dag gis smras pa'i dri ba dang lan dag ston par byed de /
analyzed: gnas brtan dag gis smras pa'i dri ba dang lan dag ston par byed de /
translated: presents the questions and answers taught by the elders.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang skye ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang skye ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “The bodhisattva is also unborn.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sgras byang chub sems dpa'i de bzhin nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sgras byang chub sems dpa'i de bzhin nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word “bodhisattva” expresses the reality of the bodhisattva.

original: de yang byang chub kyi rang bzhin las bdag nyid gcig pa yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas thob pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang byang chub kyi rang bzhin las bdag nyid gcig pa yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas thob pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: And that is the same nature as enlightenment, so it is called “attained by the bodhisattva.”

original: dka' ba spyad pa spyod pa'am /
analyzed: dka' ba spyad pa spyod pa'am /
translated: The practice of austerities

original: nang gi bdag nyid phyi'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gnod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid phyi'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gnod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: is characterized by the suffering of giving up all external things, such as one’s body.

original: sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi dka' ba spyod pa nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi dka' ba spyod pa nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the practice of austerities as the application of effort,

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus kyi yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus kyi yang gsungs pa /
translated: he also teaches the armor of effort:

original: sdug bsngal gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Whatever suffering there is” and so on.

original: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de dag nyams su myong ba'i don du spro ba ci zhig ces bya ba ni ngan song thams cad nas skyes pa rnams kyis sems can re re'i don gyi phyir de rnams kyang yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de dag nyams su myong ba'i don du spro ba ci zhig ces bya ba ni ngan song thams cad nas skyes pa rnams kyis sems can re re'i don gyi phyir de rnams kyang yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: What is the point of delighting in experiencing those sufferings?🔽Because of the non-passing-away of those very sufferings for the sake of each and every sentient being, by those born in all the lower realms.

original: rang nyid kyis de dang de'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba khas blangs pas sems can rnams kyi don du de rnams kyang ci'i phyir nyams su myong bar byed de //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis de dang de'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba khas blangs pas sems can rnams kyi don du de rnams kyang ci'i phyir nyams su myong bar byed de //
translated: Since one has accepted the experience of those and those sufferings, why does one not experience them for the sake of sentient beings?

original: byang chub thob pa nyid kyi phyir dka' ba'i spyod pa ma yin de yang rnam par gzhag pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub thob pa nyid kyi phyir dka' ba'i spyod pa ma yin de yang rnam par gzhag pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of the attainment of enlightenment itself, it is not a difficult practice. That is also not a conceptualization, that is the meaning.

original: kho bo ni byang chub sems dpa' dka' ba spyad pa spyod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kho bo ni byang chub sems dpa' dka' ba spyad pa spyod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: I do not assert that the bodhisattvas practice difficult conduct.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la don dam par de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la don dam par de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Because for the bodhisattvas, such conceptualization does not exist ultimately.

original: byang chub @54a * //
analyzed: byang chub @54a * //
translated: enlightenment🔽

original: sems dpa' ni sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i phyir gang gi tshe chos thams cad mi dmigs pa de'i tshe skyes rabs la sogs pas byas pa'i dka' ba spyod pa rtsom pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i phyir gang gi tshe chos thams cad mi dmigs pa de'i tshe skyes rabs la sogs pas byas pa'i dka' ba spyod pa rtsom pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva, on the eighth stage, because he has attained the acquiescence to the non-production of things, when he does not apprehend any thing, then he undertakes the performance of the difficult practices, such as the Jatakamala, etc.

original: de'i tshe na yang 'ga' zhig tu yang mi dmigs pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mgo gcod pa la sogs pa'i dka' ba spyod pa'i 'du shes sam sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes rab tu 'jug pa ma yin zhes ston par byed do
analyzed: de'i tshe na yang 'ga' zhig tu yang mi dmigs pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mgo gcod pa la sogs pa'i dka' ba spyod pa'i 'du shes sam sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes rab tu 'jug pa ma yin zhes ston par byed do
translated: And at that time, also, the bodhisattva, who is endowed with the mental orientation of non-apprehension, does not engage in the notion of the difficult practices, such as the beheading, etc., or in the notion of suffering.

original: // yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: // yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan gnyis pa yin no //
translated: Again, etc. is the second reply.

original: spyod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'grub pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'grub pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not a practice means not an accomplishment.

original: 'thad pa gsungs pa ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'thad pa gsungs pa ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The justification is stated: Why is that?

original: bde ba'i 'du shes nyid ni ji ltar yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: bde ba'i 'du shes nyid ni ji ltar yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is it the notion of pleasure? It is stated:

original: sems can thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: For all sentient beings and so on.

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas sems can thams cad kyi ma nyid la sogs pa yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir 'di ltar gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas sems can thams cad kyi ma nyid la sogs pa yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir 'di ltar gsungs so //
translated: Because of the correct origination of all sentient beings as one's mother and so on, since beginningless cyclic existence, it is said just as I do for myself.

original: 'du shes kyi rab nyid gsungs pa ni ji srid du bdag nyid kyi bar du yang 'du shes bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi rab nyid gsungs pa ni ji srid du bdag nyid kyi bar du yang 'du shes bskyed par bya ste /
translated: The best thought is stated: As long as I have not attained enlightenment, I should generate the thought just as I do for myself.

original: ji ltar bdag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Just as I do for myself and so on.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga rnams thams cad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga rnams thams cad do //
translated: All suffering is all of the contaminated five aggregates.

original: de rnams thams cad las thar par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad las thar par bya'o //
translated: I should liberate all of them from all suffering.

original: thams cad nas zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba gzhan ma yin ba'i dbye ba thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: thams cad nas zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba gzhan ma yin ba'i dbye ba thams cad kyis so //
translated: All means all of the different types of transmigrators.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gsum gyis so //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gsum gyis so //
translated: All means all three types of suffering.

original: rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis so //
translated: All aspects means all conceptual thoughts.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni ma lus pa'o //
translated: All means completely.

original: thar bar bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thar bar bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “from the mass of suffering” refers to the object that is to be liberated.

original: sdug bsngal ni spungs pa las so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni spungs pa las so //
translated: The word “mass” refers to suffering.

original: gnod sems ni khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: gnod sems ni khong khro ba'o //
translated: The word “hatred” refers to anger.

original: 'di ni kun rdzob tu yang dka' ba'i 'du shes med pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni kun rdzob tu yang dka' ba'i 'du shes med pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This verse shows that there is no notion of difficulty even in the conventional sense.

original: sngar ni don dam par dka' ba'i rnam par rtog pa med par nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: sngar ni don dam par dka' ba'i rnam par rtog pa med par nye bar bstan to //
translated: The previous verse showed that there is no notion of difficulty in the ultimate sense.

original: dpes gsal bar byed pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //🔽ji ltar bdag med pa thams cad nas zhes bya ba ni bdag dang sems can dang srog la sogs pa dbye ba thams cad @54b kyis so //🔽thams cad ni ji ltar gyur pa mthong bar bya ba dang mthong bar bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: dpes gsal bar byed pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so // ji ltar bdag med pa thams cad nas zhes bya ba ni bdag dang sems can dang srog la sogs pa dbye ba thams cad @54b kyis so // thams cad ni ji ltar gyur pa mthong bar bya ba dang mthong bar bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: The following verse is stated as an example to illustrate this point.🔽The phrase “in every way” refers to all the different ways in which a self is conceived, such as a self that is identical to or different from the aggregates, the elements, and so on.🔽The phrase “in every respect” refers to the different ways in which a self is conceived, such as a self that is permanent or impermanent, and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa rnams las tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa rnams las tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pas so //
translated: The phrase “in every mode” refers to the different ways in which a self is conceived, such as a self that is identical to or different from the aggregates, elements, and so on.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni dus thams cad la'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni dus thams cad la'o //
translated: All means at all times.

original: ji ltar bdag de ltar chos rnams thams cad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag de ltar chos rnams thams cad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as the self does not exist, so also all dharmas do not exist.

original: thams cad nas zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa tshogs kyi dbye ba thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: thams cad nas zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa tshogs kyi dbye ba thams cad kyis so //
translated: All means all the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, etc., in all their categories.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ji ltar yin ba tshogs rnams la yan lag yongs su rdzogs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ji ltar yin ba tshogs rnams la yan lag yongs su rdzogs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: All means all the collections, because the parts are complete.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba thams cad las bdag nyid dang gzhan rnams la thams cad dang thams cad ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba thams cad las bdag nyid dang gzhan rnams la thams cad dang thams cad ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In every way means in all their categories. The meaning is that neither the self nor others are all or not all.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: All means as before.

original: sngar ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus byang chub sems dpa' yang skye ba med ces bya ba dgongs pa gang gis gsungs pa de'i lan gdab pa'i don du gsal pa'i phyir rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: sngar ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus byang chub sems dpa' yang skye ba med ces bya ba dgongs pa gang gis gsungs pa de'i lan gdab pa'i don du gsal pa'i phyir rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Previously, the Elder Shariputra said, “The bodhisattva is also non-arisen,” and in order to clarify the intention with which that was said, Subhuti said,

original: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma zin pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang byan chub sems dpa' la 'bras bu'i ngo bo🔽nyid dang bral ba'i phyir yin mod /
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma zin pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang byan chub sems dpa' la 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir yin mod /
translated: “All” and so forth. It is true that form and so forth are devoid of the nature of arising because they are not embraced by the perfection of wisdom, and the bodhisattva is devoid of the nature of the effect.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin te de'i phyir ji ltar skye ba med pa yin zhes gdul bya'i skye bo la ltos nas mi srid pa nyid ston cing gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin te de'i phyir ji ltar skye ba med pa yin zhes gdul bya'i skye bo la ltos nas mi srid pa nyid ston cing gsungs pa /
translated: But omniscience is the nature of the effect. Therefore, in consideration of the disciples, he teaches and says that it is impossible:

original: 'on te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang skye ba med ces bya ste thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos rnams ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang skye ba med ces bya ste thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos rnams ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “But omniscience is also non-arisen.” The phenomena of omniscience are the powers, fearlessnesses, and so forth.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa skye ba med pa yin mod /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa skye ba med pa yin mod /
translated: It is true that the bodhisattva and so forth, who are to be established, are non-arisen.

original: 'o na grub pa'i so so'i skye bo la sogs pa la'ang de yod pa la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na grub pa'i so so'i skye bo la sogs pa la'ang de yod pa la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: Well then, it follows that even ordinary beings who have attained the results of the path would have that, but would not have the bodhisattva deeds and so on.

original: 'on te so so'i skye bo yang skye ba med ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te so so'i skye bo yang skye ba med ces bya ba ste /
translated: Or else, even ordinary beings would be non-arisen.

original: de ltar chos thams cad la mi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad la mi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the non-arisen nature of all phenomena,

original: sngar mngon par 'dod pa'i mi 'dod pa 'bab pa bsal bar byed ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngar mngon par 'dod pa'i mi 'dod pa 'bab pa bsal bar byed ba gsungs pa /
translated: he states the removal of the unwanted consequence that was previously intended.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'o na zhes bya @55a * //🔽ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'o na zhes bya @55a * // ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Lord said, “Venerable Subhūti, is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings to be fully awakened to, or not?”

original: rjes su thob pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid du thams cad la skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings nyid tsam gyi phyir chos kyi dbyings kyang rang bzhin gyi dus thams cad du gdod ma nas rtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su thob pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid du thams cad la skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings nyid tsam gyi phyir chos kyi dbyings kyang rang bzhin gyi dus thams cad du gdod ma nas rtag pa'i phyir /
translated: “Is it to be fully awakened to?” means that from the very beginning, the nature of non-arising is the mere basic space of phenomena, and the basic space of phenomena is primordially permanent at all times by nature.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang dag par rtogs pa las chos kyi dbyings nyid yang dag par rtogs pa yin no zhes sems can thams cad kyang don dam par mthong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang dag par rtogs pa las chos kyi dbyings nyid yang dag par rtogs pa yin no zhes sems can thams cad kyang don dam par mthong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is that from the correct understanding of form and so on, the Dharma-element itself is correctly understood, and all sentient beings also are seen in the ultimate.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rab 'byor gyi lan no //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rab 'byor gyi lan no //
translated: The reply of Subhuti beginning with Thus it has been said and so on.

original: ma skyes pa'i chos la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings byed pa por byed pa la'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings byed pa por byed pa la'o //
translated: As to in a non-produced dharma, the Dharma-element called 'Bodhisattva' is the agent.

original: thob pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sku las su gyur pa la thob pa 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sku las su gyur pa la thob pa 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: As to attainment, the Dharma-body called 'omniscience' is the object, and attainment is not desired.

original: mngon par rtogs par yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: As to not even realization, it is the realization of attainment.

original: gal te 'dod na de'i tshe mi skye ba'i ngo bos byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i ngo bo'i byang chub thob ces bdag la mi 'dod pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dod na de'i tshe mi skye ba'i ngo bos byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i ngo bo'i byang chub thob ces bdag la mi 'dod pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept, then it follows that the Bodhisattva, by way of the non-arisen nature, attains enlightenment by way of the non-arisen nature, and this is unacceptable to you.

original: de ltar ni bdag mi 'dod pas de'i phyir thal bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni bdag mi 'dod pas de'i phyir thal bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not right to draw out a consequence in this way, since you do not accept the self.

original: ma skyes pa'i chos kyis thob pa ma skyes pa 'thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos kyis thob pa ma skyes pa 'thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “An unarisen dharma does not attain an unarisen attainment.”

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings so sor rtog par byed ces bya ba yang bdag 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de nas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gal te ma skyes pas ma skyes pa'i thob pa thob par mi 'gyur 'on te skyes pas skyes pa'i thob pa thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings so sor rtog par byed ces bya ba yang bdag 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to // de nas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gal te ma skyes pas ma skyes pa'i thob pa thob par mi 'gyur 'on te skyes pas skyes pa'i thob pa thob par 'gyur /
translated: “The dharma-dhātu does not discern the dharma-dhātu” also means that you do not accept the self.🔽Then the elder Śāriputra, having analyzed whether if the unarisen does not attain an unarisen attainment, then does the arisen attain an arisen attainment?

original: 'on te skyes bas ma skyes pa'i thob pa thob bar 'gyur zhes brtags pa byas nas de gnyi ga dri bar byed de /
analyzed: 'on te skyes bas ma skyes pa'i thob pa thob bar 'gyur zhes brtags pa byas nas de gnyi ga dri bar byed de /
translated: Or does the arisen attain an unarisen attainment?

original: yang ci zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: yang ci zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Moreover, the verse begins with “If the bodhisattva who has the nature of thusness obtains the imagined…”

original: gal te de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can byang chub sems dpa' kun tu brtags pa yongs su thob par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can byang chub sems dpa' kun tu brtags pa yongs su thob par gyur na /
translated: If the bodhisattva who has the nature of thusness obtains the imagined,

original: de ltar yod na ni mi skye ba'i chos kyis skyes ba'i thob pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yod na ni mi skye ba'i chos kyis skyes ba'i thob pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the non-arisen would obtain the arising.

original: gal te kun tu brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i byang chub de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid thob par 'gyur ba de ltar yod na ni skye ba'i chos kyis mi skye ba'i thob pa thob par 'gyur ro //🔽de srid pa'i 'dod pas sel bar byed de /
analyzed: gal te kun tu brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i byang chub de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid thob par 'gyur ba de ltar yod na ni skye ba'i chos kyis mi skye ba'i thob pa thob par 'gyur ro // de srid pa'i 'dod pas sel bar byed de /
translated: If the imagined bodhisattva obtains the true enlightenment that has the nature of thusness, then the non-arisen would obtain the arising.

original: ma skyes pa'i @55b chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i @55b chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: He refutes that with “The non-arisen does not obtain the non-arisen.”

original: don ni 'di yin te gnyis su med pa'i don ni de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te gnyis su med pa'i don ni de kho na nyid de /
translated: The meaning is this: the non-dual meaning is reality.

original: de lta na yang gal te ma skyes pa dang skyes pa dag la gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur na de'i tshe ma skyes pa skyes pa dang skyes pas ma skyes pa'i thob pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang gal te ma skyes pa dang skyes pa dag la gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur na de'i tshe ma skyes pa skyes pa dang skyes pas ma skyes pa'i thob pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: But if the unarisen and the arisen were to have the same nature, then at that time the unarisen would arise and the arisen would obtain the unarisen.

original: de ltar yod na ni phyogs gnyis la yang ma skyes pa'i chos skye ba yin zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yod na ni phyogs gnyis la yang ma skyes pa'i chos skye ba yin zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then in both cases the unarisen dharma would arise.

original: 'di yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs te /
translated: But this is not reasonable.

original: ma skyes pa'i chos ni yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos ni yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: The unarisen dharma is the perfected.

original: de'i ji ltar kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo skye ba srid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i ji ltar kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo skye ba srid ces bya ba'o //
translated: How could the arising of the imagined nature be possible for it?

original: gal te yang ma skyes pa'i chos ma skyes pa nyid yin na de'i tshe legs par smras par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang ma skyes pa'i chos ma skyes pa nyid yin na de'i tshe legs par smras par 'gyur te /
translated: But if the unarisen dharma is unarisen, then that is well said.

original: ma skyes pa'i chos kyis ma skyes pa'i thob pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos kyis ma skyes pa'i thob pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is that the unarisen dharma does not obtain the unarisen.

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag gnyi ga la yang yod pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag gnyi ga la yang yod pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The elder Śāriputra said that both the arisen and the unarisen exist.

original: skye ba'i chos nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽don ni 'di yin te skye ba yang re zhig rgyu yod pa rnams la mngon sum gyis grub pa ste ci'i phyir mi skye ba'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin /
analyzed: skye ba'i chos nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste / don ni 'di yin te skye ba yang re zhig rgyu yod pa rnams la mngon sum gyis grub pa ste ci'i phyir mi skye ba'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin /
translated: The reality of arising and so on.🔽The meaning is as follows. Arising is established by direct perception in the case of things that have causes. Why would it not arise, since it is empty of intrinsic reality?

original: gang zhig yang mi skye ba'i chos stong pa nyid ces bya ba de yang skye ba yin zhes rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig yang mi skye ba'i chos stong pa nyid ces bya ba de yang skye ba yin zhes rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning is as follows: Arising is established by direct perception in the case of things that have causes. Why would it not arise? It is not logical to say that emptiness, which is non-arising, is also arising.

original: de'i phyir skye ba dang mi skye bdag gnyi ga yang so so kho na yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba dang mi skye bdag gnyi ga yang so so kho na yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, both arising and non-arising are distinct from each other.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni kun brtags kyi ngo bos mi skye ba yang med pa gsungs ba ni skye ba'i chos sam zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni kun brtags kyi ngo bos mi skye ba yang med pa gsungs ba ni skye ba'i chos sam zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The elder Subhūti says that non-arising due to the imagined nature is also non-existent. He says this with “Is there any dharma called arising?” and so on.

original: smra bar mi spobs so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: smra bar mi spobs so zhes bya ste /
translated: He says “I do not have the confidence to speak.”

original: ma skyes pa yang smra ba ni gnas par kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir kho bo 'dod pa nyid ma yin sngon nyid skye ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang smra ba ni gnas par kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir kho bo 'dod pa nyid ma yin sngon nyid skye ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The statement non-arising is also spoken of is not what I assert, because it is an entity imagined as abiding. The thought is that arising is prior.

original: gal te mi skye ba yod na 'o na thob ba dang mngon par rtogs pa yang rigs pa ma yin zhes tha dad par 'gyur pa gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus bstan par byed de /
analyzed: gal te mi skye ba yod na 'o na thob ba dang mngon par rtogs pa yang rigs pa ma yin zhes tha dad par 'gyur pa gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus bstan par byed de /
translated: If non-arising exists, then attainment and realization are also illogical, this distinction was taught by the elder Shariputra.

original: khyod kyi skye ba med pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khyod kyi skye ba med pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: He said, Your non-arising... and so on.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhuti said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu skye ba med pa nyid brjod pa ma yin la zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa yang gzugs la skye ba med pa dang / sgra la skye ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos kun tu brtags pa kho na ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu skye ba med pa nyid brjod pa ma yin la zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa yang gzugs la skye ba med pa dang / sgra la skye ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos kun tu brtags pa kho na ste /
translated: Venerable Shariputra, non-arising itself is not spoken of, meaning that non-arising is only imagined as an entity called non-arising of form, non-arising of sound, and so on.

original: 'o na ci zhig mngon par rtogs par 'gyur thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba dgongs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig mngon par rtogs par 'gyur thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba dgongs pa gsungs pa /
translated: Then what is realized and attained? The thought is stated:🔽If non-arising is realized and attained...

original: skye ba med pa nyid so sor snang ba yin no zhes @56a * //🔽bya ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba med pa nyid so sor snang ba yin no zhes @56a * // bya ba ste /
translated: It is the non-arising itself that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang spros pa thams cad dang bral ba ni mi skye ba nyid gcig tu de'i tshe ni so sor snang /🔽'o na skye ba la sogs pa so sor ye shes yod de gang du 'di so sor snang zhes gsungs pa ni skye ba med pa nyid spobs pa yin te zhes bya ba ste /🔽ye shes kyang de'i tshe skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid du song ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang spros pa thams cad dang bral ba ni mi skye ba nyid gcig tu de'i tshe ni so sor snang / 'o na skye ba la sogs pa so sor ye shes yod de gang du 'di so sor snang zhes gsungs pa ni skye ba med pa nyid spobs pa yin te zhes bya ba ste / ye shes kyang de'i tshe skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid du song ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.

original: 'o na ye shes de la ji ltar snang zhes brjod pa la zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa gsungs pa /🔽de kho na bzhin du shin tu so sor snang ba nyid do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'o na ye shes de la ji ltar snang zhes brjod pa la zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa gsungs pa /🔽de kho na bzhin du shin tu so sor snang ba nyid do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.🔽The non-arising itself is the wisdom that appears individually.

original: de bzhin nyid du skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid thob pa nyams pa'i dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa ngo bos gnas pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo rnam bar mi rtog pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes de
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid thob pa nyams pa'i dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa ngo bos gnas pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo rnam bar mi rtog pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes de
translated: The nonconceptual supramundane wisdom, which is the object of attainment of the nonarisen nature that is thusness, is the object of observation and the observer that is the nature of nonabiding, which is the nature of nonapprehended object and apprehender.

original: so so'i skye bo thams cad la dmus long rnams la gzugs ltar spyod yul ma yin te de'i tshe so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo thams cad la dmus long rnams la gzugs ltar spyod yul ma yin te de'i tshe so sor snang ngo //
translated: That is not the domain of all ordinary beings, like form is not the domain of the blind. At that time, it appears to each.

original: shin tu zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig las 'don pa ste /🔽der shin tu 'das pa dang sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: shin tu zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig las 'don pa ste / der shin tu 'das pa dang sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Very is stated in some recensions.🔽There, very is beyond the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: kun tu brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dag med pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' med pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dag med pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' med pa'o //
translated: The extreme of superimposition is absent because the imaginary and the dependent do not exist.

original: yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo yod pa'i phyir skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' med pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo yod pa'i phyir skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' med pa'o //
translated: The extreme of denial is absent because the perfect, which is the nature of thusness, exists.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa /
translated: Therefore it is stated:

original: sems med mi dmigs pa ni 'di //
analyzed: sems med mi dmigs pa ni 'di //
translated: The absence of mind and nonobservation are here.

original: ye shes 'jig rten 'das kyang de //
analyzed: ye shes 'jig rten 'das kyang de //
translated: Although supramundane wisdom is not mundane,

original: de nyid zag pa med pa'i dbyings //
analyzed: de nyid zag pa med pa'i dbyings //
translated: it is the uncontaminated realm itself.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab dge ba brtags //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab dge ba brtags //
translated: It is the inconceivable, virtuous nature.

original: bde ba rnam par grol sku 'di//🔽chos zhes bya dang thub chen gyi //
analyzed: bde ba rnam par grol sku 'di// chos zhes bya dang thub chen gyi //
translated: This is the blissful, liberated body.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the Dharma, and the Great Sage.

original: 'di ni 'dir skabs kyi don te thob par bya ba dang thob par byed pa gnyi ga la yang don dam par mi skye ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir chos 'ga' yang gang gis kyang thob par bya ba'i phyir dang mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir nus pa ma
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir skabs kyi don te thob par bya ba dang thob par byed pa gnyi ga la yang don dam par mi skye ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir chos 'ga' yang gang gis kyang thob par bya ba'i phyir dang mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir nus pa ma
translated: This is the meaning of the context here. Neither the object to be attained nor the means of attaining it is ultimately able to attain or realize anything, because they both have the nature of non-arising.

original: yin te / gcig tu chos thams cad kyi don dam pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: yin te / gcig tu chos thams cad kyi don dam pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: The ultimate of all phenomena is the realm of phenomena,

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
translated: which is naturally luminous,

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: without beginning or end.

original: de bas na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings glo bur ba'i sgrib pa dang dri ma rnams kyis dri ma @56b can du byas pa de na de rnams la zad pa yod na de zad pa'i mtshan nyid can
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings glo bur ba'i sgrib pa dang dri ma rnams kyis dri ma @56b can du byas pa de na de rnams la zad pa yod na de zad pa'i mtshan nyid can
translated: Therefore, the dharmadhātu, which is called the “bodhisattva that is luminous by nature,” is made to be defiled by adventitious obscurations and stains.🔽

original: gyi rnam par dag pa sngon chad med pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: gyi rnam par dag pa sngon chad med pa thob pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the dharmadhātu, which is called the “naturally luminous bodhisattva,” is made defiled by adventitious obscurations and stains. When those are extinguished in it, the bodhisattva attains the purity that is characterized by their extinction.

original: dper na rang bzhin gyis nam mkha' ni glo bur ba'i kha ba dang rdul dang sprin dang du ba la sogs pa'i sgrib pa rnams kyis dri ma can du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na rang bzhin gyis nam mkha' ni glo bur ba'i kha ba dang rdul dang sprin dang du ba la sogs pa'i sgrib pa rnams kyis dri ma can du byed pa yin te /
translated: For example, naturally pure space is made defiled by adventitious obscurations such as snow, dust, clouds, and smoke.

original: phyis de med pa'i mtshan nyid can rnam par dag pa des thob pa yin no //
analyzed: phyis de med pa'i mtshan nyid can rnam par dag pa des thob pa yin no //
translated: Later, when those are absent, it is pure.

original: de'i glo bur ba'i 'khrul pa thams cad log pa la shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid thams cad sngon chad med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i glo bur ba'i 'khrul pa thams cad log pa la shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid thams cad sngon chad med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas thob pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva attains the cessation of all his adventitious errors. Since all the characteristics of the suchness of all very pure phenomena are unprecedented, the bodhisattva attains them.

original: de nyid rnam par dag pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa rtogs pa'i phyir thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa yang dag par yod pa yin zhes kun tu brtags pa'i sgrib pa tsam bsal ba thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa zhes 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dag pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa rtogs pa'i phyir thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa yang dag par yod pa yin zhes kun tu brtags pa'i sgrib pa tsam bsal ba thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa zhes 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Because of the realization that the purity of that very nature is the nature of the perfection of wisdom, the attainment and clear realization of the perfection of wisdom are said to exist in a real sense.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The attainment and clear realization of the perfection of wisdom are said to exist in a real sense, because of the non-existence of the nature of the grasped and the grasper.

original: 'dir ni 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis skyon med pa'i chos nye bar bstan pa spobs pa la gdul bya rnams kyi lhag par mos pa brten pa'i don du gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus bsngags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis skyon med pa'i chos nye bar bstan pa spobs pa la gdul bya rnams kyi lhag par mos pa brten pa'i don du gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus bsngags pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the noble Subhuti, in order to establish the faith of the disciples in the teaching of the faultless Dharma, the elder Shariputra praises him, saying,

original: chos ston pa'i nang na zhes bya pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos ston pa'i nang na zhes bya pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Among the teachers of the Dharma... and so on.

original: dri ba thams cad la lan gdab pa nges par 'byung ba'i phyir mchog tu gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dri ba thams cad la lan gdab pa nges par 'byung ba'i phyir mchog tu gzhag par bya'o //
translated: He should be placed at the head of all those who answer questions, because he is the one who has attained certainty.

original: the tshom med par bgrang bar bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom med par bgrang bar bya'o //
translated: He should be counted as foremost.

original: gang dang gang nyid la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang nyid la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In regard to whatever...

original: gang dang gang nyid kyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang nyid kyis gnas pa'o //
translated: It is by means of just that which is the basis.

original: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni brgal bar 'gyur ro //🔽mi g-yo zhes bya ba ni stor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni brgal bar 'gyur ro // mi g-yo zhes bya ba ni stor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One will go forth means one will cross over.🔽One will not waver means one will not be lost.

original: 'gal bar yang mi byed do zhes bya ba ni 'khrug bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal bar yang mi byed do zhes bya ba ni 'khrug bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: One will not be in conflict means one will not be disturbed.

original: mi gnas pa'i chos can rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa ni mngon par mi zhen pa chos gang rnams kyis de rnams de ltar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i chos can rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa ni mngon par mi zhen pa chos gang rnams kyis de rnams de ltar brjod pa yin no //
translated: For those who are not attached to anything means that those who are not attached to anything are so called because of those dharmas to which they are not attached.

original: mi 'da'o zhes bya ba ni skrag par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'da'o zhes bya ba ni skrag par mi byed pa'o //
translated: One will not transgress means one will not be frightened.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi gnas par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi gnas par gsungs pa'o //
translated: Having said this means having taught that all dharmas are not based anywhere.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni de ma thag par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni de ma thag par gsungs pa'o //
translated: This refers to what was just said.

original: chos thams cad la mi gnas pa yang la mchog nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mi gnas pa yang la mchog nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin no //
translated: The perfection of not being based anywhere in all dharmas is also a perfection because it is supreme.

original: gang yin zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid las gzhan nyid kyi @57a * //
analyzed: gang yin zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid las gzhan nyid kyi @57a * //
translated: What?🔽It is other than the perfection of wisdom itself.

original: dgos bas dri bar byed de /🔽rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: dgos bas dri bar byed de / rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: What is it? is the question, since it is the perfection of wisdom itself that is being asked about.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Subhūti said, The perfection of wisdom itself.

original: gang la bshad pa'i don du bdag la smras pa de ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: gang la bshad pa'i don du bdag la smras pa de ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is what I was told to explain.

original: gzhan nyid la de ltar mi gnas pa nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di nyid ni ji ltar shes par bya zhen gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhan nyid la de ltar mi gnas pa nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir ro // 'di nyid ni ji ltar shes par bya zhen gsungs pa /
translated: It is not reasonable that it is something other than that, since it does not abide in duality.

original: theg pa thams cad pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: theg pa thams cad pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How is this to be understood? He said, The vehicle of all vehicles.

original: sngar gsungs pa kho na ste nyan thos kyi sa la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas theg pa thams cad pa nyid de'i phyir 'di nyid 'di zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa kho na ste nyan thos kyi sa la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas theg pa thams cad pa nyid de'i phyir 'di nyid 'di zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is just what was said before. Even in the śrāvaka vehicle and so on shows that it is the vehicle of all vehicles. Therefore, this itself is the intended meaning.

original: 'di ni gtso bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i gdams ngag sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: 'di ni gtso bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i gdams ngag sbyor bar byed de /
translated: This is the instruction for bodhisattvas in the perfection of wisdom, which is the principal one.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom itself.🔽

original: gang gi phyir de ltar de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, therefore.

original: zhum pa nyid ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: zhum pa nyid ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Depression is suffering.

original: nem nur zhes bya ba ni the tshom za ba nyid do //
analyzed: nem nur zhes bya ba ni the tshom za ba nyid do //
translated: Doubt is uncertainty.

original: rmongs pa nyid ni rtse gcig pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa nyid ni rtse gcig pa med pa'o //
translated: Delusion is lack of one-pointedness.

original: gzhan pa nyid ni rgyab tu phyogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid ni rgyab tu phyogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Otherness is the nature of turning away.

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni tshig rnams thams cad 'don pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni tshig rnams thams cad 'don pa ma yin te /
translated: In some cases, not all the words are recited.

original: de bzhin du gnas gzhan rnams la yang nyung ba dang nyung ba'i tshig rnams po ti rnying pa rnams la mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas gzhan rnams la yang nyung ba dang nyung ba'i tshig rnams po ti rnying pa rnams la mthong ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, in the other sections, fewer and fewer words are seen in the old manuscripts.

original: de tsam yang de 'don pa bshad pa po rnams kyis bshad pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de tsam yang de 'don pa bshad pa po rnams kyis bshad pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even that much is explained by the reciters as explained.

original: yid la byed pa 'di dang zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu gnas rab tu gnas pa la sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba yid la byed pas snying rje chen po nye bar skyes pas so //
analyzed: yid la byed pa 'di dang zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu gnas rab tu gnas pa la sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba yid la byed pas snying rje chen po nye bar skyes pas so //
translated: This attention means that great compassion arises through the attention of not abandoning any sentient being in the well-established abode, conventionally.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Venerable Subhūti said, How, Śāriputra, should a Bodhisattva who courses in the perfection of wisdom stand in the perfection of wisdom?

original: 'dir sh'a ri'i bu'i dgongs pa 'di yin te rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa thams cad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gnas par 'gal ba can yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sh'a ri'i bu'i dgongs pa 'di yin te rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa thams cad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gnas par 'gal ba can yin no //
translated: Here, this is Śāriputra's thought: Conceptualization is in all ways incompatible with standing in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bas na sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba yid la byed pa yang 'gal ba can kho na ste /
analyzed: de bas na sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba yid la byed pa yang 'gal ba can kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, the mental activity of not abandoning all sentient beings is also incompatible.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /🔽don dam rnam par rtog la yang //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa / don dam rnam par rtog la yang //
translated: Just for this reason, it is said:🔽Even in the ultimate, the wise

original: mkhas pas zhum pa mi bya ste //
analyzed: mkhas pas zhum pa mi bya ste //
translated: should not be discouraged by conceptualization.

original: rnam rtog la ni tha dad gang //
analyzed: rnam rtog la ni tha dad gang //
translated: For what is different in conceptualization

original: dge ba'am ni mi dge la //
analyzed: dge ba'am ni mi dge la //
translated: is either virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: brten pa'i dbye bas tha dad med //
analyzed: brten pa'i dbye bas tha dad med //
translated: There is no difference in the division of the basis.

original: ched du me yis bsreg pa nyid //
analyzed: ched du me yis bsreg pa nyid //
translated: It is just burned by fire.

original: tsandan las 'bar de yang ni //
analyzed: tsandan las 'bar de yang ni //
translated: That which burns from sandalwood

original: reg par gyur na sreg pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: reg par gyur na sreg pa yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is also burned when it comes into contact.

original: 'dir ni rab 'byor gyis legs so zhes bya ba'i sngon du 'gro ba can lan te /
analyzed: 'dir ni rab 'byor gyis legs so zhes bya ba'i sngon du 'gro ba can lan te /
translated: Here, Subhūti's answer is preceded by Excellent!

original: rgyas par phyogs @57b snga ma brgya byas pa'i phyir legs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyas par phyogs @57b snga ma brgya byas pa'i phyir legs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the hundredfold expansion of the former position, it is called excellent.

original: don nyid ni kho bo cag la 'dod pa nyid de don la 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don nyid ni kho bo cag la 'dod pa nyid de don la 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning itself is just what we assert, because it has the characteristic of asserting the meaning.

original: yang dag pa'i tshig tu brjod pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i tshig tu brjod pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, by the expression of correct words.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo thams cad yid la byed pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pa dang 'gal ba nyid yang dag pa'i tshig ni yang dag pa'i dngos po ste de'i brjod pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo thams cad yid la byed pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pa dang 'gal ba nyid yang dag pa'i tshig ni yang dag pa'i dngos po ste de'i brjod pas so //
translated: The correct words are the correct things, because they are the opposite of all conceptual natures that are the mental engagements of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rgyas par mi 'dod pa 'bab pas phyogs snga ma'i don mi 'dod pa brjod pa nyid ces khyod la yang klan kar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyas par mi 'dod pa 'bab pas phyogs snga ma'i don mi 'dod pa brjod pa nyid ces khyod la yang klan kar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because of the expression of those, the former position is not asserted, is said.

original: 'dod pa nyid la phyogs snga ma nyid kyis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa nyid la phyogs snga ma nyid kyis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the expression of the former position itself, it is asserted.

original: chen mo rnams la yang 'don pa 'di mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: chen mo rnams la yang 'don pa 'di mthong ba yin te /
translated: This recitation is also seen in the great texts.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu legs so legs so khyod la yang klan kar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu legs so legs so khyod la yang klan kar 'gyur te /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Excellent, excellent, Venerable Śāradvatīputra! But it would be a fault for you.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu don nyid ni tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus yang dag pa'i tshig tu brjod pas yongs su bzung ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu don nyid ni tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus yang dag pa'i tshig tu brjod pas yongs su bzung ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the meaning itself is taken up by the correct words spoken by Venerable Śāradvatīputra.”

original: 'di nyid rjes su brjod nas nyi khri'i gzhung 'grel las bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid rjes su brjod nas nyi khri'i gzhung 'grel las bshad pa ste /
translated: Having expressed just this, it is explained in the commentary on the Twenty-Five Thousand:

original: tshig gsum gyis rjes su yi rang bar byed do //
analyzed: tshig gsum gyis rjes su yi rang bar byed do //
translated: “With three phrases, one rejoices.

original: tshig ni legs pa'i rigs pas klan kar byed de /
analyzed: tshig ni legs pa'i rigs pas klan kar byed de /
translated: The phrases are faultlessly reasoned.

original: legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni gcig go //
analyzed: legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni gcig go //
translated: ‘Excellent, excellent’ is one.

original: klan kar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa ste rigs pas 'di la dmigs pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: klan kar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa ste rigs pas 'di la dmigs pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‘It would be a fault’ is the second, meaning ‘it would arise as an object of reasoning here.’

original: don yongs su bzung ba zhes bya ba ni gsum pa ste rim pa 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das ma 'di la yang 'don pa nyams pa ste /
analyzed: don yongs su bzung ba zhes bya ba ni gsum pa ste rim pa 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das ma 'di la yang 'don pa nyams pa ste /
translated: ‘The meaning is taken up’ is the third. By this sequence, in this Blessed Lady, there is no loss of recitation.

original: 'di khyod la klan kar 'gyur te zhes bya ba nyid kyi 'don pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di khyod la klan kar 'gyur te zhes bya ba nyid kyi 'don pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is your fault.

original: klan ka'i don ni shin tu yang legs par 'brel ba ma mthong ste /
analyzed: klan ka'i don ni shin tu yang legs par 'brel ba ma mthong ste /
translated: The meaning of the fault is not seen to be very well connected,

original: sems can thams cad la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas par thal ba la ma spangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas par thal ba la ma spangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the non-relinquishment of the consequence that the perfection of wisdom is the station of all sentient beings.

original: ji ltar rjes su yi rang ba zhes bya ba'i dgos pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su yi rang ba zhes bya ba'i dgos pa gsungs pa /
translated: As for the purpose of the rejoicing, it is stated:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can ngo bo nyid med pas na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems can ngo bo nyid med pas na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because sentient beings are essenceless.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid de ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid de ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang de dang bral ba'o //
translated: The essencelessness is the emptiness of intrinsic identity, and the essencelessness is the freedom from that.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa ni rnam par dben pa nyid dang med pa nyid dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid de de'i bsam pa la yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa ni rnam par dben pa nyid dang med pa nyid dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid de de'i bsam pa la yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The essencelessness is the isolation, the non-existence, and the inconceivability, because there is no object for that thought.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang ma chub pas na zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pa nyid do //🔽sems can yang dag @58a * //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang ma chub pas na zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pa nyid do // sems can yang dag @58a * //
translated: Because they are not fully enlightened, they do not understand.

original: ba ji lta ba ma yin pa'i don du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pas zhes bya ba'i tshig drug pa yang 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: ba ji lta ba ma yin pa'i don du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pas zhes bya ba'i tshig drug pa yang 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa yin no //
translated: The six words, “because they are not fully enlightened with regard to the meaning of sentient beings as they really are,” are recited by some.

original: de la sems can gyi yang dag pa ji lta ba ma yin pa'i don nyid dang brdzun pa'i dngos po nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa zhes bya ba ni don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sems can gyi yang dag pa ji lta ba ma yin pa'i don nyid dang brdzun pa'i dngos po nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa zhes bya ba ni don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the statement, “They are fully enlightened with regard to the meaning of sentient beings as they really are and with regard to the meaning of sentient beings as unreal,” is as follows.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa yid la byed pa'i yul 'di rnams ni de las gzhan rnams la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa yid la byed pa'i yul 'di rnams ni de las gzhan rnams la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The objects of the attentions to realitylessness, etc., do not exist for those other than them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyi sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu'i zla ba dang mnyam par chos thams cad mthong bas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyi sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu'i zla ba dang mnyam par chos thams cad mthong bas na /
translated: The bodhisattvas see all things as being like illusions, mirages, and the reflection of the moon in water, through the subsequently attained knowledge that follows the supramundane knowledge.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i yid la byed pa yang brdzun par snang ba tsam mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i yid la byed pa yang brdzun par snang ba tsam mthong ba yin te /
translated: The mental activity of not abandoning any sentient being is also seen as merely an appearance of falsity.

original: de rnams las gzhan pa'i sems can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams las gzhan pa'i sems can ni ma yin no //
translated: There are no sentient beings other than those.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: It is said that they do not stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid la byed pa 'di dang gnas pa 'dis gnas par 'dod do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid la byed pa 'di dang gnas pa 'dis gnas par 'dod do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva wishes to stand in such an essence, to stand by this practice.

original: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo so sor rtogs pas so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo so sor rtogs pas so //
translated: By such is meant by the realization of the essence of essencelessness, etc.

original: gnas pa 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pas so zhes bya ba'i sgras ni le'u rdzogs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: gnas pa 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pas so zhes bya ba'i sgras ni le'u rdzogs pa'i don du'o //
translated: By this practice is meant by the practice of the perfection of wisdom. The word stand is for the purpose of completing the chapter.

original: rab 'byor gyi le'u zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi po ti rnams la 'don pa yin te rab 'byor gtso bo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor gyi le'u ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi le'u zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi po ti rnams la 'don pa yin te rab 'byor gtso bo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor gyi le'u ste /
translated: The chapter called Subhūti is found in the old manuscripts. It is called the chapter of Subhūti because Subhūti is taught as the chief.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir 'chad par 'gyur ba rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir 'chad par 'gyur ba rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For this very reason, it will be explained that it should be sought in the chapter of Subhūti.

original: spyod pa'i le'u ste rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi spyod pa'i le'u zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa'i le'u ste rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi spyod pa'i le'u zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
translated: The chapter on conduct, called the chapter on the conduct of omniscience, is recited in some places.

original: de la spyod pa ni spyod pa byed pa ste de gsal bar byed pa'i le'u ste le'u dang po'o /
analyzed: de la spyod pa ni spyod pa byed pa ste de gsal bar byed pa'i le'u ste le'u dang po'o /
translated: There, conduct is the performance of conduct. This is the first chapter that clarifies that.

original: // / de ltar re zhig par ma'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de ltar re zhig par ma'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the teaching of the perfection of wisdom of the mother should be completed.

original: gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas rnam pa gsum du gsal par mdzad de mdor bsdus pa dang / bar ma dang / rgyas pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas rnam pa gsum du gsal par mdzad de mdor bsdus pa dang / bar ma dang / rgyas pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: For this reason, this perfection of wisdom was clarified by the Tathagata in three aspects, called concise, intermediate, and extensive.

original: de la gdul @58b bya'i dbang gis mdor bsdus pa dang bar ma'i tshul dag gis 'chad pa las 'di'i 'og tu gdul bya yongs su ma smin pa rnams lam skyes pa dang skyes pa'i the tshom bsal bas yongs su smin par byed pa yongs su smin pa rnams
analyzed: de la gdul @58b bya'i dbang gis mdor bsdus pa dang bar ma'i tshul dag gis 'chad pa las 'di'i 'og tu gdul bya yongs su ma smin pa rnams lam skyes pa dang skyes pa'i the tshom bsal bas yongs su smin par byed pa yongs su smin pa rnams
translated: In that, there is the explanation by way of the brief and the medium modes, due to the power of those to be trained. Here, after that, there is the complete ripening of those disciples whose faculties are not completely ripe, by way of the removal of doubts about the path that has arisen and that which has not arisen.

original: la'o // de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs par byed pa dang ste kun rdzob pa dang de ni dam pa'i tshul rnam par 'byed pas rnam pa gnyis kyis byang chub sems dpa' lam gyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nas brtsams te rgyas par bshad par bya ba
analyzed: la'o // de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs par byed pa dang ste kun rdzob pa dang de ni dam pa'i tshul rnam par 'byed pas rnam pa gnyis kyis byang chub sems dpa' lam gyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nas brtsams te rgyas par bshad par bya ba
translated: For those whose faculties are completely ripe, there is the explanation of the meaning of reality, and by way of the two modes of the conventional and the ultimate, there is the extensive explanation, beginning with the knowledge of all aspects of the path of the bodhisattva.

original: ni de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ni de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is the topic of “at that time” and so forth.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ste dus de la'o //

analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams ni 'jig rten gyi khams kyis yang dag par @59a * //
translated: The second absorption and so on are the same as the first absorption in terms of the world systems that are their basis.🔽

original: bsdus pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsdus pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The second absorption and so on are not subsumed by the world systems of the desire realm.🔽The four continents, the sun and moon,

original: gling bzhi pa dang nyi zla dang // ri rab dang ni 'dod lha dang // tshangs pa'i 'jig rten stong la ni //🔽stong ni spyi phud yin par 'dod //

translated: Meru, the gods of the desire realm and the world of Brahma🔽are one chiliocosm.

original: de stong la ni stong gnyis pa //🔽bar ma'i 'jig rten khams yin no //
analyzed: de stong la ni stong gnyis pa // bar ma'i 'jig rten khams yin no //
translated: A thousand of those is a dichiliocosm.

original: de stong la ni stong gsum ste//
analyzed: de stong la ni stong gsum ste//
translated: A thousand of those is a trichiliocosm

original: mnyam du 'jig cing 'jug pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: mnyam du 'jig cing 'jug pa yin // zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: that is destroyed and formed simultaneously.

original: tshangs pa'i tshogs de de las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i tshogs de de las 'byung ba'o //
translated: The assembly of Brahmas arises from that.

original: 'dir ni 'og ma'i tshogs la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'og ma'i tshogs la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Here, the lower assembly is included.

analyzed: 'di rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: These are free from the attachment of the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mdun du gnas gtsang ma lnga ste mi che ba dang mi gdung ba dang shin tu mthong ba dang blta na sdug dang 'og min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mdun du gnas gtsang ma lnga ste mi che ba dang mi gdung ba dang shin tu mthong ba dang blta na sdug dang 'og min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Five pure abodes are located in front of the fourth absorption: Mahanimisa, Avriha, Sudarshana, Sudarshana and Akanistha.

original: ci'i phyir gnas gtsang ma rnams te 'phags pa rnams nyid de rnams las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnas gtsang ma rnams te 'phags pa rnams nyid de rnams las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because they are born from the pure abodes, i.e. from the Noble Ones themselves.

original: rigs lnga po de rnams kyi stong phrag lnga nyid do //
analyzed: rigs lnga po de rnams kyi stong phrag lnga nyid do //
translated: And those five families are five thousand.

original: gang yin pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: gang yin pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: Those who are, etc.

original: de rnams kyang 'khod par gyur pa gang zhig yang de rnams kyi 'od de yang zil gyis mnan to //
analyzed: de rnams kyang 'khod par gyur pa gang zhig yang de rnams kyi 'od de yang zil gyis mnan to //
translated: They also assembled, and their light was also surpassed.

original: dus mnyam nyid du gang yin pa yang de gzhan gyi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: dus mnyam nyid du gang yin pa yang de gzhan gyi sgra'i don to //
translated: Simultaneously, etc.

original: ci'i phyir lha'i 'du ba bshad par byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lha'i 'du ba bshad par byed /
translated: Why is the assembly of gods explained?

original: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od yang dag par brjod pa la gnas skabs yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od yang dag par brjod pa la gnas skabs yin zhe na /
translated: And in the declaration of the light of the Tathagata, what is the occasion?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di la sngon chad ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di la sngon chad ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this teaching of the perfection of wisdom has not occurred before.

original: slar ni grangs su bya ba'i 'khor 'dus pa yang bstan par bya /
analyzed: slar ni grangs su bya ba'i 'khor 'dus pa yang bstan par bya /
translated: Again, the assembly of the retinue to be counted is to be shown.

original: 'od zer 'byung ba yang snga na med pa'i chos bstan pa la rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: 'od zer 'byung ba yang snga na med pa'i chos bstan pa la rgyu mtshan no //
translated: And the appearance of the light is the reason for the teaching of the unprecedented Dharma.

original: 'od zer 'byung ba ni 'od kyi tshogs bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: 'od zer 'byung ba ni 'od kyi tshogs bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The arising of light is indicated by the words “an array of light.”

original: 'od ces bya ba ni 'dod do //
analyzed: 'od ces bya ba ni 'dod do //
translated: “ Light” means desired.

original: las kyi rnam par smin par byed pa ni rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin par byed pa ni rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The ripening of karma is ripening.

original: de las skyes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa ste mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las skyes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa ste mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which arises from that is innate, not fabricated—this is the meaning.

original: rgyu gang gis zil gyis mnan snyam na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis zil gyis mnan snyam na /
translated: By what cause are they outshone?

original: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang nye bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang nye bas so //
translated: “ By the Buddha’s blessing” means by the Buddha’s proximity.

original: gang gis gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis gang du zhe na /
translated: By whom and where?

original: sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi 'od kyis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi 'od kyis so //
translated: By the Buddha’s splendor and by the light of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: de rnams kyang mthu chen po dang ldan pa de'i phyir ji ltar zil gyis non zhe na /🔽gsungs pa / sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang mthu chen po dang ldan pa de'i phyir ji ltar zil gyis non zhe na / gsungs pa / sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since they also have great power, how are they outshone?🔽It is said: “By the Buddha’s power.”

original: sangs @59b rgyas kyi mthus mthu thams cad zil gyis gnon pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs @59b rgyas kyi mthus mthu thams cad zil gyis gnon pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By the Buddha’s power, all powers are outshone—this is the meaning.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, etc.

original: ci'i phyir lha'i dbang po de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba mi 'debs par gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'dri bar byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lha'i dbang po de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba mi 'debs par gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'dri bar byed /
translated: Why does he not request the Tathagata, but rather questions Subhuti?

original: nyan thos kyis bstan pas 'dul bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir de'i dus kyi 'khor rnams la'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis bstan pas 'dul bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir de'i dus kyi 'khor rnams la'o //
translated: Because the assembly at that time was to be disciplined by the teaching of the Sravakas.

original: 'khor der rab 'byor la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i don du bka' stsal pa nyid kyi phyir de la gsol ba 'debs pa'i sgo nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la yang gsol ba 'debs par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor der rab 'byor la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i don du bka' stsal pa nyid kyi phyir de la gsol ba 'debs pa'i sgo nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la yang gsol ba 'debs par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: In that assembly, Subhuti was commanded to teach the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the Bodhisattvas. Therefore, by the very fact of his request, he also requests the Tathagata.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhes bya ba 'di dang 'brel lam mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhes bya ba 'di dang 'brel lam mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: nye bar bstan par byed pas na nye bar bstan pa ste de nyid kyi don to //

translated: The summary is that together with that, which is the teaching that is the teaching of the obstructions to that, by the very activity for those who are suitable for understanding.

original: can ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: can ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: they are not vessels.

analyzed: de rnams dus ji srid par yang skal ba med pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: For as long as they are not vessels, they are said to be unfortunate.
