original: dge ba'i phyogs la zhes bya ba ni don dam par dge ba mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la zhes bya ba ni don dam par dge ba mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The side of virtue is nirvana, which is ultimately virtuous.

original: de'i phyogs ni rjes su mthun pa byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyogs ni rjes su mthun pa byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'o //
translated: Its side is the concordant factors, such as the thought of awakening.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The especially exalted factors are the thought of awakening, etc.

original: lnga pa ni rgyu la'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni rgyu la'o //
translated: The fifth is in the cause.

original: ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos kyi bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid kyi nges ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos kyi bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid kyi nges ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The especially exalted activity of the Dharma is the ascertainment of reality, etc.

original: lhag par dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag par dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba'o //
translated: One should especially focus on it means one should attain it.

original: de'i phyir bar du gcod par mi byed ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir bar du gcod par mi byed ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi sgra'i don to //
translated: Therefore, “do not obstruct” is the meaning of the word “because.”

original: de ltar kha cig ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i don du spro ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar kha cig ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i don du spro ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Thus, some are inspired to generate the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems sngar bskyed pa rnams ni yang dag par dga' ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems sngar bskyed pa rnams ni yang dag par dga' ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Those who have already generated the Thought of Enlightenment are inspired to perfect it.

original: de ltar byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i phyir de dag gnyi ga yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yod par gyur pa las lam shes pa nyid la spro ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i phyir de dag gnyi ga yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yod par gyur pa las lam shes pa nyid la spro ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Thus, both of them are Bodhisattvas, Great Beings, who have generated the Thought of Enlightenment, and they are inspired to the knowledge of the path.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: It is for this very reason that it is said:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Then,” etc.

original: khyod legs so zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don che ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod legs so zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don che ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Well done” is because of the great benefit to others.

original: bdag cag gis ni bka' drin gzo bar bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag cag gis ni bka' drin gzo bar bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “We will repay your kindness,” etc.

original: sngar nyan thos rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gang zhig byas pa de rig pa kho bo cag gis bgyi'o //
analyzed: sngar nyan thos rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gang zhig byas pa de rig pa kho bo cag gis bgyi'o //
translated: The śrāvakas previously said to the Bhagavān, “We will do whatever you do.”

original: ci smras @60b par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci smras @60b par 'gyur ro //
translated: What did they say?

original: sngar ni kho bo cag la bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i sngon byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'khor gyi nang du nyan thos rnams kyis gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pas yang dag par sgrub pa la nges par zhugs par byed pa
analyzed: sngar ni kho bo cag la bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i sngon byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'khor gyi nang du nyan thos rnams kyis gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pas yang dag par sgrub pa la nges par zhugs par byed pa
translated: “Previously, when the Bhagavān was a bodhisattva, he was established in the instructions and teachings of the śrāvakas in the retinue of the tathāgatas of the past.

original: des smras pa'i sgrub pa'i rim gyis grub pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa gang de'i phyir /
analyzed: des smras pa'i sgrub pa'i rim gyis grub pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa gang de'i phyir /
translated: By the stages of practice that he taught, he attained complete buddhahood.

original: kho bo cag gis kyang 'di'i 'khor gyi nang du byang chub sems dpa' 'di rnams gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa dang yang dag par sgrub pa la nges par zhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis kyang 'di'i 'khor gyi nang du byang chub sems dpa' 'di rnams gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa dang yang dag par sgrub pa la nges par zhugs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, we also will establish these bodhisattvas in the instructions, teachings, and practice in his retinue.”

original: snga ma des kho bo cag la nye bar bstan pa'i rim pas rtogs par byed pa na mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma des kho bo cag la nye bar bstan pa'i rim pas rtogs par byed pa na mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one realizes it by the process taught to us, one becomes fully enlightened.

original: de'i phyir sngon gyi nyan thos bka' drin gzo ba kho bo cag gis bgyi ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon gyi nyan thos bka' drin gzo ba kho bo cag gis bgyi ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, we should repay the kindness of the former disciples.

original: ngon gyi ni sngon nyid do //
analyzed: ngon gyi ni sngon nyid do //
translated: The former is the past.

original: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Brahma is nirvana.

original: de'i phyir spyod pa ni tshangs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyod pa ni tshangs par spyod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the practice is the practice of Brahma.

original: de spyod pa na zhes bya ba ste byang chub kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi don du'o //
analyzed: de spyod pa na zhes bya ba ste byang chub kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi don du'o //
translated: When one practices it, i.e., for the sake of enlightenment, i.e., for the sake of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means practicing the practice of enlightenment.

original: gang bdag gis zhes bya ba ni byed tshig dang 'dra ba'i mi 'jig pa ji ltar gyi don no //
analyzed: gang bdag gis zhes bya ba ni byed tshig dang 'dra ba'i mi 'jig pa ji ltar gyi don no //
translated: What I have done is like the verbal root, and the meaning of how is like the non-perishing.

original: gdams shing zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag du byas pa yang dag par bskyang ba'o /
analyzed: gdams shing zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag du byas pa yang dag par bskyang ba'o /
translated: Having instructed means having given instructions and having sustained them.

original: kha da zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i ngag la'o zhes bya ba 'di yang dza la sogs pa'i bar du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha da zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i ngag la'o zhes bya ba 'di yang dza la sogs pa'i bar du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word khatha means clear speech, and this is explained up to jala and so on.

original: gdams par byas pa zhes bya bya ba ni 'ga' zhig las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gdams par byas pa zhes bya bya ba ni 'ga' zhig las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The word avavāda means instruction.

original: der ba da zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i dngos po la ste khams 'di la don mang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽rjes su yongs su gzung bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni gdams par bya'o //
analyzed: der ba da zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i dngos po la ste khams 'di la don mang ba nyid kyi phyir ro // rjes su yongs su gzung bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni gdams par bya'o //
translated: The word vadatā means in the matter of teaching, because this element has many meanings.🔽The word anuparigṛhṇīyāma means we should instruct.

original: rjes su yongs su bskor bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su yongs su bskor bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su bstan par bya'o //
translated: The word anuparivartayāmāsm means we should teach.

original: 'og ma'i tshig dag la yang dag la yang dag pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'og ma'i tshig dag la yang dag la yang dag pa'i don to //
translated: The word adho means below, and the word adhas means the meaning of reality.

original: bdag cag gis zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams kyis yang bdag nyid dang rigs mthun pa rnams la bdag nyid kyi tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag cag gis zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams kyis yang bdag nyid dang rigs mthun pa rnams la bdag nyid kyi tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word asmābhiḥ means by us, because the Śrāvakas also have the convention of self in relation to those of the same lineage.

original: ngas khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ngas khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: The word ahaṃ te vyākariṣyāmi means I will explain to you.

original: koo shi ka nyon cig ces 'grel to //
analyzed: koo shi ka nyon cig ces 'grel to //
translated: The word kauśika śṛṇu means listen, Kauśika.

original: ji ltar char 'bebs kyang snod gsum la chus chu'i bya ba mi byed pa ni gang du kha phub pa la chu mi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar char 'bebs kyang snod gsum la chus chu'i bya ba mi byed pa ni gang du kha phub pa la chu mi 'jug pa ste /
translated: Just as rain falls, but the water does not perform its function of water in three kinds of vessels.🔽In which vessel?🔽In the one that is upside down, the water does not enter.

original: gang du yang mi @61a * //
analyzed: gang du yang mi @61a * //
translated: In which vessel?

original: gtsang ba la zhugs pa skyon dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtsang ba la zhugs pa skyon dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the one that is cracked, it is lost.🔽In which vessel?

original: gang du zhabs rdol la ni mi gnas pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang du zhabs rdol la ni mi gnas pa de bzhin du /
translated: In the one that is leaking, it does not stay.

original: nyan pa po'i skye bo'i yid kyi snod gsum la chos kyi char bab kyang chos smra ba po'i chos kyi chus bya ba mi byed do //
analyzed: nyan pa po'i skye bo'i yid kyi snod gsum la chos kyi char bab kyang chos smra ba po'i chos kyi chus bya ba mi byed do //
translated: In the same way, when the rain of Dharma falls on the three kinds of vessels of the minds of listeners, the water of the Dharma of the one who preaches the Dharma does not perform its function.🔽In which vessel?🔽In the one that is upside down, because of distraction, etc., the water does not enter.🔽In which vessel?

original: gang du ma thos pas g-yeng ba la sogs pas mi zhugs pa dang / gang du yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa zhugs pas 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang du ma thos pas g-yeng ba la sogs pas mi zhugs pa dang / gang du yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa zhugs pas 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the one that is cracked, because of incorrect mental placement, it is lost.🔽In which vessel?

original: gang du yang dran pa brjod pas gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang du yang dran pa brjod pas gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: In the one that is leaking, because of forgetfulness, it does not stay.

original: skyon gsum po ni bsal ba'i don du gsungs pa legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang / de ni nyan pa'i skyon rnam pa gsum du ma gyur cig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: skyon gsum po ni bsal ba'i don du gsungs pa legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang / de ni nyan pa'i skyon rnam pa gsum du ma gyur cig ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is to say, “May I not have the three kinds of faults of a listener.”

original: yang dag par gus par byas nas chos nyon cig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag par gus par byas nas chos nyon cig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is, “Listen to the Dharma with perfect respect.”

original: ji ltar gnas par bya zhes brgya byin gyi sngar gyi dri ba de'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas par bya zhes brgya byin gyi sngar gyi dri ba de'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of the question asked by Śatakratu above, “How should one stand?” is stated:

original: ji ltar gnas par bya zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas par bya zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “How should one stand?”

original: stong pa nyid la zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid la'o //
translated: “In emptiness” means in the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: gnas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lam mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lam mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo la gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should stand in the perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of the knowledge of paths.

original: stong pa nyid dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag la mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag la mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because emptiness and the perfection of wisdom have the same nature.

original: gnas bkag pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa zhes bstan par byed de /
analyzed: gnas bkag pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa zhes bstan par byed de /
translated: By refuting standing, it is taught that one should stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha chen po ste der gnas kyi sgro 'dogs pa ni rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha chen po ste der gnas kyi sgro 'dogs pa ni rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: The non-apprehension of all dharmas is the great armor of the Bodhisattva. The authoritativeness of the Bodhisattva who is stationed there is shown by three kinds of non-apprehension.

original: chos rnams la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba ni gcig go //
analyzed: chos rnams la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba ni gcig go //
translated: The first is: one should not stand in the dharmas.

original: chos nyid la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is: one should not stand in the dharmata.

original: gang zag rnams la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag rnams la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is: one should not stand in the persons.

original: chos la spyod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos la spyod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The practice of the dharmas is also of two kinds.

original: chos bshad pa dang chos kyi mtshan nyid spyad pa'o //
analyzed: chos bshad pa dang chos kyi mtshan nyid spyad pa'o //
translated: The practice of the explanation of the dharmas and the practice of the characteristics of the dharmas.

original: de la gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ji sred sangs rgyas nyid la yang gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya bas chos kyi bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ji sred sangs rgyas nyid la yang gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya bas chos kyi bshad pa'o //
translated: The practice of the explanation of the dharmas is from the words: one should not stand in form, up to: one should not stand in Buddhahood.🔽The practice of the characteristics of the dharmas is from the words: one should not stand in the perfection of giving, up to: one should not stand in the knowledge of all modes.

original: de bzhin du gzugs so zhes gnas par mi bya'o nas ji srid de bzhin du sangs rgyas zhes gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas chos kyi mtshan nyid bshad pa'o //🔽gzugs rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'o zhes gnas par mi bya'o @61b zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ji srid sangs rgyas nyid 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya bas chos nyid kyi bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs so zhes gnas par mi bya'o nas ji srid de bzhin du sangs rgyas zhes gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas chos kyi mtshan nyid bshad pa'o // gzugs rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'o zhes gnas par mi bya'o @61b zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ji srid sangs rgyas nyid 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya bas chos nyid kyi bshad pa'o //
translated: Similarly, one should not settle down on the idea that it is form, and so on up to one should not settle down on the idea that it is a Buddha. This is the explanation of the characteristics of the Dharma.🔽One should not settle down on the idea that form is permanent or impermanent, and so on up to one should not settle down on the idea that Buddhahood is distinguished by the unconditioned. This is the explanation of the nature of the Dharma.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa sbyin pa'i gnas so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ji srid sangs rgyas kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mthas gang zag bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa sbyin pa'i gnas so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ji srid sangs rgyas kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mthas gang zag bshad pa'o //
translated: One should not settle down on the idea that the stream-winner is a fit object for offerings, and so on up to one should not settle down on the idea that the Buddha passes into final Nirvana through Parinirvana. This is the explanation of the individual.

original: de la chos kyi gnas bkag pa la gzugs nas ji srid rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bya zhes bya bas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi gnas bkag pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos kyi gnas bkag pa la gzugs nas ji srid rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bya zhes bya bas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi gnas bkag pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the prohibition of the basis of dharma is the prohibition of the basis of the dharmas of defilement, from “one should not stand in form” up to “one should not stand in consciousness.”

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par byang ba'i chos kyi gnas pa bkag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par byang ba'i chos kyi gnas pa bkag pa'o //
translated: The prohibition of the basis of the dharmas of purification is the prohibition of the basis of the dharmas of purification, from “one should not stand in the fruit of entering the stream” and so on.

original: po ti 'ga' zhig la rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bya ba 'di'i rjes la mig la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: po ti 'ga' zhig la rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bya ba 'di'i rjes la mig la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: In some editions, after “one should not stand in consciousness” there is an additional line: “one should not stand in the eye.”

original: ji srid lam gyi yan lag rnams la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba lhag par 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: ji srid lam gyi yan lag rnams la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba lhag par 'don pa yin no //
translated: And after that, “one should not stand in the limbs of the path” and so on.

original: de la mig la zhes bya ba la sogs pas khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: de la mig la zhes bya ba la sogs pas khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
translated: In this regard, from “the eye” and so on, the distinctions of the elements, sense bases, and so on are taught.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'dus pa yod pa la /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'dus pa yod pa la /
translated: In the coming together of the eye, the sense faculty, object, and consciousness,

original: gang zhig bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba bskyed pa la rjes su mthun pa'i dbang por 'gyur ba'i yongs su gcod par byed pa 'dra ba tsam nyid kyis bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba skyed par byed pa dang bcas pa'i sems las byung ba ni reg🔽pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang zhig bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba bskyed pa la rjes su mthun pa'i dbang por 'gyur ba'i yongs su gcod par byed pa 'dra ba tsam nyid kyis bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba skyed par byed pa dang bcas pa'i sems las byung ba ni reg pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Contact is that which, by the mere fact of its similarity to the faculty that produces the sensation of pleasure, etc., produces the sensation of pleasure, etc.

original: dbang po'i 'gyur ba ni 'dra bas reg par byed ces bya ba byas pas so //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'gyur ba ni 'dra bas reg par byed ces bya ba byas pas so //
translated: It is called contact because it brings about the contact of the object with the faculty.🔽The contact of the eye, etc., is called contact because it brings about the contact of the object with the faculty, since the faculty is modified in a similar way.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i dbye bas mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas ji srid yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i dbye bas mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas ji srid yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'o //
translated: Therefore, contact is classified according to the faculties, from contact of the eye up to contact of the mind.

original: chos mngon pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las gsungs pa /
translated: The Abhidharma states:

original: gsum 'dus pa las dbang po'i 'gyur ba yongs su gcod pa ni reg pa ste /
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las dbang po'i 'gyur ba yongs su gcod pa ni reg pa ste /
translated: Contact is the modification of the faculty that occurs when the three, i.e., the object, faculty, and consciousness, meet.

original: tshor ba bskyed pa yang dag pa'i rten sbyin pa'i las can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba bskyed pa yang dag pa'i rten sbyin pa'i las can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Its activity is to provide support for the generation of sensation.

original: 'don pa 'di thams cad sngar gyi po ti rnams la ma mthong ste /
analyzed: 'don pa 'di thams cad sngar gyi po ti rnams la ma mthong ste /
translated: This passage is not found in the earlier editions.

original: de'i phyir gzhag pa byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhag pa byung bar gyur to //
translated: Therefore, it is added here.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di la mdor bsdus pa bshad pa thams cad du chos 'chad pa la phung po rnams nyid 'don pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di la mdor bsdus pa bshad pa thams cad du chos 'chad pa la phung po rnams nyid 'don pa yin te /
translated: In this Blessed Lady, the brief explanation is that the aggregates themselves are recited in all explanations of the Dharma.

original: khams dang skye mched la sogs pa ni ma yin no //🔽de'i phyir ji ltar gnas pa 'di la 'di lta bu'i 'don pa rigs @62a * //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched la sogs pa ni ma yin no // de'i phyir ji ltar gnas pa 'di la 'di lta bu'i 'don pa rigs @62a * //
translated: The elements, sense bases, etc. are not.

original: pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this recitation is appropriate in this context.

original: gzhan yang chos nyid bshad pa'i dus na gzugs ni rtag pa ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa phung po rnams nyid la gcig tu chos nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos nyid bshad pa'i dus na gzugs ni rtag pa ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa phung po rnams nyid la gcig tu chos nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, when the reality of phenomena is explained, the reality of the aggregates alone is taught, such as saying “Form is neither permanent nor impermanent,” etc.

original: chen po rnams la yang 'di mig la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: chen po rnams la yang 'di mig la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'don pa yin no //
translated: And in the great texts, it is recited as “Do not abide in the eye,” etc.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid la yang gnas par mi bya zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid la yang gnas par mi bya zhes gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said to abide in the characteristics of phenomena.

original: de bzhin du gzugs so zhes gnas par mi bya zhes bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas chos rnams la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs so zhes gnas par mi bya zhes bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas chos rnams la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “Do not abide in form,” etc. is explained by the immediately preceding sequence, so do not abide in phenomena.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir la'o /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir la'o /
translated: “For what reason?” means “for what reason?”

original: de'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs su byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gzugs zhes bya ba ste chos kyi mtshan nyid la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs su byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gzugs zhes bya ba ste chos kyi mtshan nyid la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, “form” is the characteristic of that which is formed, called “form.” It is said, “One should not abide in the characteristic of dharmas.”

original: de bzhin du gzugs zhes bya ba ste chos kyi mtshan nyid la yang gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs zhes bya ba ste chos kyi mtshan nyid la yang gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Similarly, “form” is the characteristic of that which is formed. The meaning is: “One should not abide in the characteristic of dharmas.”

original: chos nyid la yang gnas pa med pa gsungs pa ni gzugs rtag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste re zhig chos dang chos kyi mtshan nyid la yang gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyid la yang gnas pa med pa gsungs pa ni gzugs rtag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste re zhig chos dang chos kyi mtshan nyid la yang gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: As for the statement that “one should not abide in the nature of dharmas,” it is said, “Form is permanent,” and so on. One should not abide in dharmas and the characteristics of dharmas.

original: gang zhig yang de rnams la phyin ci log gi ngo bos skye ba'i chos nyid brtags pa nyon mongs pa dang zad pa'i rgyu nyid kyis phyin ci log ma yin pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal las mi rtag pa nyid de dag la yang gnas par mi bya ste
analyzed: gang zhig yang de rnams la phyin ci log gi ngo bos skye ba'i chos nyid brtags pa nyon mongs pa dang zad pa'i rgyu nyid kyis phyin ci log ma yin pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal las mi rtag pa nyid de dag la yang gnas par mi bya ste
translated: Moreover, one should not abide in impermanence, etc., which are imagined to be the nature of arising through the essential error of those, because of being the cause of the exhaustion of afflictions.

original: / gzugs la sogs pa rnams la rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis de'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / gzugs la sogs pa rnams la rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis de'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because form, etc. are devoid of intrinsic reality, and the nature of their reality is non-existent.

original: sdug pa ni gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: sdug pa ni gtsang ba'o //
translated: The agreeable is the pure,

original: mi sdug pa ni mi gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa ni mi gtsang ba'o //
translated: and the disagreeable is the impure.

original: gzugs stong pa'o zhes bya ba yang mi dmigs pa ste dmigs pa yin pas na dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs stong pa'o zhes bya ba yang mi dmigs pa ste dmigs pa yin pas na dmigs pa'o //
translated: The statement form is empty is also non-apprehension, because it is apprehension.

original: de bas ni 'di gnyi ga yang ngo //
analyzed: de bas ni 'di gnyi ga yang ngo //
translated: Therefore, both are apprehensions.

original: 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya ba la 'dus ma byas pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya ba la 'dus ma byas pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The unconditioned is nirvana,

original: des rab tu phye ba ni bskyed pa ste dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rab tu phye ba ni bskyed pa ste dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and that which is distinguished by it is generated, because it has the nature of an object.

original: sbyin pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni yon gnas kyi ngo bo can chos nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni yon gnas kyi ngo bo can chos nyid gsungs so //
translated: The statement the basis of gifts is the statement of reality, which has the nature of a basis of gifts.

original: lam la gnas pa la yang yon ni gzhal du med pa'i 'bras bu ster ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam la gnas pa la yang yon ni gzhal du med pa'i 'bras bu ster ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the result given to one who abides in the path is immeasurable.

original: srid pa lan bdun pa'o zhes bya ba ni las kyi sgom pa la brtson 'grus dang mi ldan yang chos nyid kyi stobs kyis skye ba bdun @62b pa la dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa lan bdun pa'o zhes bya ba ni las kyi sgom pa la brtson 'grus dang mi ldan yang chos nyid kyi stobs kyis skye ba bdun @62b pa la dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who is reborn seven times is one who strives with vigor in the path of action, but who, by the power of reality, attains the state of an arhat in seven existences.

original: mthar ma phyin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad kyis 'dod pa'i chags pa ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar ma phyin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad kyis 'dod pa'i chags pa ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has not completed the course, he has not abandoned attachment to the realm of desire in all its forms.

original: 'jig rten 'dir lan cig phyir 'ongs nas zhes bya ba ni lan cig slar 'dod pa'i khams su 'ongs nas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dir lan cig phyir 'ongs nas zhes bya ba ni lan cig slar 'dod pa'i khams su 'ongs nas so //
translated: Having returned once to this world, he returns once more to the realm of desire.

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa med pa'i 'jig rten la'o //
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa med pa'i 'jig rten la'o //
translated: In that very place, in the realm of desire.

original: 'di nyid du zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i gnas gang la khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa lhag mar gyur pa 'di rnams la bdag tu brlan pa de'i phyir lhag ma rnams ni phung po rnams so //
analyzed: 'di nyid du zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i gnas gang la khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa lhag mar gyur pa 'di rnams la bdag tu brlan pa de'i phyir lhag ma rnams ni phung po rnams so //
translated: In this very place, in the place of rebirth, he abandons the remaining defilements of the three realms.

original: de nyid ni lhag ma ste phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa la de bzlog pas lhag ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni lhag ma ste phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa la de bzlog pas lhag ma med pa'o //
translated: That itself is the remainder, and the one who has eliminated that is the one without remainder.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa nyid ni dbyings te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa nyid ni dbyings te /
translated: The realm is nirvana itself,

original: dmigs pa'i ngo bos 'phags pa rnams bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i ngo bos 'phags pa rnams bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause for the generation of the noble ones through the nature of the object.

original: nyan thos kyis las 'das nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sgra la rjes su 'gro ba ni nyan thos kyi sa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis las 'das nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sgra la rjes su 'gro ba ni nyan thos kyi sa'o //
translated: Having transcended the level of the śrāvakas means that the śrāvakas follow the words of another.

original: de yang gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa med na rang nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs pa'i phyir rang sangs rgyas kyis 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa med na rang nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs pa'i phyir rang sangs rgyas kyis 'da' ba'o //
translated: Having transcended that, the pratyekabuddhas do not rely on another, because they themselves manifest complete enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir de'i ye shes kyang khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i ye shes kyang khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, their gnosis is also distinguished.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ba ni kun tu 'od la gnas nas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ba ni kun tu 'od la gnas nas so //
translated: The level of the buddhas means that, having attained the level of Universal Radiance,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni bdud bcom pa dang chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni bdud bcom pa dang chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the deeds of the buddhas are the deeds of the buddhas, such as conquering Māra, turning the wheel of Dharma, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas zhes bya ba ni ji srid du sangs rgyas rnams kyi bar chad med pa'i byang chub thob par rung ba byang chub sems dpa'i lung bstan pa la sogs pa gdon mi za bar bya ba de thams cad byas
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas zhes bya ba ni ji srid du sangs rgyas rnams kyi bar chad med pa'i byang chub thob par rung ba byang chub sems dpa'i lung bstan pa la sogs pa gdon mi za bar bya ba de thams cad byas
translated: Having done all that is to be done, such as the prediction of the bodhisattvas, which is necessary for the uninterrupted attainment of enlightenment by the buddhas for as long as they exist,

original: nas / ji lta bur gyur pa'i yul dang dus la sogs pa rnams la sangs rgyas rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de lta bur gyur pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes brjod do
analyzed: nas / ji lta bur gyur pa'i yul dang dus la sogs pa rnams la sangs rgyas rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de lta bur gyur pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes brjod do
translated: the parinirvāṇa that is the parinirvāṇa of the buddhas in such places and times, etc., is called the Buddha's parinirvāṇa.

original: // yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i skus zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: // yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i skus zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One will attain parinirvāṇa should be understood as referring to the emanation body.

analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /

original: bzo yi skye gnas byang chub che //
analyzed: bzo yi skye gnas byang chub che //

analyzed: rtag tu sprul pa mthong rnams kyis //

original: sangs rgyas sprul pa'i sku 'di ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sprul pa'i sku 'di ni //

original: rnam par grol la thabs chen yin //
analyzed: rnam par grol la thabs chen yin //

analyzed: ji ltar gzhan du me 'bar te //

analyzed: slar yang gzhan du zhi bar 'gyur //
translated: and is extinguished elsewhere,🔽so it is for the buddhas

analyzed: yang dag mthong dang ma mthong dang // sangs rgyas @63a * // rnams la yang zhes bya // zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: 'dir bye brag tu smra ba rnams phyogs snga mar gnas pa yin te /

analyzed: skyon dang dgos pa thal bar 'gyur //

original: 'di'i de rnams gdul bya ma yin zhes smra bar nus pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i de rnams gdul bya ma yin zhes smra bar nus pa yang ma yin no //

original: ro // byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams kyi go skabs byed pa'i don du 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan rnams la sangs rgyas rnams sems can gyi don mi mdzad kyi nus pa med pa nyid kyi @63b phyir slar ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ro // byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams kyi go skabs byed pa'i don du 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan rnams la sangs rgyas rnams sems can gyi don mi mdzad kyi nus pa med pa nyid kyi @63b phyir slar ma yin no zhe na /
translated: In order to make room for other Bodhisattvas, the Buddhas do not work for the welfare of sentient beings in other world-realms, not because they are incapable.

original: gal te de ltar na gling bzhi tsam la sangs rgyas 'byung ba de lta na yang mang ba rnams la shin tu yang go skabs byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na gling bzhi tsam la sangs rgyas 'byung ba de lta na yang mang ba rnams la shin tu yang go skabs byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then even if the Buddhas appear in just the four continents, they make room for many.

original: stong gsum pa gcig gi don du gling bzhi pa'i 'byung ba 'dod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: stong gsum pa gcig gi don du gling bzhi pa'i 'byung ba 'dod pa kho na yin te /
translated: They assert that the Buddhas appear in the four continents for the sake of one trichiliocosm.

original: gal te de ltar na stong gsum thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gling re rer sprul pa'i skus sems can gyi don zhes khas len par gyis /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na stong gsum thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gling re rer sprul pa'i skus sems can gyi don zhes khas len par gyis /
translated: If that is so, then you should accept that a single Tathagata in all trichiliocosms acts for the welfare of sentient beings in each continent through his emanation body.

analyzed: gzhan du na thogs pa med pa'i nus pa can de bzhin gshegs pa zhes snyan pa smra ba tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, you would be merely speaking sweetly of the Tathagata as having unobstructed power.

original: 'jig rten yongs su gtong ba'i don du bdag sangs rgyas su gyur cig ces bya ba yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten yongs su gtong ba'i don du bdag sangs rgyas su gyur cig ces bya ba yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam mo //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ vow is: “May I become a Buddha for the sake of giving the world.”

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan la ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par 'byung /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan la ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par 'byung /
translated: Therefore, how could a Tathāgata appear in another world-realms?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gnas par gyur pa la mtha' yas pa nyid ni 'thad par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gnas par gyur pa la mtha' yas pa nyid ni 'thad par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that a Tathāgata would remain in one place and be infinite.

original: khyad par med par 'jig rten zhes brjod pa na stong gsum rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par med par 'jig rten zhes brjod pa na stong gsum rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: When the world is referred to without distinction, it is not understood as the trichiliocosm,

original: gling bzhi tsam la yang rtogs par thal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gling bzhi tsam la yang rtogs par thal par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that even the four continents would be understood as the world.

original: de ltar na yang med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tshogs yang dag par bsags pa rnams la shin tu nas kyang go skabs byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tshogs yang dag par bsags pa rnams la shin tu nas kyang go skabs byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, the bodhisattvas who have gathered the accumulations would have no opportunity at all.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba la yongs su gnas pa'i stong gsum thams cad du long ba'i 'jig rten la dus gcig nas 'byung gnas de bzhin gshegs pa gcig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba la yongs su gnas pa'i stong gsum thams cad du long ba'i 'jig rten la dus gcig nas 'byung gnas de bzhin gshegs pa gcig go //
translated: Therefore, in all the billion worlds filled with blind people, there is only one Tathagata who appears at one time.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad mdzad nas rang gis yongs su smin pa rnams gdul bar bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad mdzad nas rang gis yongs su smin pa rnams gdul bar bya ste /
translated: Having performed all the deeds of a Buddha, he disciplines those who are ready to be disciplined.

original: rang gi gdul bya med pa'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed do //
analyzed: rang gi gdul bya med pa'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed do //
translated: And then, because there are no more disciples, he enters into final Nirvana.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba med na ji ltar ring bsrel mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba med na ji ltar ring bsrel mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: If the Lord has no final Nirvana, how can there be a seeing of his relics?

original: 'dir thogs pa med pa'i nus pa nyid la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas mang ba nyid ma yin pa la tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir thogs pa med pa'i nus pa nyid la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas mang ba nyid ma yin pa la tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: Here is a verse on the fact that the Buddhas have no multiplicity of Buddhas, because of their unobstructed power.

original: rigs tha dad phyir don bcas phyir //
analyzed: rigs tha dad phyir don bcas phyir //
translated: 1. Because of different lineages, because of the same goal,

original: tshang phyir thogs pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tshang phyir thogs pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: because of completeness, because of unobstructedness,🔽because of non-differentiation, there is only one Buddha;

original: tha mi dad phyir sangs rgyas gcig / dri med gnas la mang nyid min //
analyzed: tha mi dad phyir sangs rgyas gcig / dri med gnas la mang nyid min //
translated: but not a multiplicity, because of the one immaculate stage.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the assertion.

original: sangs rgyas gcig kho na zhes 'di ni 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas gcig kho na zhes 'di ni 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not accepted that there is only one Buddha.🔽Why?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rigs @64a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rigs @64a * //
translated: Because of the

original: tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: difference in lineage.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi rigs can rnams kyi mtha' yas pa ste de la gcig nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na gzhan rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ci'i phyir 'di yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi rigs can rnams kyi mtha' yas pa ste de la gcig nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na gzhan rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ci'i phyir 'di yin /
translated: Because the lineages of the buddhas are infinite, and when one of them attains manifest perfect buddhahood, it is not the case that the others do not attain manifest perfect buddhahood.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyang don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyang don med par 'gyur te /
translated: The accumulations of merit and wisdom would be meaningless,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because other bodhisattvas would not attain manifest perfect buddhahood.

original: don med kyang rigs pa ma yin te de'i phyir don med pa ma yin pas sangs rgyas gcig kho na yin no //
analyzed: don med kyang rigs pa ma yin te de'i phyir don med pa ma yin pas sangs rgyas gcig kho na yin no //
translated: It is not logical that they would be meaningless, and therefore they are not meaningless, and so there is only one Buddha.

original: sems can gyi don gyi bya ba tshang ba nyid kyang mi 'gyur te sangs rgyas nyid la gang gis kyang mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don gyi bya ba tshang ba nyid kyang mi 'gyur te sangs rgyas nyid la gang gis kyang mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the activity for the sake of sentient beings would be incomplete, because there would be no one abiding in buddhahood.

original: 'di yang rigs pa ma yin te thog ma'i sangs rgyas 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin la tshogs bsags pa med pas sangs rgyas nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang rigs pa ma yin te thog ma'i sangs rgyas 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin la tshogs bsags pa med pas sangs rgyas nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is also unreasonable, because there is no first buddha, and without the accumulation of the collections, buddhahood is unreasonable.

original: sangs rgyas gzhan med pas kyang tshogs bsags pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzhan med pas kyang tshogs bsags pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because there is no other buddha, the accumulation of the collections is unreasonable.

original: thog ma med pa nyid kyis kyang sangs rgyas gcig rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thog ma med pa nyid kyis kyang sangs rgyas gcig rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And because there is no beginning, a single buddha is unreasonable.

original: mang ba nyid kyang 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mang ba nyid kyang 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: And many are not accepted,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku zag pa med pa'i dbyings las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku zag pa med pa'i dbyings las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the dharmakāya of the buddhas is not different from the uncontaminated realm.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'ga' zhig tu sems can 'ga' zhig rnams la gzugs bstan par mi mdzad de gzhan rnams la ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'ga' zhig tu sems can 'ga' zhig rnams la gzugs bstan par mi mdzad de gzhan rnams la ma yin no //
translated: The tathāgatas do not display their forms to some sentient beings in some buddhafields, but not to others.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: ji ltar chu snod chags pa la //
analyzed: ji ltar chu snod chags pa la //
translated: Just as a water-vessel is filled🔽

original: zla ba'i gzugs brnyan mi mthong ba //🔽de bzhin sems can skyon bcas la //
analyzed: zla ba'i gzugs brnyan mi mthong ba // de bzhin sems can skyon bcas la //
translated: Just as the reflection of the moon is not seen in water disturbed by wind,

original: sangs rgyas gzugs brnyan mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzugs brnyan mi mthong ngo //
translated: so the reflection of the Buddha is not seen in sentient beings disturbed by the wind of faults.

original: de ltar na yang thams cad du 'gro ba nyid kyis kyang snod ma yin pa'i sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi gzugs pa rnyan mi mthong zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang thams cad du 'gro ba nyid kyis kyang snod ma yin pa'i sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi gzugs pa rnyan mi mthong zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: But even so, the non-seeing of the reflection of the Buddha in sentient beings who are not vessels is said to be due to their going everywhere.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: And so:

original: mdzad grub rnams kyis tha dad pa //
analyzed: mdzad grub rnams kyis tha dad pa //
translated: The accomplishment of deeds,

original: grangs dang zhing rnams thams cad du //
analyzed: grangs dang zhing rnams thams cad du //
translated: in all the realms and in all the numbers,

original: sangs rgyas sprul pa bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sprul pa bsam mi khyab //
translated: is the inconceivable emanation of the Buddha,

original: rnam pa kun tu de shes bya //
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu de shes bya //
translated: to be known in every way.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa de yang rnam pa thams cad du dus thams cad la bsam gyis mi khyab par rig par bya ste mdzad pa'i bya ba ste tha dad pa dang grangs dang zhing gis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa de yang rnam pa thams cad du dus thams cad la bsam gyis mi khyab par rig par bya ste mdzad pa'i bya ba ste tha dad pa dang grangs dang zhing gis so //
translated: The emanation of the Buddha is to be known as inconceivable in every way and at all times, because of the variety of deeds, the number of deeds, and the realms in which they are performed.

original: gang zhig yang brjod pa /
analyzed: gang zhig yang brjod pa /
translated: And so:

original: stong @64b gsum gcig ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig go //
analyzed: stong @64b gsum gcig ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig go //
translated: One trichiliocosm is one buddha-field.

original: der sangs rgyas gcig ni gling bzhi ba so sor dang 'dzam bu'i gling pa skye ba dang yang dag pa'i byang chub la sogs pa'i ngo bo sprul pa ston par byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: der sangs rgyas gcig ni gling bzhi ba so sor dang 'dzam bu'i gling pa skye ba dang yang dag pa'i byang chub la sogs pa'i ngo bo sprul pa ston par byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: In that, one buddha manifests emanations in each of the four continents, in Jambudvipa, in the form of birth, perfect enlightenment, and so on.

original: de la dgongs pa ni 'di yin te de ltar na yang sngar gyi byang chub sems dpa' skyabs med pa'i 'jig rten pa la bdag skyabs su gyur cig ces smon lam btab pa des na /
analyzed: de la dgongs pa ni 'di yin te de ltar na yang sngar gyi byang chub sems dpa' skyabs med pa'i 'jig rten pa la bdag skyabs su gyur cig ces smon lam btab pa des na /
translated: The intention here is this: Even so, the bodhisattva of the past, who made the aspiration, “May I become a refuge for the world that has no refuge,”

original: sangs rgyas gzhan la der bstan pa 'jug pa la gzhan gyi zhugs pa smon lam gyis gnod par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzhan la der bstan pa 'jug pa la gzhan gyi zhugs pa smon lam gyis gnod par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: would be harmed by the aspiration of another who enters that buddha-field, because of the other’s entry.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis 'jug pa dang yongs su smin par byas pa phal cher 'jig rten gyi khams gcig la skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de rnams sangs rgyas gcig gi gzugs brnyan skye ba
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis 'jug pa dang yongs su smin par byas pa phal cher 'jig rten gyi khams gcig la skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de rnams sangs rgyas gcig gi gzugs brnyan skye ba
translated: Therefore, when bodhisattvas practice bodhisattva activity, they are born in a single world system that has been entered and matured by the Tathagata himself. At that time, the images of a single buddha are born there.

original: dang byang chub la sogs pa'i ngo bo mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: dang byang chub la sogs pa'i ngo bo mthong ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, when bodhisattvas practice bodhisattva activities, they are born in one world system, having been caused to enter and mature by the Tathāgata himself. At that time, they see the form of a single buddha and the essence of enlightenment and so on.

original: des na de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that their buddhafield is that.

original: mang po'i sangs rgyas rnams la go skabs kyi don du yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mang po'i sangs rgyas rnams la go skabs kyi don du yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not for the sake of many buddhas.

original: gcig ni gling bzhi tsam la skyabs med pa la skyabs su gyur pa la smon lam gyi phyir byas pa don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gcig ni gling bzhi tsam la skyabs med pa la skyabs su gyur pa la smon lam gyi phyir byas pa don med pa nyid do //
translated: It is meaningless to make aspirations for a single buddha to be a refuge for those without refuge in the four continents, because that is very easy.

original: shin tu dka' bas tshogs rdzogs pa'i 'di tsam mang po rnams ni shin tu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu dka' bas tshogs rdzogs pa'i 'di tsam mang po rnams ni shin tu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it is very difficult to complete the accumulations, and it is very unlikely that so many will do so.

original: stong gsum gyi yang mthar thug pa med pa nyid kyis de rnams la sangs rgyas kyi zhing nyid la yang smon lam byas pa tshogs rdzogs pa rnams la go skabs srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi yang mthar thug pa med pa nyid kyis de rnams la sangs rgyas kyi zhing nyid la yang smon lam byas pa tshogs rdzogs pa rnams la go skabs srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the world systems are infinite in the ten directions, it is possible for those who have completed the accumulations to make prayers to attain buddhahood in those worlds.

original: de ltar na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na yang /
translated: However,

original: khams gcig la ni gnyis med phyir //🔽gzhal med tshogs phyir dus gcig tu //
analyzed: khams gcig la ni gnyis med phyir // gzhal med tshogs phyir dus gcig tu //
translated: since two buddhas do not appear in a single realm,🔽and since the accumulations are immeasurable,

original: rim du 'jug pa mi rigs pas //
analyzed: rim du 'jug pa mi rigs pas //
translated: it is illogical for them to appear simultaneously.

original: sangs rgyas mang nyid rab tu grub //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang nyid rab tu grub //
translated: Therefore, the existence of many buddhas is established.

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: However,

original: sgrib pa thams cad nges sgrol phyir //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad nges sgrol phyir //
translated: since they are not liberated from all obscurations,

original: bya ba yang ni ma rdzogs pas //
analyzed: bya ba yang ni ma rdzogs pas //
translated: and since their activities are incomplete,

original: sangs rgyas shin tu mya ngan 'da' //
analyzed: sangs rgyas shin tu mya ngan 'da' //
translated: the buddhas do not attain nirvana.

original: 'dod de mya ngan 'da' ba'ang min //
analyzed: 'dod de mya ngan 'da' ba'ang min //
translated: They do not attain nirvana because they desire to remain.

original: thams cad 'dris pa'i phyir las can //
analyzed: thams cad 'dris pa'i phyir las can //
translated: Since they are familiar with everything, they are active.

original: rgya mtsho'i chu bzhin rgyal ba rnams //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i chu bzhin rgyal ba rnams //
translated: Like the waters of the ocean, the victors

original: byas gyur byed pa byed 'gyur te //
analyzed: byas gyur byed pa byed 'gyur te //
translated: have acted, are acting, and will act

original: gzhan gyi don la sems pa med //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la sems pa med //
translated: without any thought of benefit for themselves.

original: sems can skyon phyir mi mthong bas //
analyzed: sems can skyon phyir mi mthong bas //
translated: Since they see the faults of sentient beings,

original: chags pa'i snod du zla ba bzhin //
analyzed: chags pa'i snod du zla ba bzhin //
translated: they are like the moon in a broken vessel.

original: de rnams 'jig rten kun 'phrogs mdzad //
analyzed: de rnams 'jig rten kun 'phrogs mdzad //
translated: He is the one who has taken away all the world's darkness.

original: chos kyi 'od kyis nyi ma bzhin //
analyzed: chos kyi 'od kyis nyi ma bzhin //
translated: He is the sun of Dharma's light.

original: byang chub ston mdzad 'ga' zhig ni //
analyzed: byang chub ston mdzad 'ga' zhig ni //
translated: Some Buddhas, who are the teachers of enlightenment,

original: med bzhin myang 'das @65a * //
analyzed: med bzhin myang 'das @65a * //
translated: are not seen to pass into Nirvana,

original: 'ga' zhig tu //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu //
translated: but in some places

original: dus gang la yang med pa min //
analyzed: dus gang la yang med pa min //
translated: they are not absent at any time.

original: brtag pa'i sku can de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: brtag pa'i sku can de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The Tathagatas have bodies that are conceptual.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i sku mthong ba dang ring bsrel mthong ba yang de bstan pa'i gdul bya rnams la rjes su bzung ba'i don du sprul pa kho na yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i sku mthong ba dang ring bsrel mthong ba yang de bstan pa'i gdul bya rnams la rjes su bzung ba'i don du sprul pa kho na yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The seeing of the body of Nirvana and the seeing of the relics are also only emanations for the purpose of taking care of those disciples who are to be trained by that.

original: ji ltar yang 'dis gnas par bya zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar yang 'dis gnas par bya zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How should one stand?

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu la ci'i phyir bsam pa skyes snyam na /
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu la ci'i phyir bsam pa skyes snyam na /
translated: Why did the thought arise for the Elder Shariputra?

original: chos rnams thams cad la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba gsungs pas so //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba gsungs pas so //
translated: Because it was said, One should not stand in all dharmas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la gnas par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la gnas par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: One cannot stand in the perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of emptiness.

original: gnas par bya zhes kyang brjod pa yin na ji ltar brjod pa yin zhes bsam par byed do //
analyzed: gnas par bya zhes kyang brjod pa yin na ji ltar brjod pa yin zhes bsam par byed do //
translated: If it is said that one should abide, then how is it said?

original: de'i rjes la gnas brtan rab 'byor la mi gnas pa'i sgrub pa nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gnas pa zhes ston cing gnas so //
analyzed: de'i rjes la gnas brtan rab 'byor la mi gnas pa'i sgrub pa nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gnas pa zhes ston cing gnas so //
translated: After that, the elder Subhūti, teaching that very non-abiding practice is the abiding in the perfection of wisdom, abides.

original: thugs ni shin tu mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thugs ni shin tu mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The mind is extremely non-abiding,

original: rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir gsungs so //
translated: it is said because it goes to the non-abiding nirvana.

original: 'dus byas kyi zhes bya ba ni khams gsum la'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi zhes bya ba ni khams gsum la'o //
translated: The compounded refers to the three realms.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la ste gnyi ga la yang de ngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la ste gnyi ga la yang de ngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The uncompounded refers to nirvana, because both are not apprehended by the nature of entities.

original: de las bzhengs pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa la ni gnas pa dang bzhengs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzhengs pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa la ni gnas pa dang bzhengs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: It does not arise from that means that if an entity exists, it would abide or arise, that is the intention.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang bas byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes ston par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang bas byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes ston par byed de /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva should train in the perfection of wisdom by following the Dharma of the Tathagata.🔽Then, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de bzhin du zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa ni byang chub kyi don du ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de bzhin du zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa ni byang chub kyi don du ste /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva's attention on the Buddha is for the sake of enlightenment.

original: de yang rab tu mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pas de bzhin du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rab tu mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pas de bzhin du bslab par bya'o //
translated: And that is characterized by non-abiding, therefore, by abiding in the perfection of wisdom, one should train in the same way.

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ste /🔽gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni bzhengs pa ma yin no //🔽mi gnas pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni bzhugs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ste / gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni bzhengs pa ma yin no // mi gnas pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni bzhugs pa ma yin no //
translated: This itself is stated: Just as the Tathagata, etc.🔽Not abiding means not rising.🔽Not non-abiding means not remaining.

original: mi mthun par mi gnas pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun par mi gnas pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
translated: Not abiding in a way that is not compatible is an alternative reading.

original: de bzhin du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i byang @65b chub thob nas zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i byang @65b chub thob nas zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: And so on means that one should abide in the same way that the Tathagatas abide, having attained perfect enlightenment.

original: de yang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu las zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de yang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu las zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: And that is from a concordant cause, as it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ji lta ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ji lta ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Just as the Tathagatas abide.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la byang chub sems dpa' lam gyi gnas skabs su gnas pa'i chos thams cad kyi mi gnas pa'i lhag par mos pa'i mtshan nyid de ltar gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba de'i lhag par mos pa mngon par phyogs par byed pas
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la byang chub sems dpa' lam gyi gnas skabs su gnas pa'i chos thams cad kyi mi gnas pa'i lhag par mos pa'i mtshan nyid de ltar gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba de'i lhag par mos pa mngon par phyogs par byed pas
translated: Just as the Tathagatas, while the Bodhisattvas are abiding in the stage of the path, have the characteristic of a superior resolve toward all dharmas that do not abide, so one should abide in that way.

original: so // bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su spangs pas de dang rjes su 'jug pa las so //
analyzed: so // bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su spangs pas de dang rjes su 'jug pa las so //
translated: By that superior resolve, one should face and train in that, by abandoning the opposing factors and engaging in that.

original: de lta na yang legs par gnas te byang chub dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang legs par gnas te byang chub dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And so on means that one should abide in that way, because one is abiding in the path that is concordant with enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In the manner of non-abiding means

original: ji ltar gsungs pa'i mi gnas pa'i sgrub pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs pa'i mi gnas pa'i sgrub pas so //
translated: by the practice of non-abiding as taught.

original: 'di ni sngar dam bcas pa'i nye bar sdud cing gsungs pa ni 'dis de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sngar dam bcas pa'i nye bar sdud cing gsungs pa ni 'dis de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is the conclusion of the earlier commitment. Thus and so forth are the statements.

original: de ltar mi gnas pa'i gnas pa sgrub pa bstan par byed par gyur pa la gang rnams brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i bstan pas gdul bar bya ba de rnams the tshom skyed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi gnas pa'i gnas pa sgrub pa bstan par byed par gyur pa la gang rnams brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i bstan pas gdul bar bya ba de rnams the tshom skyed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those to be trained who are not to be taught by such a teaching of the practice of non-abiding will give rise to doubt.

original: de nas de rnams las brtsams te gzhan du bstan pa skabs 'byed de /
analyzed: de nas de rnams las brtsams te gzhan du bstan pa skabs 'byed de /
translated: Then, beginning with that, the opportunity for teaching elsewhere is opened:

original: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Then, from within that assembly... and so forth.

original: kha cig zhes bya ba ni gang zhig mi gnas pa'i gnas pa sgrub pa bstan par byed pa zab mo'i bdag nyid kyi lha rnams 'phags pa'i skad nyid kyis tha snyad byed pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig zhes bya ba ni gang zhig mi gnas pa'i gnas pa sgrub pa bstan par byed pa zab mo'i bdag nyid kyi lha rnams 'phags pa'i skad nyid kyis tha snyad byed pa'o //
translated: Some means those who are not to be taught by the teaching of the practice of non-abiding, which has the nature of profundity, using only the noble language of the gods.

original: gnod sbyin rnams ni gsang ba'i don gyi sgra sbyor bar byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: gnod sbyin rnams ni gsang ba'i don gyi sgra sbyor bar byed pa rnams so //
translated: The Yakshas are those who employ the secret meaning of sounds.

original: skad ni rang gi rigs la rab tu grags pa tha snyad kyi bdag nyid can gyi tshig rnams te gnod sbyin gyi skad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad ni rang gi rigs la rab tu grags pa tha snyad kyi bdag nyid can gyi tshig rnams te gnod sbyin gyi skad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The language is the words that are well known in their own class, having the nature of conventions, and the meaning is the language of the Yakshas.

original: sgra ni sgra'i dbyangs kyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: sgra ni sgra'i dbyangs kyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid can te /
translated: Sound is the characteristic of the variety of sound tones.

original: de rnams kyis kyang don gyi khyad par bya go bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang don gyi khyad par bya go bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they also convey the distinction of meaning.

original: tshig ni gsang ba'i yi ge'i tshogs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tshig ni gsang ba'i yi ge'i tshogs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The words are the collection of secret syllables.

original: gtam du byes pa ni rang gi 'khor la yang gsang ba'i brjod pa rnams bsam pa tha dad pas don dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gtam du byes pa ni rang gi 'khor la yang gsang ba'i brjod pa rnams bsam pa tha dad pas don dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The discourse is the secret expressions to one's own retinue, which have meaning due to different intentions.

original: rab tu brjod pa ni rkan la sogs pa'i 'bad pa'i khyad par gyis rnam par gzhag pa byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: rab tu brjod pa ni rkan la sogs pa'i 'bad pa'i khyad par gyis rnam par gzhag pa byed pa rnams so //
translated: The expressions are those that are established by the particular efforts of the palate and so forth.

original: shes par rung gi zhes bya @66a * //
analyzed: shes par rung gi zhes bya @66a * //
translated: The statement suitable to be known

original: ba ni tha snyad dang brda dag gis te /
analyzed: ba ni tha snyad dang brda dag gis te /
translated: is by means of conventions and signs.

original: goms ba'i rim pas de'i don la 'jig rten dang thun mong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: goms ba'i rim pas de'i don la 'jig rten dang thun mong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because its meaning is common to the mundane.

original: shes par yang mi rung ngo snyam mo zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i don 'jig rten la ma grags pa nyid kyis sngar ma shes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes par yang mi rung ngo snyam mo zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i don 'jig rten la ma grags pa nyid kyis sngar ma shes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not suitable to be known means that it is not known previously because the meaning of not abiding in form, etc. is not renowned in the world.

original: 'chad pa ni gang zhig ngag rnams kyis so //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni gang zhig ngag rnams kyis so //
translated: Explained means that which is explained by means of statements.

original: rab tu brjod pa ni ngag gi tshogs rnams kyis so //🔽ston pa ni gdams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu brjod pa ni ngag gi tshogs rnams kyis so // ston pa ni gdams par byed pa'o //
translated: Fully expressed means that which is expressed by means of a collection of statements.🔽Taught means that which is instructed.

original: nye bar ston par byed pa ni rjes su ston par byed do //
analyzed: nye bar ston par byed pa ni rjes su ston par byed do //
translated: Demonstrated means that which is taught subsequently.

original: 'dir ni rab 'byor de ma rtogs pa nyid kyis thams cad la brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir nye bar ston cing gsungs pa /🔽shes par mi rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni rab 'byor de ma rtogs pa nyid kyis thams cad la brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir nye bar ston cing gsungs pa / shes par mi rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, Subhūti, because of not understanding this, he demonstrates and says that it is not suitable to be known, etc.

original: gnyis su brjod pa ni nges pa la'o //
analyzed: gnyis su brjod pa ni nges pa la'o //
translated: Not suitable to be known is a statement of certainty.

original: gang gi phyir brjod pa de'i phyir shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brjod pa de'i phyir shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Because it is expressed, it is not suitable to be known.

original: 'di la yang cung zad kyang smos pa med do zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la yang cung zad kyang smos pa med do zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Here, too, nothing at all is said, because the perfection of wisdom is not something that can be expressed.

original: thos pa med do zhes bya ba ni yi ge gcig kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rjod par byed pa nyid kyis thos pa med do //
analyzed: thos pa med do zhes bya ba ni yi ge gcig kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rjod par byed pa nyid kyis thos pa med do //
translated: There is no hearing, because there is no hearing of even a single syllable that expresses the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'on te 'di ltar sgras ni don rjod par mi byed pa de'i phyi rol gyi don yang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyis dgag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te 'di ltar sgras ni don rjod par mi byed pa de'i phyi rol gyi don yang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyis dgag pa ma yin no //
translated: Or, if it is like this, that sound does not express meaning, then the external object is not negated by the fact that it is not something that can be expressed.

original: gzhan dbang gi ngo bo ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis ring ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan dbang gi ngo bo ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis ring ba ste /
translated: The nature of the dependent is far removed by the fact that it is consciousness.

original: de bas na sngar gsungs pa'i chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la gnod par byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na sngar gsungs pa'i chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la gnod par byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the statement that all phenomena are essenceless is undermined.

original: 'on te yi ge gcig kyang brjod pa ma yin thos pa yang ma yin pa gang zhig der bstan pa'i snang ba dang thos pa'i snang ba de ni kun brtags rmi lam dang sprul pa dang sgra brnyan dang sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te yi ge gcig kyang brjod pa ma yin thos pa yang ma yin pa gang zhig der bstan pa'i snang ba dang thos pa'i snang ba de ni kun brtags rmi lam dang sprul pa dang sgra brnyan dang sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: But if not even a single letter is uttered or heard, then the appearance of the teaching and the appearance of hearing are imagined, like a dream, a magical creation, an echo, or an illusion.

original: de'i tshe de ltan yang chos thams cad la ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gnas pa'i bsgrub pa las brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i sgrub pa la khyad par gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de ltan yang chos thams cad la ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gnas pa'i bsgrub pa las brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i sgrub pa la khyad par gang yin zhe na /
translated: At that time, if it is like that, then because all phenomena are without entityness, what is the difference between the non-expressed and the expressed?

original: 'dir brjod par bya ste thog ma med pa'i brdzun pa'i brjod pa'i bag chags kyis yang dag par da blas blas pa ni kun brtags te /
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ste thog ma med pa'i brdzun pa'i brjod pa'i bag chags kyis yang dag par da blas blas pa ni kun brtags te /
translated: Here it should be said: The imagined is the false expression of beginningless false expressions and imprints.

original: 'di ni gzhan dbang bzhin du rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan dbang bzhin du rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not generated by causes and conditions like the dependent.

original: rang gi ngo bos kyang snang ba med de /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos kyang snang ba med de /
translated: It also does not appear by its own nature.

original: 'on kyang ma rig pas blangs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i stobs @66b kyis gzhan dbang nyid so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma rig pas blangs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i stobs @66b kyis gzhan dbang nyid so sor snang ngo //
translated: However, the power of the conceptualization that is taken up by ignorance causes the dependent itself to appear as separate.

original: de bas na kun brtags la brjod pa la sogs pa la rnam par brtag pa log pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na kun brtags la brjod pa la sogs pa la rnam par brtag pa log pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the conceptualization of the imagined, such as expression, is false.

original: de med pas phyi rol gyi snang ba log pa nyid do //
analyzed: de med pas phyi rol gyi snang ba log pa nyid do //
translated: Because that is absent, the appearance of external things is false.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyis gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyis gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that they exist in the nature of the inexpressible.

original: 'on te log pa la yang brdzun pa'i snang ba'i ngo bo rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du shes pa tsam ni lhag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te log pa la yang brdzun pa'i snang ba'i ngo bo rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du shes pa tsam ni lhag par 'gyur ro //
translated: But even in error, the mere consciousness that has the nature of a false appearance, like a dream, and so on, remains.

original: de yang don stong pa nyid kyis brdzun pa nyid du nges pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa la brdzun pa'i phyir log pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang don stong pa nyid kyis brdzun pa nyid du nges pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa la brdzun pa'i phyir log pa kho na'o //
translated: And that is false because it is false that the object is empty of duality, just as it is ascertained to be false that the object is empty of duality.

original: de ltar yang chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi gnas pa'i sgrub pa'i don du lha'i bu rnams dang po zab pa'i bdag nyid can la kun brtags med pa'i rnam par bsgom pa'i sgo 'dis de la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi gnas pa'i sgrub pa'i don du lha'i bu rnams dang po zab pa'i bdag nyid can la kun brtags med pa'i rnam par bsgom pa'i sgo 'dis de la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Thus, in order to accomplish the non-abiding of all dharmas by the characteristic of non-apprehension, the Devaputras should enter into it by this door of meditation on the non-existence of the imagined, in the beginning, in the profound nature.

original: 'jug pa rnams kyang dga' bas ji ltar rnam par rtog par byed pa de gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'jug pa rnams kyang dga' bas ji ltar rnam par rtog par byed pa de gsungs pa /
translated: And those who have entered into it, how do they conceive it? He says:

original: de nas de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then they, etc.

original: gsal ba ni kho bo cag la bzung bar rung ba'i mi gnas ba'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ni kho bo cag la bzung bar rung ba'i mi gnas ba'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: The clear one is the non-abiding accomplishment which is suitable to be taken up by us.

original: dga' bas lan gnyis kyi tshig go //
analyzed: dga' bas lan gnyis kyi tshig go //
translated: The word twice is for emphasis.

original: 'jig rten pa dang phra ba dang sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul nyid kyis ring bas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang phra ba dang sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul nyid kyis ring bas so //
translated: It is far by being mundane, subtle, and the domain of the Buddhas.

original: spyod pa med pa nyid kyis phra ba las so //
analyzed: spyod pa med pa nyid kyis phra ba las so //
translated: It is subtle by being without activity.

original: 'dzin par dka' ba nyid kyis zab pa las so //
analyzed: 'dzin par dka' ba nyid kyis zab pa las so //
translated: It is profound by being difficult to grasp.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don las ches ring ba dang / ches ring du 'jug pa /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don las ches ring ba dang / ches ring du 'jug pa /
translated: It is very far from the meaning which has the characteristic of being inexpressible, and it is very far to enter into it.

original: ches zab pa mi gnas pa'i sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don la 'jug pa sems kyis so //🔽ston cing ni yul gyis so //
