analyzed: ches zab pa mi gnas pa'i sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don la 'jug pa sems kyis so // ston cing ni yul gyis so //
translated: One enters into the meaning characterized by the most profound practice, with the mind.🔽One teaches with the object.

original: 'chad pa ni don gyis so //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni don gyis so //
translated: One expounds with the meaning.

original: de ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i bstan pa 'di la 'bras bu gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i bstan pa 'di la 'bras bu gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: In this teaching which is inexpressible, another result is stated:

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: bzod pa 'di la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa thos pa dang mi thos pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bzod pa 'di la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa thos pa dang mi thos pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: In this acceptance, of the non-appearance of form, etc., the characteristic of hearing and not hearing.

original: don ni 'di yin te sgra'i spyod yul nyid ma yin pa la chos thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid de sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag la phan tshun du rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te sgra'i spyod yul nyid ma yin pa la chos thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid de sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag la phan tshun du rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is this: The non-objectness of all dharmas is not the domain of sound, because sound and conceptualization are mutually causal.

original: de ltar yang nyan thos gang zhig nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam spang bar 'dod pa des kyang bzod pa 'dis bskyed par bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang nyan thos gang zhig nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam spang bar 'dod pa des kyang bzod pa 'dis bskyed par bya ba kho na'o //
translated: Thus, even a śrāvaka who wishes to abandon only the obscurations of the afflictions should generate this acceptance.

original: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa rnams kyi yul las byung ba ma yin te /🔽de rnams yod pa la yang 'dod chags dang bral @67a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa rnams kyi yul las byung ba ma yin te / de rnams yod pa la yang 'dod chags dang bral @67a * //
translated: Because the afflictions do not arise from objects,

original: ba rnams la nyon mongs pa rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba rnams la nyon mongs pa rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for those who are free from attachment, the afflictions do not exist even though those objects exist.

original: 'on kyang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can rnam par rtog pa rnams nyid las nyon mongs pa la sogs pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can rnam par rtog pa rnams nyid las nyon mongs pa la sogs pa skye ba yin no //
translated: However, the afflictions and so on arise from the very conceptualizations that have the characteristics of desirable and undesirable.

original: de'i phyir de la yang bzod pa 'di nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yang rgyu yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la yang bzod pa 'di nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yang rgyu yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in that regard, this patience is also the cause of the affliction-obstruction.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa la chos thams cad kyi 'du shes glo bur ba'i 'du shes 'di rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad la rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis nye bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa la chos thams cad kyi 'du shes glo bur ba'i 'du shes 'di rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad la rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis nye bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: For that very reason, on the Bodhisattva-stage, this notion of all phenomena as adventitious is taught by the purification of all phenomena through conformity.

original: ji skad gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: chos thams cad kyi 'du shes de nyid dang glo bur ba'i 'du shes gal te de mi sdug pa yid la byed pa 'di brtsams par 'gyur ba gal te 'di'i rkyen nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi 'du shes de nyid dang glo bur ba'i 'du shes gal te de mi sdug pa yid la byed pa 'di brtsams par 'gyur ba gal te 'di'i rkyen nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If the perception of all phenomena and the adventitious perception are initiated by this mental attention to repulsiveness, then the condition itself is dependent origination, etc.

original: khyad par 'di yin te nyan thos ni rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid tsam chos rnams la rtogs par byed de rang gi ngo bo bral ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par 'di yin te nyan thos ni rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid tsam chos rnams la rtogs par byed de rang gi ngo bo bral ba ni ma yin no //
translated: This is the difference: the śrāvaka realizes phenomena only as not being the domain of conceptualization, but not as being devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyis kun brtags kyi don la rnam pa thams cad du med pa rtogs par byed de de tsam gyis ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyis kun brtags kyi don la rnam pa thams cad du med pa rtogs par byed de de tsam gyis ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva realizes the imagined object as completely nonexistent due to not being the domain of conceptualization, because of that mere intrinsic reality.

original: chos nyan pa rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig ces bya ba ni gal te don dam pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ston par byed pa po dang nyan pa po yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe chos nyan pa po rnams kyis kyang yod
analyzed: chos nyan pa rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig ces bya ba ni gal te don dam pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ston par byed pa po dang nyan pa po yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe chos nyan pa po rnams kyis kyang yod
translated: “What kind of person listens to the Dharma?” If the ultimate is not an object of expression, and the one who teaches and the one who listens do not exist, then those who listen to the Dharma also do not exist.

original: par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba mtshon par byed de 'di'i phyir rab 'byor don dam chos nyan pa po rnams la med pa nyid gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba mtshon par byed de 'di'i phyir rab 'byor don dam chos nyan pa po rnams la med pa nyid gsal bar byed de /
translated: This is what is indicated. Therefore, Subhūti, the nonexistence of those who listen to the ultimate Dharma is made clear.

original: sgyu ma dang sprul ba lta bu zhes bya ba ni sngags la sogs pa'i stobs kyis snang bar gyur pa brdzun pa'i skyes bu ni sgyu ma ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang sprul ba lta bu zhes bya ba ni sngags la sogs pa'i stobs kyis snang bar gyur pa brdzun pa'i skyes bu ni sgyu ma ste /
translated: “Like an illusion or a magical creation” means that a false person who appears through the power of mantras and so on is an illusion.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis yang dag par bstan pa ni sprul pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis yang dag par bstan pa ni sprul pa'o //
translated: A magical creation is one who is correctly taught through magical power.

original: 'di lta bu dag dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu dag dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: They are like these.

original: sems can de dag sgyu ma lta bu yin gyi de dag sgyu ma ni ma yin nam zhes bya ba ste brdzun pa nyid ni sgyu ma nyid du lha'i bu rnams 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can de dag sgyu ma lta bu yin gyi de dag sgyu ma ni ma yin nam zhes bya ba ste brdzun pa nyid ni sgyu ma nyid du lha'i bu rnams 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Are not those sentient beings like illusions? The sons of the gods accept that falsity is illusion.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di brdzun pa'i khyad par sgyu ma yang yin la rmi lam yang yin te de dag dang 'dra bar brdzun pa nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di brdzun pa'i khyad par sgyu ma yang yin la rmi lam yang yin te de dag dang 'dra bar brdzun pa nyid du 'dod do //
translated: The elder Subhūti accepts that the particularity of falsity is illusion and dream, and that they are accepted as false, like that.

original: de bas na sgyu ma dang sems can zhes gnyis su med de brdzun pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na sgyu ma dang sems can zhes gnyis su med de brdzun pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no duality of illusion and sentient beings, because there is no difference in falsity.

original: gnyis su byar med @67b ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis kyis byed pa po'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su byar med @67b ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis kyis byed pa po'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Without duality” means that there is no cause of a maker in two ways.

original: mtshan nyid 'di yang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang 'phags pa rnams dang de'i 'bras bu byang chub kyi mthar thug pa rnams la mnyam pa zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di yang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang 'phags pa rnams dang de'i 'bras bu byang chub kyi mthar thug pa rnams la mnyam pa zhes gsungs pa /
translated: This characteristic is said to be the same in all phenomena such as form, in the noble ones, and in the culmination of enlightenment, their result.

original: chos thams cad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “All phenomena” and so on.

original: gzhan rnams la sgyu ma'i rang bzhin nyid spang bar bya ba'i phyir yin mod /
analyzed: gzhan rnams la sgyu ma'i rang bzhin nyid spang bar bya ba'i phyir yin mod /
translated: It is indeed the case that the others are to be abandoned as having the nature of illusion.

original: sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas nyid la de rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas nyid la de rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not reasonable for the Buddha and Buddhahood,🔽because they are to be established as the highest reality.

original: dam pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bstan par byed pa ni /
analyzed: dam pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bstan par byed pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, the Buddha, the best of speakers,🔽spoke to the Bodhisattva, the great being,🔽Vajra-mind, about the nature of illusion.

original: re zhig sangs rgyas nyid ni lta zhog gi gang yang des thob par bya ba mthar thub par gyur pa mya ngan las 'das pa zhes brjod pa de yang rtogs pa ji lta bar med pa'i phyir sgyu ma lta bu zhes smra ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig sangs rgyas nyid ni lta zhog gi gang yang des thob par bya ba mthar thub par gyur pa mya ngan las 'das pa zhes brjod pa de yang rtogs pa ji lta bar med pa'i phyir sgyu ma lta bu zhes smra ba'o //
translated: Now, let alone Buddhahood, even that which is attained by it, which is called “nirvana,” the final goal, does not exist as it is realized, and so it is said to be like an illusion.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Even more than nirvana” means

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi tshig go //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi tshig go //
translated: “if” is a word of comparison.

original: gang zhig sgyu ma lta bu de ni cung zad yod pa ma yin pas 'di gnas 'dzin to //
analyzed: gang zhig sgyu ma lta bu de ni cung zad yod pa ma yin pas 'di gnas 'dzin to //
translated: That which is like an illusion does not exist in the least, so this is a position to be held.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu rnams la don gcig pa nyid dam mchog tu zab pa'i don 'di la gzung bar dka' ba nyid kyis lhag par mos pa'i che ba nyid rab tu bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu rnams la don gcig pa nyid dam mchog tu zab pa'i don 'di la gzung bar dka' ba nyid kyis lhag par mos pa'i che ba nyid rab tu bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: Thus is stated for the purpose of teaching the greatness of the superior belief in this meaning of the same object or the profound meaning of illusion-like, since it is difficult to grasp.

original: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis de'i gdul bya las brtsams te khyad par gyi tshig 'di gsungs pa /
analyzed: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis de'i gdul bya las brtsams te khyad par gyi tshig 'di gsungs pa /
translated: The assembly of śrāvakas and bodhisattvas, beginning with those to be guided by that, spoke this distinguishing statement:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, and so on.

original: yang dag par 'dzin pa ni rjes su tshol bar byed pa de'i phyir yang dag par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin pa ni rjes su tshol bar byed pa de'i phyir yang dag par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Correctly holding is seeking it, therefore it is correct holding.

original: nye bar len pa po rnams so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po rnams so //
translated: They are the appropriators.

original: yang na so sor 'dod pas na yang dag par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: yang na so sor 'dod pas na yang dag par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Or, since they desire individually, it is correct holding.

original: yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: It is fully grasping.

original: dag pa'i sems can rnams ni 'di la yang dag par 'dzin pa ste zhes bya ba ni che ba nyid bskyed pa'i don du 'phags pa kun dga' bos re zhig kun rdzob tu yang dag par 'dzin pa rnams gsungs pa /
analyzed: dag pa'i sems can rnams ni 'di la yang dag par 'dzin pa ste zhes bya ba ni che ba nyid bskyed pa'i don du 'phags pa kun dga' bos re zhig kun rdzob tu yang dag par 'dzin pa rnams gsungs pa /
translated: In order to generate greatness, the noble Ananda first spoke of those who take it up conventionally,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: those who are irreversible, etc.

original: rigs nges pa'i sems can yang dag par 'byung bas 'dir ni dang po'i phyir mi ldog pa rnams gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rigs nges pa'i sems can yang dag par 'byung bas 'dir ni dang po'i phyir mi ldog pa rnams gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Since sentient beings of fixed potential take it up, here one should take the first irreversible ones.

original: lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i sa'i rang bzhin dang thob pa rnams so //
analyzed: lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i sa'i rang bzhin dang thob pa rnams so //
translated: Those who are endowed with the view are those who have obtained the path of seeing, which has the nature of the stage called Very Joyful.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba rnams @68a * //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba rnams @68a * //
translated: Those who are arhats are those who dedicate to enlightenment.

original: so // gnas brtan rab 'byor ni don dam par chos nyan pa po bzhin du yang dag par 'dzin pa rnams la yang med pa gsungs pa 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: so // gnas brtan rab 'byor ni don dam par chos nyan pa po bzhin du yang dag par 'dzin pa rnams la yang med pa gsungs pa 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Elder Subhūti, in the ultimate sense, as if he were a listener, says, “I do not apprehend those who would take up this discourse,” etc.

original: 'di ni gang rnams 'di ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon du byas par gyur pa de rnams nyid yongs su 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gang rnams 'di ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon du byas par gyur pa de rnams nyid yongs su 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
translated: This shows that those who have realized the perfection of wisdom, which is nonconceptual in this way, are the very ones who take it up.

original: de rnams kyang don dam par yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te yongs su 'dzin par bya ba med pa'i phyir zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de rnams kyang don dam par yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te yongs su 'dzin par bya ba med pa'i phyir zhes ston par byed do //
translated: And they do not take it up in the ultimate sense, because there is nothing to take up.

original: smos zhes bya ba ni mdo'i ngo bos te mdor bsdus pa bstan pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: smos zhes bya ba ni mdo'i ngo bos te mdor bsdus pa bstan pa nyid kyis so //
translated: “It is said” refers to the essence of the sūtra, which is taught in brief.

original: snang bar ma byas zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba byas pas gsal bar bstan pas so //
analyzed: snang bar ma byas zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba byas pas gsal bar bstan pas so //
translated: “It is not illuminated” means that it is taught clearly by making a detailed analysis.

original: gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po rnams kyis tha snyad byed pa ste rgyas par nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po rnams kyis tha snyad byed pa ste rgyas par nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The setting is the conventional usage of the expounders and listeners, in order to teach extensively.

original: de bas na ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdu bar byed do //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdu bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is summarized by thus... and so on.

original: lha'i bu rnams la ye shes kyi snang ba bskyed pa'i rtags bstan pa'i don du me tog gi mchod pa bstan par byed de /
analyzed: lha'i bu rnams la ye shes kyi snang ba bskyed pa'i rtags bstan pa'i don du me tog gi mchod pa bstan par byed de /
translated: In order to show the sign of generating the light of wisdom for the sons of the gods, the offering of flowers is taught.

original: de nas brgya byin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de nas brgya byin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Then Śakra... and so on.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs ni chos kyi rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs ni chos kyi rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: Dharma-discourse is the classification of the Dharma.

original: de la mchod pa'i don du mchod gnas mchod pa ni chos mchod pas so //
analyzed: de la mchod pa'i don du mchod gnas mchod pa ni chos mchod pas so //
translated: There, the worship of the object of worship for the sake of worship is the worship of the Dharma.

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni mchod pa'i don du zhes bya ba 'don pa yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni mchod pa'i don du zhes bya ba 'don pa yin te /
translated: In some places, it is recited as for the sake of worship.

original: der ni bdun pa'i don la drug pa'o //
analyzed: der ni bdun pa'i don la drug pa'o //
translated: There, the seventh case has the meaning of the sixth case.

original: chos nye bar bstan pa'i gnas skabs su nye bar ston pa po'i mchod pa ni legs pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos nye bar bstan pa'i gnas skabs su nye bar ston pa po'i mchod pa ni legs pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the context of teaching the Dharma, the worship of the teacher is excellent, it is said.

original: brgya byin 'di snyam du sems te zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: brgya byin 'di snyam du sems te zhes 'brel lo //
translated: The connection is: Śakra thought like this.

original: 'di snyam du zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rtogs pa sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'di snyam du zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rtogs pa sems pa'o //
translated: The phrase like this refers to the thought of the realization that will be explained.

original: 'di ltar gyi sgra ni ngag gi rgyan no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gyi sgra ni ngag gi rgyan no //
translated: The word like this is an ornament of speech.

original: brgya byin rjes su ni brgya byin gyi slad du'o //
analyzed: brgya byin rjes su ni brgya byin gyi slad du'o //
translated: For the sake of Śakra means for the sake of Śakra.

original: brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to express means in order to speak.

original: me tog 'di dag sprul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bsam pa ni gong du bstan pa'i gnas skabs skyed par byed pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: me tog 'di dag sprul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bsam pa ni gong du bstan pa'i gnas skabs skyed par byed pa'i don du'o //
translated: The thought expressed in the phrase these flowers are emanations and so on is for the purpose of producing the state that will be explained above.

original: yid las byung ba'i zhes bya ba ni yid kyi sprul pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid las byung ba'i zhes bya ba ni yid kyi sprul pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Mentally produced means having the meaning of mentally emanated.

original: brgya byin ni yid las byung ba nyid kyang dgag pa'i don du smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin ni yid las byung ba nyid kyang dgag pa'i don du smras pa /
translated: In order to refute the very mental production of Śakra, he said:

original: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ste ji ltar yang shing la sogs pa rnams ni rang bzhin med pa de bzhin du yid la byed kyang de bas na ma skyes pa zhes bya @68b ba'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ste ji ltar yang shing la sogs pa rnams ni rang bzhin med pa de bzhin du yid la byed kyang de bas na ma skyes pa zhes bya @68b ba'o //
translated: unborn. Just as trees and so on are without intrinsic nature, so too is mental activity. Therefore, it is called unborn.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: koo shi ka gang ma skyes pa de ni me tog ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka gang ma skyes pa de ni me tog ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Kauśika, that which is not produced is not a flower.

original: ma skyes pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi me tog rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma skyes pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi me tog rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the nature of the emptiness of the perfected characteristic is itself unproduced, in regard to the flowers.

original: shes rab zab ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa thams cad kyis bzung par dka' ba'i chos kyi de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab zab ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa thams cad kyis bzung par dka' ba'i chos kyi de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Deep wisdom means realizing the reality of phenomena that is difficult to grasp for all worldly beings.

original: ming dang tshig rnams kyis brtags pa ni tha snyad de de ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang tshig rnams kyis brtags pa ni tha snyad de de ston par byed pa'o //
translated: Conceptualized by names and phrases is convention, and it is taught.

original: brtags pa tsam nyid rtogs pa yang chos thams cad la ji ltar mos pas gzhan rnams la de ltar ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa tsam nyid rtogs pa yang chos thams cad la ji ltar mos pas gzhan rnams la de ltar ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Realizing mere conceptualization is teaching others in accordance with one's own realization of all phenomena.

original: chos nyid de dang 'gal bar yang mi byed ces bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dang mi 'gal bas gsal bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos nyid de dang 'gal bar yang mi byed ces bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dang mi 'gal bas gsal bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not contradicting that reality means manifesting without contradicting the conventional and ultimate truths.

original: gsal bar byed cing zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don ston par byed pa'i dgongs pas tha snyad la skyon med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar byed cing zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don ston par byed pa'i dgongs pas tha snyad la skyon med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It illuminates” means that there is no fault in conventional expressions, because of the intention to teach the benefit of others.

original: gal te yang don dam par chos thams cad brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir cung zad kyang brjod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe chos nyid 'di gzhan rnams la ston par byed nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang don dam par chos thams cad brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir cung zad kyang brjod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe chos nyid 'di gzhan rnams la ston par byed nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If, in the ultimate, all phenomena are inexpressible, and therefore nothing is expressed at all, then this reality cannot be taught to others.

original: nye bar ston to zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i kun rdzob la brten nas de ci nas kyang nye bar bstan par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye bar ston to zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i kun rdzob la brten nas de ci nas kyang nye bar bstan par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “It is taught” means that, based on the conventional that is imagined, it is taught in such a way that it can be taught.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /🔽tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa / tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
translated: As it is said:🔽Without relying on the conventional,

original: dam pa'i don ni rtogs mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i don ni rtogs mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The ultimate is not realized.

original: de ltar ba rgya byin shes rab zab pa nyid rtog par byed cing gnas brtan gyis ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir me tog rnams la rang bzhin med pa gsungs pa de rjes su bsam par byed cing smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar ba rgya byin shes rab zab pa nyid rtog par byed cing gnas brtan gyis ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir me tog rnams la rang bzhin med pa gsungs pa de rjes su bsam par byed cing smras pa /
translated: Thus, Śatakratu, having understood the profundity of wisdom, and the elder having taught that flowers have no intrinsic nature because they are not produced, he reflects on that and says,

original: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “It is just so” and so forth.

original: de bzhin du 'di las zhes bya ba ni me tog rnams bzhin du ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ngo bo nyid med pa'i blos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di las zhes bya ba ni me tog rnams bzhin du ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ngo bo nyid med pa'i blos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Just so in this perfection of wisdom” means that because of not being produced, like flowers, one should train in this perfection of wisdom with a mind that has no intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar yang gang zhig sngar brgya byin gyis dris pa ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya zhes der gnas pa med pa nyid gnas pa zhes bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: de ltar yang gang zhig sngar brgya byin gyis dris pa ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya zhes der gnas pa med pa nyid gnas pa zhes bstan pa yin no /
translated: Thus, what was asked by Śatakratu before, “How should one stand in the perfection of wisdom?” there, non-standing itself is taught as standing.

original: da ni brgya byin gyis gang 'di ji ltar bslab par bya zhes bya ba'i dri ba gnyis pa de gnas brtan rab 'byor lan 'debs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: da ni brgya byin gyis gang 'di ji ltar bslab par bya zhes bya ba'i dri ba gnyis pa de gnas brtan rab 'byor lan 'debs par byed pa ni /
translated: Now, the elder Subhuti answers the second question, “How should one train in this?”

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen pos 'di la bslab par bya ba ste /🔽de ltar zhes bya ba ni me tog rnams @69a * //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen pos 'di la bslab par bya ba ste / de ltar zhes bya ba ni me tog rnams @69a * //
translated: Thus should the great being train in this.

original: bzhin du chos thams cad ma skyes pa nyid du lhag par mos pas rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la slob ces bya ba la sogs pas mi slob pa nyid la bslab pa ji ltar gnas pa med pa nyid ni gnas pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhin du chos thams cad ma skyes pa nyid du lhag par mos pas rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la slob ces bya ba la sogs pas mi slob pa nyid la bslab pa ji ltar gnas pa med pa nyid ni gnas pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: “Thus” means that, with the conviction that all phenomena are non-arisen, like flowers in the sky, one should train in the fruit of stream-entry, etc. This teaches that the non-training in non-training is the training. The non-abiding is taught as abiding.

original: gang zhig slob par byed pa dang gang la slob par byed pa de gnyi ga med pas slob pa med ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig slob par byed pa dang gang la slob par byed pa de gnyi ga med pas slob pa med ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is that since neither the one who trains nor the one in whom one trains exists, there is no training.

original: gang gi tshe gcig gi stong pa nyid la slob pa de'i tshe /🔽gang zhig gcig gi stong pa nyid //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gcig gi stong pa nyid la slob pa de'i tshe / gang zhig gcig gi stong pa nyid //
translated: When one trains in the emptiness of one thing,🔽at that time🔽the emptiness of one thing

original: de nyid kun gyi stong pa nyid //
analyzed: de nyid kun gyi stong pa nyid //
translated: is the emptiness of all.

original: ces bya ba'i rigs pas thams cad kyi stong pa nyid rnams la slob pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i rigs pas thams cad kyi stong pa nyid rnams la slob pa'o //
translated: Thus, by this reasoning, one should train in the emptiness of all things.

original: 'og tu gang slob par mi byed pa de ni sangs rgyas nyid la sogs pa rnams la slob ces bya ba brjod ces bstan par byed de /
analyzed: 'og tu gang slob par mi byed pa de ni sangs rgyas nyid la sogs pa rnams la slob ces bya ba brjod ces bstan par byed de /
translated: What is not to be trained in is taught to be training in Buddhahood, etc.

original: de la sangs rgyas nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dang gdod ma nas zhi ba dang rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis🔽mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dang gdod ma nas zhi ba dang rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o //
translated: Buddhahood is the full realization of the perfected nature of things, through the aspects of non-production, non-cessation, primordial peace, natural nirvāṇa, etc., which are supramundane.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni kun tu brtags pa'i chos rnams la khams gsum gyi mthar thug pa rnams la 'jig rten pa dang bcas pa'i kun rdzob pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni kun tu brtags pa'i chos rnams la khams gsum gyi mthar thug pa rnams la 'jig rten pa dang bcas pa'i kun rdzob pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o //
translated: Omniscience is the full realization of the imagined nature of things, through the aspects of mundane conventional truth, which are the limits of the three realms.

original: gang zhig bslab pa 'di de dag gzhal du med pa'i chos kyi bslab pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig bslab pa 'di de dag gzhal du med pa'i chos kyi bslab pa ste /
translated: This is the immeasurable Dharma training of those who train in this training,

original: gzhal du med pa'i stobs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa'i stobs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: because the immeasurable powers and so on, which are the qualities of a Buddha, are the nature of the object of observation.

original: 'og tu gang de ltar gzhal du med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams slob pa de'i 'phel bar bya ba dang 'grib par bya ba dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams yod pa ma yin zhes bstan par byed de /
analyzed: 'og tu gang de ltar gzhal du med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams slob pa de'i 'phel bar bya ba dang 'grib par bya ba dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams yod pa ma yin zhes bstan par byed de /
translated: Later, it will be shown that the increase and decrease of those who train in the immeasurable qualities of a Buddha in that way do not exist in forms and so on.

original: de ni gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: That is taught by the passage beginning with “form” and so on.

original: dkar po'i phyogs 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin te nag po'i phyogs 'grib par bya ba'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin te nag po'i phyogs 'grib par bya ba'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not for the sake of increasing the side of virtue and not for the sake of decreasing the side of non-virtue.

original: 'og tu gang gi 'di ltar 'phel bar bya ba'am 'grib par bya ba'i chos rnams yod pa ma yin pa de'i khyad par can gyi don chos rnams la yongs su bzung ba dang dman pa'i chos rnams la 'jig par byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin zhes bstan
analyzed: 'og tu gang gi 'di ltar 'phel bar bya ba'am 'grib par bya ba'i chos rnams yod pa ma yin pa de'i khyad par can gyi don chos rnams la yongs su bzung ba dang dman pa'i chos rnams la 'jig par byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin zhes bstan
translated: Later it will be shown that the phenomena that increase or decrease in this way do not exist, and that the special meaning of this is that grasping phenomena and the inferior phenomena that are to be destroyed do not exist.🔽

original: par byed pa ni /
analyzed: par byed pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the special quality of that which is taught below, “that which increases or decreases does not exist,” is that the grasping of phenomena does not exist and the destruction of inferior phenomena does not exist.

original: de ni gzugs yongs su gzung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de ni gzugs yongs su gzung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: This is taught by “form is not grasped” and so on.

original: glo bur @69b ba'i gzugs la skye ba med de des na yongs su 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: glo bur @69b ba'i gzugs la skye ba med de des na yongs su 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Form that is adventitious is not produced, and therefore grasping does not exist.

original: gnas pa la 'gag pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa la 'gag pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Dwelling is not ceased.

original: des na dong ba med do //
analyzed: des na dong ba med do //
translated: Therefore, going does not exist.

original: 'on te byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du bslab pa 'di yin te des na ci nas kyang des khyad par can gyi chos rnams yongs su 'dzin par bya ba dang / bskyed par bya ba dman pa rnams la yang 'jig par bya /
analyzed: 'on te byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du bslab pa 'di yin te des na ci nas kyang des khyad par can gyi chos rnams yongs su 'dzin par bya ba dang / bskyed par bya ba dman pa rnams la yang 'jig par bya /
translated: However, this is the training of the bodhisattva for the sake of omniscience. Therefore, in every way, the grasping of special phenomena and the generation of inferior phenomena should be destroyed.

original: gzhan du na bslab pa ni mtshang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na bslab pa ni mtshang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the training would be pointless.

original: de ci'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yongs su 'dzin pa dang dor ba'i phyir slob par mi byed ces brjod snyam du dgongs nas gsungs pa /🔽chos 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yongs su 'dzin pa dang dor ba'i phyir slob par mi byed ces brjod snyam du dgongs nas gsungs pa / chos 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: With the thought, “Why does he not train in order to adopt and reject forms, etc.?” he says:

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni skye ba'i phyir yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'don pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni skye ba'i phyir yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'don pa ma yin te /
translated: No dharma whatsoever is apprehended as being produced or not being produced, as having a nature or not having a nature, as existent or non-existent.🔽“No dharma whatsoever is apprehended as being produced or not being produced” is not the reading.🔽When no dharma whatsoever exists as being apprehended as being produced, etc., then omniscience itself does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig tu chos gang gis kyang yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don yang yod pa ma yin zhes gsungs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig tu chos gang gis kyang yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don yang yod pa ma yin zhes gsungs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: He says this in, “Omniscience itself is not apprehended as being produced or not being produced, as having a nature or not having a nature, as existent or non-existent.”

original: ste / byang chub sems dpa' ni dman pa'i chos rnams yongs su dor nas khyad par can rnams thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ste / byang chub sems dpa' ni dman pa'i chos rnams yongs su dor nas khyad par can rnams thob pa ma yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva does not abandon inferior dharmas and attain superior ones.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa dag yod pa la rnam pa 'di yod pa yin no /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa dag yod pa la rnam pa 'di yod pa yin no /
translated: This is the case for the arising and ceasing of form, etc.

original: rab tu dbye ba yod pa ma yin chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa rnams la skye ba dang 'gag pa dag yod pa ma yin ngo bo nyid kyis g-yo ba dang bral ba'i phyir dang kun brtags dang / gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnams la yang shin tu med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba yod pa ma yin chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa rnams la skye ba dang 'gag pa dag yod pa ma yin ngo bo nyid kyis g-yo ba dang bral ba'i phyir dang kun brtags dang / gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnams la yang shin tu med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Arising and ceasing do not exist for form, etc., in their reality, because they are devoid of intrinsic reality, and because they do not exist at all in the imagined and interdependent natures.

original: gal te de ltar yin na ji ltar byang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na ji ltar byang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa zhes gsungs pa /
translated: If this is so, how can it be said that the bodhisattva is trained?

original: de ltar slob pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Lord replies: “He who trains thus, etc.”

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas gang zhig slob par byed pa de nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas gang zhig slob par byed pa de nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Thus” refers to the practice of nonapprehension. He who trains in this way will certainly attain omniscience.

original: sh'a ri'i bus dri bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus dri bar byed pa ni /
translated: Śāriputra asks:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Lord said:🔽Thus, Subhūti, should you understand that the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has newly set out in the vehicle, should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord said:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la slob cing zhes bya ba ni ji ltar slob ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la slob cing zhes bya ba ni ji ltar slob ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, Subhūti, should you understand that the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has newly set out in the vehicle, should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord said:🔽Thus, Subhūti, should you understand that the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has newly set out in the vehicle, should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor gyi lan ni de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi lan ni de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, Subhūti, should you understand that the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has newly set out in the vehicle, should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord said:🔽Thus, Subhūti, should you understand that the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has newly set out in the vehicle, should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord said:🔽Thus, Subhūti, should you understand that the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has newly set out in the vehicle, should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord said:

original: de de bzhin te ni ji ltar bshad par bya ba de ltar de zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: de de bzhin te ni ji ltar bshad par bya ba de ltar de zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: Thus, Subhūti, should you understand that the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has newly set out in the vehicle, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The Lord said:🔽Thus, Subhūti, should you understand that the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has newly set out in the vehicle, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshe @70a * //🔽dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshe @70a * // dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Lord said:🔽Thus, Subhūti, should you understand that the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has newly set out in the vehicle, should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord said:🔽Thus, Subhūti, should you understand that the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has newly set out in the vehicle, should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord said:

original: gang nyid chos thams cad mi dmigs pas spyod pa rnam par sbyong bar byed pa de nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sgrub par byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang nyid chos thams cad mi dmigs pas spyod pa rnam par sbyong bar byed pa de nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sgrub par byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, Subhūti, should you understand that the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has newly set out in the vehicle, should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord said:🔽Thus, Sub

original: de ltar lam gyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'dir bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la dri bar byed pa ni gang las
analyzed: de ltar lam gyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'dir bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la dri bar byed pa ni gang las
translated: Thus, in order to show here the perfection of wisdom which is the knowledge of all aspects of the path, it is said: “One should seek that perfection of wisdom which is the knowledge of all aspects from where?”

original: btsal bar bya zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: btsal bar bya zhes bya ba ste /
translated: From where should it be sought?

original: rab 'byor gyi le'u las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi le'u las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said: “In the chapter of Subhūti.”

original: gang zhig 'di bar ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bstan pa de rab 'byor gyi le'u las shes par bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di bar ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bstan pa de rab 'byor gyi le'u las shes par bya bar brjod do //
translated: It is said that one should understand that teaching of the perfection of wisdom from the chapter of Subhūti.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te 'jug pa'i phyir de bstan pa la de las btsal bar bya zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te 'jug pa'i phyir de bstan pa la de las btsal bar bya zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: Because it is the introduction that begins with the perfection of wisdom of the knowledge of all aspects, it is said that it should be sought in that teaching.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul zab pa bstan pa la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las brtsams te rab 'byor gyi bsngags pa mi dpyod cing lha'i dbang pos dri bar byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul zab pa bstan pa la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las brtsams te rab 'byor gyi bsngags pa mi dpyod cing lha'i dbang pos dri bar byed de /
translated: In the teaching of the profound domain of the Tathagata, beginning with the knowledge of all modes, Subhuti is not praised, and the Lord of the Gods asks:

original: su'i mthu zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: su'i mthu zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Whose power is it?

original: gang gi phyir bstan pa de sngar gnas skabs su byas pa de'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bstan pa de sngar gnas skabs su byas pa de'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Because that teaching was done previously, therefore Shariputra says:

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the Tathagata's.

original: don ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: don ni 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning is this:

original: gal te yang rab 'byor gyi le'u nyid la gsungs pa de lta na yang lha'i 'dus pa da ltar 'jug pa'i phyir de'i tshe na brgya byin zhes bya ba'i dri ba yang dag par 'byung ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang rab 'byor gyi le'u nyid la gsungs pa de lta na yang lha'i 'dus pa da ltar 'jug pa'i phyir de'i tshe na brgya byin zhes bya ba'i dri ba yang dag par 'byung ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if it is said in the chapter of Subhuti, still, because the assembly of gods is now engaged, at that time the question called Shakra does not arise.

original: 'di nyid bstan par byed pa'i phyir rab 'byor rjes su sems par byed cing gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan par byed pa'i phyir rab 'byor rjes su sems par byed cing gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach just this, Subhuti thinks and says:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then and so on.

original: de ltar gnas brtan rab 'byor kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin rlabs las bdag nyid kyis bstan pa byas par 'gyur zhes bya ba bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar gnas brtan rab 'byor kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin rlabs las bdag nyid kyis bstan pa byas par 'gyur zhes bya ba bstan par mdzad do //
translated: Thus, the elder Subhūti, by the method of the conventional, has himself taught through the blessing of the Tathāgata.

original: da ni don dam pa'i tshul gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni don dam pa'i tshul gyis gsungs pa /
translated: Now, he speaks by the method of the ultimate:

original: gzugs las btsal bar mi bya zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs las btsal bar mi bya zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Do not search for it in form.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams med pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams med pa brjod pa'o //
translated: This is the statement that form and so on do not exist.

original: gzugs las gzhan du yang btsal bar mi bya zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang med pa nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa yod pa ma yin zhes tha dad pa med pa'i phyir brjod pa /
analyzed: gzugs las gzhan du yang btsal bar mi bya zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang med pa nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa yod pa ma yin zhes tha dad pa med pa'i phyir brjod pa /
translated: “Do not search for it apart from form.” This is the statement that it is not separate, because it does not exist in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gzugs ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / gzugs ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why is that?🔽“Form is not the perfection of wisdom.”

original: gzugs dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyi ga yang @70b med pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzugs dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyi ga yang @70b med pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated because both form and the perfection of wisdom do not exist.

original: gzugs las gzhan na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs las gzhan na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom does not exist apart from form.

original: med pa nyid kyis tha dad par brjod par nus pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //🔽de ltar yang chos thams cad la stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo bstan pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa dang rab 'byor gyi le'u la yang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid bstan par byas pa'o //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyis tha dad par brjod par nus pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o // de ltar yang chos thams cad la stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo bstan pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa dang rab 'byor gyi le'u la yang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid bstan par byas pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning is that it cannot be expressed as different by way of non-existence.🔽Thus, by teaching the reality of emptiness of all phenomena, the reality of emptiness is taught in the chapter on the benediction of the Tathagata and in the chapter of Subhuti.

original: de ltar yang don dam par stong pa nyid kho na la byin gyis brlabs pa dang / stong pa nyid kho na las btsal ba dang de'i bstan pa la stong pa nyid las brtsams nas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar yang don dam par stong pa nyid kho na la byin gyis brlabs pa dang / stong pa nyid kho na las btsal ba dang de'i bstan pa la stong pa nyid las brtsams nas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the benediction is only in emptiness, the ultimate, and only emptiness is sought, and the teaching is engaged by way of emptiness. This is the meaning.

original: yang 'og tu brgya byin rnam pa bzhis ngag bstan pa sna tshogs pa nyid gnas skabs su yang nye bar bkod par byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang 'og tu brgya byin rnam pa bzhis ngag bstan pa sna tshogs pa nyid gnas skabs su yang nye bar bkod par byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Again, below, the teaching by the fourfold Indra is the variety of speech, and the application to the occasion is the great perfection.

original: brgya byin gyis bstan pa'i don la gnas brtan zhes bya ba la sogs pa rab 'byor gyi bsngags pa dang bcas pa rjes su brjod pa ste /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis bstan pa'i don la gnas brtan zhes bya ba la sogs pa rab 'byor gyi bsngags pa dang bcas pa rjes su brjod pa ste /
translated: The praise of Subhuti together with the statement of the meaning of the teaching by Indra is the expression.

original: de bas na rab 'byor nyid kyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rab 'byor nyid kyis bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the teaching of Subhuti himself.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid can 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus gsum la yod par 'gyur ram med par 'gyur zhes bya ba'am 'byung bar 'gyur ram 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'am yod dam med ces bya ba yongs
analyzed: gzugs kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid can 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus gsum la yod par 'gyur ram med par 'gyur zhes bya ba'am 'byung bar 'gyur ram 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'am yod dam med ces bya ba yongs
translated: The characteristic of the perfected form of form is whether it exists or does not exist in the three times, past, future, and present, or whether it will arise or will not arise, or whether it exists or does not exist.

original: su gcod pa med pa'i phyir chen po nyid de /
analyzed: su gcod pa med pa'i phyir chen po nyid de /
translated: Because there is no determination, it is greatness.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid can la chen po nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid can la chen po nyid de /
translated: Likewise, the perfection of wisdom is also great in the perfection of wisdom that has the nature of the consummate.

original: tshad ma med pa nyid ni 'di tsam du yongs su gcod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa nyid ni 'di tsam du yongs su gcod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is immeasurable because it cannot be delimited by measure.

original: tshad med pa nyid ni grangs kyis yongs su gcod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa nyid ni grangs kyis yongs su gcod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is limitless because it cannot be delimited by number.

original: mtha' yas pa nyid ni mtshan nyid kyis yongs su gcod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa nyid ni mtshan nyid kyis yongs su gcod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is infinite because it cannot be delimited by characteristic.

original: po ti kha cig rnams la ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes la gzugs mtha' yas pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: po ti kha cig rnams la ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes la gzugs mtha' yas pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'don pa yin no //
translated: In some editions, after “why is that?” it reads “because form is infinite,” and so on.

original: 'don pa de yang gang gis kyang ma bshad pa de bas na 'dri mkhan gyis bag med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'don pa de yang gang gis kyang ma bshad pa de bas na 'dri mkhan gyis bag med pa kho na'o //
translated: But since no one explains that reading, the questioner is simply careless.

original: de lta bas na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po nyi la sogs pa la gal te mngon par zhen pa yin na de'i tshe chen po nyid la sogs pa med ces ston par byed de /🔽de bzhin @71a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po nyi la sogs pa la gal te mngon par zhen pa yin na de'i tshe chen po nyid la sogs pa med ces ston par byed de / de bzhin @71a * //
translated: Thus, if one is attached to the greatness of the perfection of wisdom, etc., then it is taught that greatness, etc. do not exist.

original: du pha rol tu phyin pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: du pha rol tu phyin pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Similarly, in the case of the so-called “great perfection,” etc.

original: yang rab tu dbye ba gnyis kyis mtha' yas pa nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang rab tu dbye ba gnyis kyis mtha' yas pa nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Again, the infinitude is stated in terms of two divisions:

original: dmigs pa mtha' yas pa nyid dang / sems can mtha' yas pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dmigs pa mtha' yas pa nyid dang / sems can mtha' yas pa nyid kyis so //
translated: the infinitude of objective supports and the infinitude of sentient beings.

original: yang ci ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang ci ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Again, how is it?

original: chos thams cad kyi zhes bya bas ni don dam par chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin las mtha' med ces bya ba snga ma skye ba'i mtha'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi zhes bya bas ni don dam par chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin las mtha' med ces bya ba snga ma skye ba'i mtha'o //
translated: By “all dharmas” is meant that ultimately, the nature of the dharma-dhātu is without end, the former being the end of arising;

original: dbus ma yin zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dbus ma yin zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma'i gnas pa'o //
translated: “without middle” means the abiding of the moment;

original: tha ma med ces bya ba ni 'gag pa'i mtha' ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha ma med ces bya ba ni 'gag pa'i mtha' ni ma yin no //
translated: “without final end” means that it is not the end of cessation.

original: 'di rnams la yang mi dmigs pa ni chos thams cad la stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams la yang mi dmigs pa ni chos thams cad la stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, too, non-apprehension is due to the emptiness nature of all things.

original: de ltar mtha' la sogs pa mi dmigs pas chos thams cad la yongs su grub pa nyid kyis mtha' yas pa nyid rab tu bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mtha' la sogs pa mi dmigs pas chos thams cad la yongs su grub pa nyid kyis mtha' yas pa nyid rab tu bstan nas /
translated: Thus, by the non-apprehension of end, etc., the infinity of all things is demonstrated by their perfected nature.

original: da ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyis kyang bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyis kyang bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate [infinity] by means of the imagined and interdependent natures as well, [the Lord] declares,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, etc.

original: thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma med pas gsungs pa yang sems can mtha' yas pa nyid la brgya byin grangs kyis yang sems can mtha' yas pa nyid rang bzhin du byed cing dri bar byed pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma med pas gsungs pa yang sems can mtha' yas pa nyid la brgya byin grangs kyis yang sems can mtha' yas pa nyid rang bzhin du byed cing dri bar byed pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The statement about beginning, middle, and end is also made in terms of the infinity of sentient beings. Indra, by means of the number, makes the infinity of sentient beings into a nature and asks about it with, How, etc.

original: bgrang ba dang mi ldan pa 'am bgrang ba mang pos zhes bya ba ni grangs las 'da' ba nyid kyis ma yin te mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba'i grangs kyis kyang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bgrang ba dang mi ldan pa 'am bgrang ba mang pos zhes bya ba ni grangs las 'da' ba nyid kyis ma yin te mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba'i grangs kyis kyang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not by counting or by many counts means not by the number beyond number, not by the number infinite.

original: 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What then?

original: 'o na'i sbra ni mi bzod pa la'o //
analyzed: 'o na'i sbra ni mi bzod pa la'o //
translated: The word “then” is for the purpose of expressing impatience.

original: chos gang gi tshig bla dvags yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos gang gi tshig bla dvags yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the designation of a dharma?

original: chos rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi tshig bla dvags ma yin te de rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi tshig bla dvags ma yin te de rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Dharmas are not the designation of form, etc., because they do not exist.

original: chos med pa'i tshig bla dvags kyang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos med pa'i tshig bla dvags kyang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is the designation of a dharma that does not exist, because there is no self apart from form, etc.

original: brtags pa zhes bya ba ni rmongs pa rnams kyis rab tu sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: brtags pa zhes bya ba ni rmongs pa rnams kyis rab tu sbyar ba'o //
translated: Imagined means applied by the ignorant.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir glo bur ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir glo bur ba ste /
translated: Because it is adventitious.

original: don dam par nges par dpyad pa yod pa la de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par nges par dpyad pa yod pa la de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In ultimate analysis, it does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po med pa gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang bdag gi mtshan @71b nyid kyi rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po med pa gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang bdag gi mtshan @71b nyid kyi rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the non-existence of things, such as form, and the substance of the self-characteristic do not exist.

original: bdag dang 'brel bas cung zad bdag gi zhes brjod de de yang med pa ste bdag shin tu yang med pas na de'i phyir bdag gi ba med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang 'brel bas cung zad bdag gi zhes brjod de de yang med pa ste bdag shin tu yang med pas na de'i phyir bdag gi ba med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no connection with the self, the term “mine” is used to a slight degree, but that also does not exist. Since the self is utterly non-existent, therefore there is no “mine.”

original: dmigs pa ni yul te /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni yul te /
translated: The objective support is the object.

original: de med pas dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pas dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: Since that does not exist, there is no objective support.

original: gal te bstan pa 'di la sems can 'ga' zhig bstan par gyur na de ltar yod na sems can mtha' yas pa nyid kyang bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bstan pa 'di la sems can 'ga' zhig bstan par gyur na de ltar yod na sems can mtha' yas pa nyid kyang bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If any sentient beings were to be taught in this teaching, then in that case, the infinity of sentient beings would also be taught.

original: gang gi phyir ngo bo nyid kyis sems can med pa'i phyir sems can bstan du med pa de'i phyir 'dir sems can mtha' yas pa nyid don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ngo bo nyid kyis sems can med pa'i phyir sems can bstan du med pa de'i phyir 'dir sems can mtha' yas pa nyid don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since sentient beings are not taught because of the intrinsic reality of sentient beings, therefore, here the infinity of sentient beings does not exist ultimately.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: What do you think, etc.

original: sems can mtha' yas pa yod dam zhes bya ba ni sems can med pa'i phyir sems can mtha' yas pa nyid kyang bstan pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can mtha' yas pa yod dam zhes bya ba ni sems can med pa'i phyir sems can mtha' yas pa nyid kyang bstan pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The question Are there infinite sentient beings? means that because sentient beings do not exist, the teaching of infinite sentient beings also does not exist.

original: 'og tu ni sems can mtha' yas pa nyid tshig la rag lus pa ma yin te sems can med pa nyid kyis mtha' yas pa nyid rang bzhin can zhes bstan par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'og tu ni sems can mtha' yas pa nyid tshig la rag lus pa ma yin te sems can med pa nyid kyis mtha' yas pa nyid rang bzhin can zhes bstan par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Below, it is shown that the infinity of sentient beings is not dependent on words, but is naturally infinite due to the non-existence of sentient beings. It says If... and so on.

original: gsungs zhes bya ba ni tshig gis so //
analyzed: gsungs zhes bya ba ni tshig gis so //
translated: The word said means by words.

original: mtha' las 'das pa'i 'jig rten gyi rnam par rig par byed pa ni don shes par byed pa'i dbyangs ni sgra 'di la yod pa de ltar brjod pas so //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa'i 'jig rten gyi rnam par rig par byed pa ni don shes par byed pa'i dbyangs ni sgra 'di la yod pa de ltar brjod pas so //
translated: The expression the world beyond the extremes is used because it has the sound that makes known the meaning of infinite.

original: de ltar na yang shin tu che ba nyid kyis zab mo dbyangs sil snyan gyi sgra bzhin du sna tshogs pa'i sgra 'di la yod pa de ltar brjod pas so //
analyzed: de ltar na yang shin tu che ba nyid kyis zab mo dbyangs sil snyan gyi sgra bzhin du sna tshogs pa'i sgra 'di la yod pa de ltar brjod pas so //
translated: However, it is also called the sound of the great one because it has various sounds like the sound of musical instruments.

original: yang bzhugs zhes bya ba ni ngal mi so bas so //
analyzed: yang bzhugs zhes bya ba ni ngal mi so bas so //
translated: The word abides means without weariness.

original: zin kyang zhes bya ba ni ci zhig go snyam na /
analyzed: zin kyang zhes bya ba ni ci zhig go snyam na /
translated: “Even if it were grasped” means what?

original: don ni 'di yin te gal te tshig la rag lus pa sems can mtha' yas pa nyid du gyur na de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gis sems can skye bar yang 'gyur 'gag par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te gal te tshig la rag lus pa sems can mtha' yas pa nyid du gyur na de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gis sems can skye bar yang 'gyur 'gag par yang 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning is this: if the infinity of sentient beings depended on words, then the speech of the Tathāgatas would produce and stop sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir de ni yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir sems can mtha' yas pa nyid kyi tshig las 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir sems can mtha' yas pa nyid kyi tshig las 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But since that is not the case, therefore the infinity of sentient beings does not arise from words.

original: thog ma nas dag pa nyid ni dang po nyid nas so //
analyzed: thog ma nas dag pa nyid ni dang po nyid nas so //
translated: “Pure from the beginning” means from the very beginning.

original: yongs su dag pa nyid ni thams cad du yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa nyid ni thams cad du yod pa nyid do //
translated: “Totally pure” means existing everywhere.

original: rnam grangs 'dis kyang ni rab tu dbye bas so //
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis kyang ni rab tu dbye bas so //
translated: “By this enumeration” means by this classification.

original: mtha' yas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zhes bya ba ste /🔽gal te 'dir bstan pa las @72a * //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zhes bya ba ste / gal te 'dir bstan pa las @72a * //
translated: “The infinite perfection” means the perfection of the infinite.🔽If sentient beings were taught in this teaching,

original: sems can bstan par 'gyur na de yod pa'i phyir mtha' rnams kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can bstan par 'gyur na de yod pa'i phyir mtha' rnams kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then because they exist, the extremes would also exist.

original: de rnams bstan pas mtha' yas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams bstan pas mtha' yas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This is not a perfection that goes to the end of the infinite, because of the teaching of those.

original: de'i phyir sems can bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, sentient beings are not taught.

original: de'i phyir sems can med de med pas mtha' yas pa yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can med de med pas mtha' yas pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, sentient beings do not exist, and because they do not exist, the infinite also does not exist.

original: de bas na sems can ma bstan pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zhes brjod pa yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na sems can ma bstan pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zhes brjod pa yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this perfection goes to the end of the infinite because sentient beings are not taught. This is the intended meaning.

original: 'di ni 'khor rnams kyi dang po'i khyad par dang shin tu ngo mtshar ba'i tshig smras pa de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor rnams kyi dang po'i khyad par dang shin tu ngo mtshar ba'i tshig smras pa de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is the first distinction of the retinue. The words of the most amazing statement are “then” and so on.

original: skye dgu'i bdag po rnams ni 'jig rten skyong ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag po rnams ni 'jig rten skyong ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The lords of beings are the four world guardians.

original: khyad par gyi chos thos pas rab tu dga' ba'i phyir smras pa'i tshig ni ched du brjod pas de ched du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi chos thos pas rab tu dga' ba'i phyir smras pa'i tshig ni ched du brjod pas de ched du brjod pa'o //
translated: The words of the statement of delight in hearing the special qualities are the expression of delight. That is the expression of delight.

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba la'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba la'o //
translated: “Amazing!” is for the amazing.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos so //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos so //
translated: “Dharma” is the taught Dharma.

original: rab tu dga' ba dang ngo mtshar ba la tshig gnyis so //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba dang ngo mtshar ba la tshig gnyis so //
translated: Two verses on the joy and wonder of the bodhisattvas.

original: chos de nyid kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin te de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: chos de nyid kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin te de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: The reality nature of that reality is its intrinsic reality, which is the very occurrence of the transcendent lords.

original: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /🔽gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa / gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽The reality nature of that reality is its intrinsic reality, which is the very occurrence of the transcendent lords.

original: 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: The occurrence is the arising.

original: brjod cing de'i tshig las dang por cung zad gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: brjod cing de'i tshig las dang por cung zad gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The expression is the first slight manifestation of the word.

original: de nas rim gyis shin tu gsal ba dang de bas gsal bar rtogs pa'i phyir bstan te bshad pa la rab tu gzhag go //
analyzed: de nas rim gyis shin tu gsal ba dang de bas gsal bar rtogs pa'i phyir bstan te bshad pa la rab tu gzhag go //
translated: Then, gradually, it is taught and explained, and one is established in it, because it is understood more and more clearly.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa legs par 'dzin to zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa legs par 'dzin to zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The transcendent lords hold it well,

original: chos kyi sku ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The reality body is the transcendent lords, the nature of the buddhadharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang der slob par gyur pa na don dam par sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rang bzhin nyid ces de'i byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa la tha dad med pa de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa de nyid brjod par bya
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang der slob par gyur pa na don dam par sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rang bzhin nyid ces de'i byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa la tha dad med pa de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa de nyid brjod par bya
translated: And when the bodhisattvas train in that, then the nature of the Buddha qualities is ultimate, and the bodhisattvas and the Tathagata are not different in that. Therefore, the Tathagata himself is to be expressed.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: ma bral ba ni thob pa las yongs su ltung ba med pas so //
analyzed: ma bral ba ni thob pa las yongs su ltung ba med pas so //
translated: Not separated means not falling away from attainment.

original: gnas par 'gyur ni yang dag par phyogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas par 'gyur ni yang dag par phyogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Abiding means having the nature of correct orientation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yang nas yang du slob par gyur pa rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid gsal @72b ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das sngar gyi gtam brjod par mdzad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yang nas yang du slob par gyur pa rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid gsal @72b ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das sngar gyi gtam brjod par mdzad de /
translated: For the bodhisattvas who repeatedly train in the Buddha qualities, the Bhagavat spoke the above discourse in order to clarify the nature of the Buddha qualities.

original: gang gi tshe bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: When I say “me” and so on,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang ma bral bar bdag la gzigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la lung bstan par mdzad pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang ma bral bar bdag la gzigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la lung bstan par mdzad pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Tathagata Dipankara, seeing me as not being separated from the qualities of a Buddha, prophesied me as a Tathagata.

original: 'dus ni 'dug pa dang 'dus pa dag go //
analyzed: 'dus ni 'dug pa dang 'dus pa dag go //
translated: The assembly is the gathering and those gathered.

original: dbus ni dril bu 'dogs pa'i lam ste de'i dbus su song ba'o //
analyzed: dbus ni dril bu 'dogs pa'i lam ste de'i dbus su song ba'o //
translated: The middle is the path of the bell, having gone to the middle of that.

original: na so gzhon pa klog pa'i bram ze'i khye'u ste de'i bod pa ni bram ze'i khye'u zhes bya'o //
analyzed: na so gzhon pa klog pa'i bram ze'i khye'u ste de'i bod pa ni bram ze'i khye'u zhes bya'o //
translated: The young is the young brahman student, and his brahman student is called a brahman student.

original: de'i tshe na bcom ldan 'das ming gis brlan pa zhes bya ba dang blo rab tu gsal bas legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya ba dang rgyal po zas gtsang mas gzhon nu'i skye ba la don thams cad grub pa'i phyir don thams cad grub pa zhes mtshan btags
analyzed: de'i tshe na bcom ldan 'das ming gis brlan pa zhes bya ba dang blo rab tu gsal bas legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya ba dang rgyal po zas gtsang mas gzhon nu'i skye ba la don thams cad grub pa'i phyir don thams cad grub pa zhes mtshan btags
translated: At that time, the Bhagavat was called the one who is moistened by name, and because of his very clear mind, he was called good mind, and because King Shuddhodana gave the name of Siddharaja to the prince for the sake of accomplishing all goals,

original: so // gang gi phyir grong khyer du zhugs par byas pa de'i tshe sh'akya rnams shin tu dregs pa yang thub pa bzhin grub pa de bas na rgyal po gzhon nu'i mtshan gnyis pa sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba btags so //
analyzed: so // gang gi phyir grong khyer du zhugs par byas pa de'i tshe sh'akya rnams shin tu dregs pa yang thub pa bzhin grub pa de bas na rgyal po gzhon nu'i mtshan gnyis pa sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba btags so //
translated: Because he was able to subdue the pride of the Shakyas when he entered the city, the king named the prince “Shakyamuni,” the “Sage of the Shakyas.”

original: ji ltar chos rnams 'dis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bzhin du gsungs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar chos rnams 'dis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bzhin du gsungs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is the Tathagata because he speaks just as he did when he fully awakened to dharmas.

original: ga ta zhes bya ba la aa nyid dang nges tshig pa nga yig go //
analyzed: ga ta zhes bya ba la aa nyid dang nges tshig pa nga yig go //
translated: The word gata means “gone” and is a nominal suffix.

original: dgra rnams ni nyon mongs pa rnams te de rnams 'joms pas na dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: dgra rnams ni nyon mongs pa rnams te de rnams 'joms pas na dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: He is an arhat because he destroys the enemies, the afflictions.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du don dam par chos rnams rtogs pas na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du don dam par chos rnams rtogs pas na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: He is a samyak-sambuddha because he realizes dharmas just as they are in the ultimate sense.

original: 'dis ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //
translated: This teaches the perfection of the teacher.

original: gang gi phyir smra ba po ma yin pa dang phyin ci log tu smra ba ni ston pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smra ba po ma yin pa dang phyin ci log tu smra ba ni ston pa ma yin te /
translated: Because one who is not a speaker and one who speaks falsely are not teachers.

original: phyin ci log tu smra ba yang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis mi shes pas kyang yin la de gnyi ga yang 'di la med pa ste don ji lta bar dgra bcom pa nyid kyi phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu smra ba yang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis mi shes pas kyang yin la de gnyi ga yang 'di la med pa ste don ji lta bar dgra bcom pa nyid kyi phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He is also one who does not speak falsely, because he is not ignorant through the power of the afflictions. And he is one who does not speak in both ways, because he is an arhat who is just like the meaning and because he is a perfect buddha.

original: 'khor ba can la ji ltar 'di lta bu'i nus pa zhes gsungs pa ni bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba can la ji ltar 'di lta bu'i nus pa zhes gsungs pa ni bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He is called a Sugata because he has the ability to do this, which is not the case for those in cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba las gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba las gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa'o //
