translated: He is a Sugata because he has gone to bliss.

original: bde ba'i sgra ni shin tu'i don nyid la ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i sgra ni shin tu'i don nyid la ste /
translated: The term bliss has the sense of complete.

original: khams gsum gyi 'jig rten las so //🔽shin tu bkra shis par gshegs pas @73a * //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi 'jig rten las so // shin tu bkra shis par gshegs pas @73a * //
translated: He has gone to the world of the three realms.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is a Sugata because he has gone to complete bliss.

original: shin tu mdzes pa'i gzugs 'di la yod pas na bde bar gshegs pas gzugs mdzes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shin tu mdzes pa'i gzugs 'di la yod pas na bde bar gshegs pas gzugs mdzes pa bzhin no //
translated: He is a Sugata because he has a body that is completely beautiful, like a beautiful form.

original: shin tu phyir mi ldog pas rims nad legs par byang ba bzhin du gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu phyir mi ldog pas rims nad legs par byang ba bzhin du gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is a Sugata because he has gone to complete nonreturn, like one who is completely cured of a fever.

original: shin tu ste ma lus par bum pa legs par gang ba bzhin du gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu ste ma lus par bum pa legs par gang ba bzhin du gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is the Well-Gone because he has gone to the other shore of the ocean of the knowable, which is like a great ocean, by means of the ship of the path of the three vehicles.

original: don gsum po 'di yang phyi rol pa dang slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams las rnam par bcad pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: don gsum po 'di yang phyi rol pa dang slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams las rnam par bcad pa'i don du'o //
translated: This third meaning is for the purpose of distinguishing him from the non-Buddhists, the trainees, and the adepts.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis gshegs pa nyid kyi phyir shin tu mdzes par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis gshegs pa nyid kyi phyir shin tu mdzes par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is the Well-Gone because he has gone beautifully by means of the supramundane path.

original: phyi rol pa ni de ltar ma yin te bdag med par mthong ba med pas 'dod pa'i chags pa la sogs pa rnams spangs kyang slar skyes pas sdig pa la sogs pa dang sdug bsngal yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol pa ni de ltar ma yin te bdag med par mthong ba med pas 'dod pa'i chags pa la sogs pa rnams spangs kyang slar skyes pas sdig pa la sogs pa dang sdug bsngal yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-Buddhists are not like that, because even though they have abandoned attachment to sense-objects and so on, they are again born, and so evil and so on and suffering arise again.

original: slob pa rnams la ni gal te yang spangs pa'i skyon yang dag par 'byung ba yod pa ma yin yang 'on kyang phyir mi ldog pa zhes brjod pa na skye ba dang skyon yang 'byung ba yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: slob pa rnams la ni gal te yang spangs pa'i skyon yang dag par 'byung ba yod pa ma yin yang 'on kyang phyir mi ldog pa zhes brjod pa na skye ba dang skyon yang 'byung ba yod pa nyid do //
translated: Even though there is no possibility of error in the case of those in training, still, when they are called “non-returners,” there is the possibility of error in regard to birth and error in regard to the passions.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid du gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid du gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa ste /
translated: The Lord has gone to the state of non-returner, and so he is the Well-Gone.

original: lhag ma nyon mongs rims nad med //
analyzed: lhag ma nyon mongs rims nad med //
translated: He is free from the passions and the sickness of birth.

original: lus ngan blo ni ma tshang nyid //
analyzed: lus ngan blo ni ma tshang nyid //
translated: He is free from the error of the body and the error of the mind.🔽He is free from the error of the path and the error of pride.🔽He is free from the error of the vehicle and the error of disciples.🔽He is free from the error of the Solitary Buddhas and the error of the Bodhisattvas.🔽He is free from the error of the Buddha and the error of the Dharma.

original: lam brjod pas ni g-yer ba dang // de mi slob pa'i theg pa dman pa dgra bcom pa rnams la ji srid par yod kyi bcom ldan 'das la ma yin no //
analyzed: lam brjod pas ni g-yer ba dang // de mi slob pa'i theg pa dman pa dgra bcom pa rnams la ji srid par yod kyi bcom ldan 'das la ma yin no //
translated: He is free from the error of the Sangha and the error of the precepts.🔽He is free from the error of the aggregates and the error of the elements.🔽He is free from the error of the sense-spheres and the error of the sense-fields.

original: de'i phyir ma lus par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma lus par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is free from the error of the perfections and the error of the emptinesses.🔽He is free from the error of the applications of mindfulness and the error of the right efforts.🔽He is free from the error of the bases of psychic power and the error of the faculties.🔽He is free from the error of the powers and the error of the limbs of enlightenment.🔽He is free from the error of the path and the error of the fruits.🔽He is free from the error of the concentrations and the error of the formless states.🔽He is free from the error of the liberations and the error of the bindings.🔽He is free from the error of the stages and the error of the vehicles.🔽He is free from the error of the Buddhadharmas and the error of the knowledge of all modes.🔽He is free from the error of the knowledge of the path and the error of the knowledge of the aspects.

original: ji ltar bde bar gshegs pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar bde bar gshegs pa yin snyam na /
translated: He is free from the error of the knowledge of the aspects and the error of the knowledge of the path.🔽He is free from the error of the knowledge of the aspects and the error of the knowledge of all modes.🔽He is free from the error of the knowledge of all modes and the error of the knowledge of the path.

original: gang gi phyir rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa'o //
translated: He is free from the error of the knowledge of all modes and the error of the knowledge of the

original: rig pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa dang lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa dang lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: Awareness is the practice of the training in higher wisdom, the training in higher morality, and the training in higher mind.

original: shes rab kyi phrin las su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir yang dang yang du spyod cing zhes pas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi phrin las su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir yang dang yang du spyod cing zhes pas so //
translated: It is the one who practices again and again, because he has the activity of wisdom.

original: de bas na rig pas mig bzhin du mthong zhing gzhan dag gis rkang pa dang 'dra bar de ltar gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rig pas mig bzhin du mthong zhing gzhan dag gis rkang pa dang 'dra bar de ltar gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the one who goes well, because he sees with the eye of awareness and goes with the feet of others.

original: de'i phyir tshig gnyis po 'dis ston pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig gnyis po 'dis ston pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu gsungs so //
translated: Thus, these two words state the cause of the perfection of the teacher.

original: 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i dus dang dus ma yin pa la sogs pa yongs su @73b shes pa'i phyir 'jig rten rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i dus dang dus ma yin pa la sogs pa yongs su @73b shes pa'i phyir 'jig rten rig pa'o //
translated: He is the one who knows the world, because he fully knows the time and the non-time for taming, etc.

original: skyes bu gdul bya ni gdul bya nyid 'dul bar bya ba ste 'dul bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu gdul bya ni gdul bya nyid 'dul bar bya ba ste 'dul bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The one to be tamed is the person to be tamed, because he is the one to be tamed.

original: de rnams kyi kha lo sgyur ba ni yang dag par 'dul bar byed pa gdul bar dka' ba la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa shes che ba nyid rnams kyang 'dul ba'i phyir kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi kha lo sgyur ba ni yang dag par 'dul bar byed pa gdul bar dka' ba la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa shes che ba nyid rnams kyang 'dul ba'i phyir kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa'o //
translated: The one who guides them is the one who truly disciplines, the unsurpassed guide, because he disciplines even those who are difficult to discipline, those whose passions such as lust are strong.

original: tshig gnyis po 'dis ston pa phun sum tshogs pa'i phrin las gsungs so //
analyzed: tshig gnyis po 'dis ston pa phun sum tshogs pa'i phrin las gsungs so //
translated: These two phrases state the Buddha's activity as a perfect teacher.

original: phrin las kyi yul gsungs pa /
analyzed: phrin las kyi yul gsungs pa /
translated: The Buddha's activity as a teacher is stated in the phrase

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: teacher of gods and men.

original: gal te yang bcom ldan 'das khyad par med par 'gro ba thams cad la song ba rnams la ston pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang bcom ldan 'das khyad par med par 'gro ba thams cad la song ba rnams la ston pa yin te /
translated: Although the Lord is engaged in the welfare of all beings without distinction,

original: 'on kyang gang du 'bras bu thob pa de nyid lha dang mi rnams kyi gtso cher mdzad pa'i phyir ston pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang du 'bras bu thob pa de nyid lha dang mi rnams kyi gtso cher mdzad pa'i phyir ston pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: he is called teacher because he is preeminent in the attainment of the result among gods and men.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa gang yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa gang yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is the nature of the one who has such qualities?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase Buddha Bhagavat states this.

original: don dang nye bar bcas pa'i chos kyi phung po dang don ma yin pa nye bar bcas pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i chos kyi phung po ma lus shing rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs pas na sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: don dang nye bar bcas pa'i chos kyi phung po dang don ma yin pa nye bar bcas pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i chos kyi phung po ma lus shing rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs pas na sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Buddha is one who has fully and completely realized all the aggregates of Dharma, together with their meaning and their near-at-hand application, and also the aggregates of Dharma that are not the meaning and their near-at-hand application, and also all the other aggregates of Dharma without exception.

original: bdud thams cad kyi stobs dang g-yul ngo chen po 'joms pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: bdud thams cad kyi stobs dang g-yul ngo chen po 'joms pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He is the Bhagavat because he has conquered all the demons and their great armies.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, etc.

original: gsol to zhes bya ba ni mar me mdzad kyis lung bstan pa thos pas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gsol to zhes bya ba ni mar me mdzad kyis lung bstan pa thos pas brjod pa yin no //
translated: He asked means that he spoke after hearing the prophecy of Dipankara.

original: chos thams cad la stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir dbang sgyur bar sgrub par byed pa dang rjes su 'dzin pa dag med de 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid snga na med pa yongs su bzung bar byed ces bya ba 'di ngo mtshar ba yin
analyzed: chos thams cad la stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir dbang sgyur bar sgrub par byed pa dang rjes su 'dzin pa dag med de 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid snga na med pa yongs su bzung bar byed ces bya ba 'di ngo mtshar ba yin
translated: Since all dharmas have the nature of emptiness, there is no one to establish sovereignty and no one to be sustained. Nevertheless, it is amazing that he has taken up omniscience which did not exist before.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: bar du sgrub par byed pa ni 'gugs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bar du sgrub par byed pa ni 'gugs par byed pa'o //
translated: In the middle, it is the accomplishment, because it attracts.

original: rjes su yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ni thob pa las mi ltung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ni thob pa las mi ltung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the end, it is the complete possession, because it does not fall away from the attainment.

original: brgya byin gnas skabs byas pa'i phyir nye bar mtshon pa'i le'u ni brgya byin gyi le'u ste gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: brgya byin gnas skabs byas pa'i phyir nye bar mtshon pa'i le'u ni brgya byin gyi le'u ste gnyis pa'o /

analyzed: // / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor der lha'i bu zhes bya ba nas brtsams te bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par byed pa ni /
