original: de'i rjes la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di la mthong ba'i chos @74a * //🔽la myong bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan gyi phan yon ni bsod nams mang po skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyang bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di la mthong ba'i chos @74a * //🔽la myong bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan gyi phan yon ni bsod nams mang po skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyang bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhūti, the devaputra Suvikrāntavikrāmin has come here in order to hear the perfection of wisdom taught.🔽Subhūti, the devaputra Suvikrāntavikrāmin has come

original: 'khor 'di la ni gang zhig lha'i bu rnams 'dus pa de rnams kha cig ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don thos pa phan yon mthong ba de rnams /
analyzed: 'khor 'di la ni gang zhig lha'i bu rnams 'dus pa de rnams kha cig ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don thos pa phan yon mthong ba de rnams /
translated: In this retinue, some of the sons of the gods who have gathered here, having seen the benefits of hearing the meaning of the perfection of wisdom from previous buddhas,

original: slar yang chos kyi gus pas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don thos pa'i don du 'khor gyi nang du nye bar 'ongs te /
analyzed: slar yang chos kyi gus pas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don thos pa'i don du 'khor gyi nang du nye bar 'ongs te /
translated: again, out of respect for the dharma, have come into the retinue in order to hear the meaning of the perfection of wisdom from the Bhagavān Śākyamuni.

original: de nas sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzung ba la sogs pa byas par gyur pa de rnams ni phan yon mthong ba dbang por byas pa ste /
analyzed: de nas sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzung ba la sogs pa byas par gyur pa de rnams ni phan yon mthong ba dbang por byas pa ste /
translated: Then, those who have previously taken up the perfection of wisdom from the buddhas and so on, having seen the benefits, are made the foremost.

original: don rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan rnams la bka' stsal pa bstan pa la gtso bo nyid kyi phyir brgya byin gyi ming gzung ba'o //
analyzed: don rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan rnams la bka' stsal pa bstan pa la gtso bo nyid kyi phyir brgya byin gyi ming gzung ba'o //
translated: Because they themselves have realized the meaning, they are addressed by the Teacher, and because they are foremost in teaching, they are addressed by the name Śatakratu.

original: rigs kyi bu'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skyes pa'am bud med dag gzung ba ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skyes pa'am bud med dag gzung ba ste /
translated: The phrase son or daughter of good family and so on refers to men and women.

original: rtogs pa la sogs pa la skal pa nyid kyis gtso bo nyid kyi phyir gzhan rnams la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'am gyi don no //
analyzed: rtogs pa la sogs pa la skal pa nyid kyis gtso bo nyid kyi phyir gzhan rnams la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'am gyi don no //
translated: The phrase not to others means that it is not for those who are not destined for realization and so on, because of their lack of the principal cause.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zhes bya ba ni sngar gsungs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang lam shes pa nyid la sogs pa ston par byed pa'i yum gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zhes bya ba ni sngar gsungs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang lam shes pa nyid la sogs pa ston par byed pa'i yum gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The phrase this perfection of wisdom refers to the mother who teaches the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of paths, and so on, as previously mentioned.

original: 'dzin tam zhes bya ba la 'dzin pa ni kha ton du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin tam zhes bya ba la 'dzin pa ni kha ton du byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase to take up means to recite.

original: 'chang ba ni po ti la gnas pa la mchod pa dang bkur sti la sogs pas gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'chang ba ni po ti la gnas pa la mchod pa dang bkur sti la sogs pas gzhag pa'o //
translated: The phrase to bear in mind means to keep it in mind by means of worship, respect, and so on, as it is written in books.

original: klog pa ni po ti la sogs par gnas pa la 'don pa'o //
analyzed: klog pa ni po ti la sogs par gnas pa la 'don pa'o //
translated: The phrase to read means to recite it as it is written in books and so on.

original: kun chub par byed pa ni bzung nas gang zhig 'di la bsam pa 'dir ni 'di'i don yin 'di ni dgongs pa yin zhes bya ba ni kun chub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun chub par byed pa ni bzung nas gang zhig 'di la bsam pa 'dir ni 'di'i don yin 'di ni dgongs pa yin zhes bya ba ni kun chub par byed pa'o //
translated: One masters it by retaining it, and then by thinking, This is the meaning of this text, this is what he intended to say, one masters it.

original: rab tu 'don pa ni gzhung dang don dag bzung nas snod du gyur pa gzhan la gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'don pa ni gzhung dang don dag bzung nas snod du gyur pa gzhan la gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: One recites it by retaining the text and the meaning, and by elucidating it for others who are suitable vessels.

original: bdud ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i bu ste rang bzhin nyid kyis dge ba la bar chad byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdud ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i bu ste rang bzhin nyid kyis dge ba la bar chad byed pa'o //
translated: The demons are the sons of the gods of the Paranirmita-vasavartin realm, who naturally create obstacles to virtue.

original: glags ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa la gegs byed pa'i don du go skabs tshol ba'o //
analyzed: glags ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa la gegs byed pa'i don du go skabs tshol ba'o //
translated: The opportunities are the occasions for creating obstacles to the retention of the text and meaning, and to the elucidation of them for others.

original: de tshol ba ni ma 'ongs pa na rjes su tshol ba dang da ltar byung ba la lta ba'o //
analyzed: de tshol ba ni ma 'ongs pa na rjes su tshol ba dang da ltar byung ba la lta ba'o //
translated: One seeks them by seeking them in the future, and by observing them in the present.

original: mi ma yin pa ni gnod sbyin la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa ni gnod sbyin la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The non-humans are the yakshas and so on.

original: yang ba ni g-yang du ltung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang ba ni g-yang du ltung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The precipitous places are the precipices of falling and so on.

original: de ma spangs pa ni yongs @74b su gtong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ma spangs pa ni yongs @74b su gtong ba ma yin no //
translated: One does not abandon them by not giving them up.

original: tshe yod kyang yang ba ma spangs pas kyang 'chi ba yin te dper na mar nag la sogs pa yod kyang mar me 'bar ba rlung gis 'chi ba yin no //
analyzed: tshe yod kyang yang ba ma spangs pas kyang 'chi ba yin te dper na mar nag la sogs pa yod kyang mar me 'bar ba rlung gis 'chi ba yin no //
translated: Even if one has a life span, one dies because one does not avoid what is harmful, just as, for example, a burning lamp is extinguished by the wind even if there is oil.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bar chad med pa gcig pur ma zad kyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bar chad med pa gcig pur ma zad kyi /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is not only uninterrupted,

original: sems can mchog nye bar gnas pa nyid kyis mtshams la rab tu gnas pa dang ldan pa'i lha rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzung ba la sogs pa'i don du rang nyid kyis 'jug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir
analyzed: sems can mchog nye bar gnas pa nyid kyis mtshams la rab tu gnas pa dang ldan pa'i lha rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzung ba la sogs pa'i don du rang nyid kyis 'jug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir
translated: but also the gods who are situated at the boundaries, who are endowed with the presence of the highest beings, approach the bodhisattva who is engaged in taking up the perfection of wisdom, etc., for the sake of

original: zhes bstan par byed pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bstan par byed pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: indicating this, he says, moreover, etc.

original: 'di ni bshad ma thag pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa gcig pur ma zad kyi skrag pa la sogs pa sel ba'i rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bshad ma thag pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa gcig pur ma zad kyi skrag pa la sogs pa sel ba'i rgyu yang yin no //
translated: This is not only endowed with the qualities just explained, but is also the cause of dispelling fear, etc.

original: 'jig rten na grags pa'i 'jigs pa'i gnas de dang de rnams la rnam pa thams cad du 'jigs pa med pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na grags pa'i 'jigs pa'i gnas de dang de rnams la rnam pa thams cad du 'jigs pa med pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The reason why he is not at all afraid of all the fearful things that are renowned in the world is stated in the line “Moreover, he has no fear in any situation.

original: dgon par song ba ni grong las gzhu 'dom lnga brgya las 'das pa'i gnas shing drung ba rnams dang rtsva dang shing gel pa la sogs pa rnams kyis khyab pa ni dgon pa'o //
analyzed: dgon par song ba ni grong las gzhu 'dom lnga brgya las 'das pa'i gnas shing drung ba rnams dang rtsva dang shing gel pa la sogs pa rnams kyis khyab pa ni dgon pa'o //
translated: “Having gone to the wilderness” means that he has gone to a place that is more than five hundred bow-lengths from a village, a place that is filled with trees, grass, and thickets.

original: bla gab med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa med pa'i sa phyogs ni bla gab med pa'o //
analyzed: bla gab med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa med pa'i sa phyogs ni bla gab med pa'o //
translated: “In the open air” means in a place that is not covered.

original: 'jigs pa ni mi 'dod pa dang phrad pa'i dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni mi 'dod pa dang phrad pa'i dogs pa'o //
translated: “Fear” is the apprehension of encountering something undesirable.

original: rengs par 'gyur ba ni dgos pa'i gnyen po bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rengs par 'gyur ba ni dgos pa'i gnyen po bsgrub pa'o //
translated: “Paralysis” is the inability to accomplish what needs to be done.

original: 'gyur ba nyid ni rgyun gyis rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ba mi skye zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'gyur ba nyid ni rgyun gyis rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ba mi skye zhes 'brel to //
translated: “Change” means that the continuity of engagement does not arise.

original: bsrung ba ni bskyab pa dang bcas pa la sba ba ni bsrung ba dang bskyab pa dang sbo pa'o //
analyzed: bsrung ba ni bskyab pa dang bcas pa la sba ba ni bsrung ba dang bskyab pa dang sbo pa'o //
translated: “Protection” is the guarding of those who are unprotected. “Shelter” is the guarding, protecting, and sheltering of those who are unprotected.

original: bsrung ba ni lus kyi bde ba thams cad nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: bsrung ba ni lus kyi bde ba thams cad nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: Protection is the gathering of all bodily happiness.

original: bskyab pa ni phyi rol gyi 'jigs pa sel par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bskyab pa ni phyi rol gyi 'jigs pa sel par byed pa'o //
translated: Rescue is the removal of external fears.

original: sba ba ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi nad la sogs pa sel ba'o //
analyzed: sba ba ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi nad la sogs pa sel ba'o //
translated: Concealment is the removal of internal diseases, etc.

original: yang na bsrung ba ni sngags la sogs pas so //
analyzed: yang na bsrung ba ni sngags la sogs pas so //
translated: Alternatively, protection is by means of mantras, etc.

original: bskyab pa ni srung byed nges par sbyar bas so //
analyzed: bskyab pa ni srung byed nges par sbyar bas so //
translated: Rescue is by means of the application of a protector.

original: sba ba ni rang nyid kyis song ste de la byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: sba ba ni rang nyid kyis song ste de la byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: Concealment is by means of one's own going and the blessing of that.

original: bgyi ba ni yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bgyi ba ni yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Performance is the correct application.

original: 'di ni bdud 'jug pa mi rnyed pa dang / dus ma yin par shi ba med pa dang / 'jigs pa la sogs pa mi bskyed pa dang / lha rnams las bsrung ba zhes bya ba'i phan yon rnam pa bzhi'o//
analyzed: 'di ni bdud 'jug pa mi rnyed pa dang / dus ma yin par shi ba med pa dang / 'jigs pa la sogs pa mi bskyed pa dang / lha rnams las bsrung ba zhes bya ba'i phan yon rnam pa bzhi'o//
translated: This is the fourfold benefit of the gods, namely, the non-discovery of the entry of Mara, the absence of untimely death, the non-arising of fear, etc., and the protection from the gods.

original: @75a * // 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba'i rjes la bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: @75a * // 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba'i rjes la bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar to //
translated: After he said this, the Bhagavat said, Wonderful!

original: de nas ji srid theg pa gsum gyis sems can rnams 'dul bar byed cing sems can gyi 'du shes kyang mi bskyed pa ni zhes bya ba'i 'don pa mthong ste /
analyzed: de nas ji srid theg pa gsum gyis sems can rnams 'dul bar byed cing sems can gyi 'du shes kyang mi bskyed pa ni zhes bya ba'i 'don pa mthong ste /
translated: Then, as long as one tames sentient beings through the three vehicles, one does not generate the notion of sentient beings.

original: 'di ni sngon gyi po ti rnams la med do //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon gyi po ti rnams la med do //
translated: This reading is not found in the earlier texts.

original: 'don pa de bshad pa po rnams kyis ma bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa sbyar ba la chags pa rnams kyis btags pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'don pa de bshad pa po rnams kyis ma bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa sbyar ba la chags pa rnams kyis btags pa nyid de /
translated: The explanation of this reading is that it is a fabrication of those attached to the application of the term realization, since it is not explained by the expounders.

original: rtsa ba'i don gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dang theg pa gsum la sems can rnams 'dul ba la skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i don gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dang theg pa gsum la sems can rnams 'dul ba la skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows the meaning of the root text and because there is no opportunity to tame sentient beings through the three vehicles.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni bdud mi 'jug pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni bdud mi 'jug pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: These refers to the above such as the maras not entering.

original: mthong ba'i chos la zhes bya ba la mthong ba'i chos ni thob pa'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la zhes bya ba la mthong ba'i chos ni thob pa'i skye ba'o //
translated: With regard to the phrase in this very life, this very life is the birth of attainment.

original: de la 'byung ba rnams nges par 'thob pa ste thog mar de rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba rnams nges par 'thob pa ste thog mar de rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The occurrence of these is definitely attained, because one first obtains them.

original: yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ni rgyun gyis de dag mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ni rgyun gyis de dag mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of their non-abandonment because it is the cause of their non-interruption.

original: yang na snga ma'i tshig 'og mas gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: yang na snga ma'i tshig 'og mas gsal bar byed de /
translated: Or else, the latter phrase clarifies the former:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po bzung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan du na phan yon 'di tsam gyis yang dag par 'byung ba ji ltar yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po bzung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan du na phan yon 'di tsam gyis yang dag par 'byung ba ji ltar yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: One becomes possessed of the six perfections means that one becomes possessed of the benefit that arises from them.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yang dag par bsdu bar byed pa gcig pur ma zad kyi rtsod pa med pa yang yin zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yang dag par bsdu bar byed pa gcig pur ma zad kyi rtsod pa med pa yang yin zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Not only does one become possessed of the collection of all the perfections, but also one becomes free of disputes. The Blessed One has said that one also becomes free of disputes, as stated in the following:

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtsod pa med pa mchog nyid mthong ba'i chos kyi yon tan nyid kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtsod pa med pa mchog nyid mthong ba'i chos kyi yon tan nyid kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Here, one who is free of disputes and so on. He has said that the quality of being free of disputes is the highest quality of the visible Dharma.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos so //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos so //
translated: Dharma refers to the Dharma that is taught.

original: 'dir gtso bo yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gtso bo yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, it is the teaching of the perfection of wisdom that is foremost.

original: rtsod pa ni phan tshun smras pa'i skyon mi bzod pa'o //🔽rtsod pa'i gnas la phan tshun du log par rtog pa du mas rgol ba ni rgal ba'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa ni phan tshun smras pa'i skyon mi bzod pa'o // rtsod pa'i gnas la phan tshun du log par rtog pa du mas rgol ba ni rgal ba'o //
translated: Quarrel is the mutual intolerance of the faults that are spoken.🔽Disputation is the mutual argumentation about the bases of quarrel through many wrong ideas.

original: 'gal ba ni gcig gis smras pa'i don la phyin ci log gi don so sor nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni gcig gis smras pa'i don la phyin ci log gi don so sor nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: Contradiction is the mutual establishment of the opposite of the meaning that is spoken by one.

original: slar nub pa nyid du 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni dus ring por sgrub pa dang 'gal ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar nub pa nyid du 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni dus ring por sgrub pa dang 'gal ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be a falling away means that it will be a contradiction for a long time.

original: bsam pa ni rtsod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni rtsod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: Thought is the thought of quarrel, etc.

original: de ni 'di ltar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni chos nyid 'di kho na yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni chos nyid 'di kho na yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is like this means this is the very nature of things.

original: nye bar sdud par byed pa ni 'di dag kyang zhes bya ba la @75b sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar sdud par byed pa ni 'di dag kyang zhes bya ba la @75b sogs pa ste /
translated: The summary is these, etc.

original: sngar gsungs pa gcig pur ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa gcig pur ma yin no //
translated: It is not just the one previously mentioned.

original: 'dzin pa la sogs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la sogs pa bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of grasping, etc. is finished.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dag 'gal ba'i don rnam par phye ste bshad pa ni bstan pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dag 'gal ba'i don rnam par phye ste bshad pa ni bstan pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i don du'o //
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the perfection of wisdom, which is the differentiation of the meaning of non-contradiction, is for the sake of teaching, meditation, etc.

original: nye bar ston pa ni gdams ngag sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar ston pa ni gdams ngag sbyin pa'o //
translated: Instruction is the bestowal of advice.

original: lung 'bogs pa ni rgyas pa las ston nas mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lung 'bogs pa ni rgyas pa las ston nas mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: Transmission is the teaching in brief after teaching in detail.

original: kha ton du byed pa ni 'don pa'i yum gcig bu ngag gis yongs su rgyal par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kha ton du byed pa ni 'don pa'i yum gcig bu ngag gis yongs su rgyal par byed pa'o //
translated: Recitation is the complete victory by means of the single mother of recitation.

original: gsungs pa'i don rtsi ma ghi'i dpes gsal bar byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa'i don rtsi ma ghi'i dpes gsal bar byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The elucidation of the meaning of the statement by the example of the myrobalan fruit is as follows.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: For example, etc.

original: rtsi zhes bya ba ni sman las byung ba'i mthu 'di la yang dag par 'dzin pas na rtsi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsi zhes bya ba ni sman las byung ba'i mthu 'di la yang dag par 'dzin pas na rtsi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The myrobalan fruit is so called because it is held to be the power that arises from the medicine.

original: da dha te ni 'dzin pa'i khams la kim gyi rkyen no //
analyzed: da dha te ni 'dzin pa'i khams la kim gyi rkyen no //
translated: The suffix -ta is the condition of the affix -ki.

original: 'di ni rigs yin te de bas na rtsi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs yin te de bas na rtsi'o //
translated: This is the class, therefore it is the myrobalan fruit.

original: rigs ma yin zhes bya bas aa na mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rigs ma yin zhes bya bas aa na mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The word 'not' is not used.

original: 'di yang mo rtags yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang mo rtags yin no //
translated: This is also a feminine ending.

original: de'i phyir kri di k'a r'a dakti na zhes bya bas rib kyi rkyen gyis brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kri di k'a r'a dakti na zhes bya bas rib kyi rkyen gyis brtags pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called aśīviṣa, because it is imagined to be a snake with a poisonous bite.

original: aa shi ni sbrul gyi mche ba'o //
analyzed: aa shi ni sbrul gyi mche ba'o //
translated: Aśī means “snake”; viṣa means “poison.”

original: de la dug 'di la yod pa de'i phyir aa shi bi sha ste mche ba la dug yod pa'i sbrul lo //
analyzed: de la dug 'di la yod pa de'i phyir aa shi bi sha ste mche ba la dug yod pa'i sbrul lo //
translated: Since this poison exists in it, it is called aśīviṣa, a snake with a poisonous bite.

original: skye bo ni lus can no //
analyzed: skye bo ni lus can no //
translated: A creature is a living being.

original: bkres shing zhes bya ba'i tshig ni de nyid la nges par nye bar khyab pa'i rgyu yod kyang nye bar bya ba pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bkres shing zhes bya ba'i tshig ni de nyid la nges par nye bar khyab pa'i rgyu yod kyang nye bar bya ba pa med pa ste /
translated: The word “hungry” means that although the cause of the definite pervasion of that [hunger] exists, the action is not performed.

original: rtsi'i dri'i mthus zhes bya ba bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: rtsi'i dri'i mthus zhes bya ba bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The word “because of the power of the smell of the medicine” is taught for that purpose.

original: srog chags su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro'i bye brag go //
analyzed: srog chags su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro'i bye brag go //
translated: A living being means a particular animal.

original: phyogs su 'brang zhing zhes bya ba ni sems kyis bza' ba'i bdag nyid du byas pas phyogs su 'brang ba ni lus kyi steng du rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs su 'brang zhing zhes bya ba ni sems kyis bza' ba'i bdag nyid du byas pas phyogs su 'brang ba ni lus kyi steng du rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: “Wandering around” means that it follows the body by being made into the self of food by the mind.

original: phyir ldog go zhes bya ba ni log par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyir ldog go zhes bya ba ni log par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Turns back” means it turns away.

original: sman gyi yon tan de zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir nor bu dang / sngags dang / sman rnams kyi mthu ni bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sman gyi yon tan de zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir nor bu dang / sngags dang / sman rnams kyi mthu ni bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the words “the power of the jewel, mantra, and medicine” is that the power of the jewel, mantra, and medicine is inconceivable.

original: dug de zil gyis gnon pa ni mche ba la dug yod pa'i sprul gyi gzi brjid ni dug kho na ste /
analyzed: dug de zil gyis gnon pa ni mche ba la dug yod pa'i sprul gyi gzi brjid ni dug kho na ste /
translated: The meaning of “overpowering poison” is that the splendor of a snake with poison in its fangs is poison itself.

original: de zil gyis gnon pa la cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i bdag nyid du 'dod par byed cing log par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de zil gyis gnon pa la cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i bdag nyid du 'dod par byed cing log par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should understand that it is powerless to overpower the jewel, mantra, or medicine.

original: rang gi ngo bo la sbyar bar byed pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽gzi brjid dang zhes bya ba ni mthus so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la sbyar bar byed pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / gzi brjid dang zhes bya ba ni mthus so //
translated: The meaning of “applying to one’s own nature” is as follows.🔽“Splendor” means power.

original: stobs dang zhes bya ba ni gnod par @76a * //🔽byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: stobs dang zhes bya ba ni gnod par @76a * // byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: “Strength” means the ability to harm.

original: mthu dang zhes bya ba ni gnod par byas pa ma yin pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mthu dang zhes bya ba ni gnod par byas pa ma yin pa nyid kyis so //
translated: “Power” means the ability not to be harmed.

original: stobs bskyed pas zhes bya ba ni de dang ldan pa la nus pa bskyed pas so //
analyzed: stobs bskyed pas zhes bya ba ni de dang ldan pa la nus pa bskyed pas so //
translated: “Power generation” means the ability to generate power in those who possess it.

original: med par 'gyur ba ni dus de nyid du rab tu zhi ba'o //
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba ni dus de nyid du rab tu zhi ba'o //
translated: “Disappearance” means complete pacification at that very time.

original: nye bar zhi ba ni dus gzhan du mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba ni dus gzhan du mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: “Complete pacification” means not engaging in anything else.

original: nub par 'gyur ba ni sems kyi log pa'o //
analyzed: nub par 'gyur ba ni sems kyi log pa'o //
translated: “Setting” means the cessation of the mind.🔽Here, the quality of the perfection of protection is applied to the meaning of the perfection of qualities.

original: 'dir ni yon tan tshang ba'i don du bsrung ba phun sum tshogs pa'i yon tan la sbyar bar byed pa ni rgyal po chen po bzhi dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni yon tan tshang ba'i don du bsrung ba phun sum tshogs pa'i yon tan la sbyar bar byed pa ni rgyal po chen po bzhi dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “The four great kings” and so on.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ste /
translated: “All the Blessed Buddhas and all the Bodhisattvas” is recited by some.

original: de ni sngon gyi po ti rnams la mi snang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni sngon gyi po ti rnams la mi snang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It does not appear in the old manuscripts.

original: sangs rgyas rnams las bsrung ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba chen po rnams las bshad pa mthong nas btags pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams las bsrung ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba chen po rnams las bshad pa mthong nas btags pa'o //
translated: “Protection and so on from the Buddhas” is imputed after seeing the explanation in the Mahāvastu.

original: sgrub pa ni rtsod pa med pa gcig pur ma zad kyi skyon med pa'i tshig kyang yin zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni rtsod pa med pa gcig pur ma zad kyi skyon med pa'i tshig kyang yin zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Accomplishment” is not only non-disputation, but also faultless speech. This is stated by “Furthermore” and so on.

original: de'i tshig gzung bar 'os zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bden pa nyid kyis so //🔽tshig ran par zhes bya ba ni tshig mi rtsub pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de'i tshig gzung bar 'os zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bden pa nyid kyis so // tshig ran par zhes bya ba ni tshig mi rtsub pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The phrase his words are worth taking up and so on is because of truthfulness.🔽The phrase his words are moderate is because of not being harsh.

original: tshig 'jam pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtsub pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: tshig 'jam pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtsub pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The phrase his words are gentle is because of not being harsh.

original: tshig 'chal pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ngag 'khyal pa med pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: tshig 'chal pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ngag 'khyal pa med pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The phrase his words are not frivolous is because of not being idle.

original: 'di ni rnam pa bzhi skyon med pa'i tshig gi yon tan bde bas sems can yongs su smin pa'i don du yang dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa bzhi skyon med pa'i tshig gi yon tan bde bas sems can yongs su smin pa'i don du yang dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the fourfold excellence of speech, which is faultless, pleasant, and conducive to the maturation of sentient beings.

original: slar yang sgrub pa 'di la khong khro ba dang nga rgyal nyid rnam par bral ba'i rgyu nyid bstan par byad pa ni /
analyzed: slar yang sgrub pa 'di la khong khro ba dang nga rgyal nyid rnam par bral ba'i rgyu nyid bstan par byad pa ni /
translated: Again, in order to demonstrate the cause of being free from anger and pride in this practice,

original: khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang rnam par bral ba la rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi dbang gis gong nas gang du rab tu yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang rnam par bral ba la rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi dbang gis gong nas gang du rab tu yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: he says, because of being free from anger and pride, one is able to manifest the benefit of self and other.

original: zil gyis gnon par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: One does not overcome them and so on.

original: gnod pa byed pa'i rgyu so sor nye bar gnas pa la khong khro ba las byung ba'i sems kyis 'joms pa ni khong khro ba la 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba la yang dag par brten pas sems kyi mthong ba ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa'i rgyu so sor nye bar gnas pa la khong khro ba las byung ba'i sems kyis 'joms pa ni khong khro ba la 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba la yang dag par brten pas sems kyi mthong ba ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: The destruction of the cause of harm by the mind that arises from anger is pride, because the mind that sees the perishable composite is based on the view of the perishable composite.

original: gtso bo byang chub sems dpa'i chos gnod par byed pa nyid kyis thog ma nyid du rab tu spang bya nyid kyi phyir 'di @76b dag gzung ba'o //
analyzed: gtso bo byang chub sems dpa'i chos gnod par byed pa nyid kyis thog ma nyid du rab tu spang bya nyid kyi phyir 'di @76b dag gzung ba'o //
translated: These are to be taken up because they are the foremost Dharma of the bodhisattvas, to be abandoned first of all because they are harmful.

original: 'di tsam ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos yin no //🔽'di lta ste snying rje dang shes rab bo //
analyzed: 'di tsam ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos yin no // 'di lta ste snying rje dang shes rab bo //
translated: This much is the Dharma of the bodhisattvas.🔽It is compassion and wisdom.

original: de la khong khro ba ni snying rje dang 'gal te nga rgyal ni shes rab la'o //
analyzed: de la khong khro ba ni snying rje dang 'gal te nga rgyal ni shes rab la'o //
translated: Among them, anger is contrary to compassion, and pride is contrary to wisdom.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can la shes rab kyi rnam par dag pa med ces bya ba gsungs pas so //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can la shes rab kyi rnam par dag pa med ces bya ba gsungs pas so //
translated: It is said, One who is full of pride has no pure wisdom.

original: 'di thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid las zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa sngon du 'gro bas gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid las zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa sngon du 'gro bas gsungs pa /
translated: All of this is stated with the intention of the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: yongs su dul bar byed pa dang yongs su 'dud par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i dmigs pa'i spyad pa byang chub sems dpa' yongs su dul bar mi byed /
analyzed: yongs su dul bar byed pa dang yongs su 'dud par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i dmigs pa'i spyad pa byang chub sems dpa' yongs su dul bar mi byed /
translated: The phrase “to thoroughly tame and to thoroughly bow” means that the bodhisattva does not thoroughly tame the mundane practice of reference points.

original: thabs la mi mkhas pa yang mthon por 'gro ba'i phyir yongs su 'dud par mi byed de /
analyzed: thabs la mi mkhas pa yang mthon por 'gro ba'i phyir yongs su 'dud par mi byed de /
translated: Nor does he thoroughly bow because he is not skilled in means and goes to high status.

original: mi dmigs pa'i spyod pa la spyod par byed cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad du 'dul ba'i phyir yongs su 'dul bar byed de /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i spyod pa la spyod par byed cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad du 'dul ba'i phyir yongs su 'dul bar byed de /
translated: He practices the practice of nonreference points and thoroughly tames this perfection of wisdom in every way.

original: mthon por 'gro ba med pa'i phyir yongs su 'dud par byed do //
analyzed: mthon por 'gro ba med pa'i phyir yongs su 'dud par byed do //
translated: He thoroughly bows because he does not go to high status.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' de khong khro ba la 'phel bar mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' de khong khro ba la 'phel bar mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva does not increase anger, etc.

original: khro ba las gong du bdag la 'dis gnod par byas pa zhes bya ba'i khon du 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bsam pa 'di mi gtong bar rgyun gyis 'jug pa ni kho na du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: khro ba las gong du bdag la 'dis gnod par byas pa zhes bya ba'i khon du 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bsam pa 'di mi gtong bar rgyun gyis 'jug pa ni kho na du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Resentment is the non-abandonment of the attitude of the self-notion “he has harmed me” which is based on anger and continues in a series.

original: gnod sems ni sems can la rnam par sdang ba'o //
analyzed: gnod sems ni sems can la rnam par sdang ba'o //
translated: Malice is the hatred of sentient beings.

original: bag la nyal ni de las gzhan gyi sems la yongs su 'gro ba khro ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: bag la nyal ni de las gzhan gyi sems la yongs su 'gro ba khro ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i sa bon no //
translated: Dormant tendency is the seed of anger, etc. which goes into the other mind.

original: 'dir ni 'khor dang bcas pa'i khro ba dang nga rgyal dag las rnam par rgyal ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'khor dang bcas pa'i khro ba dang nga rgyal dag las rnam par rgyal ba gsungs so //
translated: Here, victory over anger and pride along with their retinue is taught.

original: khro ba la sogs pa rnams la zhi bar byed pa gcig pur ma zad kyi de'i gnyen por yang nye bar gzhag pa byed pa gsungs pa ni de ltar spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khro ba la sogs pa rnams la zhi bar byed pa gcig pur ma zad kyi de'i gnyen por yang nye bar gzhag pa byed pa gsungs pa ni de ltar spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is not only the pacification of anger, etc. but also the establishment of their antidote that is taught: “Thus, the bodhisattva who is engaged in the practice of the perfection of patience should think: ‘Anger is my enemy, not the one who is angry. ’”

original: de la dran pa gsungs pa ni de 'di snyam du sems te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la dran pa gsungs pa ni de 'di snyam du sems te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement of mindfulness is “He thinks thus” and so on.

original: dbang po rnams zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams sam dad pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dbang po rnams zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams sam dad pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The faculties are the eye and so on, or faith and so on.

original: 'khrug pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Agitation is disturbance.

original: bzhin gyi mdog kyang 'gyur ba ni dha hi zhes bya ba'i khams kyi sbyor ba'o //🔽de'i phyir 'di ni mthong ba'i chos la nyes dmigs sems can thams cad kyi don @77a * //
analyzed: bzhin gyi mdog kyang 'gyur ba ni dha hi zhes bya ba'i khams kyi sbyor ba'o // de'i phyir 'di ni mthong ba'i chos la nyes dmigs sems can thams cad kyi don @77a * //
translated: A change in facial expression is the application of the element dhahi.

original: gyi bya ba dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gyi bya ba dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the intention: “This is the danger in the present life, which is contrary to the welfare of all sentient beings.”

original: byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa'i bdag la 'dis 'os pa ma yin zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa'i bdag la 'dis 'os pa ma yin zhes gsungs pa /
translated: He says that this is not proper for one who has set out for enlightenment.

original: 'di ni mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “I do not observe this” and so on.

original: bla na med pa yang dag pa'i byang chub la 'jug pa dran pa la yang thams cad kyi rnam pa kun gyi phan pa dang / bde ba nye bar bsdus pa'i bsam pa'i mtshan nyid byams pa'i yon tan gyis yang dag par 'byung ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag pa'i byang chub la 'jug pa dran pa la yang thams cad kyi rnam pa kun gyi phan pa dang / bde ba nye bar bsdus pa'i bsam pa'i mtshan nyid byams pa'i yon tan gyis yang dag par 'byung ba gsungs so //
translated: The quality of love, which is characterized by the thought of benefit and happiness for all sentient beings in every way, is said to be the cause of entering into unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'di lta bu'i rnam pa'i phan yon thos pas ngo mtshar ba thob pa brgya byin sngar gsungs pa nyid kyi don nye bar bstan par byed de /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rnam pa'i phan yon thos pas ngo mtshar ba thob pa brgya byin sngar gsungs pa nyid kyi don nye bar bstan par byed de /
translated: Having attained wonder through hearing the benefits of this kind of practice, Śakra teaches the meaning of what was previously stated:

original: bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Bhagavān, it is amazing!”

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “How?” means “what?”

original: yongs su dul ba dang khengs pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i dmigs pa'i spyod pa la spyod cing chos gnyis po 'di yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su dul ba dang khengs pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i dmigs pa'i spyod pa la spyod cing chos gnyis po 'di yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: “Fully disciplined and without pride” means that these two qualities do not exist for one who engages in worldly, objectified conduct.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la de'i stobs nyid kyis gnyi ga yang med ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la de'i stobs nyid kyis gnyi ga yang med ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is that, by the power of that, both do not exist in the practice of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The benefits are stated by the Lord:🔽Moreover, Subhūti, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva,

original: phan yon gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: phan yon gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: who has newly set out in the vehicle, hears this deep perfection of wisdom and

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: if he is not frightened, is not fearful, does not become terrified,🔽if he hears this deep perfection of wisdom, and if he learns it, masters it, reads it out loud, and properly pays attention to it,🔽then, Subhūti, that bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as one who has trained for a long time under good spiritual friends,

original: g-yul du thog mar zhugs par gyur na zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du mtshon cha 'phangs pa'i dus su mdun du 'gro ba'i sa la'o //
analyzed: g-yul du thog mar zhugs par gyur na zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du mtshon cha 'phangs pa'i dus su mdun du 'gro ba'i sa la'o //
translated: who has trained in the perfection of giving,🔽who has trained in the perfection of morality,🔽who has trained in the perfection of patience,

original: gnas ma yin zhes bya ba ste snga ma'i tshig gsal bar byed pa ni go skabs med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas ma yin zhes bya ba ste snga ma'i tshig gsal bar byed pa ni go skabs med ces bya ba'o //
translated: who has trained in the perfection of perseverance,🔽who has trained in the perfection of concentration,🔽and who has trained in the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba nye bar bstan pa'i don du'o //🔽de srog gi bar chad du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba de ni gzhan gyi phyir gzhan gyis 'phangs pa'i mtshon cha lus la phog pas so //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba nye bar bstan pa'i don du'o //🔽de srog gi bar chad du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba de ni gzhan gyi phyir gzhan gyis 'phangs pa'i mtshon cha lus la phog pas so //
translated: Why is that? Subhūti, it is because that bodhisattva mahāsattva has trained in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, it is because that bodhisattva mahāsattva has trained in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, it is because that bodhisattva mahāsattva has trained in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, it is because that bodhisattva mahāsattva has trained in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, it is because that bodhisattva mahāsattva has trained in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, it is because that bodhisattva mahāsattva has trained in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, it is because that bodhisattva mahāsattva has trained in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, it is because that bodhisattva mahāsattva has trained in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, it is because that bodhisattva mahāsattva has trained in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, it is because that bodhisattva mahāsattva has trained in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, it is because that bodhisattva mahāsattva has trained in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, it is because that bodhisattva mahāsattva has trained in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, it is because that bodhisattva mahāsattva has trained in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhū

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa byed pas zhes bya ba ni gang zhig de nyid la srog gi bar chad byed pa'i gzhan gyi gnod pa ste des so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa byed pas zhes bya ba ni gang zhig de nyid la srog gi bar chad byed pa'i gzhan gyi gnod pa ste des so //
translated: By the harm of others means by the harm of others that interrupts life itself.

original: 'dir rgyu gsungs pa ni gal te de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu gsungs pa ni gal te de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the reason is stated: if he thinks thus, etc.

original: de zhes bya ba ni phog pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni phog pa'o //
translated: He means the one who is struck.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: lan ni rig sngags chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lan ni rig sngags chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The answer is: the great spell, etc.

original: dus thams cad du yul thams cad la mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams la thogs pa med pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir rim pa ji lta bar chen mo dang tshad ma med pa dang tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du yul thams cad la mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams la thogs pa med pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir rim pa ji lta bar chen mo dang tshad ma med pa dang tshad med pa'o //
translated: Because it has the power to be unobstructed at all times and in all places with regard to adverse factors, it is, in order, great, immeasurable, and infinite.

original: bla na med pa ni de las lhag @77b pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa ni de las lhag @77b pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unsurpassed because there is nothing higher than it.

original: mnyam pa med pa ni mnyam pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽mnyam pas mnyam pa ni mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa ni mnyam pa med pa'i phyir ro // mnyam pas mnyam pa ni mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: It is unequaled because it has no equal.🔽It is equal to the equal because it is equal to the equal.

original: cung zad nyung ba mo nyid kyi phyir mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad nyung ba mo nyid kyi phyir mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: It is equal to the unequal because it is equal to the unequal.

original: de yang med pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de yang med pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: And because that also does not exist, it is equal to the unequal.

original: tshad med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni sngon gyi po ti rnams la ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshad med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni sngon gyi po ti rnams la ma mthong ngo //
translated: The three phrases beginning with “immeasurable” are not seen in the earlier editions.

original: bdag la gnod pa ni nye bar 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la gnod pa ni nye bar 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Harm to oneself is injury.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams dang gnyi ga la ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams dang gnyi ga la ste /
translated: Similarly, to others and to both.

original: de'i don du sems par byed pa ni ma yin pas sems ni bya ba mi byed de nye bar 'tshe ba la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la rang dang gzhan la sdug bsngal byed pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas kyang khro ba la sogs pa rnams nye bar zhi ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pa dang sems can rnams la phan pa'i rgyu yin zhes
analyzed: de'i don du sems par byed pa ni ma yin pas sems ni bya ba mi byed de nye bar 'tshe ba la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la rang dang gzhan la sdug bsngal byed pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas kyang khro ba la sogs pa rnams nye bar zhi ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pa dang sems can rnams la phan pa'i rgyu yin zhes
translated: The mind does not perform actions, because it is not seen to be the cause of injury, and because it is seen to cause suffering to oneself and others. And because the perfection of wisdom pacifies anger, etc., it is the cause of the knowledge of all modes and the cause of benefit to beings.

original: bstan pa ni 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa ni 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The teaching of this is stated by “Here, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom, etc.”

original: ma lus pa'i dngos po shes pa ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: ma lus pa'i dngos po shes pa ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: The knowledge of all things is perfect enlightenment.

original: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni dngos su'o //
analyzed: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni dngos su'o //
translated: “Correctly” means directly.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba ni tha snyad las tha dad pa ste dngos po la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba ni tha snyad las tha dad pa ste dngos po la ni ma yin no //
translated: “Perfect enlightenment” and “knowledge of all things” are synonyms, not different things.

original: rnam par lta bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dul ba la sogs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: rnam par lta bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dul ba la sogs pa'i don du'o //
translated: “One sees” means one sees in the sense of taming, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Why is that?

original: de zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis mdzad pa de la cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis mdzad pa de la cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: “That” refers to the activity of the knowledge of all things. There is nothing whatsoever that exists there.

original: gang zhig thob pa ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig thob pa ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is not attained?

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thams cad ni thob par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thams cad ni thob par bya ba ste /
translated: Because all the qualities of a Buddha are to be attained.

original: de rnams kyang so sor rang gis rig par bya ba de bas na gal te 'dis thob par ma gyur na 'di ni thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang so sor rang gis rig par bya ba de bas na gal te 'dis thob par ma gyur na 'di ni thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are to be individually cognized by him, if he did not obtain them, he would not be omniscient.

original: de'i phyir de cung zad yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de cung zad yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, they do not exist in the least,

original: gang zhig 'dis thob par ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dis thob par ma gyur pa'o //
translated: since he did not obtain them.

original: de'i phyir thob pa dang gzhan thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad yod pa ma yin te gang zhig 'dis mkhyen par ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thob pa dang gzhan thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad yod pa ma yin te gang zhig 'dis mkhyen par ma gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, “obtainment” and “omniscience” do not exist in the least, since he did not cognize them.

original: blo gros rab kyi mngon du bya ba'i ye shes 'dir ni gzung bar bya ste de'i phyir de cung zad yod pa ma yin gang zhig mngon du ma byas par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //🔽'am gyi sgra rnams ni phan tshun ltos pas rtogs pa'i don la'o //
analyzed: blo gros rab kyi mngon du bya ba'i ye shes 'dir ni gzung bar bya ste de'i phyir de cung zad yod pa ma yin gang zhig mngon du ma byas par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o // 'am gyi sgra rnams ni phan tshun ltos pas rtogs pa'i don la'o //
translated: The wisdom that is the object of the highest cognition should be understood here, therefore, they do not exist in the least, since he did not actualize them.
The words “or” indicate that the meaning is to be understood in terms of mutual dependence.

original: phyir 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa ste de'i ye shes ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: phyir 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa ste de'i ye shes ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Therefore, he is omniscient, and his wisdom is the wisdom of the omniscient one.

original: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pa dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa'i rgyu yin pa'o //🔽de lta na yang gang zhig mthong ba'i chos kyi yon tan 'di brjod pa de rigs pa kho na yin no zhes nye bar bsdu bar byed pa ni 'di yang zhes bya ba la /🔽bdag la gnod pa bya bar yang mi sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mthong ba'i chos kyi yon tan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pa dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa'i rgyu yin pa'o // de lta na yang gang zhig mthong ba'i chos kyi yon tan 'di brjod pa de rigs pa kho na yin no zhes nye bar bsdu bar byed pa ni 'di yang zhes bya ba la / bdag la gnod pa bya bar yang mi sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mthong ba'i chos kyi yon tan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This shows that the practice of the perfection of wisdom is the cause of the knowledge of all modes, and the cause of the benefit of all beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang sa phyogs byin gyis brlabs pa yang dag par srid pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang sa phyogs byin gyis brlabs pa yang dag par srid pa ste /
translated: And yet, it is quite reasonable to proclaim the virtues of the Dharma that is seen. This is the summing up: “And this perfection of wisdom is the consecration of the place where it is,

original: sa phyogs ni rnam pa gnyis las gcig ni po ti la sogs pa'i rten no //
analyzed: sa phyogs ni rnam pa gnyis las gcig ni po ti la sogs pa'i rten no //
translated: the place is of two kinds: one is the support of the book, etc.,

original: gzhan ni bzung bar gyur pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni bzung bar gyur pa la'o //
translated: the other is the place where it is taken up,

original: ji srid kha ton byed par 'gyur ba la'o //
analyzed: ji srid kha ton byed par 'gyur ba la'o //
translated: and where it is recited.

original: de la dang po gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la dang po gsungs pa /
translated: Of these, the first is stated:

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, etc.

original: chung du na zhes bya ba ni mchog 'grib pa la'o //
analyzed: chung du na zhes bya ba ni mchog 'grib pa la'o //
translated: Even a little, etc.🔽Having done this first, etc.

original: sngon du byas te zhes bya ba ni gzhag pa'i dus su mchod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngon du byas te zhes bya ba ni gzhag pa'i dus su mchod pa gsungs pa /
translated: Having made offerings at the time of placement,

original: bkur stir byed la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bkur stir byed la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: he should honor them.

original: bzhag nas ni 'og tu'o //
analyzed: bzhag nas ni 'og tu'o //
translated: Having placed them, he should do it later.

original: 'ga' zhig bkur stir mi byed la zhes 'don te bzhag nas ni 'og tu'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig bkur stir mi byed la zhes 'don te bzhag nas ni 'og tu'o //
translated: Some read “he should not honor them,” but it should be placed later.

original: bkur stir mi byed la zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bkur stir mi byed la zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o //
translated: “He should not honor them” is explained.

original: glags zhes bya ba ni skabs sam go 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: glags zhes bya ba ni skabs sam go 'byed pa'o //
translated: An opportunity is a chance or an opening.

original: gtogs par zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du byas pa sngon gyi skye ba las gzhan gyi rnam grangs rig par bya ba rnam par smin pa nges pa mi dge ba'i las de'i rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gtogs par zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du byas pa sngon gyi skye ba las gzhan gyi rnam grangs rig par bya ba rnam par smin pa nges pa mi dge ba'i las de'i rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Belonging to is being externalized. The synonyms of former birth should be understood. The result of the maturation of that nonvirtuous karma is an undesirable result.

original: bkur stir byed pa de tsam yang yon tan 'di lta bu'i sa phyogs der gang zhig yang gzung ba la sogs pa yang rten de byang chub kyi snying po dang 'dra ba 'di nyid zhes ston par byed pa ni 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba ste
analyzed: bkur stir byed pa de tsam yang yon tan 'di lta bu'i sa phyogs der gang zhig yang gzung ba la sogs pa yang rten de byang chub kyi snying po dang 'dra ba 'di nyid zhes ston par byed pa ni 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba ste
translated: The one who is worshipped in that place of such good qualities is shown to be just this as the support of the enlightenment site and so on. It is said, For example...

original: / byang chub kyi snying po na 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni snying po zhes bya ba ste byang chub kyi don du snying po ni byang chub kyi snying po'o //
analyzed: / byang chub kyi snying po na 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni snying po zhes bya ba ste byang chub kyi don du snying po ni byang chub kyi snying po'o //
translated: The enlightenment site is the essence of enlightenment. The essence of enlightenment is the site of enlightenment, because it is the essence for the sake of enlightenment.

original: 'dir 'dug nas byang chub la rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir 'dug nas byang chub la rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the site because enlightenment is realized there.

original: gang du snying po zhe na /
analyzed: gang du snying po zhe na /
translated: Where is the site?

original: gser gyi rang bzhin gyis gzhi la 'di lta ste skye ba'i bskal ba'i thog mar gser gyi rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi sngon du grub pa la de'i snying po rdo'i rang bzhin ka ba @78b rgyar dpag tshad tsam ba gyen du grangs su ma bgrangs pa yang dag
analyzed: gser gyi rang bzhin gyis gzhi la 'di lta ste skye ba'i bskal ba'i thog mar gser gyi rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi sngon du grub pa la de'i snying po rdo'i rang bzhin ka ba @78b rgyar dpag tshad tsam ba gyen du grangs su ma bgrangs pa yang dag
translated: It is said, on the golden ground, meaning that at the beginning of the eon of creation, the golden ground is formed first, and in its essence there is a pillar of stone, a yojana in circumference, rising up, immeasurable in height.

original: par mngon du 'byung ba de 'dzam bu'i gling gi lte ba ste /
analyzed: par mngon du 'byung ba de 'dzam bu'i gling gi lte ba ste /
translated: The place where the Buddha attained enlightenment is the center of Jambudvīpa.

original: de rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi phyir rdo rje zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi phyir rdo rje zhes brjod de /
translated: It is called vajra because it is the nature of vajra.

original: de ni 'dir byang chub kyi snying po'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dir byang chub kyi snying po'o //
translated: That is the site of enlightenment here.

original: rgyar dpag tshad tsam pa bcom ldan 'das kyi skyil krung gis khyab pa tsam sa phyogs kyi tshad ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyar dpag tshad tsam pa bcom ldan 'das kyi skyil krung gis khyab pa tsam sa phyogs kyi tshad ni ma yin te /
translated: It is one yojana in breadth, just the size of the Blessed One’s crossed legs, not the size of the ground.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ma nges pa'i tshad skyil krung gi phyir te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ma nges pa'i tshad skyil krung gi phyir te /
translated: Because the size of the buddhas is not fixed, it is crossed legs.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi mnyam nyid ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi mnyam nyid ni //
translated: The equality of all buddhas

original: sngon gyi mdangs dang tshad kyis min //
analyzed: sngon gyi mdangs dang tshad kyis min //
translated: is not by former radiance or size.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is stated by the verse.

original: 'di nyid kyang rdo rje gdan gyi sgra'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyang rdo rje gdan gyi sgra'i bshad pa'o //
translated: This is also an explanation of the term vajra seat.

original: byang chub kyi snying po la rjod byed med pa'i phyir de bas na snying po ni snying po la brgyan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la rjod byed med pa'i phyir de bas na snying po ni snying po la brgyan pa ste /
translated: Since the site of enlightenment is inexpressible, therefore the essence is adorned with the essence.

original: byang chub nyid kyi sangs rgyas thams cad la de ka nges pa skyed pa snying po ni sa phyogs 'di la de'i phyir byang chub kyi snying po'o //
analyzed: byang chub nyid kyi sangs rgyas thams cad la de ka nges pa skyed pa snying po ni sa phyogs 'di la de'i phyir byang chub kyi snying po'o //
translated: The enlightenment site itself is the enlightenment site because the enlightenment of all Buddhas is generated there.

original: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa ni thob pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa ni thob pa'o //
translated: Sitting at the enlightenment site means to attain it.

original: khor yug tu 'byung bas khor yug ste khor yug gi nang na 'dug pa ni nang na 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: khor yug tu 'byung bas khor yug ste khor yug gi nang na 'dug pa ni nang na 'dug pa'o //
translated: The enclosure is the outer rim, and sitting within the enclosure means sitting inside.

original: nang ni dbus so //
analyzed: nang ni dbus so //
translated: Inside means in the middle.

original: byang chub kyi don du shing ni byang chub kyi shing ngo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi don du shing ni byang chub kyi shing ngo //
translated: The tree for the sake of enlightenment is the enlightenment tree.

original: de'i rtsa bar zhugs nas byang chub rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rtsa bar zhugs nas byang chub rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he entered its root and realized enlightenment.

original: de'i rtsa ba ni rtsa bas mngon par zhen pa yangs su bcad pa'i sa phyogs te der 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba ni rtsa bas mngon par zhen pa yangs su bcad pa'i sa phyogs te der 'dug pa'o //
translated: Its root is the site of the cutting off of attachment to the root, and he sat there.

original: gal te yang byang chub kyi shing gi rtsa ba yang byang chub kyi snying po yin pa de lta na yang mchog nyid du grags pa'i phyir so sor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gal te yang byang chub kyi shing gi rtsa ba yang byang chub kyi snying po yin pa de lta na yang mchog nyid du grags pa'i phyir so sor bstan pa'o //
translated: Even if the root of the enlightenment tree is the enlightenment site, it is taught separately because it is renowned as the supreme.

original: dang gi sgra rnams ni phan tshun du ltos pas rnam par rtog pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: dang gi sgra rnams ni phan tshun du ltos pas rnam par rtog pa'i don du'o //
translated: The words “and so on” are for the sake of conceptualization, since they are mutually dependent.

original: gtse ba 'am zhes bya ba ni mtshon la sogs pas rdeg pa sbyin pas rnam par 'tshe bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gtse ba 'am zhes bya ba ni mtshon la sogs pas rdeg pa sbyin pas rnam par 'tshe bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Harm” means to inflict harm by giving a weapon, etc.

original: gnod par bya ba ni nges par gsod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba ni nges par gsod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “To be harmed” means to be killed.

original: 'bebs par byed pa ni 'byung po dang sha za la sogs pa rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir mi nus so zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: 'bebs par byed pa ni 'byung po dang sha za la sogs pa rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir mi nus so zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: “To be frightened” is connected with “because of the entry of bhūtas, piśācas, etc.”

original: 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po nyid kyi phyir 'jigs pa med pa dang 'khon med pa dang mi skrag pa byams pa chen po zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa rab tu bsgom pa yin zhes bya ba la sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po nyid kyi phyir 'jigs pa med pa dang 'khon med pa dang mi skrag pa byams pa chen po zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa rab tu bsgom pa yin zhes bya ba la sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: “Fearlessness, absence of hostility, and absence of fright” are the great friendliness, because they are the antidotes to fear, etc.

original: rab tu ston par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams la de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu ston par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams la de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “To teach” means to teach it to others.

original: bye ba phrag sum cu @79a * //
analyzed: bye ba phrag sum cu @79a * //
translated: Thirty koṭis of

original: rtsa gsum gyi 'khor dang mtshon cha sna tshogs pa dang dbyig pas rdeg pa la sogs pas rdeg pa'i bdud la mtshon cha phog pa 'bras bu med pa'i phyir te ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: rtsa gsum gyi 'khor dang mtshon cha sna tshogs pa dang dbyig pas rdeg pa la sogs pas rdeg pa'i bdud la mtshon cha phog pa 'bras bu med pa'i phyir te ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: The demons who beat him with the wheels, weapons, and clubs of the three psychic channels and so on are ineffective in striking him with their weapons, as stated in the scriptures.

original: byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par zhugs pa la mtshon chas lus la tshugs pa ma yin zhes bya ba rgyas par ro //
analyzed: byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par zhugs pa la mtshon chas lus la tshugs pa ma yin zhes bya ba rgyas par ro //
translated: “One who enters the samadhof love is not struck by weapons.”

original: don ni 'di yin te gang zhig byams pa'i rang bzhin gyi sku dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams phyogs gang zhig mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs par mdzad pa der gnas pa'i srog chags rnams ni gzhan🔽rnams kyis gtse bar mi nus so //
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te gang zhig byams pa'i rang bzhin gyi sku dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams phyogs gang zhig mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs par mdzad pa der gnas pa'i srog chags rnams ni gzhan rnams kyis gtse bar mi nus so //
translated: The meaning is this: Beings dwelling in the direction where the Blessed Buddhas, who possess bodies of the nature of love, have attained manifest, complete enlightenment and so on, are blessed by them and cannot be harmed by others.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid kyis byams pa bsgom pa la rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan 'di yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid kyis byams pa bsgom pa la rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore this is the quality concordant with the cause of cultivating love by the Tathagatas themselves.

analyzed: phyag bya ba ni lus la sogs pas phyag btsal ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ri mor bya ba ni skor ba la sogs pa byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya ba ni gzhan rnams la yang phrag dog la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral bar byas shing mchod pa la sogs pa skul bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should serve them, by being free from the faults of envy, etc., and by encouraging others to make offerings, etc.

original: bkur stir bya ba ni khyad par can gyi gdugs dang rgyal mtshan la sogs pa rab tu gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkur stir bya ba ni khyad par can gyi gdugs dang rgyal mtshan la sogs pa rab tu gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should respect them, by establishing special canopies, banners, etc.

original: bla mar bya ba ni bla ma bzhin du phan yon du bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bla mar bya ba ni bla ma bzhin du phan yon du bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: One should esteem them, by esteeming them as one does one’s own teacher.

original: skyob pa ni rang nyid kyis gzhag pa skyong bar byed pas skyob pa'o //
analyzed: skyob pa ni rang nyid kyis gzhag pa skyong bar byed pas skyob pa'o //
translated: One should protect them, by protecting what they have established.

original: skyabs ni khas len @79b pa la 'jigs pa thos pas na skyabs pas so //
analyzed: skyabs ni khas len @79b pa la 'jigs pa thos pas na skyabs pas so //
translated: One should take refuge in them, by taking refuge in them when one hears of the fear of a vow’s transgression.

original: gnas ni mi 'jigs shing las kun las 'brel bas na gnas so //
analyzed: gnas ni mi 'jigs shing las kun las 'brel bas na gnas so //
translated: The place is the abode, because it is the abode of all actions and their relationships.

original: dpung gnyen ni mchog tu 'gro bas na dpung gnyen no //
analyzed: dpung gnyen ni mchog tu 'gro bas na dpung gnyen no //
translated: The protector is the protector, because it is the protector of the highest.

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skus rab tu gang ba'i mchod rten gyi mchod pa bas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchod pa nyid la bsod nams lhag pa nyid de /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skus rab tu gang ba'i mchod rten gyi mchod pa bas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchod pa nyid la bsod nams lhag pa nyid de /
translated: Now, the worship of the perfection of wisdom is superior to the worship of a stupa filled with the relics of the Tathagata.

original: de'i rgyu brgya byin gyis zhus pa la bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan par byed pa ni de skad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu brgya byin gyis zhus pa la bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan par byed pa ni de skad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The reason for that is taught by the Lord in the Questions of Sakra chapter, beginning with the words:

original: bris nas zhes bya ba ni rang gi lag gis sam gzhan 'dri mkhan rnams la yon byin nas so //
analyzed: bris nas zhes bya ba ni rang gi lag gis sam gzhan 'dri mkhan rnams la yon byin nas so //
translated: Having written it, with one's own hand or having given wages to others who write it.

original: glegs bam du chud par bgyis te zhes bya ba ste snga ma'i don ni phyi mas mngon par gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: glegs bam du chud par bgyis te zhes bya ba ste snga ma'i don ni phyi mas mngon par gsal bar byed do //
translated: Having made it into a book, the meaning of the former is clarified by the latter.

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni 'am gyi sgra 'don pa yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni 'am gyi sgra 'don pa yin te /
translated: In some places the word or is used,

original: der gzhan bskul bar byas nas bris pa glegs bam du chud par bgyis pa'o //
analyzed: der gzhan bskul bar byas nas bris pa glegs bam du chud par bgyis pa'o //
translated: and there it is written after having urged others to do so, and it is made into a book.

original: lha zhes bya ba ni rang gi rigs la ltos pas mchog tu gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba ni rang gi rigs la ltos pas mchog tu gyur pa rnams so //
translated: The term “god” is used in reference to one’s own class, and so it is the highest.

original: lha rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi po ti rnams la 'don pa'o //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi po ti rnams la 'don pa'o //
translated: The reading in the old manuscripts is “by the gods.”

original: de la dang por spyir nye bar bstan pa brjod par 'dod la bud med nyid kyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang por spyir nye bar bstan pa brjod par 'dod la bud med nyid kyis bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, first, the general offering is stated, and then the offering by women.

original: me tog ni sil ma'i me tog rnams so //
analyzed: me tog ni sil ma'i me tog rnams so //
translated: Flowers are loose flowers.

original: dri ni dri'i shing rnams so //
analyzed: dri ni dri'i shing rnams so //
translated: Incense is incense trees.

original: phreng ba ni me tog gi phreng ba rnams so //
analyzed: phreng ba ni me tog gi phreng ba rnams so //
translated: Garlands are flower garlands.

original: byug pa ni dri'i byug pa rnams so //
analyzed: byug pa ni dri'i byug pa rnams so //
translated: Perfume is fragrant perfume.

original: phye ma ni aa ga ru dang tsandan la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: phye ma ni aa ga ru dang tsandan la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Powder is of agarwood, sandalwood, and so on.

original: na bza' ni gos rnams so //
analyzed: na bza' ni gos rnams so //
translated: Clothes are garments.

original: mchod pa ni lha bshos la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mchod pa ni lha bshos la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Worship is of food offerings and so on.

original: rnam pa mang po dag ni sna tshogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa mang po dag ni sna tshogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: With many kinds is with various kinds.

original: me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa dang zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa dang zhes 'brel to //
translated: It is connected with “worship with flowers and so on.”

original: ji ltar mchod par bya zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar mchod par bya zhes gsungs pa /
translated: How should one worship? It is stated:

original: bkur stir bgyis pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bkur stir bgyis pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Having honored them” and so on.

original: bkur sti dang rjed pa sngon du 'gro bas mchod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bkur sti dang rjed pa sngon du 'gro bas mchod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should make offerings to them, preceded by respect and reverence.

original: de la bkur sti ni seng ge'i khri la sogs pa la bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la bkur sti ni seng ge'i khri la sogs pa la bskyed pa'o //
translated: Therein, respect is to place them on a lion throne and so on.

original: bla mar byed pa ni gus pa'o //
analyzed: bla mar byed pa ni gus pa'o //
translated: Honoring them is to revere them.

original: rjed pa ni yon tan rjes su dran pa sngon du 'gro bas lan mang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjed pa ni yon tan rjes su dran pa sngon du 'gro bas lan mang bar byed pa'o //
translated: Reverence is to make offerings to them many times, preceded by recollection of their good qualities.

original: ri mor bgyis pa ni mchog gi mchod pa'o //
analyzed: ri mor bgyis pa ni mchog gi mchod pa'o //
translated: Making images of them is to make the supreme offerings.

original: bsnyen bkur bgyis na ni gzhan rnams kyis kyang de byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bgyis na ni gzhan rnams kyis kyang de byed pa'o //
translated: Serving them is to cause others to do so.

original: sku dag ni ring bsrel rnams @80a * //
analyzed: sku dag ni ring bsrel rnams @80a * //
translated: Their bodies are their relics.

original: so // sems can mang po phan par byed pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas til tsam du dbye bar byas nas gtsug tor dang 'gram pa gnyis dang mche ba bzhi spangs nas so //
analyzed: so // sems can mang po phan par byed pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas til tsam du dbye bar byas nas gtsug tor dang 'gram pa gnyis dang mche ba bzhi spangs nas so //
translated: The Blessed One Shakyamuni, for the sake of benefiting many beings, divided them into particles the size of sesame seeds, excluding the ushnisha, the two sides, and the four eyeteeth.

original: mchod rten gyi nang du ni mchod rten rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: mchod rten gyi nang du ni mchod rten rnams kyi'o //
translated: In stupas are the relics of stupas.

original: stsal te zhes bya ba ni gzhag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: stsal te zhes bya ba ni gzhag par bya ba'o //
translated: “Having placed” means having set it down.

original: yongs su 'dzin cing zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la mchod par bya ba nyid kyis bdag tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin cing zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la mchod par bya ba nyid kyis bdag tu byed pa'o //
translated: “Having taken possession of” means having made it one’s own by the act of worshipping it.

original: 'chang la zhes bya ba ni za ma tog la sogs pa byas nas gzhug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chang la zhes bya ba ni za ma tog la sogs pa byas nas gzhug par bya ba'o //
translated: “Having held it” means having put it in a box, etc.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i po ti bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i po ti bzhin du'o //
translated: “In the same way” means like the book of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “For that reason” and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis brgya byin nyid la phar dri ba mdzad pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis brgya byin nyid la phar dri ba mdzad pa /
translated: The Blessed One, having asked Śatakratu himself,🔽taught this in order to make clear that the worship of the perfection of wisdom is good by the nature of being the cause of omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu'i ngo bos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de mchod pa nyid legs pa zhes gsal ba 'di bstan pa'i don du brgya byin dang des 'dul bar bya ba rnams la yang dag par dga' ba bskyed pa'i don du
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu'i ngo bos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de mchod pa nyid legs pa zhes gsal ba 'di bstan pa'i don du brgya byin dang des 'dul bar bya ba rnams la yang dag par dga' ba bskyed pa'i don du
translated: In order to generate true joy in Śatakratu and those to be disciplined by him,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he said this.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bdag gi dngos po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bdag gi dngos po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The nature of the self is omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni bdag gi dngos po'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni bdag gi dngos po'o //
translated: Omniscience is the nature of the self.

original: bdag gi dngos po gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin gshegs pa zhes grangs su 'gro ba mngon par grub pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin gshegs pa zhes grangs su 'gro ba mngon par grub pa'o //
translated: By the nature of the self, the Tathagata is called a Tathagata.🔽On which path?

original: lam gang zhig la zhes bya ba ni lam la'o //
analyzed: lam gang zhig la zhes bya ba ni lam la'o //
translated: On the path.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di ni slar gang yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di ni slar gang yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is the fruit of omniscience?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: It is unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba la brnyes pa'i don gang yin zhe na gsungs pa /
