analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba la brnyes pa'i don gang yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is the meaning of the word “attain”?

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is “fully and perfectly realize”.

original: sngon gyi po ti rnams la ni bdag gi dngos po grub pa zhes 'don pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi po ti rnams la ni bdag gi dngos po grub pa zhes 'don pa yin te /
translated: In the old translations, it is “the nature of the self is accomplished”.

original: de yang bdag gi dngos po ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bdag gi dngos po ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: The nature of the self is to be known as omniscience.

original: 'di nyid la zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid la'o /
analyzed: 'di nyid la zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid la'o /
translated: Here is in this very [Perfection of Wisdom].

original: de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nges pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir 'di'i po ti mchod pa yang de las gzhan pa'i mchod pa rnams las bla na med pa'i bsod nams bskyed pa'i rgyu yin zhes bstan par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nges pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir 'di'i po ti mchod pa yang de las gzhan pa'i mchod pa rnams las bla na med pa'i bsod nams bskyed pa'i rgyu yin zhes bstan par byed pa ni /
translated: Thus, because it is the very cause of the knowledge of all aspects, it is shown that even the worship of its book generates the highest merit, more than any other worship.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore... and so on.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'di khyed @80b la sogs pa thams cad kyi mngon sum gyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'di khyed @80b la sogs pa thams cad kyi mngon sum gyi spyod yul lo //
translated: This is that which is the domain of experience of all of you and so on.

original: bdag gi dngos po yang yin la bdag tu rab tu brtags pa'i phyir sku yang yin te gzugs kyi sku'o //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po yang yin la bdag tu rab tu brtags pa'i phyir sku yang yin te gzugs kyi sku'o //
translated: It is a body because it is a real entity and a self, and it is a form body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'gro'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'gro'o //
translated: The Tathagata goes.

original: ci zhig 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig 'gro zhe na /
translated: Where does he go?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni grangs de bgrang ba mtshan dang dpe byed kyis 'bar ba'i sku tsam yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba la yang de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni grangs de bgrang ba mtshan dang dpe byed kyis 'bar ba'i sku tsam yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba la yang de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is that the term “tathāgata” would apply to a universal monarch, since he is the source of a body that is radiant with the major and minor marks.

original: skabs kyi don dang rjes su mthun par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gtso bo nyid du sbyar zhing gsungs pa gang yin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: skabs kyi don dang rjes su mthun par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gtso bo nyid du sbyar zhing gsungs pa gang yin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning with “This perfection of wisdom, which is the chief of all perfections” is stated in accordance with the topic at hand.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the ultimate, which is characterized by the nonapprehension of all phenomena.

original: thabs la mkhas pa yang sems can gyi don la ltos pas byang chub kyi sems dang byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa kun rdzob pa de dag las byung ba yod cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rten du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa yang sems can gyi don la ltos pas byang chub kyi sems dang byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa kun rdzob pa de dag las byung ba yod cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rten du 'gyur ro //
translated: Skill in means also exists, since it arises from the conventional, such as the thought of awakening, love, and compassion, which are dependent on the welfare of sentient beings, and it serves as the basis for the gnosis of omniscience.

original: gal te yang chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid don dam par thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te de yang don dam pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku nyid de /
analyzed: gal te yang chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid don dam par thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te de yang don dam pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku nyid de /
translated: Moreover, the gnosis of omniscience, which is characterized by the realization of the emptiness of all phenomena, is the ultimate. And that is the Dharma Body of the Tathagatas.

original: de la brten pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i rang bzhin gzugs kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i rang bzhin gzugs kyi sku'o //
translated: The Form Body, which is the nature of the Enjoyment Body and the Emanation Body, is based on that.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /🔽rang don gzhan don dam pa sku dang ni //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa / rang don gzhan don dam pa sku dang ni //
translated: As it is said:🔽The ultimate body for one’s own benefit

original: de la brten pa'i kun rdzob sku nyid de //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i kun rdzob sku nyid de //
translated: and the relative body based on that.

original: zhes bya'o // ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i rtogs pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi sku thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rten zhes brjod sdo //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i rtogs pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi sku thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rten zhes brjod sdo //
translated: Just as the mundane realizations are said to be the basis of the Form Body, the gnosis of omniscience is the basis of the Form Body.

original: rten 'di la brten nas ni zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i gzugs kyi sku nye bar ston par byed pa ni 'jig rten pa'i rtogs pa pa ni rab tu 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rten 'di la brten nas ni zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i gzugs kyi sku nye bar ston par byed pa ni 'jig rten pa'i rtogs pa pa ni rab tu 'byed pa'o //
translated: “Based on this” refers to the Form Body that is taught, which is the mundane realizations that are distinguished.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rab tu 'byed pas sangs rgyas kyi sku ni zhes rab tu 'byed pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rab tu 'byed pas sangs rgyas kyi sku ni zhes rab tu 'byed pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The body of the Dharma and the body of the Saṅgha are also distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.🔽The summary is stated from “thus” on.🔽The body of the Buddha is distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.

original: ji ltar chos dang dge 'dun dag gi sku ste rang bzhin la'o //
analyzed: ji ltar chos dang dge 'dun dag gi sku ste rang bzhin la'o //
translated: The body of the Dharma and the body of the Saṅgha are also distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.

original: nye bar bsdu bar byed pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu bar byed pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The summary is stated from “thus” on.🔽The body of the Buddha is distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nges /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nges /
translated: The body of the Dharma and the body of the Saṅgha are also distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.🔽The summary is stated from “thus” on.🔽The body of the Buddha is distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.🔽The body of the Dharma and the body of the Saṅgha are also distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.🔽The summary is stated from “thus” on.🔽The body of the Buddha is distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.🔽The body of the Dharma and the body of the Saṅgha are also distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.🔽The summary is stated from “thus” on.🔽The body of the Buddha is distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.🔽The body of the Dharma and the body of the Saṅgha are also distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.🔽The summary is stated from “thus” on.🔽The body of the Buddha is distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.

original: @81a * // par skye ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rgyu gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa la 'dir bdag gis dngos po la dmigs pa zhes rtogs pa /
analyzed: @81a * // par skye ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rgyu gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa la 'dir bdag gis dngos po la dmigs pa zhes rtogs pa /
translated: The body of the Dharma and the body of the Saṅgha are also distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.🔽The summary is stated from “thus” on.

original: 'jig rten la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa la gang gi phyir 'byung ba des na de ltar brjod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa la gang gi phyir 'byung ba des na de ltar brjod do //
translated: The body of the Buddha is distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.🔽The body of the Dharma and the body of the Saṅgha are also distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.🔽The summary is stated from “thus” on.🔽The body of the Buddha is distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.🔽The body of the Dharma and the body of the Saṅgha are also distinguished by the gnosis of omniscience.

original: de'i phyir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam mchod pa nyid legs pa zhes nye bar ston par byed pa ni de bas na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam mchod pa nyid legs pa zhes nye bar ston par byed pa ni de bas na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The summary is

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma mchod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma mchod par byed pa'o //
translated: This very one is the one who worships the Blessed Lady.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mchod par byed pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mchod par byed pa las so //
translated: From that is from the worship of the Tathāgata's body.

original: bsod nams mang ba nyid la yang ji ltar 'dzin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa med pa zhes brgya byin gyi dri ba bstan par byed pa ni de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: bsod nams mang ba nyid la yang ji ltar 'dzin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa med pa zhes brgya byin gyi dri ba bstan par byed pa ni de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: As for the abundance of merit, how is it that there is no engagement in grasping, etc.? This is shown by When this was said, etc.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: As for in this Rose Apple Land, etc.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling du skyes pa'i mi rnams kyi yang dag par 'byung ba ni blo dang brtson 'grus rab nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling du skyes pa'i mi rnams kyi yang dag par 'byung ba ni blo dang brtson 'grus rab nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The arising of the people born in the Rose Apple Land is due to the excellence of their intelligence and diligence.

original: de ltar na yang 'dzin pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa la zhes bya ba ngo mtshar bskyed pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'dzin pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa la zhes bya ba ngo mtshar bskyed pa'i don du'o //
translated: Even so, there is no engagement in grasping, etc. is for the purpose of generating wonder.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci ma 'tshal lags sam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci ma 'tshal lags sam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Blessed One said, What is it, Śatakratu?

original: 'tshal na ni ji ltar mi 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshal na ni ji ltar mi 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: If one does worship, how can one not engage in it? This is the idea.

original: de ltar don chen po ni mchod pa byas par gyur na de ltar don chen por gyur zhes bya bar 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar don chen po ni mchod pa byas par gyur na de ltar don chen por gyur zhes bya bar 'brel ba'o //
translated: Thus, if one does worship, one will attain great benefits. This is the connection.

original: don chen po zhes bya ba ni bdud kyis glags mi rnyed pa dang chags pa med pa la sogs pa dang por gsungs pa'i don bzhi thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don chen po zhes bya ba ni bdud kyis glags mi rnyed pa dang chags pa med pa la sogs pa dang por gsungs pa'i don bzhi thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great benefits means attaining the four goals mentioned earlier, such as not being vulnerable to Mara and being free from attachment, and so on.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po zhes 'don pa la yang don ni 'di nyid do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po zhes 'don pa la yang don ni 'di nyid do //
translated: The reading great magical power also has this meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci phan yon chen po dang ldan par rtogs par ma gyur lags sam zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci phan yon chen po dang ldan par rtogs par ma gyur lags sam zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: The Blessed One said, Do you think that great benefits are not understood?

original: zhes bya ba'i don can gyi be ta ti ni rtogs pa la aet dang bcas pa la yin yang bar ma'i bstan pa mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i mdos aet med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don can gyi be ta ti ni rtogs pa la aet dang bcas pa la yin yang bar ma'i bstan pa mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i mdos aet med pa'o //
translated: The meaning is this. The word vita in the phrase great benefits is used in the sense of to understand, but in the sutra Impermanence of the Middle Teaching, it is used without the e.

original: phan yon chen po dang de ltar 'bras bu chen po dang de ltar rnam par smin pa chen por 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'on te 'tshal cing rtogs la zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: phan yon chen po dang de ltar 'bras bu chen po dang de ltar rnam par smin pa chen por 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'on te 'tshal cing rtogs la zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: Great benefit, great result, great evolutionary development, is the connection with “if he knows and understands.”

original: 'tshal bar byed pas na 'tshal ba ste zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshal bar byed pas na 'tshal ba ste zhes pa'o //
translated: “He knows” is the one who causes that.

original: de byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba la ne tso'o //
analyzed: de byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba la ne tso'o //
translated: “He will do” is the parrot.

original: ma 'tshal zhes @81b bya ba de nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: ma 'tshal zhes @81b bya ba de nyid kyi don to //
translated: “If he does not know” has the same meaning.

original: 'bras bu che ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel dang mchod rten dag la mchod pa yang 'bras bu che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel dang mchod rten dag la mchod pa yang 'bras bu che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Great result is the worship of the relics and stūpas of the Tathāgata, because it has a great result.

original: rnam par smin pa che ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la mchod pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la mchod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa che ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la mchod pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la mchod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Great evolutionary development is the worship of the Buddha, because by worshipping him one worships the knowledge of a Omniscient One.

original: gtso bor sangs rgyas la mchod pa rnam par smin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bor sangs rgyas la mchod pa rnam par smin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The worship of the Buddha is the principal cause of evolutionary development.

original: 'on te 'tshal cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de ltar don chen po zhes 'on te 'tshal lam /
analyzed: 'on te 'tshal cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de ltar don chen po zhes 'on te 'tshal lam /
translated: “If he knows” and so on. “Great benefit” is the same as “great result.”

original: de ltar phan yon che ba zhes 'on te rtogs la'o //
analyzed: de ltar phan yon che ba zhes 'on te rtogs la'o //
translated: Thus, it is of great benefit.

original: de ltar 'bras bu che ba dang de ltar rnam par smin pa che ba zhes rig kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu che ba dang de ltar rnam par smin pa che ba zhes rig kyang ngo //
translated: Thus, it has great results and thus it has great maturation.🔽But I have not gained faith in them.

original: dad par ma gyur pa lags zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo nyid la dus de tsam du shes pa skye ba la the tshom la sogs pa rnams la yang dag par spyod pas sems rnyog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad par ma gyur pa lags zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo nyid la dus de tsam du shes pa skye ba la the tshom la sogs pa rnams la yang dag par spyod pas sems rnyog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the case of ordinary beings, knowledge arises only to that extent. Doubt and so on are due to the defilement of the mind by wrong practice.🔽In the earlier editions, it reads:

original: sngon gyi po ti rnams la bcom ldan 'das de rnams ci ma 'tshal lam 'on te 'tshal yang zhes 'don pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi po ti rnams la bcom ldan 'das de rnams ci ma 'tshal lam 'on te 'tshal yang zhes 'don pa yin te /
translated: Has the Blessed One not known or seen these?🔽At the end, it is just this:

original: tha mar yang de rnams rig pa ma yin 'tshal ba ma yin zhes bya ba 'di tsam mo //
analyzed: tha mar yang de rnams rig pa ma yin 'tshal ba ma yin zhes bya ba 'di tsam mo //
translated: I have not known or seen them.

original: der de ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba zhes 'tshal ba ma yin de ltar phan yon che ba zhes rtogs pa ma yin pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: der de ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba zhes 'tshal ba ma yin de ltar phan yon che ba zhes rtogs pa ma yin pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: There, I have not known them as having such great spiritual powers and I have not realized them as having such great benefits should be applied.

original: dman pa nyid du song ba 'di sems can nyung ba nyid kyi rgyu zhes bstan par mdzad pa ni 'di ci snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: dman pa nyid du song ba 'di sems can nyung ba nyid kyi rgyu zhes bstan par mdzad pa ni 'di ci snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: This is the cause of the small number of sentient beings.

original: rtogs nas dad pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyi dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa de la thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis rigs pas bgrang ba zhes rtogs nas /
analyzed: rtogs nas dad pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyi dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa de la thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis rigs pas bgrang ba zhes rtogs nas /
translated: Having understood, faith is that which is taught in terms of the Buddha, Dharma and Saṅgha, having understood it through the wisdom of listening and the wisdom of reflection, by means of logical reasoning.

original: gang zhig sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams la de ltar 'di rnams yod ces bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'dir rtogs nas dad pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams la de ltar 'di rnams yod ces bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'dir rtogs nas dad pa'o //
translated: That which is said to exist in this way in the Buddha and so on is here faith through understanding.

original: gang zhig bden pa rnams mthong nas the tshom zad de de rtogs nas dad pa de rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gang zhig bden pa rnams mthong nas the tshom zad de de rtogs nas dad pa de rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: That faith through understanding which arises from seeing the truths and the exhaustion of doubt is the fruit of stream-entry.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa ni de nyid 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa ni de nyid 'bras bu'o //
translated: The stream-enterer is the fruit of that.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i yang 'bras bu dang dgra bcom pa'i ngo bo ni dgra bcom pa nyid la 'bras bu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i yang 'bras bu dang dgra bcom pa'i ngo bo ni dgra bcom pa nyid la 'bras bu bzhi pa'o //
translated: The nature of the fruit of once-returner and non-returner and the nature of the arhat are the fourth fruit, i.e. the state of arhatship.

original: bdag nyid gcig pu'i phyir byang chub ni rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub bo //🔽legs pa @82a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig pu'i phyir byang chub ni rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub bo // legs pa @82a * //
translated: Enlightenment for the sake of oneself alone is the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddha.🔽The excellence of the fruit of the universal vehicle is now described.

original: yang dag par 'dod pa rnams la yang dman pa'i 'bras bu rnams la phal che ba nyid nye bar bstan nas theg pa chen po rnams la nyung ba nyid bstan par byed pa ni de dag pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dod pa rnams la yang dman pa'i 'bras bu rnams la phal che ba nyid nye bar bstan nas theg pa chen po rnams la nyung ba nyid bstan par byed pa ni de dag pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having taught the abundance of the inferior fruits for those who aspire to the inferior, he now teaches the paucity of the fruits of the universal vehicle in the passage beginning with: “even in comparison with those...”.

original: rab tu rgyas par byed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yongs su smin pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis goms pas rab tu rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: rab tu rgyas par byed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yongs su smin pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis goms pas rab tu rgyas par byed do //
translated: “It is extended” means that it is extended by the full maturation of the knowledge of all the aspects through the practice of the six perfections.

original: rgyas par byas nas zhes bya ba 'di ni pra la sogs pa dang 'dra ba ste pra la sogs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyas par byas nas zhes bya ba 'di ni pra la sogs pa dang 'dra ba ste pra la sogs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: “Having extended it” is similar to “having extended it” and not to “extension”.

original: rab tu sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin no //
analyzed: rab tu sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin no //
translated: One gives the gift of generosity, etc.

original: des na lya pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: des na lya pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the lyap affix does not occur.

original: nye bar 'phel ba ni zhes bya ba ni kha cig go //
analyzed: nye bar 'phel ba ni zhes bya ba ni kha cig go //
translated: Some say increase.

original: de bzhin du tso ra la sogs pa la g-yul du byed ces bya ba'i 'don pa la nges pa'i don nyid kyi phyir lya pa thob pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tso ra la sogs pa la g-yul du byed ces bya ba'i 'don pa la nges pa'i don nyid kyi phyir lya pa thob pa nyid do //
translated: Similarly, in the recitation one fights in battle, etc., the lyap affix is obtained because of the very definitive meaning.

original: sngon gyi po ti rnams la nye bar 'phel bar byas te zhes bya ba 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi po ti rnams la nye bar 'phel bar byas te zhes bya ba 'don pa yin no //
translated: In the old manuscripts, the recitation is having increased.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams shing zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang kho bo cag gis 'gro ba'i don gyis khur bar bya zhes pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la zhum pa'i sems nyid spangs nas mgo la me 'bar ba dang 'dra pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams shing zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang kho bo cag gis 'gro ba'i don gyis khur bar bya zhes pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la zhum pa'i sems nyid spangs nas mgo la me 'bar ba dang 'dra pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i
translated: Having begun striving, means that having abandoned the very dispiritedness in the six perfections, etc., one engages in them like a head-burning fire, thinking How can I bear the burden of the welfare of the world?

original: phyir ro // rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyir ro // rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Yoga means grasping, etc.

original: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas so //
analyzed: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas so //
translated: Practice means by the practice of a bodhisattva.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir phan pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir phan pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa'o //
translated: The irreversible benefit is the irreversible stage.

original: de dag pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rim gyis so //
analyzed: de dag pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rim gyis so //
translated: The phrase and even more than that and so on.🔽 The phrase will fully awaken to supreme enlightenment refers to the gradual process.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ni nye ba nyid kyi dus la'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ni nye ba nyid kyi dus la'o //
translated: The phrase will fully awaken refers to the immediate process.

original: sngon gyi po ti rnams la ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'don pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi po ti rnams la ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'don pa ma yin te /
translated: In the earlier editions, the phrase will fully awaken to supreme enlightenment is not found.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don rtse gcig pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don rtse gcig pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The phrase in those refers to the single-pointedness of the benefit of others.

original: de rnams las byang chub sems dpa' 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams las byang chub sems dpa' 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase from those refers to the bodhisattvas who arise from those.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub la rtogs pa'i phyir bsam pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub la rtogs pa'i phyir bsam pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The phrase perfection of the superior intention means that the superior intention is the intention to attain enlightenment.

original: de ltar 'di la sgrub pa'i don du rtogs par byed pa rnams kyang de rnams kyi rtogs pa de rnams nyid 'di la @82b bla na med pa nyid bstan nas 'dzin pa dang mchod pa la sogs pa byed ces gsungs pa ni de dag la yang 'dzin du
analyzed: de ltar 'di la sgrub pa'i don du rtogs par byed pa rnams kyang de rnams kyi rtogs pa de rnams nyid 'di la @82b bla na med pa nyid bstan nas 'dzin pa dang mchod pa la sogs pa byed ces gsungs pa ni de dag la yang 'dzin du
translated: Thus, those who realize this for the sake of practice, having been taught the unsurpassedness of those realizations, will uphold, make offerings, and so on.

original: 'jug ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those who are engaged in upholding this, and so on, are said to be those who are engaged in upholding this.

original: slar ni byang chub kyi sems la ltos nas ji skad du gsungs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgrub pa la shin tu rnyed par dka' ba nyid gsungs pa ni yod mod kyi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: slar ni byang chub kyi sems la ltos nas ji skad du gsungs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgrub pa la shin tu rnyed par dka' ba nyid gsungs pa ni yod mod kyi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Again, in dependence on the thought of awakening, it is said that the practice of the perfection of wisdom, as it is taught, is extremely difficult to find. This is stated in although it is said...

original: mnyam pa'i bsam pa dang tshogs dang yang dag par 'byung ba las ji ltar 'ga' zhig nyid ni phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dgos pa sngon du 'gro bas gsungs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa'i bsam pa dang tshogs dang yang dag par 'byung ba las ji ltar 'ga' zhig nyid ni phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dgos pa sngon du 'gro bas gsungs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya ba ste /
translated: With the thought of equality and the assembly, the purpose is stated in why is it that some do not turn back?

original: brtson 'grus zhen pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus zhen pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed par dka' ba'o //
translated: Diligence is said to be difficult to find.

original: gal te yang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa gtso bo yin pa de lta na yang de la gnas pa nges par yang dag pa'i byang chub la gzhol ba zhes bya ba yang dag pa'i byang chub nyid la brtson 'grus zhan pa nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te yang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa gtso bo yin pa de lta na yang de la gnas pa nges par yang dag pa'i byang chub la gzhol ba zhes bya ba yang dag pa'i byang chub nyid la brtson 'grus zhan pa nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Even if the stage of nonretrogression is the principal one, it is said that one who abides in it is not necessarily intent on perfect enlightenment, that is, he is not diligent in perfect enlightenment itself.

original: brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i las la spro ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i las la spro ba'o //
translated: Diligence is enthusiasm for virtuous action.

original: le lo ni las ngan pa byas pa la chags pa'o //
analyzed: le lo ni las ngan pa byas pa la chags pa'o //
translated: Laziness is attachment to bad action.

original: si dva te: zhes bya ba las zhes bya ba'i rkyen de aa ra ba bin da bzhin no //
analyzed: si dva te: zhes bya ba las zhes bya ba'i rkyen de aa ra ba bin da bzhin no //
translated: Siddhattha is a compound of siddha and attha, like aruṇabindu.

original: padma bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: padma bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is “lotus-born.”

original: sems pa ni bstan pa ste sems ni ting nge 'dzin la'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni bstan pa ste sems ni ting nge 'dzin la'o //
translated: Thought is teaching; mind is concentration.

original: 'du shes ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni dran pa'o //
translated: Perception is memory.

original: mos pa ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni dad pa'o //
translated: Interest is faith.

original: shes rab ni de kho na nyid rab tu 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni de kho na nyid rab tu 'byed pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the discernment of reality.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams la nyam chung ba nyid brtson 'grus zhan pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams la nyam chung ba nyid brtson 'grus zhan pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis brjod pa yin no //
translated: The weakness of the faculties of faith, etc., is expressed by the words “lack of diligence,” etc.

original: de la brtson 'grus zhen pa dang le lo can zhes bya bas brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'i'o //🔽sems dman pa dang zhes bya bas ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'i'o //
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus zhen pa dang le lo can zhes bya bas brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'i'o // sems dman pa dang zhes bya bas ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'i'o //
translated: The phrase those who are diligent but are attached and lazy refers to the faculty of effort.🔽The phrase those whose minds are inferior refers to the faculty of meditative absorption.

original: 'du shes dman pa zhes bya bas dran pa'i dbang pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dman pa zhes bya bas dran pa'i dbang pa'i'o //
translated: The phrase those whose ideation is inferior refers to the faculty of mindfulness.

original: mos pa dman pa zhes bya bas dad pa'i dbang po'i'o //
analyzed: mos pa dman pa zhes bya bas dad pa'i dbang po'i'o //
translated: The phrase those whose faith is inferior refers to the faculty of faith.

original: shes rab dman pa zhes bya bas shes rab kyi dbang po'i'o //
analyzed: shes rab dman pa zhes bya bas shes rab kyi dbang po'i'o //
translated: The phrase those whose wisdom is inferior refers to the faculty of wisdom.

original: bsam pa mnyam pas 'jug pa la yang brtson 'grus kyi dbang po la sogs pa yang dag par mi 'byung ba'i phyir thams cad ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa mnyam pas 'jug pa la yang brtson 'grus kyi dbang po la sogs pa yang dag par mi 'byung ba'i phyir thams cad ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The phrase those who are not established in the stage of nonregression is stated with the intention that all of these are not established in the stage of nonregression because the faculties of effort, etc., do not function in those who are engaged in the practice of the perfections with an inferior attitude.

original: de bas na phyir mi ldog pa'i sa dang mnyam pa ji ltar gsungs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgrub pa zhes nye bar byed pa ni de @83a * //
analyzed: de bas na phyir mi ldog pa'i sa dang mnyam pa ji ltar gsungs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgrub pa zhes nye bar byed pa ni de @83a * //
translated: Therefore, the phrase the practice of the perfection of wisdom as it has been described is supplied in the statement the stage that is equivalent to nonregression.

original: bas na zhes bya ba la sogs te /
analyzed: bas na zhes bya ba la sogs te /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: myur du zhes bya ba ni myur bar ro //
analyzed: myur du zhes bya ba ni myur bar ro //
translated: Quickly means swiftly.

original: gal te yang grangs med gsum gyi mthar thug pa la gdon mi za bar 'byung ba nyid de de lta na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sbyor ba las bskal pa rnams la ldog pa yod ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te yang grangs med gsum gyi mthar thug pa la gdon mi za bar 'byung ba nyid de de lta na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sbyor ba las bskal pa rnams la ldog pa yod ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: Even though it is certain that the end of the three incalculable eons occurs, still, with regard to the perfection of wisdom, there is a reversal of the eons, this is the idea.

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni brgya byin 'khor los sgyur ba nyid 'dzin pas kyang tshogs la sogs pa mi ltung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni brgya byin 'khor los sgyur ba nyid 'dzin pas kyang tshogs la sogs pa mi ltung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Happiness means that, even though he is Indra or a universal monarch, he does not fall from the accumulations, etc.

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni 'di nyid la chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis der gling bzhi ba'i myong ba'i gegs dang bral ba nyid kyis myur du bde bar mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni 'di nyid la chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis der gling bzhi ba'i myong ba'i gegs dang bral ba nyid kyis myur du bde bar mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This very means that, in this very life, he quickly attains the happiness of perfect enlightenment, because he is free from the obstacles to the experience of the four continents, due to the fact that all things are not perceived, due to the fact that their nature is nonexistence.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par zhes bya ba ni nyan pa dang thos pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par zhes bya ba ni nyan pa dang thos pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Without interruption means by listening, hearing, etc.

original: yongs su dri ba ni the tshom gcod pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: yongs su dri ba ni the tshom gcod pa'i don du'o //
translated: Questioning is for the purpose of resolving doubts.

original: bdag cag gi ston pa'o zhes shes te bya ba ni ston pa nyid du byas nas nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag cag gi ston pa'o zhes shes te bya ba ni ston pa nyid du byas nas nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of our teacher is that it is the teacher itself that is placed in the foreground by the action of making known.

original: 'di ni bdag gi zhes 'don pa la gtso bor gyur pa'i rtags bzung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi zhes 'don pa la gtso bor gyur pa'i rtags bzung ba'o //
translated: This is the reading of the Sanskrit original, where the word my is the predominant case ending.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba srid pa rnams la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa nyid legs pa yin te yang dag pa'i byang chub gtso bo'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir zhes gsungs pa lta zhog ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba srid pa rnams la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa nyid legs pa yin te yang dag pa'i byang chub gtso bo'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir zhes gsungs pa lta zhog ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is good to practice the perfection of wisdom even for those who have seen the Tathagata, because it is the principal cause of perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba mi srid pa rnams la rin po che'i mchod rten ring bsrel gyi snying po can mchod pas bsod nams mang ba nyid kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'grub pa nyid legs pa yin zhes gsungs pa ni
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba mi srid pa rnams la rin po che'i mchod rten ring bsrel gyi snying po can mchod pas bsod nams mang ba nyid kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'grub pa nyid legs pa yin zhes gsungs pa ni
translated: Let alone, and so on, is stated to show that it is good to practice the perfection of wisdom even for those who have not seen the Tathagata, because of the great merit of worshiping a jeweled stupa containing relics.

original: de bas na de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is stated: Therefore, in that way, etc.

original: mchod rten mchod pas bsod nams mang ba nyid de nor mchog gtong bas so //
analyzed: mchod rten mchod pas bsod nams mang ba nyid de nor mchog gtong bas so //
translated: The merit of worship of a stupa is greater because of the giving of the best wealth.

original: rin po che sna bdun gyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rten che ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rten che ba nyid kyis so //
translated: The nature of the seven jewels is said because of the greatness of the support.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi snying po can zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan che ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi snying po can zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan che ba nyid kyis so //
translated: The essence of the relics of the Tathagata is said because of the greatness of the image.

original: mchod rten rnams zhes bya ba ni dus rab nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mchod rten rnams zhes bya ba ni dus rab nyid kyis so //
translated: The stupas are said because of the greatness of the time.

original: nam 'tsho'i bar du zhes bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba mang ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: nam 'tsho'i bar du zhes bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba mang ba nyid kyis so //
translated: As long as one lives is said because of the greatness of the division.

original: lha'i dril bu dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lha'i dril bu dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The divine bells are said because of the greatness of the sound.

original: de de'i gzhi las zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de de'i gzhi las zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu'o //
translated: That is its basis is said because of the greatness of the cause.

original: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste yang dag par 'khrul pa'i tshig ni bsod nams rgya che ba grub pa'i don @83b du'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste yang dag par 'khrul pa'i tshig ni bsod nams rgya che ba grub pa'i don @83b du'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “Very much!” and so on. The words of error are for the purpose of establishing great merit.

original: mngon par dad pa zhes bya ba ni don chen po yang dag par byung bas so //
analyzed: mngon par dad pa zhes bya ba ni don chen po yang dag par byung bas so //
translated: Complete faith is said because of the arising of the great meaning.

original: de rtog cing zhes bya ba ni bdag 'dir bsgrub par bya zhes khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtog cing zhes bya ba ni bdag 'dir bsgrub par bya zhes khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase reflecting on that means that one accepts the vow, thinking I will accomplish this.🔽 The phrase with superior aspiration means that one turns toward the vow by accepting it with superior faith.

original: lhag par mos la zhes bya ba ni lhag par dad pa khas blangs pas mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag par mos la zhes bya ba ni lhag par dad pa khas blangs pas mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase with a clear mind means that one is free of the turbidity that is adverse to faith and the other virtues.🔽 Moreover, one does not seek another result, but rather, as it is said, having generated the thought of enlightenment.🔽 The phrase with superior intention means that one is endowed with a special effort that is ever more intense.

original: sems dang ba zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnyog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang ba zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnyog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase with a clear mind means that one is free of the turbidity that is adverse to faith and the other virtues.🔽 Moreover, one does not seek another result, but rather, as it is said, having generated the thought of enlightenment.

original: de yang 'bras bu gzhan 'dod pa ma yin te 'on kyang byang chub tu sems bskyed nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu gzhan 'dod pa ma yin te 'on kyang byang chub tu sems bskyed nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase with superior intention means that one is endowed with a special effort that is ever more intense.🔽 The phrase with a clear mind means that one is free of the turbidity that is adverse to faith and the other virtues.🔽 Moreover, one does not seek another result, but rather, as it is said, having generated the thought of enlightenment.🔽 The phrase with superior intention means that one is endowed with a special effort that is ever more intense.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du brtson 'grus kyi khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du brtson 'grus kyi khyad par gyis so //
translated: The phrase with a clear mind means that one is free of the turbidity that is adverse to faith and the other virtues.🔽 Moreover, one does not seek another result, but rather, as it is said, having generated the thought of enlightenment.🔽 The phrase with superior intention means that one is endowed with a special effort that is ever more intense.🔽 The phrase with a clear mind means that one is free of the turbidity that is adverse to faith and the other virtues.🔽 Moreover, one does not seek another result, but rather, as it is said, having generated the thought of enlightenment.🔽 The phrase with superior intention means that one is endowed with a special effort that is ever more intense.

original: yang nas yang du nyan par bya ba la sogs pa nyid kyis so sor brten pa nyid gsungs pa ni nyan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽yid kyi rjes su rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems de mnyam par gzhag pas so //
analyzed: yang nas yang du nyan par bya ba la sogs pa nyid kyis so sor brten pa nyid gsungs pa ni nyan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽yid kyi rjes su rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems de mnyam par gzhag pas so //
translated: The phrase with a clear mind means that one is free of the turbidity that is adverse to faith and the other virtues.🔽 Moreover, one does not seek another result, but rather, as it is said, having generated the thought of

original: ci lta bur grub pa'i shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni gang gis ji lta bu'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pa chung ngu dang 'bring la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis de lta nyid du don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci lta bur grub pa'i shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni gang gis ji lta bu'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pa chung ngu dang 'bring la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis de lta nyid du don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By what kind of wisdom is it accomplished? It is the wisdom that is accomplished in the small, medium, etc., natures, and it is the realization of the object as it is.

original: ji ltar lhag pa zhes 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa yin te de ltar lhag pa ni dad pa la sogs pa yang dag par ldan pa'i shes rab gang zhig de yang ji ltar lhag pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar lhag pa zhes 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa yin te de ltar lhag pa ni dad pa la sogs pa yang dag par ldan pa'i shes rab gang zhig de yang ji ltar lhag pa'o //
translated: As it is said in some recensions, as it is superior, and so on. The wisdom that is superior is the wisdom that is endowed with faith, etc. And it is superior in the way that is described.

original: yongs su dpyod par byed pa ni brtags pa'o //🔽chung du na zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa med kyang ngo //
analyzed: yongs su dpyod par byed pa ni brtags pa'o // chung du na zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa med kyang ngo //
translated: It is thoroughly investigated means it is examined.🔽Even if it is only a little means even if it is not memorized, etc.

original: 'chang ba zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis ma chad par po ti tsam yang ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chang ba zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis ma chad par po ti tsam yang ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is kept means it is not abandoned even as a book, etc.

original: bzhag la zhes bya ba ni gzhan la phan pa'i bsam pas po ti 'ga' zhig la nges par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhag la zhes bya ba ni gzhan la phan pa'i bsam pas po ti 'ga' zhig la nges par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is placed means it is placed in some book, etc., with the intention of benefiting others.

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshul ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshul ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do //
translated: The way of the Buddha is the perfection of wisdom itself, which causes the attainment of the knowledge of all modes.

original: chos kyi tshul zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la yang lam dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi chos thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi tshul zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la yang lam dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi chos thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The recitation called the way of the Dharma is the attainment of the Dharma which has the nature of the path and the result.

original: rgyun chad pa ni 'di'i glegs bam ma tshang ba nyid kyis thos pa la sogs pa yang dag par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa ni 'di'i glegs bam ma tshang ba nyid kyis thos pa la sogs pa yang dag par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The interruption is because of the incompleteness of the scriptures, the correct arising of hearing, etc. does not occur.

original: dam pa'i chos nub pa zhes bya ba ni lung dang rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dam pa'i chos bcom ldan 'das ma chos thams cad kyi gtso bo'am de'i yang dag par mchod pa ni dam @84a * //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nub pa zhes bya ba ni lung dang rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dam pa'i chos bcom ldan 'das ma chos thams cad kyi gtso bo'am de'i yang dag par mchod pa ni dam @84a * //
translated: The disappearance of the true Dharma is the disappearance of the true Dharma which has the nature of the scriptures and realizations. The worship of the Blessed Lady, the foremost of all dharmas, or of that, is the worship of the true Dharma.

original: pa'i chos thams cad nub pa na'o //
analyzed: pa'i chos thams cad nub pa na'o //
translated: When all the true Dharma has disappeared.

original: de bas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gsungs pa'i mchod pa las ji ltar yang rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten mchod pa las bcom ldan 'das ma'i mchod pa la bsod nams mang ba nyid de bzhin du yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'dzam bu gling gi tshad🔽dang gling bzhi pa'i sems can tshad med pa rnams la stong gcig pa'i sems can gyi tshad dang / stong gnyis pa'i sems can gyi tshad dang / stong gsum pa'i sems can gyi tshad dang / stong chen po'i sems can thams cad kyi tshad dang /
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gsungs pa'i mchod pa las ji ltar yang rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten mchod pa las bcom ldan 'das ma'i mchod pa la bsod nams mang ba nyid de bzhin du yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'dzam bu gling gi tshad dang gling bzhi pa'i sems can tshad med pa rnams la stong gcig pa'i sems can gyi tshad dang / stong gnyis pa'i sems can gyi tshad dang / stong gsum pa'i sems can gyi tshad dang / stong chen po'i sems can thams cad kyi tshad dang /
translated: Therefore, as stated, the worship of the Blessed Lady is more meritorious than the worship of the seven precious things of the cakravartin.🔽Similarly, the worship of the Blessed Lady is more meritorious than the worship of stūpas equal to the number of sentient beings in a four-continent world system, a thousand world systems, a million world systems, a billion world systems,

original: sems can thams cad kyi tshad kyi mchod rten rnams mchod pa bas bcom ldan 'das ma'i mchod pa ni bsod nams mang ba nyid de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi tshad kyi mchod rten rnams mchod pa bas bcom ldan 'das ma'i mchod pa ni bsod nams mang ba nyid de /
translated: and all sentient beings in the great trichiliocosm.

original: de bzhin du gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su grub pa'i sems can thams cad kyis so sor rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten rnams byas te mchod pa bas lhag pa'i bsod nams nyid de'i rgyu yang ston cing gsungs🔽pa lta zhog ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su grub pa'i sems can thams cad kyis so sor rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten rnams byas te mchod pa bas lhag pa'i bsod nams nyid de'i rgyu yang ston cing gsungs pa lta zhog ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The merit of that is the cause of the bodhisattvas’ joy.

original: mchod rten zhes bya ba ni ji tsam ste 'dzam bu'i gling khyab pa'o //
analyzed: mchod rten zhes bya ba ni ji tsam ste 'dzam bu'i gling khyab pa'o //
translated: The term stupa refers to the size of Jambudvipa.

original: de nyid ni gling ste 'bras bu che bas 'dzam bu'i shing chen pos mtshon pa nyid kyi phyir 'dzam bu'i gling ngo //
analyzed: de nyid ni gling ste 'bras bu che bas 'dzam bu'i shing chen pos mtshon pa nyid kyi phyir 'dzam bu'i gling ngo //
translated: It is an island because it is characterized by the great jambu tree, which has great fruit.

original: dbus su ri rab rin po che chen po sna bzhi'i rang bzhin dang phyogs bzhi la gling bzhi ste /
analyzed: dbus su ri rab rin po che chen po sna bzhi'i rang bzhin dang phyogs bzhi la gling bzhi ste /
translated: In the center is Mount Meru, which is the nature of the four great precious substances, and in the four directions are the four continents.

original: shar gyi lus 'phags pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling dang / sgra mi snyan dang / ba lang spyod ces bya ba 'di la yod pas gling bzhi pa ste rang gi don la ni rkyen aan no //
analyzed: shar gyi lus 'phags pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling dang / sgra mi snyan dang / ba lang spyod ces bya ba 'di la yod pas gling bzhi pa ste rang gi don la ni rkyen aan no //
translated: The term caturdvīpaka is derived from caturdvīpa, which means “having four continents.”

original: gling bzhi'i stong gi tshad 'di la yod pas na stong spyi phud do //🔽spyi phud dang ldan bas na spyi phud do //🔽stong gnyis kyi tshad 'di la yod pas na stong gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: gling bzhi'i stong gi tshad 'di la yod pas na stong spyi phud do // spyi phud dang ldan bas na spyi phud do // stong gnyis kyi tshad 'di la yod pas na stong gnyis pa ste /
translated: The term sahasracūḍika is derived from sahasra and cūḍika.🔽The term dvisāhasra is derived from dvisāhasra.

original: stong dang stong zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: stong dang stong zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: The term trisāhasra is derived from trisāhasra.

original: de yang bar ma ste /🔽stong dang stong chen po dag gi dbus nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang bar ma ste / stong dang stong chen po dag gi dbus nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the middle universe.

original: stong gsum gyi tshad 'di la yod pas na stong gsum ste /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi tshad 'di la yod pas na stong gsum ste /
translated: It is the middle universe because it is situated between the thousand universes and the great thousand universes.🔽The term trisāhasramahāsāhasra is derived from trisāhasra and mahāsāhasra.

original: stong gnyis pa rnams kyi stong zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de nyid ni stong chen po ste /
analyzed: stong gnyis pa rnams kyi stong zhes bya ba'i don to // de nyid ni stong chen po ste /
translated: The term mahāsāhasra is derived from mahāsāhasra.

original: stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams so //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams so //
translated: It is the great trichiliocosm.

original: 'on kyang de la sems can thams cad ni mi kho nar gyur pa ste sngon ni ma yin /🔽tha ma ni ma yin /
analyzed: 'on kyang de la sems can thams cad ni mi kho nar gyur pa ste sngon ni ma yin / tha ma ni ma yin /
translated: But in that case, all sentient beings would be human beings, not previously, not finally,🔽not later, but all at once.

original: phyis ni ma yin te cig car zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyis ni ma yin te cig car zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the word “simultaneously.”

original: 'dir sems can nyid @84b ni sems can rnams so //
analyzed: 'dir sems can nyid @84b ni sems can rnams so //
translated: Here, “sentient beings” means all sentient beings.

original: sngon mi rnams nyid yongs su brtag pa ste /
analyzed: sngon mi rnams nyid yongs su brtag pa ste /
translated: “Previously” means when they were human beings.

original: rtogs pa nye bar blangs nas bdag tu byas te 'gro ba sna tshogs la sogs pa 'phags par byed pa sna tshogs pa'i las byed pa'i sems can rnams kyi cig car bskal pa'i bar du 'gro ba med par so sor dmigs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa nye bar blangs nas bdag tu byas te 'gro ba sna tshogs la sogs pa 'phags par byed pa sna tshogs pa'i las byed pa'i sems can rnams kyi cig car bskal pa'i bar du 'gro ba med par so sor dmigs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having taken on a conceptualized self, they are the sentient beings who create various actions that lead to various migrations. It is impossible for them to be observed separately without migration for even a moment.

original: bskal pa'am bskal pa bas lhag par zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe bskal ba'i cung zad lhag par gyur na cung zad kyis ma tshang ba bskal pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bskal pa'am bskal pa bas lhag par zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe bskal ba'i cung zad lhag par gyur na cung zad kyis ma tshang ba bskal pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “For an eon or more” means that when it is slightly more than an eon, it is slightly less than an eon. This is the meaning of the word “eon.”

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'di lta bu'i rnam pa'i mchod rten gyi bkur sti byed pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'di lta bu'i rnam pa'i mchod rten gyi bkur sti byed pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: Such an essence means by the essence of such a form of worship, such as the worship of a stupa, etc.

original: bsod nams bya ba ni bsod nams kyi sems pas so //
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba ni bsod nams kyi sems pas so //
translated: The merit-making is by the intention of merit.

original: 'dir ni brgya byin rang gi lhag par mos pa dad pa dang bcas pa gsungs pa ni de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni brgya byin rang gi lhag par mos pa dad pa dang bcas pa gsungs pa ni de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the statement of Śakra's own special faith is from When this was said...

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis zhes bya ba ni tshad las 'das pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis zhes bya ba ni tshad las 'das pa rnams la'o //
translated: By the wisdom of the Buddha refers to those beyond measure.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyis gzhal du med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams yul nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyis gzhal du med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams yul nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the wisdom of the Blessed One is the object of immeasurable world systems.

original: de lta na yang 'dir stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams nye bar bkod pa nyung ba zhes brgya byin nyid kyis gsol pa /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'dir stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams nye bar bkod pa nyung ba zhes brgya byin nyid kyis gsol pa /
translated: Even so, here Śakra himself states that the arrangement of the trichiliocosm is small, saying:

original: lta zhog ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lta zhog ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Leave that aside... and so on.

original: 'dir brgya byin gyi lhag par mos pa bstan par bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang ba gsungs pa ni de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir brgya byin gyi lhag par mos pa bstan par bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang ba gsungs pa ni de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the Bhagavat's statement of permission is for the sake of teaching the superiority of Indra's faith, beginning with Then the Bhagavat said to Sakra, Chief of Gods.

original: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: So it is, so it is, etc.

original: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa la lam gcig yin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa la lam gcig yin te /
translated: So it is means that the Bhagavat is the one path for attaining the knowledge of all aspects of all Tathagatas.

original: de ltar yang de 'dzin pa nyid kyis de'i glegs bam mchod pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod pa'i don gyis bsod nams chen po bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang de 'dzin pa nyid kyis de'i glegs bam mchod pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod pa'i don gyis bsod nams chen po bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Thus, by just holding it, the worship of its book is the cause for generating great merit by the meaning of worship of all Tathagatas.

original: gzhal du med pa la sogs pa rnams ni phal che ba rjod par byed pa'i rnam grangs sam lhag pa bas lhag pa'i grangs rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa la sogs pa rnams ni phal che ba rjod par byed pa'i rnam grangs sam lhag pa bas lhag pa'i grangs rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: Incalculable, etc. are synonyms for mostly, or they express a number greater than the greatest.

original: yang na mang po ni sngon gyi bsod nams la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mang po ni sngon gyi bsod nams la ltos pa'o //
translated: Or else, many means dependent on former merit.

original: gzhal du med pa ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas go bar bya ba ma yin @85a * //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas go bar bya ba ma yin @85a * //
translated: Incalculable means not to be understood by direct perception, etc.,🔽means of knowledge.

original: pa'o // grangs med pa ni gcig nyid la sogs pa'i grangs dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: pa'o // grangs med pa ni gcig nyid la sogs pa'i grangs dang bral ba'o //
translated: Immeasurable means free from the number one, etc.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'di lta bu nyid kyis bsam par bya ba mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'di lta bu nyid kyis bsam par bya ba mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Inconceivable means not able to be conceived by suchness.

original: mnyam pa med pa ni 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa ni 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unequalled means without a like.

original: tshad med pa ni nam mkha' bzhin du thams cad las yongs su gcod pa mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa ni nam mkha' bzhin du thams cad las yongs su gcod pa mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Unlimited means like space, not able to be delimited at all.

original: de lta na yang rim gyis mchod pa chen po nye bar bkod pa ni rim gyis sems can rnams lhag par mos pa las 'jug pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang rim gyis mchod pa chen po nye bar bkod pa ni rim gyis sems can rnams lhag par mos pa las 'jug pa'i don du'o //
translated: Even so, the great worship is set forth gradually, for the sake of engaging in the path gradually, from the superior resolve of sentient beings.

original: 'dir ni dogs pa sngon du 'gro bas 'thad pas gsungs pa ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni dogs pa sngon du 'gro bas 'thad pas gsungs pa ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the objection being anticipated, the rationale is stated: Why is it so? etc.

original: bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa ni bsod nams kyi las kyi char mi phod ces bya ba la sogs pa la thog ma dang tha mar yang char mi phod ces bya ba'i tshig ni dbus su yang 'brel ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa ni bsod nams kyi las kyi char mi phod ces bya ba la sogs pa la thog ma dang tha mar yang char mi phod ces bya ba'i tshig ni dbus su yang 'brel ba'i don du'o //
translated: The phrase “not even a fraction” is to be connected with the middle and the end.

original: mi phod ces bya ba ni thob par mi byed rnyed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi phod ces bya ba ni thob par mi byed rnyed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Not even a fraction” means not even a part, not even a portion.

original: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi khyad par gyis so //
translated: “Not even one hundredth” is a particular kind of number.

original: grangs su yang zhes bya ba ni khyad par du ma byas pa'i grangs 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: grangs su yang zhes bya ba ni khyad par du ma byas pa'i grangs 'dzin pas so //
translated: “Not even a number” is a number that is not distinguished.

original: de las gzhan pa'i grangs 'dzin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i grangs 'dzin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as a number that is not distinguished from the other numbers.

original: char yang zhes bya ba ni mthus so //
analyzed: char yang zhes bya ba ni mthus so //
translated: “Not even a portion” is by way of power.

original: bgrang bar yang zhes bya ba ni rigs kyis so //
analyzed: bgrang bar yang zhes bya ba ni rigs kyis so //
translated: “Not even a count” is by way of kind.

original: bsod nams kyi rigs 'di la mchod rten rnams kyi bkur sti las skyes pa'i bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa grangs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi rigs 'di la mchod rten rnams kyi bkur sti las skyes pa'i bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa grangs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this kind of merit, the merit of the first is not even a fraction of the merit of the second, because the merit of the first is not even a number in comparison to the merit of the second.

original: khyad par 'di la 'jig rten na dpe yang yod pa ma yin te gang gis bsod nams de 'dra par 'gyur //
analyzed: khyad par 'di la 'jig rten na dpe yang yod pa ma yin te gang gis bsod nams de 'dra par 'gyur //
translated: There is no example in the world for this distinction, by which that merit would be equal.

original: de bzhin du grangs kyis nyung ba med par bsod nams de las zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du grangs kyis nyung ba med par bsod nams de las zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, there is no small number by which that merit would be equal.

original: dper yang mi bzod do zhes bya ba ni mthu la yang dpe med par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dper yang mi bzod do zhes bya ba ni mthu la yang dpe med par gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is not even possible to give an example of the power of that merit.

original: dpes bstan par bya ba yang mi bzod do //
analyzed: dpes bstan par bya ba yang mi bzod do //
translated: It is not even possible to give an example of the object of that merit.

original: dpes bstan par bya ba zhes bya ba la rang gi don las shyanya zhes bya ba'i rkyen no //
analyzed: dpes bstan par bya ba zhes bya ba la rang gi don las shyanya zhes bya ba'i rkyen no //
translated: The object of merit is the basis of merit.🔽It is not even possible to give an example of the family of that merit.

original: rigs la yang dpe med pa gsungs pa ni rten du yang zhes bya ba la rten du bya ba ni rten te nye bar 'jal ba nyid do //
analyzed: rigs la yang dpe med pa gsungs pa ni rten du yang zhes bya ba la rten du bya ba ni rten te nye bar 'jal ba nyid do //
translated: The family of merit is the basis of merit.

original: phra ba n+ya gro dha'i sa bon gyis dpangs shin tu mtho ba dang rgyar yangs pa n+ya gro dha'i shing skye ba bzhin du rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po'i 'brel ba 'byung bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa'i rgyur yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phra ba n+ya gro dha'i sa bon gyis dpangs shin tu mtho ba dang rgyar yangs pa n+ya gro dha'i shing skye ba bzhin du rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po'i 'brel ba 'byung bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa'i rgyur yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Just as a very tall and wide banyan tree grows from a small banyan seed, so too, the relationship of cause and effect occurs.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bos kyang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bos kyang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no relationship even in terms of the nature of cause and effect.

original: 'di rgyur @85b gyur pa yang 'di'i ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di rgyur @85b gyur pa yang 'di'i ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is not the cause of that.

original: 'di la don 'di nyid rtogs par bya ste ji skad du 'phags pa thogs med kyi zhal snga nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di la don 'di nyid rtogs par bya ste ji skad du 'phags pa thogs med kyi zhal snga nas gsungs pa /
translated: This meaning should be understood here, as stated by the noble Asanga:

original: grangs dang mthu dang rigs rnams kyi //
analyzed: grangs dang mthu dang rigs rnams kyi //
translated: In terms of number, power, and type,

original: 'brel pa'i khyad par byed pa la //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i khyad par byed pa la //
translated: The specific relationship

original: 'jig rten kun la dpyad nas ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun la dpyad nas ni //
translated: Is examined in the world,

original: dpe yang rnyed pa ma yin no //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dpe yang rnyed pa ma yin no // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: But no example is found.

original: sngon gyi po ti rnams la ni dpes bstan par bya ba dang rten du yang zhes bya ba 'don pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi po ti rnams la ni dpes bstan par bya ba dang rten du yang zhes bya ba 'don pa ma yin te /
translated: In the earlier texts, the phrase “to be illustrated by an example” and “also” are not recited.

original: der dper yang zhes bya ba 'dis dpe thams cad kyi ngo bo rtogs par bya'o //🔽bdag nyid chen po nye bar bkod pa thams cad 'di'i 'bras bu gdul bya rnams nyid la 'di de bzhin zhes lhag par mos pa de de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan par byed pa ni zung shig ces bya ba ste gtso bo yongs su 'dzin
analyzed: der dper yang zhes bya ba 'dis dpe thams cad kyi ngo bo rtogs par bya'o // bdag nyid chen po nye bar bkod pa thams cad 'di'i 'bras bu gdul bya rnams nyid la 'di de bzhin zhes lhag par mos pa de de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan par byed pa ni zung shig ces bya ba ste gtso bo yongs su 'dzin
translated: Here, for example should be understood as the nature of all examples.

original: pa ni skye bo mang po yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: pa ni skye bo mang po yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The great self-existence of all those who are set forth is its fruit.  For disciples, this is just so. This is the conviction.  Then, and so forth, indicates grasp it! The chief one is the holder, because it is the cause of holding many beings.

original: grogs po zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: grogs po zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: Friend is a Tibetan word.

original: 'dir 'thad pa ni grogs po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'thad pa ni grogs po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the justification is that the friend is the perfection of wisdom. Grasp it! and so forth.

original: gzung bar bya ba la sogs pa nyid la ji skad gsungs pa'i 'bras bu la grub pa'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba la sogs pa nyid la ji skad gsungs pa'i 'bras bu la grub pa'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is that the fruit as it is taught is established in the very act of grasping and so forth.

original: 'dir lha'i bu rnams la sogs pa bstan par bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir lha'i bu rnams la sogs pa bstan par bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Here, in order to teach the sons of the gods and so forth, the Blessed One said:

original: gzung bar bya ba la sogs pa ste 'dir dgongs pa sngon du song bas dngos su brgya byin gyis byas pa'i yon tan gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba la sogs pa ste 'dir dgongs pa sngon du song bas dngos su brgya byin gyis byas pa'i yon tan gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the intended meaning is stated in advance, and the other qualities created by Indra are stated directly:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Why is that? and so on.

original: rgyu ba 'byung ba zhes bya ba rnams kyi dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba 'byung ba zhes bya ba rnams kyi dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning of arising of movement and so on is as follows.

original: 'thab par bya'o zhes bya ba sngon nyid du gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'thab par bya'o zhes bya ba sngon nyid du gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The word fight clarifies it in advance.

original: g-yul 'gyed bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bran par byos shig ces dran pa'o //
analyzed: g-yul 'gyed bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bran par byos shig ces dran pa'o //
translated: The word battle is a reminder to be ready.

original: 'dir lha ma yin rnams kyi 'thab par 'dod pa nye bar zhi ba la bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa chen po la sogs pa nyid rgyu zhes brgya byin bstod pa'i sgo nas smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir lha ma yin rnams kyi 'thab par 'dod pa nye bar zhi ba la bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa chen po la sogs pa nyid rgyu zhes brgya byin bstod pa'i sgo nas smras pa /
translated: Here, in order to pacify the desire to fight of the asuras, the Blessed Lady, the Great Knowledge Mantra, and so on, are said to be the cause. Indra praises her and says:

original: rig sngags chen mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rig sngags chen mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Great Knowledge Mantra, and so on.

original: rig sngags chen mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: rig sngags chen mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum ni bshad zin to //
translated: The three phrases beginning with The Great Knowledge Mantra have already been explained.

original: gong na med pa ni shin tu lhag pa med pas so //
analyzed: gong na med pa ni shin tu lhag pa med pas so //
translated: The word unsurpassed means without anything superior.

original: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad lhag pa'i rigs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad lhag pa'i rigs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Supreme means that there is no other reason that is even slightly superior.

original: mnyam pa med pa ni mtshungs pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ni @86a * //
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa ni mtshungs pa med pa'i phyir ro // mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ni @86a * //
translated: Unequalled means that there is nothing that is equal to it.

original: cung zad nyung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cung zad nyung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Equal to the unequalled means that there is nothing that is even slightly less than it.

original: gang zhig 'di lta bu rig sngags chen mo'i rang bzhin de ji ltar lha ma yin rnams kyi stobs ma gos pa tsam gyis ji ltar rab tu zhi bar byed ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //🔽lha ma yin gyi stobs kyi stobs 'phrogs pa la /
analyzed: gang zhig 'di lta bu rig sngags chen mo'i rang bzhin de ji ltar lha ma yin rnams kyi stobs ma gos pa tsam gyis ji ltar rab tu zhi bar byed ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o // lha ma yin gyi stobs kyi stobs 'phrogs pa la /
translated: How can this great knowledge mantra, which has such a nature, pacify the asuras merely by the power of the asuras themselves?

original: rig sngags chen mo la sogs pa nyid rgyu nyid yin zhes brgya byin la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: rig sngags chen mo la sogs pa nyid rgyu nyid yin zhes brgya byin la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The power of the asuras is taken away by the great knowledge mantra and so on.🔽This is the reason, Indra!

original: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: So it is! and so on.

original: rjes su gnang nas dus gsum gyi rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas skyed pas kyang rig sngags chen mo la sogs pa nyid ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su gnang nas dus gsum gyi rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas skyed pas kyang rig sngags chen mo la sogs pa nyid ston par byed pa ni /
translated: Having given permission, it is also shown that the great knowledge mantra and so on are the teachers, because they give rise to the perfect buddhas of the three times.

original: 'di la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'di la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The phrase in dependence upon this and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma'i yon tan gzhan yang gsungs la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma'i yon tan gzhan yang gsungs la /
translated: The Blessed Lady also teaches other qualities.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase in this regard and so on.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams zhes bya ba ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa gsum las gsod pa dang rku ba dang 'dod pas log par g-yem pa las log pa gsum mo //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams zhes bya ba ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa gsum las gsod pa dang rku ba dang 'dod pas log par g-yem pa las log pa gsum mo //
translated: The phrase the paths of the ten virtuous actions refers to the three physical nonvirtuous actions, from which one turns away: killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct.

original: brdzun dang tshig rtsub dang ngag 'khyal pa rnams kyis ngag gi nyes par spyod pa bzhi las log pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun dang tshig rtsub dang ngag 'khyal pa rnams kyis ngag gi nyes par spyod pa bzhi las log pa'o //
translated: The phrase the four verbal nonvirtuous actions refers to lying, harsh words, and frivolous speech, from which one turns away.

original: brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba'i ngo bo gsum gyis yid kyi nyes par spyod pa gsum las log pa'o //
analyzed: brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba'i ngo bo gsum gyis yid kyi nyes par spyod pa gsum las log pa'o //
translated: The phrase the three mental nonvirtuous actions refers to covetousness, malice, and wrong views, from which one turns away.

original: bsam gtan bzhi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase the four concentrations refers to the four meditative absorptions.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The first concentration has five members:

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba de ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba de ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: initial thought, sustained thought, joy, pleasure, and unification of mind.

original: gnyis pa ni yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The second has four branches:🔽inner faith, joy, bliss, and unification of the mind.🔽The third has five branches:🔽equanimity, mindfulness, introspection, bliss, and unification of the mind.🔽The fourth has four branches:🔽pure equanimity, pure mindfulness, the feeling of neither pleasure nor pain, and unification of the mind.🔽The first absorption has two branches:

original: nang du yang dag par dang ba dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: nang du yang dag par dang ba dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: investigation and analysis.🔽The second has four branches:🔽inner faith, joy, bliss, and unification of the mind.

original: gsum pa ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The third has five branches:🔽equanimity, mindfulness, introspection, bliss, and unification of the mind.🔽The fourth has four branches:🔽pure equanimity, pure mindfulness, the feeling of neither pleasure nor pain, and unification of the mind.🔽The first absorption has two branches:

original: btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: investigation and analysis.🔽The second has four branches:🔽inner faith, joy, bliss, and unification of the mind.🔽The third has five branches:🔽equanimity, mindfulness, introspection, bliss, and unification of the mind.🔽The fourth has four branches:

original: bzhi pa ni yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa ste btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal med pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa ste btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal med pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
