translated: pure equanimity, pure mindfulness, the feeling of neither pleasure nor pain, and unification of the mind.🔽The first absorption has two branches:

original: de la bsam gtan dang po la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag pa ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag pa ni rgyu ste /
translated: investigation and analysis.🔽The second has four branches:🔽inner faith, joy, bliss, and unification of the mind.🔽The third has five branches:🔽equanimity, mindfulness, introspection, bliss, and unification of the mind.🔽The fourth has four branches:

original: 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs kyis nges par 'byung ba dang / zhi ba nyid la dmigs pa so sor nye bar gzhag pas de dag gis de thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs kyis nges par 'byung ba dang / zhi ba nyid la dmigs pa so sor nye bar gzhag pas de dag gis de thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: pure equanimity, pure mindfulness, the feeling of neither pleasure nor pain, and unification of the mind.

original: de la rtog pa ni dmigs pa la sems gtad pa'i @86b mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la rtog pa ni dmigs pa la sems gtad pa'i @86b mtshan nyid do //
translated: Conception is the characteristic of the mind being directed toward the object.

original: dpyod pa ni yang dag par 'khyud pa so sor nye bar bzhag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dpyod pa ni yang dag par 'khyud pa so sor nye bar bzhag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Discernment is the characteristic of the mind being directed toward the object.

original: 'bras bu ni dga' ba dang bde ba dag go //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni dga' ba dang bde ba dag go //
translated: The result is joy and pleasure.

original: de dag rjes su 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rjes su 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they have the nature of sustaining that.

original: 'dod pa dang mi dge ba'i chos las rgyal bas skyon med pa'i rab tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi dge ba'i chos las rgyal bas skyon med pa'i rab tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
translated: The faultless joy that is victorious over desire and nonvirtuous phenomena is joy.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba zhi bas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i yid du 'ong ba'i rig pa'i bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba zhi bas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i yid du 'ong ba'i rig pa'i bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid rang bzhin no //
translated: The pleasure of knowledge that is pleasing due to being free from afflictions, and the one-pointedness of mind that is due to the pacification of the torment of afflictions, are its nature.

original: 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa la rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa la rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de'o //
translated: The one-pointedness of mind that is accompanied by conception and discernment toward objects such as the faults of desire is its characteristic.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la ni nang gi yang dag pa'i rgyu ste //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la ni nang gi yang dag pa'i rgyu ste //
translated: In the second concentration, there is inner purity.

original: der rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag la sems 'khrug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: der rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag la sems 'khrug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because conceptualization and discernment agitate the mind there.

original: rtog pa med pa la phan yon mthong bas nang du yang dag par dang ba chen po bdag nyid kyi yang dag par 'byung ba yang dag par dang ba thob pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa la phan yon mthong bas nang du yang dag par dang ba chen po bdag nyid kyi yang dag par 'byung ba yang dag par dang ba thob pa yin no //
translated: He attains the second meditative concentration, which is free of conceptualization and discernment, and is accompanied by joy and pleasure arising from superior inner clarity, because he sees the benefits of being free of conceptualization and discernment.

original: yang dag par rnyog pa spangs pa'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rnyog pa spangs pa'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: He attains this meditative concentration through the power of conceptualization and discernment, but not because he abandons conceptualization and discernment.

original: nang du yang dag par dang ba'i rgyun las yang dag par byung ba'i chu bzhin du sems la rang gi dang gis rgyu ba'i dmigs pa la gnas pa'o //🔽dmigs pa ni 'dod pa rnams sam rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams la nges par 'byung ba dang zhib 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: nang du yang dag par dang ba'i rgyun las yang dag par byung ba'i chu bzhin du sems la rang gi dang gis rgyu ba'i dmigs pa la gnas pa'o // dmigs pa ni 'dod pa rnams sam rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams la nges par 'byung ba dang zhib 'bras bu ste /
translated: His mind is free of conceptualization and discernment, and it flows naturally and easily toward its object, like a river that is not agitated by waves.🔽The object of this meditative concentration is the joy and pleasure that arise from being free of conceptualization and discernment, as previously described.

original: snga ma bzhin du dga' ba dang bde ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dga' ba dang bde ba'o //
translated: The third meditative concentration is free of joy.

original: 'on kyang 'dir rtog pa dang dpyod pa rgyal bas kyang skyon dang bral ba'i rab tu dga' ba shes par bya ba la rang bzhin ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir rtog pa dang dpyod pa rgyal bas kyang skyon dang bral ba'i rab tu dga' ba shes par bya ba la rang bzhin ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: However, here, the investigation and analysis are the investigation and analysis of the first meditative concentration, which is free from the faults described by the Victor.

original: de ltar na 'dod pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang nyes dmigs dang nges par 'byung ba dang zhi ba nyid kyis dmigs pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral ba dang dga' ba dang bde bar ldan pa'i sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can bsam gtan
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang nyes dmigs dang nges par 'byung ba dang zhi ba nyid kyis dmigs pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral ba dang dga' ba dang bde bar ldan pa'i sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can bsam gtan
translated: Thus, the second meditative concentration is characterized by one-pointedness of mind that is free from investigation and analysis, and is endowed with joy and pleasure, due to the absence of investigation and analysis, and due to the absence of the faults of investigation and analysis, which are the objects of investigation and analysis.

original: gnyis pa'o // bsam gtan gsum pa la ni btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'o // bsam gtan gsum pa la ni btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin ni rgyu'o //
translated: In the third meditative concentration, equanimity, mindfulness, and introspection are the causes.

original: dge ba'i spyod pa thams cad la sems kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi sbyor ba la gnod pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa dang dbus su gnas pa gang zhig nye bar zhi ba lta ba btang snyoms zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i spyod pa thams cad la sems kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi sbyor ba la gnod pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa dang dbus su gnas pa gang zhig nye bar zhi ba lta ba btang snyoms zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Equanimity is the mental state that is neither harmful nor investigative, that abides in the middle way, and that is applied to the evenness of all virtuous activities. It is called equanimity because it is a view that is completely peaceful.

original: sngar gyi bsam gtan dag la dga' ba dang mngon par dga' ba'i dbang gis sems kyi 'bad pa spangs par mi 'gyur te rnyog pa @87a * //🔽can du byas pa'i phyir dga' ba la de'i phyir de dag la btang snyom nye bar bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar gyi bsam gtan dag la dga' ba dang mngon par dga' ba'i dbang gis sems kyi 'bad pa spangs par mi 'gyur te rnyog pa @87a * // can du byas pa'i phyir dga' ba la de'i phyir de dag la btang snyom nye bar bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind does not abandon its effort because of delight and joy in the former meditative concentrations.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, equanimity is not taught in the latter two meditative concentrations because they are not complete.

original: 'dir so sor 'dod chags dang bral ba las ldog pa'i phyir ro //🔽'bad pa bsam gtan gyi yan lag tu gyur pa btang snyoms 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir so sor 'dod chags dang bral ba las ldog pa'i phyir ro // 'bad pa bsam gtan gyi yan lag tu gyur pa btang snyoms 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Here, equanimity is the antidote to the reversal of separation from passion.🔽Effort is the branch of meditative concentration.🔽Mindfulness is the recollection of the object of meditation.

original: dran pa ni dran par byed pa ste de yang mi brjed pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: dran pa ni dran par byed pa ste de yang mi brjed pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: It is characterized by non-forgetting.🔽When mindfulness is present, introspection is present.🔽When mindfulness is absent, introspection is absent.

original: shes bzhin dang dran pa nyid la nye bar gzhag pa shes bzhin dang ma tshang ba la dran pa ni nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes bzhin dang dran pa nyid la nye bar gzhag pa shes bzhin dang ma tshang ba la dran pa ni nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: When mindfulness is impaired, introspection is impaired.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin dag kyang thams cad du mi 'gal pa nyid kyi phyir gal te yang bsam gtan rnams cig shos la yang bsdus par byas pa de lta na yang 'di nyid la rang gi sgras smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin dag kyang thams cad du mi 'gal pa nyid kyi phyir gal te yang bsam gtan rnams cig shos la yang bsdus par byas pa de lta na yang 'di nyid la rang gi sgras smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meditative concentration of the absence of conceptualization is the meditative concentration of the form realm that is attained by one who is free of attachment to the desire realm and who has not attained the formless realm.

original: dga' ba spong bar dga' ba nyid kyis de spangs kyang dran pa dang shes bzhin ma tshang ba la yang dag par spyod pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba spong bar dga' ba nyid kyis de spangs kyang dran pa dang shes bzhin ma tshang ba la yang dag par spyod pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meditative concentration of the absence of conceptualization is the meditative concentration of the form realm that is attained by one who is free of attachment to the desire realm and who has not attained the formless realm.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of conceptualization is the meditative concentration of the form realm that is attained by one who is free of attachment to the desire realm and who has not attained the formless realm.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of conceptualization is the meditative concentration of the form realm that is attained by one who is free of attachment to the desire realm and who has not attained the formless realm.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of conceptualization is the meditative concentration of the form realm that is attained by one who is free of attachment to the desire realm and who has not attained the formless realm.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of conceptualization is the meditative concentration of the form realm that is attained by one who is free of attachment to the desire realm and who has not attained the formless realm.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of conceptualization is the meditative concentration of the form realm that is attained by one who is free of attachment to the desire realm and who has not attained the formless realm.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of conceptualization is the meditative concentration of the form realm that is attained by one who is free of attachment to the desire realm and who has not attained the formless realm.

original: 'dir 'bras bu bde ba nyid de 'chums par byed pa'i sems de dang yang dag par sbyor ba las rtse gcig pa'i khyad par thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa rnyed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu bde ba nyid de 'chums par byed pa'i sems de dang yang dag par sbyor ba las rtse gcig pa'i khyad par thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa rnyed pa yin te /
translated: The meditative concentration of the absence of conceptualization is the meditative concentration of the form realm that is attained by one who is free of attachment to the desire realm and who has not attained the formless realm.

original: dga' ba yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //🔽rang bzhin ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' ba yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //🔽rang bzhin ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meditative concentration of the absence of conceptualization is the meditative concentration

original: de ltar na 'dod pa rnams dang dga' ba la nyes dmigs dang nges par 'byung ba dang zhi ba'i dmigs pa la dga' ba dang 'grel pa'i bde bar ldan pa la sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can bsam gtan gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod pa rnams dang dga' ba la nyes dmigs dang nges par 'byung ba dang zhi ba'i dmigs pa la dga' ba dang 'grel pa'i bde bar ldan pa la sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can bsam gtan gsum pa'o //
translated: Thus, the third meditation is characterized by one-pointedness of mind that is endowed with delight in the object of nondiscontent, renunciation, and peace with regard to the objects of desire and delight.

original: bzhi pa la ni btang snyoms yongs su dag pa ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni btang snyoms yongs su dag pa ni rgyu yin no //
translated: In the fourth, complete purity of equanimity is the cause.

original: btang snyoms dang dran pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang dran pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Equanimity and mindfulness have already been explained.

original: de dag gi yongs su dag pa ni bde pa la sogs pa sngon gyi bsam gtan la gnas pa rnams kyis nye bar ma 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi yongs su dag pa ni bde pa la sogs pa sngon gyi bsam gtan la gnas pa rnams kyis nye bar ma 'brel pa'o //
translated: Their complete purity is the non-association with pleasure, etc., of those who abide in the previous meditations.

original: 'di yang shin tu bstan pa nyid kyi phyir dran pa la shes bzhin yongs su dag pa ni tha dad pa'i 'bras bu ma bshad do //
analyzed: 'di yang shin tu bstan pa nyid kyi phyir dran pa la shes bzhin yongs su dag pa ni tha dad pa'i 'bras bu ma bshad do //
translated: Since this is also very well known, the complete purity of mindfulness and introspection is not explained as a separate effect.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir tshor ba ni der rtogs pa la sogs pa med bzhin du dmigs pa nye bar gzhag pa btang snyoms kyis de dang 'dra ba'i tshor ba med pa'i phyir bya ba dang bral ba yin zhes g-yo
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir tshor ba ni der rtogs pa la sogs pa med bzhin du dmigs pa nye bar gzhag pa btang snyoms kyis de dang 'dra ba'i tshor ba med pa'i phyir bya ba dang bral ba yin zhes g-yo
translated: Because it is neither pleasure nor pain, feeling is free from activity, since it is not a basis for the realization of such things as desire, etc.

original: ba med pa thob pas yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: ba med pa thob pas yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: It is pure, since it is attained without fluctuation, due to the absence of feeling that is similar to it, through the indifference that is the placement of the mind on the object.

original: de bzhin du dran pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, mindfulness is also like this.

original: 'di nyid ni 'dir 'bras bu ste bde ba ni @87b ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni 'dir 'bras bu ste bde ba ni @87b ma yin no //
translated: The result here is this very state, not pleasure.

original: bde ba ni shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba ni shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because pleasure is extremely exalted.

original: dran pa ni shes rab dang ldan pa rnams la yang sems tsam la rab tu chags pa rnams la khyad par gyi phyir nye bar 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa ni shes rab dang ldan pa rnams la yang sems tsam la rab tu chags pa rnams la khyad par gyi phyir nye bar 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: Mindfulness is not the approach for those who possess wisdom, because it is attached to mere mind, due to the absence of pleasure.

original: bde ba yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because pleasure is completely abandoned.

original: rang bzhin ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Its nature is as before.

original: de ltar na 'dod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba'i nyes dmigs dang nges par 'byung ba dang zhi ba nyid kyis dmigs pa la btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba'i nyes dmigs dang nges par 'byung ba dang zhi ba nyid kyis dmigs pa la btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
translated: Thus, the fourth meditation is characterized by equanimity, mindfulness, and one-pointedness of mind with regard to the object, by the disadvantages of desire, joy, and pleasure, by renunciation, and by peace.

original: bsam gtan 'di rnams ni byang chub kyi yan lag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: bsam gtan 'di rnams ni byang chub kyi yan lag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la ;
translated: These meditations are called “endowed with the factors of enlightenment.”

original: de rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa dran pa dang chos so sor rab tu 'byed pa dang dga' ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa dang btang snyoms dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid can byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams kyis yang dag par ldan pa 'jig rten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa dran pa dang chos so sor rab tu 'byed pa dang dga' ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa dang btang snyoms dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid can byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams kyis yang dag par ldan pa 'jig rten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are endowed with the seven factors of enlightenment, which are characterized by mindfulness, the analysis of phenomena, joy, fitness, equanimity, effort, and concentration. They are not worldly.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams la yang bdun gyi yang dag par sbyor ba sems ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams la yang bdun gyi yang dag par sbyor ba sems ni ma yin te /
translated: And even the supramundane ones are not associated with the seven, because the mind is not associated with the seven.

original: dga' ba la sogs pa rnams la rab tu 'gro ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa rnams la rab tu 'gro ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no going at all in the case of joy, etc.

original: tshad med pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms te phyogs thams cad la tshad med pa'i sems can spyod yul nyid kyi phyir tshad med pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms te phyogs thams cad la tshad med pa'i sems can spyod yul nyid kyi phyir tshad med pa rnams so //
translated: The four immeasurables are friendliness, compassion, joy, and equanimity. They are called immeasurables because they have as their domain immeasurable sentient beings in all directions.

original: kye ma sems can 'di rnams bde ba dang phrad par gyur cig ces bya ba ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di rnams bde ba dang phrad par gyur cig ces bya ba ni byams pa'o //
translated: May these sentient beings be happy is friendliness.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur cig snyam pa ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur cig snyam pa ni snying rje'o //
translated: May they be free from suffering is compassion.

original: bde ba dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig snyam pa ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig snyam pa ni dga' ba'o //
translated: May they not be separated from happiness is joy.

original: 'dod chags kyi rgyu'i dngos po nye bar rgyur pa dang 'dod chags dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la zhe sdang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par grol bar gyur cig ces bya ba ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rgyu'i dngos po nye bar rgyur pa dang 'dod chags dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la zhe sdang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par grol bar gyur cig ces bya ba ni btang snyoms so //
translated: May they be free from the afflictions of attachment, aversion, and delusion is equanimity.

original: rnam pa 'di rnams kyi bde ba dang / yang dag par sbyar ba'i bsam pa dang / sdug bsngal dang rnam par bral bar 'dod pa'i bsam pa dang / bde ba dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa'i bsam pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i bsam pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di rnams kyi bde ba dang / yang dag par sbyar ba'i bsam pa dang / sdug bsngal dang rnam par bral bar 'dod pa'i bsam pa dang / bde ba dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa'i bsam pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i bsam pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: These aspects are the intention of happiness, the intention of correct application, the intention of the desire to be free from suffering, the intention of the desire not to be separated from happiness, and the intention of the absence of defilement.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang @88a * //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang @88a * //
translated: The four formless meditative attainments are the meditative attainment of infinite space,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes yod min med min gyi skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes yod min med min gyi skye mched rnams so //
translated: the meditative attainment of infinite consciousness, the meditative attainment of nothingness, and the meditative attainment of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de la dang po snyoms par zhugs pa ni thams cad las gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams yang dag par 'das nas khong khro ba'i 'du shes rnams spangs pa dang / sna tshogs pa'i 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pa'i phyir nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes nam mkha' mtha' yas kyi skye mched la snyoms par zhugs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni mdo ste /🔽de la gzugs zhes bya ba'i 'du shes rnams ni gzugs la brten pa'am /
analyzed: de la dang po snyoms par zhugs pa ni thams cad las gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams yang dag par 'das nas khong khro ba'i 'du shes rnams spangs pa dang / sna tshogs pa'i 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pa'i phyir nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes nam mkha' mtha' yas kyi skye mched la snyoms par zhugs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni mdo ste / de la gzugs zhes bya ba'i 'du shes rnams ni gzugs la brten pa'am /
translated: First, the sutra says, “having completely transcended the perceptions of physical forms, having abandoned the perceptions of obstruction, not paying attention to the perceptions of various things, thinking ‘space is infinite,’ one enters and remains in the sphere of infinite space.”

original: gzugs kyi dmigs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi dmigs pa rnams so //
translated: The perceptions called “physical forms” are based on physical forms or are the focal objects of physical forms.

original: des na mig gi rnam par shes pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i 'du shes rnams spangs pas khong khro ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i yang dag par 'dus pa'i 'du shes rnams dang / rna ba dang /
analyzed: des na mig gi rnam par shes pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i 'du shes rnams spangs pas khong khro ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i yang dag par 'dus pa'i 'du shes rnams dang / rna ba dang /
translated: Therefore, by abandoning the perceptions that are associated with eye consciousness, the perception of obstruction is abandoned. The perception of obstruction is the perception of harm. The perception of various things is the perception of the collection of sounds, smells, tastes, and textures, and the perception of the collection of ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses.

original: sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa yang dag par mtshungs par ldan pa 'gags pas so //
analyzed: sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa yang dag par mtshungs par ldan pa 'gags pas so //
translated: by the cessation of the nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses, which are associated with the same object.

original: sna tshogs pa'i 'du shes rnams zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i 'du shes rnams sna tshogs pa'i dmigs pa can yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yang dag par mtshungs par ldan pa yid la mi byed pa ni yang dag par ldan pa med pas so //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i 'du shes rnams zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i 'du shes rnams sna tshogs pa'i dmigs pa can yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yang dag par mtshungs par ldan pa yid la mi byed pa ni yang dag par ldan pa med pas so //
translated: The various perceptions are the various objects of the various perceptions, which are associated with the mental consciousness. The non-attention of the mind is the non-association with them.

original: mtha' yas pa ni gzhal du med pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa ni gzhal du med pa'o //
translated: Infinite means immeasurable.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni gzugs la nges par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sems can brten pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni gzugs la nges par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sems can brten pa'i don du'o //
translated: Space is the deliverance from form. The word deliverance has the meaning of support for beings.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa nyid ni mtha' yas pa nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa nyid ni mtha' yas pa nyid do //
translated: The infinity of space is the infinity of space.

original: de nyid ni skye mched de /
analyzed: de nyid ni skye mched de /
translated: That itself is the sphere.

original: skye mched kyi sgo nas yid kyi sgo zhes bya ba ni skye mched do //
analyzed: skye mched kyi sgo nas yid kyi sgo zhes bya ba ni skye mched do //
translated: The sphere of the mind is the sphere of the mind.

original: snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni thob ste rtogs par byas pas so //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni thob ste rtogs par byas pas so //
translated: Having entered into means having attained and realized.

original: gnas so zhes bya ba ni nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas so zhes bya ba ni nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: Abides means is present.

original: de la gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das pa'i nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i dmigs pa can sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid du gzugs kyi chags pa rab tu zhi ba so sor nye bar gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das pa'i nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i dmigs pa can sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid du gzugs kyi chags pa rab tu zhi ba so sor nye bar gzhag pa ste /
translated: The first meditative absorption is the placement of the mind in a state of concentration that is characterized by the one-pointedness of mind that has the object of the sphere of infinite space, which is the complete transcendence of the conception of form.

original: de'i snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: It is the meditative absorption that is entered into by means of that placement.

original: gnyis pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa dang po yang dag par 'das pas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa dang po yang dag par 'das pas so //
translated: The second meditative absorption is the meditative absorption that is entered into by means of the complete transcendence of the first meditative absorption.🔽The sphere of infinite consciousness is the sphere in which consciousness is infinite.

original: rnam @88b par shes pa mtha' yas zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes par byed pas na rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam @88b par shes pa mtha' yas zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes par byed pas na rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is that which is aware.

original: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa nyid ni skye mched de thog ma dang tha ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa nyid ni skye mched de thog ma dang tha ma bzhin du'o //
translated: The sphere of infinite consciousness is that which is infinite in the sense of having no beginning or end.

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Moreover, consciousness is said to be infinite because it is not material.

original: gzung bar byed pa la yongs su gcod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung bar byed pa la yongs su gcod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not possible to delimit it in terms of what is to be grasped.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa 'dzin pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa zhes gzhan dag go //🔽lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis sam /🔽bsam gtan las gzugs med pa'i yan lag 'grib pas yang dag par 'gro bar 'gyur ro //🔽'on kyang dmigs pa yang dag par 'das pas de nyid la gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes rnams ring du med pa'i phyir yang dag par spyod pa'i 'du shes can nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa 'dzin pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa zhes gzhan dag go // lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis sam / bsam gtan las gzugs med pa'i yan lag 'grib pas yang dag par 'gro bar 'gyur ro // 'on kyang dmigs pa yang dag par 'das pas de nyid la gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes rnams ring du med pa'i phyir yang dag par spyod pa'i 'du shes can nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: It is called nothingness because it apprehends nothingness.

original: de'i mthar thug pa'i 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs mthong ba can gyi de nges par 'byung ba la zhi ba mthong ba'i rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la dmigs pa'i sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i mthar thug pa'i 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs mthong ba can gyi de nges par 'byung ba la zhi ba mthong ba'i rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la dmigs pa'i sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is called the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception because it is the sphere of the perception of the absence of the perception of the absence of perception.🔽The first three are called formless because they are devoid of form.

original: gsum pa ni gnyis pa las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gnyis pa las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: The fourth is called formless because it is devoid of the three formless concentrations.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.

original: ci yang med ces ci yang med pa'i dngos po ni ci yang med pa ste /
analyzed: ci yang med ces ci yang med pa'i dngos po ni ci yang med pa ste /
translated: The formless realm is so called because it is devoid of form.🔽The

original: de nyid ni skye mched de yid 'dzin pa'i rten no //
analyzed: de nyid ni skye mched de yid 'dzin pa'i rten no //
translated: This is the sphere, the basis of the retention of the mind.

original: dang po nyid la gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes rnams yang dag par 'das pas gnyis pa la ni nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i 'dus shes la'o //
analyzed: dang po nyid la gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes rnams yang dag par 'das pas gnyis pa la ni nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i 'dus shes la'o //
translated: In the second, the sphere of infinite space, the ideation of space is infinite.

original: 'di la ni nam mkha' mtha' yas pa zhes 'du shes la skyon gang zhig de rnams nyid ni mtha' yas pa phun sum tshogs pa dogs par gyur pa na sngar bshad pa'i cung zad dmigs pa ma byas par shes pa gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni nam mkha' mtha' yas pa zhes 'du shes la skyon gang zhig de rnams nyid ni mtha' yas pa phun sum tshogs pa dogs par gyur pa na sngar bshad pa'i cung zad dmigs pa ma byas par shes pa gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the ideation of infinite space is the fault, for the ideation of infinite space is the fault. When one fears the perfection of the infinite, the mind does not abide in the nonperception of the slightest thing, as has been previously explained.

original: de ltar 'di rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi mthar thug pa'i 'dod pa rnams la nyes dmigs mthong ba de 'das par byas nas nges par 'byung ba la zhi ba'i 'du shes can ci yang med pa'i dmigs pa sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar 'di rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi mthar thug pa'i 'dod pa rnams la nyes dmigs mthong ba de 'das par byas nas nges par 'byung ba la zhi ba'i 'du shes can ci yang med pa'i dmigs pa sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Thus, having seen the danger in the desire realm up to the sphere of infinite consciousness, he transcends it and, having the ideation of the peace of deliverance, he has the single-pointed mind that has the characteristic of the object of the sphere of nothingness.

original: bzhi pa ni 'du shes yod min med min gyi skye mched de /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni 'du shes yod min med min gyi skye mched de /
translated: The fourth is the sphere of neither ideation nor nonideation.

original: de la 'du shes ni zug rngu dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'du shes ni zug rngu dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: The idea is like a thorn,

original: de yongs su spangs nas de med pas so //🔽'du shes @89a * //
analyzed: de yongs su spangs nas de med pas so // 'du shes @89a * //
translated: because it is completely abandoned, since it does not exist.🔽The attainment of the absence of idea is the abandonment of delusion.

original: med pa yang thob pa ste gti mug ces yongs su spangs nas rim pa gzhan mthong ba phra ba'i 'du shes kyi rang bzhin de nyid ni skye mched de /
analyzed: med pa yang thob pa ste gti mug ces yongs su spangs nas rim pa gzhan mthong ba phra ba'i 'du shes kyi rang bzhin de nyid ni skye mched de /
translated: The other stage is the sphere of neither idea nor absence of idea, which is the nature of subtle idea.

original: 'di la yid 'dzin par byed pa'i don du 'bad par byed pas na skye mchad do //
analyzed: 'di la yid 'dzin par byed pa'i don du 'bad par byed pas na skye mchad do //
translated: It is a sphere because it is the sphere of the mind, since one strives to hold the mind there.🔽Since one is afraid of turning back from that sphere because of the fault of instability of idea, one also abandons the sphere of nothingness.🔽One sees the danger in the desire realm, etc., and one has renunciation.🔽One has the idea that the other sphere is peaceful.

original: de dang de'i 'du shes la g-yer ba nyid kyis skyon rnams la ldog pa'i dogs pas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyang yongs su spangs pas 'dod pa la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs mthong zhing nges par 'byung ba dang / skye mched gzhan la zhi ba'i 'du shes can 'du shes yod min med min gyi dmigs pa can sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: de dang de'i 'du shes la g-yer ba nyid kyis skyon rnams la ldog pa'i dogs pas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyang yongs su spangs pas 'dod pa la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs mthong zhing nges par 'byung ba dang / skye mched gzhan la zhi ba'i 'du shes can 'du shes yod min med min gyi dmigs pa can sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: One has the characteristic of one-pointed mind, which has the sphere of neither idea nor absence of idea as its object.

original: 'di rnams kyi gzugs med pa nyid ni gtso cher gzugs kyi 'du shes kyi gnyen po nyid kyi phyir dang / tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi rnam par smin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi gzugs med pa nyid ni gtso cher gzugs kyi 'du shes kyi gnyen po nyid kyi phyir dang / tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi rnam par smin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The formless realm is so called because it is the principal antidote to the ideation of form, and because the four aggregates of sensation, ideation, disposition, and consciousness are the only ones that are found there.

original: mngon par shes pa drug rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The six superknowledges are:

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i don du rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa la ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / de dang yang dag par mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i don du rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa la ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / de dang yang dag par mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The superknowledge of the magical power of displacement is the concentration and wisdom, and the mind and mental activities associated with them, that are based on the formless meditative development and are the means to the attainment of the various kinds of magical power of displacement through the air.

original: lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa ni phra ba dang / lkog tu gyur pa la sogs pa'i sgra thams cad thos pa phun sum tshogs pa la snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa ni phra ba dang / lkog tu gyur pa la sogs pa'i sgra thams cad thos pa phun sum tshogs pa la snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The superknowledge of the divine ear is the concentration and wisdom, and the mind and mental activities associated with them, that are the means to the hearing of all sounds, whether subtle or hidden, etc.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs kyi mngon par shes pa ni sems can gzhan rnams kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi spyod pa rab tu zhugs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa la snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs kyi mngon par shes pa ni sems can gzhan rnams kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi spyod pa rab tu zhugs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa la snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of the categories of mind consists of the perfection of the cognition of the mental activities of other beings, such as their possession of desire, and so forth, as before.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa ni sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa rjes su dran par byed pa phun sum tshogs pa la snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa ni sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa rjes su dran par byed pa phun sum tshogs pa la snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The superknowledge of the recollection of former abodes consists of the perfection of the recollection of former activities, as before.

original: 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa ni 'gro ba drug gi sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho ba dang / skyes pa yang dag par mthong ba'i gnas phun sum tshogs pa la snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa ni 'gro ba drug gi sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho ba dang / skyes pa yang dag par mthong ba'i gnas phun sum tshogs pa la snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of death, transmigration, and rebirth consists of the perfection of the vision of the death, transmigration, and rebirth of sentient beings in the six realms, as before.

original: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas zag pa zad pa'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa la gang zhig ting nge 'dzin dang / @89b shes rab dang / de dang yang dag par mtshungs par ldan pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas zag pa zad pa'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa la gang zhig ting nge 'dzin dang / @89b shes rab dang / de dang yang dag par mtshungs par ldan pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The superknowledge of the extinction of the impurities is the perfect knowledge of the extinction of the impurities, based on the absorptions. It is concentration, discernment, and the thought and thought-concomitants associated with them.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste /
translated: The thirty-seven auxiliaries of awakening are the four foundations of mindfulness,🔽the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the noble eightfold path.

original: lus dang / tshor ba dang / chos dang / sems zhes chos rnam pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i dran pa de nyid la nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang / tshor ba dang / chos dang / sems zhes chos rnam pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i dran pa de nyid la nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are mindfulness applied to the body, to sensation, to thought, and to the factors.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rnam par bzhi'i brtson 'grus dang / ma skyes pa dang / skyes pa'i mi dge ba mi skyed pa dang spangs pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rnam par bzhi'i brtson 'grus dang / ma skyes pa dang / skyes pa'i mi dge ba mi skyed pa dang spangs pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The four right efforts are the vigor of the four kinds of foundations: to prevent the arising of unarisen bad factors, to eliminate the arisen bad factors, to produce the unarisen good factors, and to develop the arisen good factors.

original: ma skyes pa dang / skyes pa'i dge ba bskyed pa dang gnas pa'i don du rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang / skyes pa'i dge ba bskyed pa dang gnas pa'i don du rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The first is for the sake of generating virtue that has not yet arisen, and the second is for the sake of increasing and maintaining virtue that has already arisen.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four bases of supernatural power are the bases of supernatural power of will, of effort, of thought, and of investigation.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos zhes bya ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyi gnas te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos zhes bya ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyi gnas te /
translated: They are the bases of the supramundane dharmas.

original: 'dun pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dang sems dang dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dang sems dang dpyod pa'o //
translated: The four are will, effort, thought, and investigation.

original: dbang po lnga ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab bo //
analyzed: dbang po lnga ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab bo //
translated: The five faculties are faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: stobs lnga ni dbang po rnams nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnas skabs las nges par rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: stobs lnga ni dbang po rnams nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnas skabs las nges par rgyal ba'o //
translated: The five powers are the same as the faculties, but they are described as powers because they crush their opposites.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / lam gyi yan lag rnams ni brgyad do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / lam gyi yan lag rnams ni brgyad do //
translated: The seven parts of enlightenment are mindfulness, investigation of dharmas, vigor, joy, fitness, concentration, and equanimity.🔽The eight parts of the path are right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes so //
translated: The knowledge of the buddhas is the knowledge of the buddhas.

original: de nyid ni tang bzhin gyis 'byung bas rang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid ni tang bzhin gyis 'byung bas rang 'byung ngo //
translated: It is self-originated because it arises from itself.

original: bsam pa las 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa las 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: It is inconceivable because it transcends thought.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la sogs pa rnams te zhes bya ba ni gzhag dag go //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la sogs pa rnams te zhes bya ba ni gzhag dag go //
translated: The wisdoms of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and perfect buddhas are called the wisdoms of the buddhas, etc.

original: sngon thos pas zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi thos pa las 'byung bas so //
analyzed: sngon thos pas zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi thos pa las 'byung bas so //
translated: It arises from previous learning, from previous learning.

original: rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma thos pa 'dra ba'i 'bras bus so //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma thos pa 'dra ba'i 'bras bus so //
translated: It is similar to the result of the Bhagavatī, similar to the result.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba med par bden pa'i mngon par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba med par bden pa'i mngon par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not endowed with the branches of enlightenment, because without the appearance of a buddha, there is no realization of the truth.

original: mngon pa shes pa lnga rnams zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa ste /
analyzed: mngon pa shes pa lnga rnams zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa ste /
translated: The five superknowledges are the exhaustion of defilements.

original: sangs rgyas mi 'byung ba la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mi 'byung ba la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not without the appearance of a buddha.

original: sman dang skar ma zhes bya ba ni sman rnams dang ni skar ma dang / sman dang skar ma ste de rnams zla ba'i 'do zer gyi dbang gis lhag par brten pa yongs su rgyas pa dang / mthu'i @90a * //🔽khyad par yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sman dang skar ma zhes bya ba ni sman rnams dang ni skar ma dang / sman dang skar ma ste de rnams zla ba'i 'do zer gyi dbang gis lhag par brten pa yongs su rgyas pa dang / mthu'i @90a * // khyad par yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The term “just as they are” means just as they are.🔽The term “just as they are” means just as they are.🔽The term “just as they are” means just as they are.🔽The term “just as they are” means just as they are.🔽The term “just as they are” means just as they are.

original: rim pa ji lta bar gsungs pa ni stobs ji lta ba dang / mthu ji lta bar kun tu snang bar byed de rang gi stobs dang / mthu rjes su mthun pa'o //🔽skar ma thams cad ces bya ba ni skar ma rnams las chen por gyur pa tha skar la sogs pa rnams so //🔽chos spyod pa zhes bya ba la 'dir chos ni lam mo //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta bar gsungs pa ni stobs ji lta ba dang / mthu ji lta bar kun tu snang bar byed de rang gi stobs dang / mthu rjes su mthun pa'o // skar ma thams cad ces bya ba ni skar ma rnams las chen por gyur pa tha skar la sogs pa rnams so // chos spyod pa zhes bya ba la 'dir chos ni lam mo //
translated: The term “just as they are” means just as they are.🔽The term “just as they are” means just as they are.🔽The term “just as they are” means just as they are.

analyzed: rab tu phye ste zhes bya ba ni de bstan pa yang byang chub sems dpa' la rag lus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: de ltar dkar po'i chos thams cad rab tu phye ba'i rgyu nyid bshad nas mthong ba'i chos kyi phan yon sngar bshad pa yang bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ni koo shi ka gzhan yang zhes bya ba ste /

original: yang ba ma spangs pas zhes bya ba la ya nga ba ni 'chi ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: yang ba ma spangs pas zhes bya ba la ya nga ba ni 'chi ba'i rgyu'o //

original: de ma spangs pa ni ya nga ba ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma spangs pa ni ya nga ba ma spangs pa'o //

original: 'di ni mdor bstan pa ste lhag ma ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mdor bstan pa ste lhag ma ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //

original: blon po dag gis zhes bya ba ni gtso bo rnams so //
analyzed: blon po dag gis zhes bya ba ni gtso bo rnams so //

original: smra ba ni yang dag par smra ba tsam mo //
analyzed: smra ba ni yang dag par smra ba tsam mo //

original: gtam zer ba ni lus tsho la sogs pa'i 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: gtam zer ba ni lus tsho la sogs pa'i 'dri ba'o //
translated: To converse means to ask about the body, etc.

original: ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang zhig sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pas de'i phyi rol tu bzhag pas na pha rol gyi rgol ba rab tu zhi ba'i rgyu nyid kyi yon tan gzhan sems 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir gsungs pa /

analyzed: bar snang gi nam mkha' la 'dug nas zhes bya ba ni nam mkhas nam mkhar song ba rnams so //

original: yun ring mo zhig na zhes bya ba ni ring pas so //
analyzed: yun ring mo zhig na zhes bya ba ni ring pas so //
translated: After a long time means after a long period.

original: nang du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni slar 'ongs pas so //
analyzed: nang du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni slar 'ongs pas so //
translated: They emerged means they came back.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba so sor 'di nges par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba so sor 'di nges par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach the individual certainty of the appearance of the Buddha.
