analyzed: yang lha'i me tog rnams bzung nas zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' bas slar mchod pa la 'jug pa'o // bar chad med pa nyid kyi yon tan lha'i bu rnams de gdul @91a * //
translated: Again, having taken up the divine flowers, etc., is the engagement in the worship with joy.

original: bya rnams kyi slad du smras pa /
analyzed: bya rnams kyi slad du smras pa /
translated: The quality of being without obstacles is spoken of by the sons of the gods, for the sake of those to be trained.

original: sems can gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those sentient beings, etc.

original: de dag la ni bdud dam zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyis dran pa nyid kyi mthu de gcig pur yod par ma zad kyi 'on kyang sems can gzhan gyis yid la byas pa la yang skyon thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dgongs
analyzed: de dag la ni bdud dam zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyis dran pa nyid kyi mthu de gcig pur yod par ma zad kyi 'on kyang sems can gzhan gyis yid la byas pa la yang skyon thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dgongs
translated: There, Mara, etc., is the power of mindfulness alone that exists for them. However, the thought is that the other sentient beings who have taken it to mind also have the antidote to all faults.

original: pa'o // ngan don ni chung ba'o //
analyzed: pa'o // ngan don ni chung ba'o //
translated: Evil means small.

original: bgyi ba bgyis pas na bgyi ba bgyis pa'o //
analyzed: bgyi ba bgyis pas na bgyi ba bgyis pa'o //
translated: Having done what is to be done, it is having done what is to be done.

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan pa'i skal ba nyid dang rjes su mthun pa sngar nyan pa sangs rgyas rnams la chos gos sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan pa'i skal ba nyid dang rjes su mthun pa sngar nyan pa sangs rgyas rnams la chos gos sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: The Blessed One's own fortune of listening is the root of merit of giving Dharma robes, etc. to the Buddhas in the past.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin nyid kyi dngos po ni de bzhin nyid de slob pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams la'o //
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin nyid kyi dngos po ni de bzhin nyid de slob pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams la'o //
translated: As for the reality of suchness in the perfection of wisdom, the three phrases beginning with suchness refer to the stages of preparation, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgya mtsho chen po las zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid rgya mtsho chen po ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgya mtsho chen po las zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid rgya mtsho chen po ste /
translated: The phrase from the great ocean of the perfection of wisdom means that the perfection of wisdom itself is the great ocean.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba nyid yang yon tan gzhan bstan par byed pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba nyid yang yon tan gzhan bstan par byed pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: To teach another quality, [the text] says then and so on.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa rab tu song bas pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa rab tu song bas pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection is because of going to the end of giving and so on.

original: bsngags pa ni bstod pa'am yon tan no //
analyzed: bsngags pa ni bstod pa'am yon tan no //
translated: Praise is eulogy or virtue.

original: gsungs pa ni dus gcig tu brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsungs pa ni dus gcig tu brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Spoken is because it is expressed at one time.

original: yongs su sgrogs pa ni rgyun gyis so //
analyzed: yongs su sgrogs pa ni rgyun gyis so //
translated: Proclaimed is because of continuity.

original: de ltar na yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyur gyur pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan yang srid pas 'di nyid gcig pu la yang dag par sgrogs pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyur gyur pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan yang srid pas 'di nyid gcig pu la yang dag par sgrogs pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: In that case, since the other perfections are also causes of omniscience, it is not reasonable to proclaim just this one alone. This is the idea.

original: sngon du 'gro ba ste zhes bya ba ni mdun ni lus so //
analyzed: sngon du 'gro ba ste zhes bya ba ni mdun ni lus so //
translated: Preceding means in front, that is, the body.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of giving, etc., is for the sake of liberation.

original: 'di nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in terms of negation:

original: de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: What do you think about this? and so on.

original: de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yongs su bsngo ba med pas mchog nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yongs su bsngo ba med pas mchog nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not so means that it is not reasonable to be supreme without dedicating to omniscience.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sbyin pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yongs su sngo bar byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sbyin pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yongs su sngo bar byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: The inconceivable is as follows: When one dedicates generosity to omniscience,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'bras bu'i @91b sa la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa nyid so sor rtogs nas sbyin par byed pa de'i tshe sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'bras bu'i @91b sa la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa nyid so sor rtogs nas sbyin par byed pa de'i tshe sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob pa yin no //
translated: at that time, one gives by realizing the non-duality of the perfection of generosity and omniscience, because there is no difference in the fruition ground. At that time, one attains the name of the perfection of generosity.

original: dmigs pa mthong ba 'di yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i las 'di ni sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kun rdzob tu tha dad pa mthong ste //
analyzed: dmigs pa mthong ba 'di yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i las 'di ni sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kun rdzob tu tha dad pa mthong ste //
translated: This seeing of the object is also the activity of the perfection of wisdom. One sees the conventional differences of generosity and so forth.

original: don dam par gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas mthong ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas mthong ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Because one sees them as non-dual ultimately through the yoga of non-duality, it is inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid rab tu song ba'i mchog tu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid rab tu song ba'i mchog tu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: It is the supreme inconceivable that has gone to the inconceivable.

original: de ltar na yang don dam par dmigs pas mchog nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang nyid las pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yang don dam par dmigs pas mchog nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang nyid las pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Nevertheless, since it is the supreme object in the ultimate sense, it is the perfection of wisdom itself that is the perfection beyond.🔽

original: gzhan la ltos pas ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pas ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, because of the supremacy of the object, the perfection is in the perfection of wisdom itself, not in another.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: 'dren pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dren pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: Guide means one who brings together.🔽Leader means one who brings to the attainment of omniscience.

original: yongs su 'dren pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su thob par byed pa'i phyir kho na'i nang du 'dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di med pas pha rol tu phyin pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dren pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su thob par byed pa'i phyir kho na'i nang du 'dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di med pas pha rol tu phyin pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Only in this means that without it, there would be no perfection.

original: rang gi ngo bo thob pa ni 'di kho na'i nang du 'dus so zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo thob pa ni 'di kho na'i nang du 'dus so zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: Attainment of its own nature means that it is included in this alone. This is the intention.

original: bshad pa'i don la dpe gsungs pa ni 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bshad pa'i don la dpe gsungs pa ni 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The example for the meaning of the explanation is stated: For example, etc.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa 'phel ba thob pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa 'phel ba thob pa yin no //
translated: The five perfections arise means that one attains the increase that is in accord with the attainment of omniscience.

original: mjug sdud par byed pa ni de lta bas na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud par byed pa ni de lta bas na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The conclusion is: Therefore.

original: slar yang brgya byin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad med pa nyid kyi yon tan gsungs pa ni re zhig bya ba ste /
analyzed: slar yang brgya byin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad med pa nyid kyi yon tan gsungs pa ni re zhig bya ba ste /
translated: Again, Śatakratu speaks of the immeasurable quality of the perfection of wisdom:

original: yon tan thams cad ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu bsgrags pa'o //
translated: All qualities means those proclaimed by the Blessed One.

original: de rnams kyang tshad med pa'i yon tan yang dag par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang tshad med pa'i yon tan yang dag par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: And those are the immeasurable qualities that arise means the intention.🔽Whoever takes up, etc.

original: gang zhig phyogs zhes bya ba ni phan yon no //
analyzed: gang zhig phyogs zhes bya ba ni phan yon no //
translated: is the benefit.🔽To the extent that one takes up, etc.

original: ji tsam yang bzung zhing zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji tsam yang bzung zhing zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: is the taking up.

original: rab tu bton pa zhes bya ba ni mi brjed pa'i don du shin tu goms par byas pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bton pa zhes bya ba ni mi brjed pa'i don du shin tu goms par byas pa'o //
translated: To make it widely known means to make it very familiar for the sake of not forgetting it.

original: legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni 'di tshad med pa'i phan yon bstan no //
analyzed: legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni 'di tshad med pa'i phan yon bstan no //
translated: Well said, well said! is the teaching of immeasurable benefits.

original: kho bos ni phan yon rnams kyi phyogs tsam yongs su bsgrags par byas pas zhes bya ba ni yang dag par brgya byin khyod kyis rtogs zhes bya ba @92a * //
analyzed: kho bos ni phan yon rnams kyi phyogs tsam yongs su bsgrags par byas pas zhes bya ba ni yang dag par brgya byin khyod kyis rtogs zhes bya ba @92a * //
translated: I have proclaimed only a fraction of the benefits, means You, Indra, should understand correctly.

original: la bcom ldan 'das kyis legs su bya ba'o //
analyzed: la bcom ldan 'das kyis legs su bya ba'o //
translated: The Blessed One said Well done!

original: gang zhig 'di glegs bam du chud par dam pa'i chos ring du gnas pa'i phyir bzhag nas mchod pa byed pa de'i yang phan yon 'di thams cad ces bya ba gsungs pa ni yang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig 'di glegs bam du chud par dam pa'i chos ring du gnas pa'i phyir bzhag nas mchod pa byed pa de'i yang phan yon 'di thams cad ces bya ba gsungs pa ni yang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: He who, having placed this in a book for the long-lasting of the true Dharma, makes offerings, for him also all these benefits are said to be the same, beginning with correct.

original: brgya byin yang phan yon gzhan klan ka med pa dang / skrag pa la sogs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa mang ba la dga' ba nyid dang / rgol ba pha rol po tshar gcod pa'i nus pa dang / lha thams cad dang /
analyzed: brgya byin yang phan yon gzhan klan ka med pa dang / skrag pa la sogs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa mang ba la dga' ba nyid dang / rgol ba pha rol po tshar gcod pa'i nus pa dang / lha thams cad dang /
translated: Indra also has other benefits: being faultless, fearless, and so on, delighting in the many worldly things, the ability to defeat opponents, and all gods, nāgas, yakṣas, and so on

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa dang / gdul bya de rnams kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du chos sbyin pa dang / lha de rnams kyis bsrungs pa dang / lha rnams 'ong ba'i rtags rnams dang // dman pa'i lha rnams ldog pa dang //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa dang / gdul bya de rnams kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du chos sbyin pa dang / lha de rnams kyis bsrungs pa dang / lha rnams 'ong ba'i rtags rnams dang // dman pa'i lha rnams ldog pa dang //
translated: The signs of the approach of the gods are: the retention of the perfection of wisdom, the gift of the Dharma as a cause for the completion of the collections of those to be trained, the protection of those gods, the signs of the coming of the gods, the departure of inferior gods,

original: dang ba mang ba nyid dang / chos tshul gnas pa'i gtsang ba nyid dang / gdung ba med pa nyid dang / bde ba skyed pa dang / rmi lam legs par mthong ba dang / lus la yang gzi brjid 'jug pa dang / zas rnams la nga rgyal med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang ba mang ba nyid dang / chos tshul gnas pa'i gtsang ba nyid dang / gdung ba med pa nyid dang / bde ba skyed pa dang / rmi lam legs par mthong ba dang / lus la yang gzi brjid 'jug pa dang / zas rnams la nga rgyal med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: great clarity, purity of abiding in the way of the Dharma, freedom from distress, the production of bliss, seeing good dreams, the entry of splendor into the body, and the absence of pride in regard to food.

original: de la spobs pa ni ji ltar brtsams pa'i chos kyi don mi brjed pa'o //
analyzed: de la spobs pa ni ji ltar brtsams pa'i chos kyi don mi brjed pa'o //
translated: Eloquence is the non-forgetting of the meaning of the Dharma as it has been studied.

original: 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is desire.

original: rgol ba ni 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: rgol ba ni 'dri ba'o //
translated: Questioning is asking.

original: shin tu yongs su goms pa'i stong pa nyid kyi phyir kun tu mi skrag pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu yongs su goms pa'i stong pa nyid kyi phyir kun tu mi skrag pa'o //
translated: Non-terror is due to thorough familiarity with emptiness.

original: snag gi gnyen mtshams ni pha ma gcig las skyes pa'i spun la tshogs pa'o //🔽chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snag gi gnyen mtshams ni pha ma gcig las skyes pa'i spun la tshogs pa'o // chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Kinsmen by the same blood are brothers born from the same parents.🔽Those who are righteous means

original: chos ni ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: chos ni ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: those who are in accordance with the Dharma.

original: 'dud pa byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bstod pa sngon du 'gro bas phyag 'tshal bar byas pas so //
analyzed: 'dud pa byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bstod pa sngon du 'gro bas phyag 'tshal bar byas pas so //
translated: They will bow down means that they will pay homage with praise preceding.

original: lha rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa drug dang / bsam gtan dang po la tshangs ris la sogs pa gsum mo //🔽gnyis pa la 'od chung la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: lha rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa drug dang / bsam gtan dang po la tshangs ris la sogs pa gsum mo // gnyis pa la 'od chung la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: The gods are the six gods of the desire realm and the three of the first concentration, such as the Brahmakayika.🔽In the second concentration there are three such as Parittabha.

original: gsum pa la dge chung la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la dge chung la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the third concentration there are three such as Apramanasubha.

original: bzhi pa la sprin med la sogs pa brgyad dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can /
analyzed: bzhi pa la sprin med la sogs pa brgyad dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can /
translated: In the fourth concentration there are eight such as Akanistha and the beings of the non-percipient realm.

original: 'bras bu che ba'i phyogs gcig las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'i phyogs gcig las byung ba'o //
translated: They arise from one part of the Bṛhatphala realm.

original: de rnams kyi yang sngon gyi smon lam las der nye bar 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang sngon gyi smon lam las der nye bar 'ong ba'o //
translated: They come there due to their previous aspirations.

original: lta bar gyur pa la sogs pa ni de rnams la med ces smra ba'o //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa la sogs pa ni de rnams la med ces smra ba'o //
translated: It is said that they do not have views and so on.

original: snang ba chen po dag mthong na //🔽zhes bya ba ni /🔽mar me la @92b sogs pa las lhag pa'i snang ba dang yang dag par shes pa zhes mtshon par byed pa ni nges par bya ba la nges par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba chen po dag mthong na // zhes bya ba ni / mar me la @92b sogs pa las lhag pa'i snang ba dang yang dag par shes pa zhes mtshon par byed pa ni nges par bya ba la nges par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If they see great lights,🔽This shows that they will have a vision and knowledge surpassing that of a lamp.

original: shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes par bya ba'o //
translated: The word “know” is used in the sense of “to be sure” in the sense of “to be certain.”

original: mi'am zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi'am zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Human” means having magical powers.

original: 'ongs shing zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs su 'gro bas so //
analyzed: 'ongs shing zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs su 'gro bas so //
translated: “Come” means to go to a place.

original: lhags pa zhes bya ba ni khyim la sogs par rab tu zhugs pas so //
analyzed: lhags pa zhes bya ba ni khyim la sogs par rab tu zhugs pas so //
translated: “Approach” means to enter a house, etc.

original: mi ma yin pa'i dri zhes bya ba ni mi rnams las byung bas na mi'i'o //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i dri zhes bya ba ni mi rnams las byung bas na mi'i'o //
translated: “Human scent” means that which comes from humans.

original: de ltar ma yin pa ni mi ma yin pa'i'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin pa ni mi ma yin pa'i'o //
translated: “Non-human” is the opposite of that.

original: gzob par 'gyur ba ni yid du 'ong ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gzob par 'gyur ba ni yid du 'ong ba nyid kyis so //
translated: “Pleasant” means agreeable.

original: gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba med pas so //
analyzed: gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba med pas so //
translated: “Pure” means not impure.

original: yi rangs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: yi rangs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams ni rnam grangs so //
translated: “Rejoice” and so on are synonyms.

original: dpal dang gzi brjid ni mthu'o //
analyzed: dpal dang gzi brjid ni mthu'o //
translated: “Glory” and “splendor” mean power.

original: btsun pa ni mchod par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: btsun pa ni mchod par bya ba nyid do //
translated: The venerable is worthy of worship.

original: dad pa mang bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa 'ongs pa mchod pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa mang bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa 'ongs pa mchod pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The increase of faith is the knowledge of the worship of the gods and so on who have come.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma la yang dad par nye bar skyes pa'i dang bas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma la yang dad par nye bar skyes pa'i dang bas so //
translated: And the arising of devotion is the devotion to the Bhagavatī.

original: ngal ba la ni gnod pa'o //
analyzed: ngal ba la ni gnod pa'o //
translated: The harm to fatigue is the harm to the fatigue of going.

original: 'gro ba la zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du gzhung dang / don nges par byed pa la mngon par brtson pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'gro ba la zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du gzhung dang / don nges par byed pa la mngon par brtson pa rnams so //
translated: The going is the mutual effort to ascertain the text and the meaning.

original: dga' ba'i zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis de nyid la'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis de nyid la'o //
translated: The delight is the continuity of that.

original: 'gro bar byed pa nyid gsungs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro bar byed pa nyid gsungs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The going is stated as follows: Thus, having gone to the place of the Dharma...🔽 The sound of manifest enlightenment is as follows:🔽 The thusness is the thusness of the Tathāgata.🔽 The manifest enlightenment is the manifest enlightenment of the Tathāgata.🔽 The sound is the sound of the Dharma.🔽 The here is the place of the Dharma.🔽 The manifest enlightenment is the manifest enlightenment of the Tathāgata.🔽 The sound is the sound of the Dharma.🔽 The here is the place of the Dharma.🔽 The manifest enlightenment is the manifest enlightenment of the Tathāgata.🔽 The sound is the sound of the Dharma.🔽 The here is the place of the Dharma.🔽 The manifest enlightenment is the manifest enlightenment of the Tathāgata.🔽 The sound is the sound of the Dharma.🔽 The here is the place of the Dharma.🔽 The manifest enlightenment is the manifest enlightenment of the Tathāgata.🔽 The sound is the sound of the Dharma.🔽 The here is the place of the Dharma.🔽 The manifest enlightenment is the manifest enlightenment of the Tathāgata.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i sgra zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i sgra zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sound is the sound of the Dharma.🔽 The here is the place of the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'di 'dir mngon par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'di 'dir mngon par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The manifest enlightenment is the manifest enlightenment of the Tathāgata.🔽 The sound is the sound of the Dharma.🔽 The here is the place of the Dharma.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ci zhig mdzad ce na /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ci zhig mdzad ce na /
translated: The manifest enlightenment is the manifest enlightenment of the Tathāgata.

original: gsungs pa ni phyogs ga ge mo zhig nas ji srid du chos ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsungs pa ni phyogs ga ge mo zhig nas ji srid du chos ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the Dharma is taught from some direction.

original: yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi sgra zhes bya ba yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi sgra sgrogs pa nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi sgra zhes bya ba yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi sgra sgrogs pa nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The sound of perfect enlightenment is also mentioned: the sound of perfect enlightenment is proclaimed.

original: phyogs ga ge mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs ga ge mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In some direction, etc.

original: sad par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sad par gyur pa sbyor bas so //
analyzed: sad par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sad par gyur pa sbyor bas so //
translated: One will awaken is said because of the application of awakening.

original: mdangs rab tu bcug pas zhes bya ba ni lha'i mthus mdangs thob pa dang / stobs thob pa dang / bya ba thams cad nus pa'o //
analyzed: mdangs rab tu bcug pas zhes bya ba ni lha'i mthus mdangs thob pa dang / stobs thob pa dang / bya ba thams cad nus pa'o //
translated: By the infusion of radiance is by the attainment of radiance through the power of the gods, by the attainment of strength, and by the ability to perform all actions.

original: yang zhing yang ba nyid myong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lci ba'i dngos po dang bral bas rmugs pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang zhing yang ba nyid myong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lci ba'i dngos po dang bral bas rmugs pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One will experience lightness is said because of the freedom from heavy things, and the teaching of sluggishness, etc.

original: brkam pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: brkam pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Greed is desire.

original: 'du shes ni dran pa'o //🔽rnal 'byor ni zhi gnas dang / @93a * //
analyzed: 'du shes ni dran pa'o // rnal 'byor ni zhi gnas dang / @93a * //
translated: Notion is memory.

original: lhag mthong zung du 'brel ba rgyu ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: lhag mthong zung du 'brel ba rgyu ba'i lam mo //
translated: Yoga is the path of union of serenity and insight.

original: de spyod pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis kha sten par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de spyod pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis kha sten par byed pa'am /
translated: Its practice is its cultivation by the path of meditative development.

original: de spyod pa ni gnas pa 'di la yod pas na rnal 'byor spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de spyod pa ni gnas pa 'di la yod pas na rnal 'byor spyod pa'o //
translated: Or else, since its practice exists in this state, it is the practice of yoga.

original: ci ltar rigs pa 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa ni rnal 'byor nyid de de'i yongs su brlan pa ni 'dra ba'i brlan pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar rigs pa 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa ni rnal 'byor nyid de de'i yongs su brlan pa ni 'dra ba'i brlan pa'o //
translated: The yoga itself is the mental attention of the Noble Disciples etc. as is appropriate. Its moisture is the moisture of similarity.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i bde ba rjes su 'jug pa'i ngo bo gang la yod pa de de lta bu'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i bde ba rjes su 'jug pa'i ngo bo gang la yod pa de de lta bu'o //
translated: That in which there is the nature of the subsequent penetration of the bliss born of meditative concentration is such.

original: ci ltar ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i bde ba rgyu mthun pa med par yang 'di zhes gsungs pa ni de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i bde ba rgyu mthun pa med par yang 'di zhes gsungs pa ni de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: How is it that this is said to be without the natural outcome of the bliss born of meditative concentration?🔽The cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is also the intention here to assist and gather the bodhisattvas etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgom pa yang 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rjes su bzung ba dang / nye bar sdud pa la sogs pa bsam pa nyid de tsam gyis ci ltar zhes gsungs pa ni de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgom pa yang 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rjes su bzung ba dang / nye bar sdud pa la sogs pa bsam pa nyid de tsam gyis ci ltar zhes gsungs pa ni de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: How is it that this is said to be just that? It is said that this is just that, i.e. the intention to assist and gather the bodhisattvas etc.

original: 'di dag kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for these as well,

original: sngar gsungs pa gcig pur ma zad kyi gang yang yon tan 'di rnams rnyed pa yin zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan yang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa gcig pur ma zad kyi gang yang yon tan 'di rnams rnyed pa yin zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan yang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is not only the previously mentioned ones, but also those who obtain these qualities. As for those who, etc.,

original: 'di'i rjes la glegs bam du chud par byas nas mchod pa sngon du 'gro bas gang du gzhag par bya ba der lha rnams nye bar 'ong ba la sogs pa bshad pa de de nyid kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi phan yon ci zhig yin nam zhes gsungs pa ni
analyzed: 'di'i rjes la glegs bam du chud par byas nas mchod pa sngon du 'gro bas gang du gzhag par bya ba der lha rnams nye bar 'ong ba la sogs pa bshad pa de de nyid kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi phan yon ci zhig yin nam zhes gsungs pa ni
translated: After this, it is explained that the gods come near, etc., where the book is placed, preceded by worship. What is the benefit of his magical power in that very case?

original: nyan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: As for those who listen, etc.,

original: gang zhig sngar bstan pa nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa la sogs pa yod pa la brten nas glegs bam gzhag pa nyid kyi de thams cad kyi phan yon 'di rnams zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sngar bstan pa nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa la sogs pa yod pa la brten nas glegs bam gzhag pa nyid kyi de thams cad kyi phan yon 'di rnams zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that all these benefits are for those who, based on listening, upholding, etc., to what was previously taught, place the book itself.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sngar bshad pa dang / rjes su mthun pa nyid nye bar bsdu bar byed pa ni de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽gzhan dag ni mthong ba'i chos kyi yon tan yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes su koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sngar bshad pa dang / rjes su mthun pa nyid nye bar bsdu bar byed pa ni de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // gzhan dag ni mthong ba'i chos kyi yon tan yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes su koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Therefore, in order to summarize the above explanation, it says “for that reason” and so forth.🔽Others will obtain the qualities of this visible world.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang 'di nas ji srid 'dzin par mi byed 'chad par mi byed de bas ni koo shi ka rigs kyi bu 'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo 'di nyid bsod nams mang du skyed de zhes bya bar lhag par 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang 'di nas ji srid 'dzin par mi byed 'chad par mi byed de bas ni koo shi ka rigs kyi bu 'am / rigs kyi bu mo 'di nyid bsod nams mang du skyed de zhes bya bar lhag par 'don pa yin no //
translated: After this, it is said, “Kauśika, moreover, a son or daughter of good family who does not take up or explain this will, Kauśika, generate much more merit than that son or daughter of good family.”🔽This is the additional recitation.

original: de bzhin du mchod pa rnam pa mang po dag gis kyang mchod par byed de zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes la koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du mchod pa rnam pa mang po dag gis kyang mchod par byed de zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes la koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Similarly, after “they will also make offerings with many kinds of offerings,” it is said, “Kauśika, a son or daughter of good family who does not take up or explain this will, Kauśika, generate much more merit than that son or daughter of good family.”

original: rigs kyi bu mo de @93b nyid de bas gzhi de las bsod nams ches mang du skyed par 'gyur te zhes bya ba lhag pa yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de @93b nyid de bas gzhi de las bsod nams ches mang du skyed par 'gyur te zhes bya ba lhag pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “that son of a good family or daughter of a good family would generate even more merit than that” is an addition.

original: 'di po ti rnying pa rnams la med pas btags pa nyid 'di zhes bya ba slob dpon rnams so //
analyzed: 'di po ti rnying pa rnams la med pas btags pa nyid 'di zhes bya ba slob dpon rnams so //
translated: Since this is not found in the old editions, the masters say that it is an interpolation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shin tu 'brel pa'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shin tu 'brel pa'i don ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not have the meaning of a very close connection.

original: po ti 'dzin pa tsam byed pa po las 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa po la bsod nams kyi khyad par ma bshad kyang grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: po ti 'dzin pa tsam byed pa po las 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa po la bsod nams kyi khyad par ma bshad kyang grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it is not explained that the person who merely holds the book generates more merit than the person who writes it, and so on, it is established.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma che ba 'ga' zhig las mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma che ba 'ga' zhig las mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not mentioned in some of the great commentaries.

original: ji ltar chen mo rnams las 'don pa de ltar ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar chen mo rnams las 'don pa de ltar ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable that it is recited in the great commentaries.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rkyen bzhi'i mchod pa las yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten byas pa la mchod pa bas bcom ldan 'das ma nyid la 'dzin pa la sogs pa
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rkyen bzhi'i mchod pa las yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten byas pa la mchod pa bas bcom ldan 'das ma nyid la 'dzin pa la sogs pa
translated: In all the world systems of the ten directions, the offerings made to all the buddhas through the four conditions are surpassed by the offerings made to the Bhagavatī herself, such as holding her in one's mind and so on.🔽

original: rnams med pas gus pa tsam gyis gcig tu bsod nams mang ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnams med pas gus pa tsam gyis gcig tu bsod nams mang ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: In all the world systems of the ten directions, there is no merit equal to that of the Blessed Lady, because the worship of all the Buddhas by means of the four conditions, and the worship of the reliquary stupas made of the seven jewels after their complete Nirvana, are not equal to the worship of the Blessed Lady alone.🔽And because of the absence of grasping, etc.,

original: de'i phyir mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba la chags pas 'di btags pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba la chags pas 'di btags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is a designation based on attachment to the realization of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshul ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshul ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The way of the Buddha is the perfection of wisdom,

original: de nyid ni spyan chen po la sha la sogs pa'i spyan lnga rnams las lhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni spyan chen po la sha la sogs pa'i spyan lnga rnams las lhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is superior to the five eyes of flesh, etc.

original: 'di la bral ba med pas bral ba ste de'i dngos po ni ma bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di la bral ba med pas bral ba ste de'i dngos po ni ma bral ba nyid do //
translated: It is inseparable, and its state is non-separation.

original: gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Inconceivable, etc.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis te glegs bam du chud par byas nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis te glegs bam du chud par byas nas /
translated: There are two kinds of retention of the perfections and the perfection of wisdom:

original: phyi rol tu bzhag pa gal te yang 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis nang du bzhag pa gzhal du med pa'i yon tan 'dzin pa gang la de pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol tu bzhag pa gal te yang 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis nang du bzhag pa gzhal du med pa'i yon tan 'dzin pa gang la de pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: retention of the perfection of wisdom in the form of books, and retention of the immeasurable good qualities of the perfection of wisdom which is retained internally by those who have it in mind.

original: mchod rten ni mchod rten te de dang de zhes gnyis pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: mchod rten ni mchod rten te de dang de zhes gnyis pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: Stūpa means a stūpa, and those refers to the two mentioned above.

original: de dag gnyis kyis bkur stir byed pa ni me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyis kyis bkur stir byed pa ni me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa'o //
translated: Those who honor them with flowers, etc. make offerings to them.

original: de dag rjod par byed pa'i le'u ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang mchod rten la bkur sti byed pa gzhal du med pa'i yon tan 'dzin pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: de dag rjod par byed pa'i le'u ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang mchod rten la bkur sti byed pa gzhal du med pa'i yon tan 'dzin pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste gsum pa'o /
translated: The chapter that describes them is called the chapter on the retention of the immeasurable good qualities of the perfections and the honoring of the stūpas.

original: // / de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skus yongs su gang ba'i 'dzam bu'i gling las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzung ba nyid mchod pa la sogs pa'i don du 'os pa zhes @94a * //🔽bstan pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das brgya byin la dri bar byed pa ni gal te khyod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: // / de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skus yongs su gang ba'i 'dzam bu'i gling las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzung ba nyid mchod pa la sogs pa'i don du 'os pa zhes @94a * // bstan pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das brgya byin la dri bar byed pa ni gal te khyod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: That is, it is suitable to take up the perfection of wisdom in order to worship it, etc., from a Jambudvipa filled with the bodies of Tathagatas.🔽In order to demonstrate that, the Lord asks Sakra: If someone were to fill with precious substances as many world-realms as there are sands in the Ganges River and offer them to the Tathagatas,

original: 'on te gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang mnyam pa'i sems can thams cad la thob par byed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi snying po can rin po che sna bdun gyi rang bzhin can gyi mchod rten byed pas de🔽mchod pa rnams las /
analyzed: 'on te gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang mnyam pa'i sems can thams cad la thob par byed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi snying po can rin po che sna bdun gyi rang bzhin can gyi mchod rten byed pas de mchod pa rnams las /
translated: and if someone else were to take up this perfection of wisdom, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchod pa la bsod nams mang ba nyid sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchod pa la bsod nams mang ba nyid sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The superiority of the merit in the worship of the perfection of wisdom has already been explained.

original: de nyid kyis 'di thams cad rtogs zhes slar rnam pa gzhan gyis nye bar bkod pa ni ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis 'di thams cad rtogs zhes slar rnam pa gzhan gyis nye bar bkod pa ni ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is the use of again setting forth this in another way, “by that he understands all this”?

original: bden te 'on kyang sngar gang zhig rgyu gsungs pa de brgya byin gyi sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir yang rgyas par nye bar bkod pa'o //🔽sku rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang sngar gang zhig rgyu gsungs pa de brgya byin gyi sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir yang rgyas par nye bar bkod pa'o // sku rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is true, but it is set forth again in detail in order to show by way of Indra that which was previously stated as the cause.

original: byed pa drug pa ste de rnams kyis yongs su gang ba'o //
analyzed: byed pa drug pa ste de rnams kyis yongs su gang ba'o //
translated: “The bodies” is the sixth case, and they are filled with those.

original: khyab pa tsam gyis ci zhig yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni byur bur yongs su bkang ste zhes bya ba ni gtsug phud kyi mthar thug par byed pas so //
analyzed: khyab pa tsam gyis ci zhig yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni byur bur yongs su bkang ste zhes bya ba ni gtsug phud kyi mthar thug par byed pas so //
translated: What is the use of just the pervasion? “Filled to overflowing” is the seventh case, because of the filling up to the topknot.

original: byin pa la zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i don du nye bar sbyin par bya ba'o //
analyzed: byin pa la zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i don du nye bar sbyin par bya ba'o //
translated: “The thighs” is the fourth case, because they are to be given for the purpose of worship.

original: brdabs na zhes bya ba ni cig shos long shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: brdabs na zhes bya ba ni cig shos long shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: “When they are struck” is the second case, because of the striking of the other.

original: ri mor bgyi ba ni gus pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: ri mor bgyi ba ni gus pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: “One should make an image” is the special respect.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma ni de rnams las shin tu bla mar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma ni de rnams las shin tu bla mar gyur pa ste /
translated: Because the Blessed Lady is the most excellent of them all.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i don gyi sku'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i don gyi sku'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the body of the Tathagata in the sense of the ultimate, which is the perfection of wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i don ni de kho na nyid kyi don te de dang ldan pa'i phyir bden pa'i don no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don ni de kho na nyid kyi don te de dang ldan pa'i phyir bden pa'i don no //
translated: The ultimate is the meaning of reality, and because it possesses that, it is the meaning of truth.

original: sku ni ring bsrel rnams ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sku ni ring bsrel rnams ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The body is not the relics.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la yul nyid kyis dam par zhes bya ba bstan par nus pa'i sku ni dam pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la yul nyid kyis dam par zhes bya ba bstan par nus pa'i sku ni dam pa'i sku ste /
translated: The body of the most excellent is the body that is able to demonstrate the most excellent by means of eye-consciousness, etc.,

original: gzugs kyi sku zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of which is the body of form.🔽The perfection of the Dharma body

original: chos kyi skus yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi skus yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la /
translated: is the perfection of the Dharma body.

original: 'dir yongs su rdzogs pa ni rtogs pa ste de skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yongs su rdzogs pa ni rtogs pa ste de skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Here, perfection is realization, because it is non-arising.

original: chos kyi sku kun tu rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad las 'das pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis yongs su bzung ba med par 'os pa'i gtso bo'i sku nyid yod mod /
analyzed: chos kyi sku kun tu rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad las 'das pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis yongs su bzung ba med par 'os pa'i gtso bo'i sku nyid yod mod /
translated: The Dharma Body is the foremost body, which is suitable to be taken up as the emptiness nature that transcends all characteristics of conceptualization and discrimination.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma la ci zhig 'byung zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma la ci zhig 'byung zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: What happens to the Bhagavatī?

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: This is stated in the verse beginning with “also.”

original: @94b yang dag pa'i mtha' ni stong pa nyid de des rab tu phye ba ni skyes pa ste /
analyzed: @94b yang dag pa'i mtha' ni stong pa nyid de des rab tu phye ba ni skyes pa ste /
translated: The limit of reality is emptiness, and that which is distinguished by it is born.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom is the essence of the teaching on the cause of the Dharma-dhātu.

original: don ni 'di yin te chos kyi sku ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste gtso bo'o //
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te chos kyi sku ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste gtso bo'o //
translated: The meaning is this: The Dharma Body is the Tathāgata, the foremost.

original: der ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir yongs su bzung ba dang mchod pa la sogs pa nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir yongs su bzung ba dang mchod pa la sogs pa nus pa ma yin no //
translated: There, because it is the nature of emptiness, it is not possible to take it up, make offerings, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma ni chos kyi sku'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa bcom ldan 'das dang / gzhan rnams kyi des rab tu phye ba de'i phyir gzugs kyi sku la chos kyi sku dang 'dra bas mchod par bya ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma ni chos kyi sku'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa bcom ldan 'das dang / gzhan rnams kyi des rab tu phye ba de'i phyir gzugs kyi sku la chos kyi sku dang 'dra bas mchod par bya ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Blessed Lady is the cause of the Dharma Body, and the others are distinguished by that. Therefore, the Form Body is to be worshipped as if it were the Dharma Body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel rnams la gus pa nyid med dam ci zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel rnams la gus pa nyid med dam ci zhe na /
translated: But is there not respect for the relics of the Tathagata?

original: ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni mi gus pa yang ma lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni mi gus pa yang ma lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The statement no means not disrespectful, etc.

original: de rnams la ma gus pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /🔽bdag ni ring bsrel rnams la ma gus par 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams la ma gus pa med pa zhes bya ba ste / bdag ni ring bsrel rnams la ma gus par 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyad par gyi don du'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyad par gyi don du'o //
translated: The word but has the sense of distinction.

original: gal te yang kho bo la de rnams la gus pa de lta na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te yang kho bo la de rnams la gus pa de lta na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means even though I have that respect for them.

original: yang gi sgra ni sngar yang khyad par gsungs pa nyid kyang phyir ro //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni sngar yang khyad par gsungs pa nyid kyang phyir ro //
translated: The word also is used because a distinction was previously stated.

original: 'khrungs te zhes bya ba ni khyad par nyid kyis de'i rgyu nyid go ba ste /
analyzed: 'khrungs te zhes bya ba ni khyad par nyid kyis de'i rgyu nyid go ba ste /
translated: The phrase having been born indicates the cause of that, namely, the special nature of the Buddha's body.

original: 'khrungs pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khrungs pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because of being born.

original: dpe ni 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dpe ni 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The example is stated in the passage beginning with the words for example.

original: lha'i 'dun sa la rten nyid kyi phyir lha'i 'dun sa ni khang pa chen po'o //
analyzed: lha'i 'dun sa la rten nyid kyi phyir lha'i 'dun sa ni khang pa chen po'o //
translated: The assembly hall of the gods is the great palace because it is the very basis of the assembly of the gods.

original: de yang dpag tshad bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa chur ste /
analyzed: de yang dpag tshad bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa chur ste /
translated: It is forty-five yojanas in height and thirty yojanas in width.

original: zheng du ni dpag tshad sum cu pa rin po che'i tshogs sna tshogs pa las brdungs pa de yang lha'i grong khyer blta na sdug pa la dpag tshad nyi shu la lho phyogs dang nub phyogs kyi cha la'o //
analyzed: zheng du ni dpag tshad sum cu pa rin po che'i tshogs sna tshogs pa las brdungs pa de yang lha'i grong khyer blta na sdug pa la dpag tshad nyi shu la lho phyogs dang nub phyogs kyi cha la'o //
translated: It is made of various precious substances and is located in the city of the gods, Sudarśana, twenty yojanas to the south and west.

original: bdag la gus pas zhes bya ba ni gdan gyi rang gi ngo bo chen po nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag la gus pas zhes bya ba ni gdan gyi rang gi ngo bo chen po nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase out of respect for me refers to the greatness of the seat, not to the greatness of the Buddha's own body.

analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: brgya byin ltar mi mnyam pa de'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i ring bsrel rnams zhes mchod pas kyang byang chub yang dag par 'byung ba la sogs pa rnams nye ba bsags pa yin no //
translated: By worshipping them, one accumulates the requisites for the arising of enlightenment, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes nyid kyi rgyu dang rkyen du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes nyid kyi rgyu dang rkyen du gyur pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavatī is the cause and condition for the knowledge of all things.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma nges par gyis pa nyid ring bsrel rnams mchod pa la bcom ldan 'das ma bzhin du ring bsrel rnams ni ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni rkyen du gyur pa ma lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma nges par gyis pa nyid ring bsrel rnams mchod pa la bcom ldan 'das ma bzhin du ring bsrel rnams ni ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni rkyen du gyur pa ma lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavatī is the definite cause, but the relics are not like the Bhagavatī.

original: kha cig ni dgag tshig dang med pa nyid 'don pa yin te bshad pa yang yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni dgag tshig dang med pa nyid 'don pa yin te bshad pa yang yin no //
translated: Some read the negative particle and the word “not” in the phrase “not a condition,” etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa goms pa nyid las thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrub par gyur pa'i sku rnams ni rkyen du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa goms pa nyid las thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrub par gyur pa'i sku rnams ni rkyen du gyur pa ste /
translated: The bodies that are produced from the practice of the perfection of wisdom are the conditions for the knowledge of all things.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la bkod nas sku'i khyad par gyi rkyen nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la bkod nas sku'i khyad par gyi rkyen nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it is the very condition of the special body of the mind consciousness.

original: de ltar yang ring bsrel rnams las bcom ldan 'das ma la khyad par 'ga' yang gsungs pa med pa yin zhes 'di ni bsam par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang ring bsrel rnams las bcom ldan 'das ma la khyad par 'ga' yang gsungs pa med pa yin zhes 'di ni bsam par bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the Blessed Lady does not say anything about any special quality of the relics.

original: de ni brgya byin gyis gang bar byas pa'i stong pa chen po'i ring bsrel rnams las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzung ba ste /
analyzed: de ni brgya byin gyis gang bar byas pa'i stong pa chen po'i ring bsrel rnams las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzung ba ste /
translated: That is the wisdom-gone-beyond that is taken up from the relics of the Great Empty that are filled by Indra.
