original: ji ltar nor bu rin po che phyung yang za ma tog de snying du sdug par 'gyur ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang de'i yum dag gi yon tan rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang ring @95b bsrel rnams ni mchod par
analyzed: ji ltar nor bu rin po che phyung yang za ma tog de snying du sdug par 'gyur ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang de'i yum dag gi yon tan rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang ring @95b bsrel rnams ni mchod par
translated: Just as the jewel-case is cherished even after the precious jewel has been taken out, so also the relics of the Lord are to be worshipped even after the Buddha and his Mother have passed into Nirvana.

original: bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is taught by the verse beginning “Just as, for example…”

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams kyis so //
translated: “Such a nature” refers to the one that is going to be explained.

original: tshar gcod ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis kyis tshar gcod pas 'phel ba 'gegs pa dang rab tu zhi bas so //
analyzed: tshar gcod ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis kyis tshar gcod pas 'phel ba 'gegs pa dang rab tu zhi bas so //
translated: “Subduing” means subduing by two means: by preventing increase and by complete pacification.

original: srog chags phra mo zhes bya ba ni drag po rnams so //
analyzed: srog chags phra mo zhes bya ba ni drag po rnams so //
translated: “Small creatures” means fierce ones.

original: gzhan dag dang yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag dang yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “And others” means

original: de rnam bstan par byed pa ni gang su dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnam bstan par byed pa ni gang su dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: those who are to be taught. “Whoever” and so on.

original: 'di thams cad kyis nor bu rin po che'i yon tan bstan pas bcom ldan 'das ma dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yon tan rnams dpes mtshon par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyis nor bu rin po che'i yon tan bstan pas bcom ldan 'das ma dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yon tan rnams dpes mtshon par blta bar bya'o //
translated: All of this should be seen as illustrating the qualities of the Blessed Lady and the wisdom of omniscience, by means of the qualities of the precious jewel.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chen po rnams las 'don pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chen po rnams las 'don pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is extracted from the great ones.

original: rin po che chen po zhes bya ba 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rin po che chen po zhes bya ba 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This great jewel is a synonym for the perfection of wisdom and the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de la 'jug pa la don du gnyer ba'i mi rnams la sogs pa nye bar bsams pas bdud la sogs pa nyid bar 'ongs pa dang / sbrul la sogs pa tshar gcod pa khong khro ba dang / 'dod chags dang gti mug rnams kyi tshar gcod pa dang /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa la don du gnyer ba'i mi rnams la sogs pa nye bar bsams pas bdud la sogs pa nyid bar 'ongs pa dang / sbrul la sogs pa tshar gcod pa khong khro ba dang / 'dod chags dang gti mug rnams kyi tshar gcod pa dang /
translated: There, the bodhisattva who is intent on the welfare of beings who are seeking to enter the path, etc., is like the man who is intent on the welfare of people who are seeking to enter the jewel mine, etc. The bodhisattva's patience in putting up with the harm done by beings who are hostile, etc., is like the man's patience in putting up with the snakes, etc., that he encounters when he enters the jewel mine.

original: snang bar byed pa nyid kyi don gsal bar byed pa dang / dro ba rab tu zhi bas rgod pa dang / rgyags pa dang / nga rgyal la sogs pa med pa nyid dang / sa phyogs dro ba nyid kyis dge ba'i phyogs la spro ba dang /
analyzed: snang bar byed pa nyid kyi don gsal bar byed pa dang / dro ba rab tu zhi bas rgod pa dang / rgyags pa dang / nga rgyal la sogs pa med pa nyid dang / sa phyogs dro ba nyid kyis dge ba'i phyogs la spro ba dang /
translated: The meaning of “illuminating” is “clarifying,” and “pacifying heat” is the absence of agitation, intoxication, pride, and so on, and the enthusiasm for virtue due to the warmth of the ground.

original: sprul gdug pa la sogs pa 'byer bas klan ka tshol bar 'dod pa'i mu stegs rnams bsal ba dang / dug rab tu zhi bas mu stegs rnams kyis dam pa ma yin pa'i 'dod pa 'dzin pa rnams la gso ba dang / mig gi skyon nye bar bsal bas lta ba'i skyon nye bar bsal ba yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed pa'o //
analyzed: sprul gdug pa la sogs pa 'byer bas klan ka tshol bar 'dod pa'i mu stegs rnams bsal ba dang / dug rab tu zhi bas mu stegs rnams kyis dam pa ma yin pa'i 'dod pa 'dzin pa rnams la gso ba dang / mig gi skyon nye bar bsal bas lta ba'i skyon nye bar bsal ba yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed pa'o //
translated: “ Dispersing” poisonous snakes and so on is the removal of tīrthikas who wish to find fault, and “pacifying poison” is the healing of those tīrthikas who hold non-virtuous views, and “removing eye defects” is the generation of the correct view by removing the defects of view.🔽Now, the qualities of the precious jewel are taught by way of the distinctions of the support:

original: da ni rten gyi khyad par gyis nor bu rin po che'i yon tan gsungs pa ni chab gang gi nang du stsal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni rten gyi khyad par gyis nor bu rin po che'i yon tan gsungs pa ni chab gang gi nang du stsal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “When placed in a vessel of water” and so on.

original: rang gi zhes bya ba ni rten tha dad pas tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi zhes bya ba ni rten tha dad pas tha dad pa ste /
translated: “One’s own” is different due to the difference of the support.

original: de'i kha dog rten thams cad kyi khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i kha dog rten thams cad kyi khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because its color conforms to the distinctions of all the supports.

original: de ston par byed pa ni gal te de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽'dis ni rigs dang / lhag par mos pa'i dbye bas gdul bya nyan thos dang @96a * //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa ni gal te de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / 'dis ni rigs dang / lhag par mos pa'i dbye bas gdul bya nyan thos dang @96a * //
translated: The teaching of that is: “If it is asked, ‘What is that?’ etc.🔽This shows that the result of the disciples, who are classified by their lineage and their superior motivation, is the result of the śrāvaka,

original: rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' nyid dang / brgya byin nyid dang 'khor los sgyur ba nyid la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dbye ba yang dag par 'byung ba mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' nyid dang / brgya byin nyid dang 'khor los sgyur ba nyid la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dbye ba yang dag par 'byung ba mtshon pa yin no //
translated: the pratyekabuddha, the bodhisattva, Śakra, a universal monarch, etc.

original: da ni gnas brtan kun dga' bo nor bu rin po che lha nyid kyi phyir rnyed par dka' ba nyid kyis nye bar gzhal bar bya'i don la yang rnyed par dka' ba nyid mtshon pa'i don du 'dri bar byed pa ni yang ci zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: da ni gnas brtan kun dga' bo nor bu rin po che lha nyid kyi phyir rnyed par dka' ba nyid kyis nye bar gzhal bar bya'i don la yang rnyed par dka' ba nyid mtshon pa'i don du 'dri bar byed pa ni yang ci zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: Now, in order to illustrate the meaning of the difficulty of obtaining the elder Ānanda, who is like a precious jewel, the difficulty of obtaining the meaning is illustrated by the question: “Again, it is asked, ‘What is the difficulty of obtaining the meaning?’ etc.”

original: pa ste / lha'i nang nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni lha'i 'jig rten dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud la shin tu rnam par dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes las yang dag par byung ba mtshon par byed pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi dag la yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: pa ste / lha'i nang nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni lha'i 'jig rten dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud la shin tu rnam par dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes las yang dag par byung ba mtshon par byed pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi dag la yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, from among the gods indicates that the perfection of wisdom and the gnosis of omniscience that arise in the continuum of a bodhisattva are extremely pure, like the world of the gods.🔽Even among the humans of Jambudvipa indicates that the lesser qualities of that [wisdom and gnosis] in the continuum of śrāvakas and so on are like the world of humans.

original: 'dis ni mi'i 'jig rten dang 'dra ba'i nyan thos la sogs pa'i rgyud la de'i yon tan chung ba nyid mtshon par byed pa de bas na nyan thos la sogs pa'i ring bsrel rnams la de dang rjes su mthun par mchod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi'i 'jig rten dang 'dra ba'i nyan thos la sogs pa'i rgyud la de'i yon tan chung ba nyid mtshon par byed pa de bas na nyan thos la sogs pa'i ring bsrel rnams la de dang rjes su mthun par mchod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the relics of śrāvakas and so on are said to be worshipped in accordance with that.

original: da ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams kyi mchod pa nyid la rgyu mtshan mnyam pas gsungs pa ni de phyung yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams kyi mchod pa nyid la rgyu mtshan mnyam pas gsungs pa ni de phyung yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, it is said that even nirvāṇa is the worship of the bodies of the Tathāgatas, because of the equality of reasons, with Even when extracted and so on.

original: snod du gyur pa lags so zhes bya ba ni 'di'i rjes la ji srid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'khrungs pa'i phyir mchod pa bya ba dang / ji ltar yang bcom ldan 'das gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams la mchod pa brnyes pa zhes bya ba'i 'don pa po ti kha cig las mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: snod du gyur pa lags so zhes bya ba ni 'di'i rjes la ji srid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'khrungs pa'i phyir mchod pa bya ba dang / ji ltar yang bcom ldan 'das gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams la mchod pa brnyes pa zhes bya ba'i 'don pa po ti kha cig las mthong ba yin te /
translated: Some editions of the text read Whoever, Blessed One, obtains worship of the Tathagata's bodies.

original: de yang sngon gyi po ti rnams la ma mthong ba nyid kyi phyir mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba'i yang dag pa'i 'dod pas btags pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sngon gyi po ti rnams la ma mthong ba nyid kyi phyir mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba'i yang dag pa'i 'dod pas btags pa'o //
translated: Since this is not seen in the earlier editions, it is a later interpolation, since it is not connected with the clear words.

original: gnas 'di la yang 'di rim pa 'dis 'brel ba'i don nyid yin te /
analyzed: gnas 'di la yang 'di rim pa 'dis 'brel ba'i don nyid yin te /
translated: In this context, the meaning of connected is as follows.

original: chen mo rnams la rin po che'i dpes brjod pas so //
analyzed: chen mo rnams la rin po che'i dpes brjod pas so //
translated: The great ones are described by the example of jewels.

original: sngar nyid du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na yod pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bstan pas mchod gnas kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa la mtshungs pa nyid 'don pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar nyid du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na yod pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bstan pas mchod gnas kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa la mtshungs pa nyid 'don pa yin te /
translated: In the very beginning, by teaching the twelve branches of scriptures of all the Buddhas in the world systems of the ten directions, she is the same as the object of worship in teaching the perfection of wisdom.

original: mdo la sogs pa'i bstan pa la bcom ldan 'das ma nyid nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo la sogs pa'i bstan pa la bcom ldan 'das ma nyid nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Bhagavatī herself is the teaching of the sūtras and so on, because she is the one who goes forth.

original: de bzhin du rgyal po la yang @96b dag par brten pas rgyal po bzhin du skyes pa'i mchod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal po la yang @96b dag par brten pas rgyal po bzhin du skyes pa'i mchod pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the worship of the Tathāgatas is like the worship of a king, because they are supported by her.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skyes pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skyes pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The bodies of the Tathāgatas are like the perfection of wisdom, which is born.

original: de la dpe'i don ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: de la dpe'i don ni bstan zin to //
translated: The meaning of the examples has been explained.

original: 'dir dpe dang po la ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthus mdo la sogs pa'i bstan pa mchod par bya ba de bzhin du ring bsrel rnams kyang de'i mthu nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir dpe dang po la ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthus mdo la sogs pa'i bstan pa mchod par bya ba de bzhin du ring bsrel rnams kyang de'i mthu nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, in the first example, it is said that just as the teachings such as the sutras are worshipped by the power of the perfection of wisdom, so too are the relics by that very power.

original: dpe tsam gyi don ni nor bu'i dpe'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: dpe tsam gyi don ni nor bu'i dpe'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the mere example is not the nature of the jewel example.

original: 'on kyang nor bu rin po che'i bdag nyid chen po las za ma tog bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid chen po las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams mchod par bya ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang nor bu rin po che'i bdag nyid chen po las za ma tog bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid chen po las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams mchod par bya ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: However, just as a box is made from the great nature of a precious jewel, so too the bodies of the Tathagatas are worshipped from the great nature of the Blessed Lady and omniscient wisdom.

original: de bzhin du dpe gnyis pa la yang chos kyi sku'i mthu las mchod gnas kyi mchod par rang bzhin gyi don dang 'dra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpe gnyis pa la yang chos kyi sku'i mthu las mchod gnas kyi mchod par rang bzhin gyi don dang 'dra ba ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, in the second example as well, the worship of the objects of worship from the power of the Dharma body is not similar to the meaning of the nature.

original: chen mo rnams kyi gzhung las kyang bcom ldan 'das ma 'dir dor ba thams cad mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: chen mo rnams kyi gzhung las kyang bcom ldan 'das ma 'dir dor ba thams cad mthong ba yin te /
translated: In the texts of the great ones, this Blessed Lady is seen to be the relinquisher of all.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that they are mistaken.

original: de'i phyir chen mo rnams gzhung 'di nor bu rin po che'i dpe las sngar 'don pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir chen mo rnams gzhung 'di nor bu rin po che'i dpe las sngar 'don pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the great ones recite this text from the Jewel Cloud Sutra first,

original: 'di'i 'og tu gsungs pa ni ma yin no //🔽da ni slar yang brgya byin bcom ldan 'das ma la shin tu mchod par bya ba nyid bsgrags pa'i don du gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mtshungs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su gang ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams las kyang shes rab kyi pha
analyzed: 'di'i 'og tu gsungs pa ni ma yin no // da ni slar yang brgya byin bcom ldan 'das ma la shin tu mchod par bya ba nyid bsgrags pa'i don du gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mtshungs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su gang ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams las kyang shes rab kyi pha
translated: not what is stated later.

original: rol tu phyin pa gzung ba'o //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa gzung ba'o //
translated: Now, in order to proclaim again the worship of the Blessed Lady by Indra, it is said that one should take up the perfection of wisdom even from the bodies of Tathagatas who fill world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, rather than from the perfection of wisdom itself.

original: de la rgyu gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das de bas na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das de bas na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, the reason is stated: Blessed One, therefore...

original: 'dir yang rgyu bstan pas bcom ldan 'das ma la mchod pa la sogs par bsod nams mang ba nyid bstan pa 'di rnams don brjod pa'i ngo bo ma yin te 'on kyang don dam pa nyid ces bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang rgyu bstan pas bcom ldan 'das ma la mchod pa la sogs par bsod nams mang ba nyid bstan pa 'di rnams don brjod pa'i ngo bo ma yin te 'on kyang don dam pa nyid ces bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here also, by teaching the reason, the teaching of the great merit in worshipping the Blessed Lady and so on is not in the nature of expressing the meaning, but rather is a teaching on the ultimate itself.

original: de ltar yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mchod pa las yang dag par byung ba'i bsod nams las bcom ldan 'das ma'i mchod pa'i bsod nams la shin tu lkog tu gyur pa gzhan nyid nye bar bstan pa yin no //🔽ring bsrel dang / mchod rten mchod pa nyid la bsod nams kyi khyad par la slob dpon rnams gser gyi lus can gyi gtam @97a * //
analyzed: de ltar yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mchod pa las yang dag par byung ba'i bsod nams las bcom ldan 'das ma'i mchod pa'i bsod nams la shin tu lkog tu gyur pa gzhan nyid nye bar bstan pa yin no // ring bsrel dang / mchod rten mchod pa nyid la bsod nams kyi khyad par la slob dpon rnams gser gyi lus can gyi gtam @97a * //
translated: Thus, the merit of worship of the Tathagata's body is shown to be the most hidden of all merits.

original: brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa yin no //
translated: The masters who have golden bodies tell of the difference in merit between worship of relics and worship of stupas.

original: 'di lta ste mnyan yod na bud med cig shos kyi khyim thab smyung ba byas pa 'dod chags par gyur te /🔽mchog gi ngo bo de nas gzhon nu ma yang dag pa de'i grangs su yang dag par brjod nas de'i gzugs dang / lang tsho la rjes su chags pas de'i khyim du 'ongs te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste mnyan yod na bud med cig shos kyi khyim thab smyung ba byas pa 'dod chags par gyur te / mchog gi ngo bo de nas gzhon nu ma yang dag pa de'i grangs su yang dag par brjod nas de'i gzugs dang / lang tsho la rjes su chags pas de'i khyim du 'ongs te /
translated: For example, in Sravasti, a certain woman's husband was fasting and became lustful.🔽The young woman, having heard of the supreme nature of that man, went to his house, having been sent by her.

original: de yang des rol pa dang bcas pas 'khyud pa'i don du lta bar gyur pa nyid dus las 'das par gyur to //
analyzed: de yang des rol pa dang bcas pas 'khyud pa'i don du lta bar gyur pa nyid dus las 'das par gyur to //
translated: She, with her passion, embraced him, and he, looking at her form and youth, died of passion.

original: de nas ngo mtshar ba dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal dag gis gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa nyid skyes pa gzhan mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas ngo mtshar ba dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal dag gis gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa nyid skyes pa gzhan mthong bar gyur to //
translated: Then, with amazement, he saw another man who had been overcome by suffering.

original: kye ma 'di dur khrod du khyer nas por bar gyis shig ces smras so //
analyzed: kye ma 'di dur khrod du khyer nas por bar gyis shig ces smras so //
translated: “Oh, take him to the charnel ground and throw him away!”

original: des kyang de ltar rjes su bsgrubs nas shi ba yang bor ba nyid de'i phyi nas lan bdun gyi bar du de'i khyim du song bar gyur to //
analyzed: des kyang de ltar rjes su bsgrubs nas shi ba yang bor ba nyid de'i phyi nas lan bdun gyi bar du de'i khyim du song bar gyur to //
translated: He did just that, and after that, for seven more times, he went to that man’s house.

original: de'i rjes la tho rangs 'dra ba'i mtshan mo la yang 'di rang gi khyim gyi nang kho nar /
analyzed: de'i rjes la tho rangs 'dra ba'i mtshan mo la yang 'di rang gi khyim gyi nang kho nar /
translated: After that, at dawn, on the same night, he was in his own house,

original: de rko ba la sogs pas nang nyid du bor 'dod pa gang du 'dug ces rko bas 'dzam bu chu bo'i gser gyi lus can du shi ba po de mthong nas ngo mtshar ba yan lags las bral ba'i de'i sor mo gcig blangs nas gser mgar gyi drung
analyzed: de rko ba la sogs pas nang nyid du bor 'dod pa gang du 'dug ces rko bas 'dzam bu chu bo'i gser gyi lus can du shi ba po de mthong nas ngo mtshar ba yan lags las bral ba'i de'i sor mo gcig blangs nas gser mgar gyi drung
translated: thinking, “Where is he, the one who wants to throw me away by digging a hole and so on?” He saw the dead man, whose body was made of gold from the Jambū River. With amazement, he took one of his fingers and went to a goldsmith.

original: du nye bar song bar gyur to //
analyzed: du nye bar song bar gyur to //
translated: He went to him.

original: des de nyos nas rin po che dang 'dra ba sngar ma mthong ba 'di lta bu'i gser zhes sor mos blangs nas /
analyzed: des de nyos nas rin po che dang 'dra ba sngar ma mthong ba 'di lta bu'i gser zhes sor mos blangs nas /
translated: Having bought it, he took it in his hand and said, “I have never seen such gold, which is like a jewel.”🔽He gave it to King Prasenajit, who summoned the gold dealer and asked him about the source of the gold.

original: rgyal po gsal rgyal la byin pa des kyang gser 'tshong ba'i skyes pa bos nas gtam yang dag par nye bar thob pa drung na gnas pa 'di nyid kyi gnas su de nas song bar gyur to //
analyzed: rgyal po gsal rgyal la byin pa des kyang gser 'tshong ba'i skyes pa bos nas gtam yang dag par nye bar thob pa drung na gnas pa 'di nyid kyi gnas su de nas song bar gyur to //
translated: “It came from the place of this man standing here.”

original: gser gyi lus can mthong nas kye ma dge ba'i las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yongs su smin pa ngo mtshar ba'i blo can gyis 'di'i las ci zhig byas zhes shes par 'dod pas /
analyzed: gser gyi lus can mthong nas kye ma dge ba'i las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yongs su smin pa ngo mtshar ba'i blo can gyis 'di'i las ci zhig byas zhes shes par 'dod pas /
translated: Seeing the man with the golden body, the king thought, “Oh! The ripening of virtuous karma is amazing. What karma did he create?”

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal de nyid na bzhugs pa'i gan du nye bar song nas las kyi rnam par smin pa dris par gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal de nyid na bzhugs pa'i gan du nye bar song nas las kyi rnam par smin pa dris par gyur to //
translated: Desiring to know, he went to the Blessed One, who was staying in the Jeta Grove, and asked about the ripening of karma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po la thams cad lung bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po la thams cad lung bstan te /
translated: Then the Blessed One revealed everything to the king.

original: bskal pa brgya phrag mang po'i 'og tu skyes pa 'di shin tu dbul po'i dka' las byed pa'i don du dgon par nye bar zhugs so //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi snying po can gyi mchod rten rnying pa rgya dang rtsva la sogs pa rnams kyis khyab par ma thong bar gyur @97b pa dang / de der rang gi nus pas mchod rten gyi khor yug gi rgya dang rtsva la sogs pa yang dag par bral bar byas nas dad pa mchog tu gyur pa dang ldan pas dgon pa de nyid la bar du med tog 'byung ba'i me tog btus nas gser gyi
analyzed: bskal pa brgya phrag mang po'i 'og tu skyes pa 'di shin tu dbul po'i dka' las byed pa'i don du dgon par nye bar zhugs so // de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi snying po can gyi mchod rten rnying pa rgya dang rtsva la sogs pa rnams kyis khyab par ma thong bar gyur @97b pa dang / de der rang gi nus pas mchod rten gyi khor yug gi rgya dang rtsva la sogs pa yang dag par bral bar byas nas dad pa mchog tu gyur pa dang ldan pas dgon pa de nyid la bar du med tog 'byung ba'i me tog btus nas gser gyi
translated: He entered the monastery for the sake of the difficult work of a very poor man, after many hundreds of eons.

original: kha dog can gyi me tog rnams kyis ring bsrel gyi mchod rten de mchod par gyur to //
analyzed: kha dog can gyi me tog rnams kyis ring bsrel gyi mchod rten de mchod par gyur to //
translated: He saw an ancient stūpa, the essence of the relics of the Tathāgata, covered with grass, weeds, and so on. With his own ability, he cleared away the grass, weeds, and so on around the stūpa. With supreme faith, he gathered flowers that grew in that very monastery, and with golden-colored flowers he made offerings to the relic stūpa.

original: bdag gis nges par sdig pa mang po byas zhes kyang bsams par gyur te /
analyzed: bdag gis nges par sdig pa mang po byas zhes kyang bsams par gyur te /
translated: He also thought, “I have certainly committed many sins.”

original: brgya lam na yang gzhan gyis rjes su bzung ba'i chas ma byas so //
analyzed: brgya lam na yang gzhan gyis rjes su bzung ba'i chas ma byas so //
translated: I have never been supported by others.

original: des na 'di lta bu'i gnas skabs nyams su myong ba des na bdag bsod nams 'dis skye ba thams cad du gang gi tshe gdon mi za bar byed pa zhes ma nges pa'i blo can bdag mi 'byung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: des na 'di lta bu'i gnas skabs nyams su myong ba des na bdag bsod nams 'dis skye ba thams cad du gang gi tshe gdon mi za bar byed pa zhes ma nges pa'i blo can bdag mi 'byung ba de'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, in this situation, I will make this aspiration prayer: ‘In all my lives, may I never be one who has an uncertain mind, thinking, “I will definitely do this or that.”

original: bdag gis sdig pa ma byas pa nyid kyis srog dang bral bar 'gyur bdag gi lus 'di shi ba na yang gser gyi rang bzhin du gyur nas gzhan rnams la dbul ba rab tu zhi ba'i don du skye ba thams cad du nye bar mkho bar gyur cig
analyzed: bdag gis sdig pa ma byas pa nyid kyis srog dang bral bar 'gyur bdag gi lus 'di shi ba na yang gser gyi rang bzhin du gyur nas gzhan rnams la dbul ba rab tu zhi ba'i don du skye ba thams cad du nye bar mkho bar gyur cig
translated: When my body dies, may it turn into gold and be offered to others for the sake of pacifying poverty. May it be useful to all beings in all my lives.’

original: ces smon lam yang byas par gyur te /
analyzed: ces smon lam yang byas par gyur te /
translated: He made this aspiration prayer.

original: de nas 'chi 'pho ba 'di bskal pa brgya phrag mang por bsod nams de nyid kyis lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du rgyal srid stong phrag rnams byas par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas 'chi 'pho ba 'di bskal pa brgya phrag mang por bsod nams de nyid kyis lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du rgyal srid stong phrag rnams byas par gyur to //
translated: Then, through that merit, for many hundreds of eons, he became a king a thousand times among gods and humans.

original: bde ba stong phrag rnams la yang nye bar longs spyod par gyur to //
analyzed: bde ba stong phrag rnams la yang nye bar longs spyod par gyur to //
translated: He will enjoy thousands of pleasures.

original: bsod nams dang smon lam de dag nyid kyis 'di'i sdig pa byed par 'dod pa las de bzhin 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang smon lam de dag nyid kyis 'di'i sdig pa byed par 'dod pa las de bzhin 'chi ba ste /
translated: By those very merits and prayers, he will not die as he wishes, but will die in that way.

original: shi nas kyang gser gyi lus nyid 'dir skye ba 'di la yang dag par 'byung bar nye bar song yang sprul pa thob pa'i don du 'di'i bsod nams kyi phung po 'di da ltar yang gnas pa yin zhes bcom ldan 'das ma mchod pas de bzhin gshegs pa
analyzed: shi nas kyang gser gyi lus nyid 'dir skye ba 'di la yang dag par 'byung bar nye bar song yang sprul pa thob pa'i don du 'di'i bsod nams kyi phung po 'di da ltar yang gnas pa yin zhes bcom ldan 'das ma mchod pas de bzhin gshegs pa
translated: And after death, he will be reborn in this very life as a golden body. Even now, this heap of his merits remains for the sake of attaining the emanation body.

original: thams cad kyi mchod pa byas par 'gyur zhes nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: thams cad kyi mchod pa byas par 'gyur zhes nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Thus, by worshipping the Blessed Lady, he will make offerings to all the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sku la sogs pa mthong ba la yang bcom ldan 'das ma nyid thob par byed pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sku la sogs pa mthong ba la yang bcom ldan 'das ma nyid thob par byed pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Having taught that, it is said that she herself, the Blessed Lady, causes the vision of the Dharma body and so forth of all the Tathagatas to be attained.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa'i phyir srog gi dbang po'i rgyun gyis lus la nad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa'i phyir srog gi dbang po'i rgyun gyis lus la nad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed One, moreover, etc. means that because of not passing into complete nirvana, the body is free from illness due to the continuity of the life faculty.

original: 'tsho zhing zhes bya ba ni glo bur ba'i nad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tsho zhing zhes bya ba ni glo bur ba'i nad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Living means being free from sudden illness.

original: gzhes pa'i zhes bya ba ni dus las gzhes pas so //
analyzed: gzhes pa'i zhes bya ba ni dus las gzhes pas so //
translated: Abiding means abiding beyond time.

original: yang na @98a * //
analyzed: yang na @98a * //
translated: Or else,

original: bzhugs te chos kyi skus gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽'tsho zhing longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus so //
analyzed: bzhugs te chos kyi skus gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro // 'tsho zhing longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus so //
translated: dwelling means abiding by means of the Dharma body.🔽Living means by means of the enjoyment body.

original: gzhes pa ni sprul pa'i skus so //
analyzed: gzhes pa ni sprul pa'i skus so //
translated: Abiding means by means of the emanation body.

original: chos nyid du zhes bya ba ni chos kyi skus so //
analyzed: chos nyid du zhes bya ba ni chos kyi skus so //
translated: In reality means by means of the Dharma body.

original: 'di yang gtso bo gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku dag gis yang lta bar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: 'di yang gtso bo gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku dag gis yang lta bar 'dod pas so //
translated: This also has the characteristic of the two principal bodies, which are the form body and the gnosis body, for the sake of those who wish to see.

original: de lta na yang chen mo rnams la yang chos kyi sku dang / gzugs kyi sku dang / ye shes kyi skus lta bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang chen mo rnams la yang chos kyi sku dang / gzugs kyi sku dang / ye shes kyi skus lta bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, it is said that the great ones also have the dharma-body, the form-body, and the knowledge-body.

original: ye shes kyi sku ni ye shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku ni ye shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: The knowledge-body is the aggregate of knowledge.

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Indra said:🔽Blessed One, it is so, it is so.

original: bcom ldan 'das de de bzhin te zhes dus su mkhyen nas der rgyu gsungs pa ni koo shi ka 'das pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de de bzhin te zhes dus su mkhyen nas der rgyu gsungs pa ni koo shi ka 'das pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having understood the time, he taught the cause there, saying, Kausika, in the past... and so on.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag pa'i byang chub la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'khrungs pa nyid kyi phyir chos kyi sku la sogs pa mthong ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu rigs pa yin zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag pa'i byang chub la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'khrungs pa nyid kyi phyir chos kyi sku la sogs pa mthong ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu rigs pa yin zhes bya ba'i
translated: It is reasonable that the result of practicing the perfection of wisdom is seeing the dharma-body and so on, because all Buddhas are born from the perfection of wisdom in perfect enlightenment.

original: dgongs pa'o // bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa'o // bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the intention. Blessed One, it is like this... and so on.

original: don dam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dgongs pas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dgongs pas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is stated with the intention of the perfection of wisdom of ultimate reality.

original: de'i chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas lta bar byed pa na nam mkha' ltar yul che bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: de'i chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas lta bar byed pa na nam mkha' ltar yul che bar 'gyur te //
translated: When one views by means of the application of the non-apprehension of all phenomena, the object becomes as great as space.

original: yul che ba nyid bstan par byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul che ba nyid bstan par byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the greatness of the object is “The Bhagavat, the Tathagata, etc.”

original: rab tu mkhyen pa'i zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu mkhyen pa'i zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Fully knows” means by means of the application of non-apprehension.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni yang dag par gzigs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni yang dag par gzigs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is clarified by “fully sees.”

original: gsal bar byed pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavat’s statement for the sake of clarification is “That is the way it is, etc.”

original: bcom ldan 'das ma'i bdag nyid chen po thos pas pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan rnams la sbyor ba med pa dang yang dag par srid cing 'dri bar byed pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma'i bdag nyid chen po thos pas pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan rnams la sbyor ba med pa dang yang dag par srid cing 'dri bar byed pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The great self of the Bhagavatī is applied to the other perfections by hearing, and is asked about their purity.

original: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni thabs su gyur pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa med par yang dag pa'i byang chub mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni thabs su gyur pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa med par yang dag pa'i byang chub mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On all means that without the skillful means of generosity, etc., perfect enlightenment is not accomplished.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /🔽brtan pa rnams kyi yang dag sbyor //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa drug po la //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa / brtan pa rnams kyi yang dag sbyor // pha rol tu phyin pa drug po la //
translated: As it is said:🔽The steadfast ones' right practice

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Is in the six perfections.

original: 'o na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das ma @98b gtso bo yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das ma @98b gtso bo yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is the Bhagavatī the principal one?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / koo shi ka 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / koo shi ka 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Kauśika, however...

original: thabs mkhas pas yongs su zin cing zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid rnam pa gnyis su byas nas bstan par byed pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bsngos pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas yongs su zin cing zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid rnam pa gnyis su byas nas bstan par byed pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bsngos pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Skill in means is the same as the perfection of wisdom, which is taught by making a twofold division.

original: des rang rang gi ngo bo mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin sgyu ma la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yongs su bsngo ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: des rang rang gi ngo bo mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin sgyu ma la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yongs su bsngo ba rnams la'o //
translated: The dedication to the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of all aspects of all illusions, etc., which have the nature of the non-apprehension of their own natures.

original: don ni 'di yin te byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rjes khengs par gyur pa sems can thams cad la ji ltar 'dod pa thams cad ster bar byed de /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rjes khengs par gyur pa sems can thams cad la ji ltar 'dod pa thams cad ster bar byed de /
translated: The meaning is as follows: The bodhisattva, filled with compassion, gives to all sentient beings whatever they desire.

original: de yang sbyin pa zhes de ltar mngon par brjod kyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang sbyin pa zhes de ltar mngon par brjod kyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And that is called “generosity,” but it is not the perfection of generosity.

original: gang gi tshe sbyin pa'am mi sbyin pa yang rnam par dag par byed pa de'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa zhes ming thob pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sbyin pa'am mi sbyin pa yang rnam par dag par byed pa de'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa zhes ming thob pa yin no //
translated: When one purifies giving or not giving, then it receives the name perfection.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po la kun tu 'gro ba'i chos kyi dbyings so sor rtogs pa nas brtsams te sbyor ba thams cad la rjes su tshol ba la mngon sum du mthong bas de bzhin nyid nye bar gnas pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po la kun tu 'gro ba'i chos kyi dbyings so sor rtogs pa nas brtsams te sbyor ba thams cad la rjes su tshol ba la mngon sum du mthong bas de bzhin nyid nye bar gnas pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma
translated: For the bodhisattvas, beginning with the realization of the all-pervading Dharma-element on the first stage, the reality-limit is present as the direct perception of the search for all the applications, and not otherwise.

original: yin no // de yang sbyin pa'i dus la yang sbyin par nus pa dang / so sor bzung ba'i don du yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yin no // de yang sbyin pa'i dus la yang sbyin par nus pa dang / so sor bzung ba'i don du yang ma yin no //
translated: And that is not possible at the time of giving, nor is it for the sake of the meaning of the individual retention.

original: de bas na don dam par yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig med de /
analyzed: de bas na don dam par yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig med de /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, there is no such thing as giving.

original: gang zhig bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gnas mal la sogs pa yongs su gtong ba de ni kun tu brtags pa'i chos la brten pa nyid kyi phyir rmi lam bzhin dang sgyu ma bzhin du mi bden pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gnas mal la sogs pa yongs su gtong ba de ni kun tu brtags pa'i chos la brten pa nyid kyi phyir rmi lam bzhin dang sgyu ma bzhin du mi bden pa'o //
translated: He who gives away food and drink, bedding, and so on, does so in dependence on the imagined nature of things, and so it is not real, like a dream, like a magical illusion.

original: de ltar na sbyin par bya ba 'ga' zhig dang dngos po sbyin par bya ba nyid dang slong ba po'i bdag nyid so sor len pa po nyid kyis dmigs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid la brten nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin par bya ba 'ga' zhig dang dngos po sbyin par bya ba nyid dang slong ba po'i bdag nyid so sor len pa po nyid kyis dmigs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid la brten nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Thus, the perfection of giving is based on the absence of the nature of being perceived, by virtue of the absence of any object of giving, of the nature of being an object of giving, and of the nature of being a receiver.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' ni thog mar snying rje'i stobs kyis kun rdzob kyi tshul la zhon nas 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa'i dbang gis sbyin pa byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' ni thog mar snying rje'i stobs kyis kun rdzob kyi tshul la zhon nas 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa'i dbang gis sbyin pa byed de /
translated: For, at the outset, the bodhisattva, by the power of compassion, mounts the conventional way and gives gifts by the power of worldly conduct.

original: don dam pa'i tshul la gnas nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod pa'i dbang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshul la gnas nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod pa'i dbang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sbyong bar byed do //
translated: But, abiding in the ultimate way, he purifies the perfection of wisdom by the power of supramundane conduct.

original: de bas na snying rjes kun rdzob la gnas nas bsam pa dag pa las rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: de bas na snying rjes kun rdzob la gnas nas bsam pa dag pa las rtogs par byed de /
translated: Therefore, one should realize the pure intention by abiding in the conventional through compassion.

original: shes rab kyis don dam pa la gnas nas sbyor ba rnam par dag pas sbyong @99a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyis don dam pa la gnas nas sbyor ba rnam par dag pas sbyong @99a * //
translated: One should purify the practice by abiding in the ultimate through wisdom.

original: bar byed pa de'i phyir snying rje las thams cad kyis sems can gyi don nyid kyi phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis bgrang bar byed de /
analyzed: bar byed pa de'i phyir snying rje las thams cad kyis sems can gyi don nyid kyi phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis bgrang bar byed de /
translated: Therefore, one should count the accumulation of merit through all the practices for the sake of sentient beings, because of compassion.

original: shes rab kyis byang chub kyi don nyid kyi phyir ye shes kyi tshogs la'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis byang chub kyi don nyid kyi phyir ye shes kyi tshogs la'o //
translated: One should count the accumulation of wisdom through wisdom, because of the goal of enlightenment.

original: de'i tshe nyid la 'di sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe nyid la 'di sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: At that time, it is called the perfection of generosity.

original: 'dis kyang de'i tshe sems bskyed pa dang po la dmigs par gyur ba sems can dang byang chub dag yongs su 'dor ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid bden pa'i don gyis byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang de'i tshe sems bskyed pa dang po la dmigs par gyur ba sems can dang byang chub dag yongs su 'dor ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid bden pa'i don gyis byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: This also shows that at that time, the first generation of the thought of enlightenment is not the abandonment of sentient beings and enlightenment. This is the very meaning of truth, and one becomes a bodhisattva.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni byang chub sems dpa' ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam pa pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni byang chub sems dpa' ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam pa pa ma yin no //
translated: On the level of earnest aspiration, the transcendent perfection of generosity is not ultimate for the bodhisattva.

original: de ltar na mi dmigs pa gsum gyis sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mi dmigs pa gsum gyis sbyin pa'o //
translated: So it is through these three kinds of nonapprehension that generosity is perfected.

original: gzhan shin tu 'gal ba yang thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang gis mi 'gal bzhin du 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan shin tu 'gal ba yang thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang gis mi 'gal bzhin du 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Even the most incompatible things are engaged in without contradiction by the power of transcendent skill in means.

original: de'i kun rdzob 'dzin par byed pa'i snying rje dang don dam pa 'dzin par byed pa'i shes rab thang la rgyu ba dang / chu la rgyu ba'i srog chags kyi sbyor ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i kun rdzob 'dzin par byed pa'i snying rje dang don dam pa 'dzin par byed pa'i shes rab thang la rgyu ba dang / chu la rgyu ba'i srog chags kyi sbyor ba bzhin du /
translated: The bodhisattvas' union of compassion, which apprehends the relative, and wisdom, which apprehends the ultimate, is like the union of land and water animals.

original: shin tu 'gal ba'i sbyor ba yang 'gal ba med pa dang / grogs por byas nas cig car sgrub par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshogs gnyis byang chub kyi mthar thug pa sgrub par byed cing shin tu phan 'dogs par byed pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu 'gal ba'i sbyor ba yang 'gal ba med pa dang / grogs por byas nas cig car sgrub par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshogs gnyis byang chub kyi mthar thug pa sgrub par byed cing shin tu phan 'dogs par byed pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Even the most incompatible things are engaged in without contradiction and, as friends, they are simultaneously accomplished. This is said to be the bodhisattvas' accomplishment of the two accumulations, which is of the greatest benefit right up until enlightenment.

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having stood in the perfection of wisdom of all the perfections, one should realize the purity of the three spheres.

original: bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan no //
analyzed: bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan no //
translated: “I am endowed with morality,”

original: 'di ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims so //
translated: “this is morality,”🔽“this is immorality,”—the non-apprehension of the three;

original: 'di ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'o zhes gsum mi dmigs pa dang / bdag ni bzod pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'o zhes gsum mi dmigs pa dang / bdag ni bzod pa dang ldan no //
translated: “I am endowed with patience,”

original: 'di ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa'o //
translated: “this is patience,”🔽“this is anger,”—the non-apprehension of the three;

original: 'di ni khro ba'o zhes gsum mi dmigs pa dang / bdag ni brtson 'grus dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'di ni khro ba'o zhes gsum mi dmigs pa dang / bdag ni brtson 'grus dang ldan no //
translated: “I am endowed with vigor,”

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: “this is vigor,”🔽“this is laziness,”—the non-apprehension of the three;🔽“I am concentrated,”🔽“this is meditative stabilization,”🔽“this is distraction,”—the non-apprehension of the three;🔽“I am wise,”

original: le lo la sogs pa mi dmigs pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par g-yeng ba mi dmigs pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la shes rab can dang /
analyzed: le lo la sogs pa mi dmigs pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par g-yeng ba mi dmigs pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la shes rab can dang /
translated: “this is wisdom,”🔽“this is foolishness,”—the non-apprehension of the three.

original: shes rab dang / shes rab 'chal pa mi dmigs so//
analyzed: shes rab dang / shes rab 'chal pa mi dmigs so//
translated: Having stood in the perfection of wisdom, one should not apprehend the perfection of wisdom, the wise one, wisdom, or foolishness.

original: @99b 'on te de nyid la gnas nas de nyid la ji ltar rnam par dag pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: @99b 'on te de nyid la gnas nas de nyid la ji ltar rnam par dag pa yin snyam na /
translated: But if one abides in thatness, how can it be purified?

original: don ni 'di yin te gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba chos 'ga' zhig don dam par yod pa ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba chos 'ga' zhig don dam par yod pa ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: The meaning is this: when the so-called perfection of wisdom does not exist ultimately,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid can rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid can rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: then one abides in the nonconceptual perfection of wisdom, the nature of nonconceptual perfection of wisdom.

original: khams gsum po ni de bzhin nyid tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa kun rdzob kyi rnam par skye bar 'gyur ba sbyor ba'i lam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa shes rab kyis rnam par rtog pa byas pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyis yongs
analyzed: khams gsum po ni de bzhin nyid tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa kun rdzob kyi rnam par skye bar 'gyur ba sbyor ba'i lam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa shes rab kyis rnam par rtog pa byas pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyis yongs
translated: At that time, the three realms arise in the form of relative reality, such as “mere suchness,” and so on. The wisdom that is included in the path of preparation and is conceptualized by wisdom is also fully grasped by nonconceptual wisdom.

original: su 'dzin pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob pa yin no //
analyzed: su 'dzin pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob pa yin no //
translated: It is the perfection that obtains the name perfection.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par byed pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par byed pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, having stood in the perfection of wisdom, one should cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar na yang ji skad du //
analyzed: de ltar na yang ji skad du //
translated: And thus:

original: chos rnams yang dag par mthong bar gyur na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid sngon du 'gro ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams yang dag par mthong bar gyur na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid sngon du 'gro ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When one sees the dharmas correctly, the perfection of wisdom is the forerunner.

original: der yang dang por ni lam gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: der yang dang por ni lam gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: And there, first, it is the nature of the path.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa chos so sor rab tu 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa chos so sor rab tu 'byed pa'o //
translated: It is the discrimination of dharmas with conceptualization.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de'i sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de'i sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom without conceptualization is the forerunner.

original: bye brag med cing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bye brag med cing zhes bya ba la /
translated: Without distinction,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang gi rang bzhin du skyes pa rnams kyi de las de rnams bye brag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang gi rang bzhin du skyes pa rnams kyi de las de rnams bye brag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is the nature of the dharmas that are born from it. There is no distinction among them.

original: tha dad du bya ba mi dmigs pa ni de rnams de lta bur byas pa la tha dad par byas nas 'ga' zhig tu bya ba nye bar sbyor ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad du bya ba mi dmigs pa ni de rnams de lta bur byas pa la tha dad par byas nas 'ga' zhig tu bya ba nye bar sbyor ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The non-apprehension of a separate activity is that, having made them that way, having made them different, there is no application of any activity whatsoever.

original: 'di nyid la dpe gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid la dpe gsungs pa ni /
translated: An example is stated just in this regard:

original: 'di lta ste dper zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is thus, for example.

original: de dag gi grib ma bye brag med cing zhes bya ba ni shing spangs nas rang dgar 'ga' zhig tu don bya ba la nye bar sbyor ba grib ma la med ces bya ba'i don to //🔽tha dad pa bya ba ni mngon zhes bya ba la shing las tha dad pa byas te /
analyzed: de dag gi grib ma bye brag med cing zhes bya ba ni shing spangs nas rang dgar 'ga' zhig tu don bya ba la nye bar sbyor ba grib ma la med ces bya ba'i don to // tha dad pa bya ba ni mngon zhes bya ba la shing las tha dad pa byas te /
translated: Their shadows are not different means that, having abandoned the trees, there is no application of any activity whatsoever in any place, as there is in the case of shadows.

original: 'ga' zhig tu don gyi bya ba la nges par sbyar ba'i don du nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu don gyi bya ba la nges par sbyar ba'i don du nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The activity of difference is not manifest means that, having made them different from the trees, they are not capable of being applied to any activity whatsoever.

original: grib ma grib ma zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni shing 'di'i grib ma 'di zhes bya ba bgrang ba yin te /
analyzed: grib ma grib ma zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni shing 'di'i grib ma 'di zhes bya ba bgrang ba yin te /
translated: The shadows are counted as shadows means that they are counted as the shadows of this or that tree.

original: shing gzhan bzhin du yang rang dgar bgrang @100a * //
analyzed: shing gzhan bzhin du yang rang dgar bgrang @100a * //
translated: They are not counted as they wish, as are other trees.

original: ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not so.

original: de bas na ji ltar shing la brten pa'i grib ma shing las tha dad pa 'ga' zhig tu nye bar sbyor ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar shing la brten pa'i grib ma shing las tha dad pa 'ga' zhig tu nye bar sbyor ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as the shadow that is based on the tree is not applied as something different from the tree,🔽in the same way, like the tree, the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of wisdom.

original: shing ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grib ma bzhin du de las gzhan rnams ni de la brten pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shing ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grib ma bzhin du de las gzhan rnams ni de la brten pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Like the shadow, the others are based on it. This is the meaning.

original: de lta na yang shing gi dpe la shing bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang shing gi dpe la shing bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Even so, in the example of the tree, the perfection of wisdom is like the tree.

original: grib ma bzhin du de las gzhan rnams zhes bya ba nyi khri'i gzhung 'grel las so //
analyzed: grib ma bzhin du de las gzhan rnams zhes bya ba nyi khri'i gzhung 'grel las so //
translated: Like the shadow, the others are like the shadow. This is from the commentary on the twenty-thousand line text.

original: sna tshogs pa'i shing gi dpe ni shing thams cad kyi grib ma la de'i tshe na yang de kho na nyid du shing 'ga' zhig la yang rang dga'i grib ma med ces bya ba bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i shing gi dpe ni shing thams cad kyi grib ma la de'i tshe na yang de kho na nyid du shing 'ga' zhig la yang rang dga'i grib ma med ces bya ba bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The example of various trees is taught in order to show that at that time, in reality, there is no shadow of any tree that is independent.
